The sound quality exceeded my expectations.
While not stereo, the spatial feature made it sound like it was.
I played a trick on wifey: Had some Xmas music playing loud as she walked in the front door.
She immediately went to the home stereo to turn the volume down, but saw it was off.
Had a confused look on her face, as she walked around the living room trying to figure out where the music was coming from.
When she realized it was coming from this unit on the sofa tabletop behind the lamp, she could not believe it !

It's pretty much what you would expect for audio features and it acts like an Echo. Enough said. What isn't as apparent is just how huge this thing is. I bought it as an audio upgrade for and Echo that is on an end table conveniently and unobtrusively tucked behind a lamp. I figured this model was similar in profile.... It is NOT. It is about 4x as large as a full size echo or about the size of a bucket. If you are planning on putting this on a table or counter it will NOT be inconspicuous. Mine is probably going on the floor in the corner of the room or under an end table. I probably shouldn't ding it for size but really it was a surprise and honestly the audio quality isn't that much better than a much smaller Echo Plus which I thought this was the next evolution of. I do not have buyers remorse but I can't use it as intended.

We have had this for like 4 months its amazing sound... But for some reason I needed a extra cord that doesnt come with it to hook it up to our brandnew 4k tv shame on Amazon then on top of that... The sound dissapears all the time forcing me to get up from my seat... Unplug it and plug it back in very frustrating having to to do this several times a week if not more... It was alot of money for it to come without the ability to hookup via blutooth or at least come with the damh cord u need to hook it up to the tv the reason why I gave it as many stars is the sound is better than anything u can buy out there its amazing sound I may buy a second one just for that movie theater feel ... Even tho u need a cord for it. Amazon please fix this ... I guess u dont need a cord if have a fire tv ... Didnt know that

I got carried away during the “Amazon day” sale and bought two more echo studios thinking I could do a three way pairing with the one I already have. Nope, you can only pair two into a stereo thing us. Which sounds fine and all. I think what I really wanted was to add in a thumps bass. A real bass with a big ol’ speaker. Way bigger than in the studio.

Over all, these echo studios are performing as expected and I expect a lot. I’ve been using various echo units for years and have been migrating toward more of the more capable ones. Seems reasonable because the things keep getting upgrades and more capabilities. Meanwhile, I use them for more stuff. A virtuous cycle.

Hey Amazon engineers - I want to receive VOIP calls on these via my old POTS phone number. Can you make that happen?

It's a nice speaker, but as a
replacement for my Bose sound bar, uh, not, not the greatest sound. But the Bose shuts off after 30 minutes and you need to really point the controller in the right way to start it up again, so the Bose got exiled into my office. But the Bose had much better sound. I expected more from the Studio, but it is nice and much better than the Echo, which sits sadly on the kitchen counter.

I had to call customer support to get it up and running.

I like the fact that the Studio permits me to include it in multi-room audio as well as use it as a "Home Theater" (which it is not). Anyway, it is way better than the Echo and serves for TV sound output, but I don't get the nice stereo sound of jets flying across the living room as one would wish. I am considering adding a second Studio to connect in stereo, but that could end in divorce.

Does anyone have experience using 2 Studios for stereo? Is it worth it or is it better to get a good sound bar?
Update: I bought a second studio and then after many months that the bass sub was not available, bought one of those. With all 3 working together I am a happy camper, the sound is rich and fills the room very nicely. I am raising to 5 stars.

This Echo Studio arrived yesterday. Initially it stopped part way through the set up process so I started again. Once I was able to get music to play it played with high treble and nearly no bass. I’m currently unable to modify the sounds to get the full body sound that’s advertised.....but Alexa did add “bass” to my shopping list. SMH. I really wanted to love this for my home office but this is a dud.

I like the sound, very happy with it for the price. What I do not like? Playing music from Amazon or Pandora many times confuses the app and you have to restart it before it will respond. Let the music play too long and then hit pause, 50% of the time this requires you swipe the app off and restart it. Certainly not fun but the worst? Alexa will make beeping noises every afternoon when left plugged in and despite having voice control off. Nothing super long or loud but just a beep or two and if it happens once it will happen at least 3 times in the afternoon. Very annoying especially since we have it set up in an office. I had decided to replace tonight with something else but of course, today no beeps or required restarts making me second guess spending the money for a replacement speaker.

Won’t play music, won’t pair with my new 4K tv. App shows it’s paired, but won’t work. When paired directly with my fire cube, may work for about 10 minutes but then goes completely silent. I “just missed” the return window by two days because we thought the problem was the cube and Amazon replaced that after multiple tests. We bought a new tv because our old one required a Bluetooth adapter and the speaker definitely wouldn’t pair with that! Have been waiting for the brains at Amazon to figure it out or authorize a return/exchange. It’s been a month and I’m still waiting.

I have 2 echo studio speakers paired with an echo sub and they sound amazing! But, only when they work.. the audio drop is still an issue and my speakers all sit within 6ft of my router running 5g with a great band with. This seems to be an on going problem amazon has yet to fix and until they do so I would not recommend buying until they fix the issue.

Big disappointment. I was really excited to receive this speaker for Christmas and for the reviews it was receiving and what a let down. I’m just going to make it quick and simple. The sound quality is good not great, you’re better off going with a Marshall Kilburn which also has Alexa built in for around the same price with a much much better sound. The build is really good but the weight in it is really heavy. Don’t understand for what though. Lastly and the most important for me at least. Is the connectivity, it states is Bluetooth compatible but it is not , unless it is connected with WiFi. If you’re not connected on WiFi it is a useless speaker which will not work on anything. And that is the reason I recommend not to buy it. Please you are better of with a Marshall Kilburn any day over this inferior product. As I will be buying.

This is replacing a 1st gen Echo in a very large room. The sound quality is much better and it does OK for a huge room where the original Echo was weak and tinny. Unfortunately it is really buggy. It becomes unresponsive and needs to by unplugged and plugged back in at least once every 2 days. Also the volume is really inconsistent. Sometimes Alexa is whispering, and each response can have very different volumes. For example when asking Alexa questions she might answer in her current volume, but if instead she reads something from the news or from Wikipedia the volume may be much louder. Depending on the station music might be either very faint or very loud compared to Alexa's responses.

Overall it is probably worth the Prime day 2020 price of $150 but could be much better. The problems do seem to be software related though so hopefully it will get better in the future, although the Studio has already been out a year.

I ordered 2 of these to start a home theatre set up. The sub was on backorder so I thought I'd get these 2 speakers first. I had a lot of issues trying to get theses to sync with my fire cube, my Alexa app could not recognize one of the speakers no matter what I tried. All my devices were connected on the same network and despite all this it never synced. I deleted and re-started all my devices, reset my modem and router multiple times and it kept saying one of my Studios was offline.
After restarting and restoring all my devices 3 times I was finally able to sync them. I watched some Amazon prime content and I was very disappointed. The sound was not as crisp as I wanted and it felt it needed a center speaker. I bought this in hopes of replacing a sound bar but my old Definitive Audio sound bar blew these away. Sadly, these went back to Amazon the same day. Connection issues is a major downfall for me and sound quality for me is not as good as what some of the reviewers are raving about.

I love the sound coming out of this for Amazon video programs that support the dolby Atmos. I then wanted to see how it works as a PC speaker. I purchased the optical cable with the 3.5mm end for connecting to the Studio. Not Bad as a PC speaker. It does duty wirelessly for Amazon shows on my HDTV and wire connection for the PC.

First I have to thank the awesome customer service at Amazon, my shipment of the Echo Studio was pushed way back - so they refunded my shipping cost.

My Echo Studio arrived yesterday.. I've been hunting for a decent, but sleek, stereo system for my master bedroom. For anyone who uses a small bluetooth speaker - they may be good, but they're not great... especially in the bass/sub-woofer category.

I plugged in the Echo Studio and it immediately went through the boot-up and set-up process. Within a minute of it talking to my iPhone's Alexa app, it was on my secured home wifi network. It did a system upgrade quietly and rebooted itself... after that, setup was done.

Man oh man this thing sounds phenomenal! For "one" speaker (with a bunch of tiny speakers inside) - its spatial stereo sound is nearly jaw-dropping. I had Alexa play me some of their "3D Music" - and you can tell it's been specifically mastered for a speaker like the Echo Studio.

You can fine-tune the speaker with a three band EQ within the app as well.

I recommend this speaker for sure... it's got wifi, bluetooth, and an AUX input if you need it.

Seriously nice sounding speaker! nice job Amazon! Speaker is 100 times better than an echo spot 3rd gen. im only listening to a single speaker set up. it actually sounds close to stereo. you can hear the soundstage. bass is pretty clean. im anxious to pair it with a second speaker for true stereo. i see it has mini 3.5 optical in. haven’t heard of this but if you can do audio out from tv or cablebox that would cool for mini home theater set up. i also havent had any issues with audio dropping out but i’ll follow up after i have this a few weeks.

The Future Value of $179 for five years until now is $202, so from my perspective I paid more for my retro Echo, and got so much less. But in technology time 5 years is a long time, and now I have so much more than I got with my original Echo. I have watched as the number of things that Echo can do has grown past my needs. Did anyone know that you can ask your Echo what the Net Worth of most celebrities is, and get an answer, or how tall they are, or what year they where born, and usually get an answer. My new Echo Studio has its own electronics Hub built in to it, and it has much better speakers, more of them, and in a configuration that provides a board listening stage, with much more accuracy, and real bass too. From my point of view, the new Echo Studio is just short of a miracle. But using any Echo is a matter of experience, and seeking to know the capabilities. Buy a new Echo Studio NOW.

Ordered the Echo Studio last night and received it today, setup took all of 2 minutes because we already have several Echo devices and an account. I’m pretty blown away with the sound this Studio produces. I purchased it to “replace” our Echo Plus in our living room and it’s incredible how much better, and louder, it is over the Echo Plus. I was also surprised at its size (see photo comparing the Echo Plus to Echo Studio). Overall very satisfied with it! Sounds better than ANY other Echo device we have (have 2 dots, 2 spots, 1 plus). Putting the Studio in our living room and the Plus in the kitchen in a speaker group fills our entire first floor with the quality sound.

Don’t forget to adjust the equalizer in the Alexa app to increase bass, miss and treble to your liking!

I purchased 3 units and am still becoming acquainted with the system. However, thus far the sound is awesome, especially so when playing HD and 3D music but in truth, everything sounds better. The Amazon 'Ambient' station features a delightful selection of all HD music and consequently my listening seems to be migrating to it almost exclusively. Amazon's 3D enabled music selections seem more raucous and 'contemporary' but still the listening experience is excellent there as well. My one negative, and this has nothing to do with the Echo Studio speaker, Amazon's music frequently doesn't play through the entire music selection and skips mid-song to another selection. This is apparently not a function of our personal wireless network as our Sirius XM Echo Studio connection plays consistently and fully through the Sirius music selections, never a premature skip.

I placed this on a tall counter - above the backsplash to my kitchen sink - and so can't see the blue light on top that indicates the device is listening, muted, etc. Bad design on the part of Amazon, and they should warn folks about this in their product listing. The unit is heavy! And much bigger than I expected. But it does put out better sound than my portable Bose Bluetooth speaker, which it can also control. I wish it had better hearing from any distance, as I feel that I need to be within about 15 feet for it to respond to a request. The aesthetic is rather bland and pedestrian - if this were designed by Apple it would look a whole lot more like something you are happy to have displayed in the house. As it is...well, it is benignly ugly and does what you expect it to do.

The speakers are amazing... They are just not utilizing the capsaty, the sound could be so much better if the used the spacail capability. It desperately needs a software update!!!! Then it would be amazing...

Update this speeker doesnt work!!!!! I have two of these as a sound system for the fire TV... EVERY DAY i have to disconneft snd reconnet them to get any kind sound, which often breaks up, one speeker stops working randomly...

Had been using dual speakers (original Echo and Echo Show 2) to provide separated (not stereo) sound in my office. This was "ok" but wanted to get some upgraded sound. I was considering 2 of the latest gen echo's and a echo subwoofer OR this unit (the studio). After deciding on the studio I was eager to hook it up and check it out. One work - Amazing! the 3D tracks are so cool as the sound just literally surround you from just this one speaker. Mind you it's not going to beat a $10K dedicated audio system with components BUT for a single device, this is by far the best sound I've heard (short of a Bose unit costing hundreds more). If you're on the fence for this or the smaller Echo's I say pull the trigger on this unit, you won't be disappointed. Keep in mind to get the full experience you need to upgrade your Amazon Music subscription to HD or you won't get the 3D audio or the HD tracks. Not worth it without doing this.

I bought two of these and the Echo Sub and they sound great. I only hope the neighbor doesn't hear the sub. Maybe I shouldn't worry about it. The Echo Studio pair without the "Sub" base unit sound great on their own, just not as much bass. I love the fact that i can adjust the sound with the equalizer on my Echo app. (treble, mid-range, and bass) I recommend. I had the first generation Echo which I still love, and i have the Prime music subscription which is great with some 20 million cd's to play. With this you have a "library" on line and create your own play lists.

We have a variety of Alexa devices - and love them. Took advantage of a deal to get a Studio, Show 5, and a Hue bulb for $199.

Moved our ‘original’ Alexa from the living room to the wife’s office and put the new Studio in its spot. Took 3 minutes to set up and run the EQ check.

BIG Pandora users, and typically play stations through home theater A/V receiver. (Denon AVR...marvelous machine) Now listening to one of our favorite stations via the new Studio...WOW. Quite good for a single column of parts.

The much hyped 3D sound is not that apparent yet. Tried the suggested playlist and it was just annoying. BUT, the music we are playing sounds wonderful.

Now, I wouldn’t have normally spent $200 on a speaker with limited use. That said, the bundle deal was great and there is ZERO regret for this purchase.

me gusto:

1. El sonido es de buena calidad supera a los echos anteriores
2. Es compacto y tiene buena presentación, enamora al verlo y escucharlo
3. Sirve como barra de sonido
4. Acepta Bluetooth
5. Acepta entrada óptica
6. Compatible con Dolby Atmos

Contras:
1. La equalizacion se reinicia
2. No acepta comandos continuos tienes que activarlo diciendo Alexa cada vez que quieres algo diferente
3. Se nota cuando reproduce Atmos vs 5.1 channel sin embargo no se siente El aspecto sonido que te rodea, los expertos deben trabajar más en esto.
4. Su potencia no es suficiente si lo comparas con algunas barras de sonido de monto similar a 200 dólares.
5. Ingenieros de soporte únicamente en inglés en español problemas básicos únicamente.
6. Es descartable no existen repuestos

I am now up to 11 echo devices in my house. I have dots, echo's, echo show 8 and 5, echo's plus, etc. This one sounds pretty good. Compared to my surround sounds system is doesn't compare, but for filling a room with good sounding (even on max volume) music, this is a big improvement over other echo devices. I have not used the echo subwoofer, so I don't have a comparison for that. I am thinking of getting another one to put on my second TV for better sound. The only one drawback. We keep the one we have on a tabletop. It is hard to see if Alexa heard you because we can not see the blue light without being close to it. If you are already playing music.. you know she heard you, but otherwise you can't see the light most of the time. Very minor issue though. It bugs me, but not the wife.

I owned an original echo and decided to take advantage of a trade in program Amazon ran earlier in the year and purchased a new Echo Studio. Am I ever glad I did! The sound quality is a huge improvement over my Echo and we really enjoy listening to music on it. In our backyard we have a large covered patio so that’s where we placed it and it allowed us to stream music and listen to Yankee’s games outside all summer long. It is now Fall and our nights have gotten significantly cooler so I’ve brought it inside. I think I will hook it up to our tv in the Family room for the winter. Setting it up was as easy as it has been for all other Alexa products (4), it took less than 5 minutes for the setup process.

I don't want to draw this review out so I will just get to the point. My wife got me the Studio for Christmas because I wanted to use it in home as the central Sound system for the main area of the house as we have an open floor plan. This one speaker fills our whole upstairs with plenty of sound for us. The problem is that when I went to bluetooth it to my new Samsung Qled TV it pairs just fine but will not play the audio from my TV. I tried for hours to trouble shoot the problem unpairing and re-pairing, changing audio stream formats, even factory resets a couple times but nothing.
We own Echo Dot(s), Echo Plus, Echo, Echo Tap, 2 4K Fire Sticks, and Fire Tv Cube. As a test, I paired one of our Echo Dots and the Echo Tap to this TV and it worked just fine.
So I gave up and called support. They informed me that this flagship $200.00 Echo Studio Speaker cannot be paired to a TV without the use of an Amazon Fire Stick/Fire Cube. That is just crazy to me. Why can I pair my $29.99 Echo Dot to my TV (Which no one would do) but not this $200 speaker? It took me literally half a day to reconfigure the devices around my house to get the Fire Cube into my living room and set up with the Studio. There is no reason for this, it says right on the box that it supports DOLBY ATMOS, so why do I need to pair it to a Fire product???

Anyways, I just wanted to write this review for anyone looking at this speaker to do what we are using it for and does not feel like dealing with the headache. If I did not already own a Fire Cube and I was not able to rearrange my setup to keep everything working pretty much the same at the end of the day I would have returned it and gave it a 2 star. Which is too bad because now that it's set up it's doing and sounding like what we wanted.

Really like this speaker. The sound is the best I have ever had on any device. Alexa isn't as smart sometimes as I wish she would be. I also, wish you could change her name to more than the options available. I finally need a catalogue of sorts on what is available with amazon unlimited besides everything. Other than those ideas this is an awesome device. The news briefs are fun. The songs unbelievable. The price is quite reasonable. I think I would go so far as to say this is the best amazon device on the market in terms of quality and price. The speakers work great together. The subwoofer has excellent deep base. I looked up songs on the browser to see which test the quality of the speaker and found some awesome songs for the tweeters and woofers. Really an enjoyable experience. A must have for anybody that loves music.

The sound quality is simply excfellent. Now this bad boy is perhaps 2-3 times larger than it's smaller cousins so think about where you want to put it. The soundbar for my TV was nearly two thousand dollars but I believe pairing two Echo Studios would give me better sound at less than half the price.

Once I start this review I would like to mention that I did a lot of research before I purchased the Echo Studio product. My 7 year old Sony sound bar for my TV suddenly died and was not fixable or in order to fix it was too pricey. Let me first say this product is for a second home and the room functions as a bedroom and entertainment room. This room is not a home theater so what I am trying to describe is I didn’t need a robust sound system based on the room size and function. Also, I did want a system (speaker) where I could listen to music and have good sound from the TV. Finally, I should mention I have Play1 Sonos speakers (1st Generation so no smart functions) at my primary home. Okay, understanding all those areas let me provide my review…

I have had the Echo Studio for about 2 ½ months and the sound is very good with the music and playing through the TV in the size of the room as I described above. The smart functions are nice to have but I will be honest I don’t really need to have them. Based on the research I did and reviews on Amazon and outside of Amazon said the sound from speaker was almost as good as the Sonos play1 speakers and I have to disagree. My personal opinion is the sound from Sonos is much better and the functions with Sonos app are 95% better for music lovers. What do I mean by that statement is I feel there are limits with the Echo Studio based on functions and performance for music lovers or as a primary speaker for music and tv in a smaller size room. The following list below includes the limitation of the echo studio.
• Always defaults to Amazon Music ( I recently changed the function within the app to my favorite music platform but Alexa still goes to Amazon music but not as much). If I want it to go to a favorite station of mine I need to be specific in my statement by naming the station exactly. And I am finding this very annoying b/c on my Sonos I have them saved and just go to the app and play them. So I have to look them up everytime if I want the echo studio to play them. This is a big fail for me.
• Unable to save favorite stations
• Doesn’t have the capability to store recent playlist or station. For example, if I like what Alexa did pick I say save that station and she communicates that function does not exist.
• Also, I don’t find the Alex app helpful when it comes to the music element as the Sonos App is. Sonos app is seamless to me. Also, I love the Sonos app in terms of saving the history of what the user has listen to and I can store favorites.
• The search function in the Sonos app is great because I can see all the options to play from all my linked music platforms.
I want to communicate to those individuals who are music lovers and are using many online platforms for their music. And understanding the difference between the two products. If you are reading this review and your in the market in purchasing a speaker for music and to play through the TV. I would highly recommend Sonos speaker b/c it is seamless more flexibility and more functions within the Sonos app that is not offered through the Alex app. This is why I am doing this review b/c that was not mention in my research and if I had known I would have spent more money for those functions and flexibility. I realized that I did get a better price but for me at what cost. I will say I am good with my echo studio and it does sound good. But if I had known what I know now, I would have gone with a Sonos speaker. I wanted to provide this information for anyone who is on the fence like I was….

Installed a fire stick on a smart TV specifically to mate to the studio for sound. Every minute or so the sound drops for a second, really ruins watching a movie. Thought it was the connection to the TV so I disabled the TV link. Now when it plays music it has the same issue with dropping out for a second every minute or two.
Also when TV was connecyed only had sound for fire stick apps not for anything broadcast through cable.

I bought the Echo Studio to connect to my 43” Insignia Fire TV but the only way I can get it to work is via Bluetooth. Bluetooth works fine for music, but for regular tv programs I have a terrible lip sync problem that I have been unable to solve. Others have the same problem. The only solution might be to connect a separate fire stick to the TV so that I can get audio via WiFi, not Bluetooth. The Studio works fine, but not as a speaker for Indignia Fire TV. It looks like Amazon is not supporting the Fire Tv app built into a smart Insignia Fire TV.

Purchased this so I could pair this with my Fire TV 4K. The audio cuts out for a second or two every few minutes. I contacted support which they had factory reset it, but the same issues exists. After researching online, I see a lot of customers have this issue. I don't know if this is a hardware issue or a software problem, but it's a problem. I don't think it is a hardware problem since streaming music works flawlessly. When I have the Fire TV 4K play audio from the TV speakers, there is no audio cut out.

Amazon really came through with this product. A few things to take into consideration:

Sound Quality:

While the sound quality is extremely good, especially given the price range, it’s definitely not on the top of the audiophile list. That being said, for the average person, this is a great speaker. It lacks luster in the mids so lyrics themselves aren’t as crisp as other high fidelity speakers on the market. However, the bass is awesome. No distortion. Also, this thing gets LOUD. Great for a house party or if you feel like rocking out.

Alexa:
While this may not be the BEST speaker out there, the Alexa integration and capability is great. The mics will pick up your voice from across the room even with music blasting. If you’re a heavy Alexa user then the great sound quality and seamless Alexa integration makes this the speaker for you. I personally run all my smart home devices through Alexa so having one more assistant in the room is great.

Size:

This speaker is chubby. Kind of looks like a chopped off robot head. It will definitely not just blend in the background. I have it on the corner of my desk 60x30 and still have plenty of room multiple screens and peripherals.

Room adaptation:

This speaker will definitely fool the room with sound. As far as the “3D Sound goes”, it’s really going to depend on the placement and structure of the room. If you place this in the corner of a room and try to listen to it from the opposite corner, you do loose some of that full sound effect. Also, the size and material of your room are going to effect the acoustics and how the sound bounces off the walls. It seems you really only get that full 3D sound effect if it’s directly in front of you and you have 4 solid walls for the sound to bounce off of. I have mine on the corner of the desk with the front speaker facing me. When I’m sitting at my desk I really get the full 3D effect. To manually reset/calibrate to a room hold down the command button for about 15 seconds.

3D MUSIC:

This speaker performs optimally when playing 3D Music from Amazon. Something to keep in mind though is that there are only about 1,000+ 3D song a offered. Who knows what the future has in store but that shouldn’t be the selling point if you’re looking at this speaker. Either way, you’re still getting great sound from any music app.

Built in Zigbee:

I don’t use any zigbee devices so I can’t comment on this. I also couldn’t figure out how it really works.

Competition:

For the same prize you could purchase a smaller Sonos One. Which one has better sound quality is up for debate but what’s lacking in the Sonos is Bluetooth connectivity. Also, the built in Alexa is limited.

Using it as a sound bar:

I personally only use this for listening to music while I’m at my desk. I can’t really see this being better than a a bar and subwoofer around the same price range or even slightly more expensive. I think it would work great with two Studio’s but then again ... there might be better options at that price range. User preference.

Summary:

I truly am impressed with this speaker and really enjoy using it. If you’re a casual music listener Like me and currently or plan to utilize Alexa, this is a great speaker. If you really want to fill the room then I would consider buying two and strategically placing them somewhere in the desired room.

OMG I’m beyond impressed!! This thing had superseded my expectations and then some! Watching movies on the 4K Fire TV stick is something else! You can hear every single sound, note & melody flying all around your head and let’s not forget the bass! It is clean and does not distort! Each time it pounds your chest pounds with it! Also amazon music HD unlimited is amazing with the speaker! HD, Super HD & 3D HD music blows my mind away! I will be purchasing another one soon! I was so impressed I purchased the Echo Sub to pair with it, that will be delivered tomorrow! My room is going to be bumping and slapping so hard! All while crystal clear! Mind boggling!!

WARNING. Do not buy the Echo Studio if you want to hook up other echo devices to it thinking you can create a surround sound system. The Echo Studio IS NOT compatible with two Echo Dots. I was told by my local Best Buy that if you have a Fire Stick, you can create a home theater with the Echo Studio + (2) Echo Dots. This will not work. Unless someone can assist me on figuring it out, it is not possible. This was very disappointing.

I purchased two of these to compliment my FireTV 4k setup and 85" LG 4k TV. Well, the sound is just okay and the whole 3D sound/home theatre concept is not apparent to me whatsoever. I am no audiophile, but as a layperson I am unimpressed for the $400 investment. With that said, my actual complaint is that it is a CONSTANT in and out connection with the FireTV...near constant crackle, repeat noises and missing sounds. I have to unplug it, and wait for it to reconnect and then have to deal with the voice/sound being off. Frankly, I am disappointed. I expected it to work flawlessly with another Amazon product...it does not. Also, note that the speakers flank the TV so it's not a "too far from the FireTV" issue. It's become so annoying that will most likely replace them. Think long and hard if you plan to use it as a home theatre system. You've been warned!

Let me start by saying the sound quality of the studio is fantastic. The design is clean. Now the bad, this studio simply put, has terrible microphones. I have changed locations multiple times, reset the system and still only recognizes about half the time. Even in a very quiet setting.
I own the original echo and let me say while the sound quality is seriously lacking when compared to the studio, the voice recognition is far superior. Let's face it, how good is a system if it fails to acknowledge you and play the music you asked for. It's pretty bad that I had to pair my sonos to my Gen one Alexa to get good sound as my studio is more or less useless. I expect more for $200. Amazon and Alexa let me down. Loyal customers deserve better.. My next smart speaker will be a sonos.

I wanted to use this instead of a sound bar and it has worked out great! We were watching a show we always watched and my wife said, where is that music coming from. It was from the show, we had just never heard it before because it was so low. Thinking about adding another to group.
UPDATE:
I loved this, when it works, but it constantly drops bluetooth. Tried to wire it to the TV, but you can't user the remote for volume. IF Amazon had an audio out on the Fire TV Cube, it would work I assume. Instead of arguing with the wife over, "wait a minute, let me unpair and pair it AGAIN so we can watch TV"..., I just unplug it. It is now just sitting by the Fire TV Cube....paperweight.. Might be good for listening to music, but not for what I bought it for.

Great addition as assistant for your home. When on your network it can help with answers to thousands of questions. The unit fits into your life anywhere. I put it at a central area so you can hear music on the ground level and the first floor. Sound from music is very impressive; for the size of the unit. We have an echo dot in the living room to eliminate shouting at the studio. The echo dot & the studio are synced as one, if you start a timer on the studio and you’re in the living room the dot will tell you the remaining time. Also, either unit can do other tasks in independently. The studio has better sound; it’s also more expensive. I would purchase the studio again, yes, it’s expensive, I’m more interested in good sound. For me it was the right purchase.

I'm updating my review again. I tried two regular Fire Sticks and neither worked without distortion. Went through a few optical cables and that didn't work. I ended up buying a 4K Fire Stick and an Ethernet adapter. The audio hasn't dropped or distorted yet, so switching to the 4K seems to have solved that problem. I still can't get the Fire Stick remote to control the Studio, but that's a different issue. No audio distortion is a win. The issue now is that the sound gets out of sync. I have to disconnect the Fire Stick and Studio and reconnect them in the Alexa app to fix it. The sound is good when it works, but it's been a weeks long, fiddly process to get the thing to work. And only sometimes at that. I definitely regret the purchase of the Studio. I'd return it if I could.

Pros: decent sound if you have a multi echo system and are using it for music only
Cons: it's massive
Not loud enough to use for a fire TV system
Not nearly loud enough for TV shows
3d music is still ... Strange

We added the Echo Studio to our home network of Echo devices as the main device on the main floor of our townhouse. We have three other devices of different sizes on two other floors of our home. The sound quality of the Echo Studio is by far superior to even the most current version of the Echo towers and, when linked to the other devices and played all together, our house literally sings.

The Echo Studio calibrates itself to the room it is in and the resulting sound quality is immersive and does justice to our wide range of musical tastes. We initially tested the sound on classic rock, dance, orchestral, choral, country, and pop. We play music and audiobooks on our devices daily and love how this device enhances our overall listening experience.

The one feature we miss on this device versus the towers is the ability to check the temperature in the room it sets in. But that’s it.

Love it. Would buy another one. Looking forward to the next upgrade.

When I first saw and read everything I could find about the Echo Studio speakers I thought they would be a game changer. Well, I still like them very much but with a very disappointing discovery. After setting up 7 Studio stereo sub pairs, 1 pair of stereo Dot speakers, and a Netgear mesh range extender (total of 23 Echo device's) THEY WILL NOT ALL PLAY THE SAME THING AT THE SAME TIME. That's the reason I bought them in the first place. Customer service techs have told me Amazon has a limit of 10 devises'. SUPRISE SUPRISE. Now I'm angry that I have to adide buy a seemingly arbitrary Amazon decision. I always try to be a positive person but from now on I will always resent Amazon's arbitrary decision to limit the number of device's that can be connected to 1 account. IS THERE ANY SOLUTION TO THIS SITUATION?

I purchased two studios and an echo sub because my smart household is.l basically ran by Amazon. I really enjoy watching movies and TV but also listen to a lot of music and am pretty picky about good sound. I can safely say that I firmly believe this $500 combo (purchased on Black Friday) is likely better than most setups you could purchase with the same amount of money. I have never listened to the Homepod but I have listened to the Sonos One. Yes the Sonos One and Homepod both likely sound better than the Studio if you are critically listening. However, I do know that the difference is not so significant that I regret my purchase. It was a little difficult to set up the speakers to my fire stick 4k at first because it was my first time doing it. For some reason the speakers would show as unavailable and I didn't understand why. I contacted Amazon support and they helped me troubleshoot the issue and I had it up and running in less than 10 minutes. Movie sounds quality is night and day compared to the speaker on my TV. The experience has been seamless since they've been set up. The only thing that disappointed me was how little of a selection there is as far as Dolby Atmos streaming because as of right now Amazon only supports Atmos on prime video titles. I wish you could take advantage of Atmos on Netflix and other streaming services but hopefully with time they will work something out as far as that goes. Movies still sound amazing but that would've been nice to have seeing as the main selling point is their "3D sound". Overall these speakers in a 2.1 setup with the echo sub sound amazing and provide an excellent value for the money and I would highly recommend it. Totally worth it if you have Amazon Music HD.

We use this as our main source of music. As to immersive sound quality, it’s fantastic, but We had to adjust it’s height to find where that perfect spot was. My husband is an audiophile, and he is quite satisfied with Echo Studio’s sound quality.

The challenge has been with Alexa. My husband was ready to send it back until we found that the best way to select music is from our iPhones. It was maddening when we would ask for a particular album cut. It seemed Alexa could usually find the album, but if we asked for a stand-alone song from the album, she couldn’t find it.

I do love that she can create playlists or that you can be awakened with the songs of your choice instead of an alarm. I’m much more energized that way.

This was a bit of a letdown. I was excited to get it but it just doesn't provide the boom I expected.

Voice activation of Alexa doesn't work from a distance while the system is at a high volume. I bought this thing to only work at high volumes so it sucks that Alexa doesn't wake up when I need it most.

Another issue is it's ability (or inability) to connect to other Alexa devices. When connected it to the fire tv it would sound great but would constantly disconnect or reconnect with no sound. Sadly, it's just inconsistent.

Lastly, the sound isn't that great. Compared to most soundbars, its a great competitor, but if you have a decent (5.1) sound system it doesn't compare.

If you have a recent generation Echo and a good sound system, just connect your Echo to the system with an aux cord (with male connectors on both sides). You won't regret it.

You can connect your fire tv to it and get surrounded sound without connecting directly to the TV.

Alexa voice wakes up from anywhere in a 20×20 room.

Plan and simple, there are better options. Hopefully the next generation will have less issues. And yes my picture is deliberately upside-down to show a frown with the Amazon logo

Lets start with my dislikes... the Cost. I wish it were less money.

The Good things... I love this device. The sound is very good. I'm not going to blow smoke up your skirt, it's not a High Fidelity (HiFi) device, it's a well designed Amazon Echo with good speakers, great voice recognition, and sounds very good. Anyone who tells you that you can get High Fidelity out of a small device it lying to you. Be cautious when someone says the sound is outstanding when the device is smaller than a hair dryer. Use some common sense and understand what you are buying. If you are an audiophile then this is not your product because you will analyze everything that is not a flat response. But if you are just looking to listen to some reasonably good sounding music at a low to medium high volume level, this is your device.

Sono"s 100% blows this away, sound, connectivity, Group, Multi-Room and if you can get, Example: Echo Show 2nd Gen to group (You can, but not easy, remember only 2 Alexa devises plus Amazons Subwolf), you just lost all of you grouped Sono's speakers. DO NOT BUY! my opinion!! Amazon needs a lot of firmware updated to compete with Sono"s not even close!! Very disappointed in Amazon to put this product out!!

The studio is a very nice audio upgrade for the Alexa ecosystem. It integrates with other Alex equipment smoothly and easily. The sound quality really is a big improvement over other Alexa equipment. However, for the price, I would like to see a bit better sound. Moreover, when it comes to price, you really are going to get the best out of the Studio if you set it up in a pair. Of course, that puts you into a different price category. Still, I'm pleased with my purchase. My ears are pleased with my purchase.

Really wanted to love it. The sound as speakers are incredible. Full sound in the highs and lows. Also purchased the subwoofer which adds even better bass.

Why I don’t love it, well I purchased the set specifically as a home theatre system. When it works, the sound is incredible. Unfortunately it disconnects from my 4K firetv constantly. Just about everyday, half way through the movie. So I’m left having to stop it and restart it so it reconnects. I’ve gotten to the point where I’ve umpaired my 4K firetv from the speakers because it was so annoying.

I have echo and echo dot in the house. The studio was a replacement for the dot in my bedroom, and frankly I’m very disappointed with the studio sound/bass. Studio is pla mid-room, on a dresser, 3D is turned off, and bass in Alexa app is set at highest setting. I run it about volume 4 or 5, not ‘party’ loud. It doesn’t really sound better (bass) than the dot! I should return it, but I’ve tried living with it for a week and its now used. Hate to see it go to land-fill. For comparison, I have a Marshall stanmore blue tooth speaker in my garage, admittedly costs $100 more but it has same size speakers and it’s awesome - I suspect the amp is a lot better.... I also have a Bose ‘sound Link color’ $99 for my kitchen TV, its more compact and sounds better than the studio. I wished I would have shopped a bit more and compared to Sonos, but online the Studio ratings were good and I was looking for the seamless Alexa experience of an amazon device, which I got, but the sound, base in particular, doesn’t cut it...

So we have several different style echos, including the old original echo. Our original echo is years old and while we loved it for its loudness and overall quality, this one blows it away. The 1st thing I tested and LOVED was that even with music at full volume, it still hears you. Our original echo could not hear you when the music is at full blast and you'd have to bust out the phone and use the app to get it to stop or push the button. 2nd, the music quality is GREAT. Studio quality, no, but love it and the bass is impressive for such a small unit. We originally were going to order an eco sub to sync to it but after hearing it, the sub is not needed. We like it so much we're considering buying more and placing them throughout the whole house! Highly recommend it

I really thought the sound of this speaker was top notch, especially for the price. If you plan to only use this as a music speaker, you'll be impressed. If you're hoping to use this for TV or movie audio I would recommend looking elsewhere.

We connected ours to a Firestick 4k and the general functionality was pretty cool, although setup was more complicated than it should have been. Audio for shows on various platforms (Prime, Hulu, Netflix) cut out constantly, to the point that we were continuously having to rewind to see what we missed. In addition to the cutting out, there were multiple times that the sound would stop all together.

Amazon support was eager to help. We spent over an hour trouble shooting but unfortunately nothing seemed to do the trick. Ended up returning the speaker all together after ~10 days. Might be worth looking at again if there is a software update or perhaps version 2.

My poor peasant ears are ruined forever. I'll never be able to listen to my music on any other speakers without feeling nauseated. I feel like I'm 4th row center stage at the concert- sitting on my couch. 3D audio is for real- not a marketing ploy. The highs are crisp and clear, the lows are clean and powerful- I can feel them in my chest at 50% volume. Alexa is responsive, but you'll have to scream her name if the volume is up over 70%. I will be buying more of these puppies starting with a stereo pair. Full disclosure, I sprang for the Amazon music HD music subscription. I agree with other reviewers on the form factor. Its not ugly- but because of the need to keep it front and center to create a 3D effect, there's definitely no hiding it.

If trying to replace a soundbar, do not buy these. I got one when it first was announced, and a second as you definitely want stereo sound. But I now write this out of frustration with this product. I have both of mine setup in the same room and paired with each other. Also created a “home theatre” group. Works when I first set it up. When I am finished and go back to it I have no sound. The only way for me to get sound, is to reset both devices, unpair my “home theatre” group and do it all over again as a brand new unit. It’s super frustrating. Every time!

Also, I have my gaming console plugged in to one of the speakers through optical fiber. I get the same results. I was using it fine last night. Just turned everything on, and I have no sound. How is this possible when it is directly plugged in?

I am officially tired of dealing with these and not having sound. Get a real pair speakers or a soundbar if that’s your thing. I am gonna move on from these as a “home theatre” setup. It simply does not work.

I love Alexa, and this just reinforces my decision to go with the Amazon ecosystem. I've been an Alexa user since the beginning (I still have my first beta Echo), and Alexa keeps getting better. I love the full sound of the Echo studio. I have an Echo subwoofer on order and am looking forward to pairing the two together. I have a set of Klipsch audio speakers for my computer that sits on the same desk, and I've considered replacing them with the Echo Studio plus subwoofer.

My wife and I use Alexa for everything from reminders to alarms and timers, shopping lists and home automation (lights, furnace, A/C, etc) and I would have to say I'm 90% pleased with the system. Any disappointment I have would be related to the fact that there are times I have to repeat myself when giving Alexa a command. I honestly haven't had time to investigate whether this is room placement or Alexa itself.

This round of Echo devices has been epic! I can't wait to try some of the others, such as the Echo show with the screen that follows the subject to the security drone that's been promised for the near future.

Amazon has definitely hit a home run with this series of Echo devices!

When I bought this, I was skeptical that the quality of sound would not be in the same league of the big sound companies such as Bose. After listening, I said straight to hell with Bose. I swear on a stack of Bibles that this is the best sounding speaker I have ever heard. And while it isn't even comparable to the Echo dot in sound quality and volume, it still lacks that bonecrushing volume that you want when you're trying to blow out the walls and raise Elvis from the grave with some Mötley Crüe or such. I suppose I am just going to have to wait until Amazon comes up with a 3 foot tall Echo floor speaker. Or if other companies would finally get their head out of their @sses and come up with something similar to that WITH Echo MRM capability. Amazon opened the door to that a while back, but surprisingly no one has really jumped on it!

Overall, this speaker is well worth what you pay. I would suggest setting them up in stereo if you can afford it though. I can't imagine how good this thing would sound with two of them in a room!

I bought this primarily as a wireless BT speaker for my MS Surface laptop. It was to replace an existing BT speaker. The sound was very good, but the lag was enough to make it unusable to use for video meetings and you tube. It also had an annoying "feature". When I muted my laptop, the Echo Studio would start streaming amazon music. So if you want the best sounding and listening Alexa device, the Studio is awesome. The BT is excellent for music, but not very good for video meetings.

The Echo Studio is way louder than all the other echoes with superb vocals, which reproduce clearly but with room for improvements.

The good:
The product itself is impressive. As an audiophile, I love the way this smart speaker sounds. It has the right balance of bass with excellent mid-tones and trebles out of the box.

Volume: As I mentioned before, it is loud enough to feel the music or to throw a party. I can see that pairing two of them will create enough volume for a large room when positioned correctly.

Streaming: I can pair my SiriusXM and Spotify with no problem. Apple Music tested and no issues either. It’ll play music according to where it is available. For example, if I ask for a popular song, Amazon Music will probably have it, but when it comes to specific songs, Spotify will be your streaming service.

The bad:
Streaming Volumes: The music will play alright, but having different streaming services will mean that each of them has a different volume output. I find Spotify louder that SiriusXM. So adjusting the volume sometimes does bother me. I would like the Echo to analyze the volume input for every service and then output it at the same standard volume and even amplify it so that it can sound equal to the others.

Voice recognition: Even though this speaker has more microphones around, I still experience problems when calling Alexa to turn on and off the lights. I have to raise my voice, even though my room is small. But don’t let this bring you down, it could be that I’m not clear enough. I sometimes speak fast.

Sometimes calling for a specific song in Spotify from X artist will not work; it’ll instead play the This is X artist on Spotify.

The vocals are reproduced easily on this speaker. However, I find it 4/5 on vocal reproduction. The vocals sound like if they were in the middle of the stage and not out in the front.

Otherwise, I believe you will not go wrong with this premium speaker. Amazon will probably update them in 1 or 2 years.

I have only had the Studio for a couple of weeks now. I rated 4 stars because it seems to be a little buggy. I have had to unplug and plug it back in twice now. The first time it stopped working all together. The second time, there was no sound but the blue light would turn on. The sound is pretty good, not quite as good as I thought it would be after watching some of the reviews on it, but still pretty good. I have a couple regular echo dots and they always work fine. I hope this one is not defected.

Very good sound for the size and power. Pairs well with another studio to fill a room. Wish it would accept bluetooth connections as well. Note, once paired it doesn't seem to be able to act as a speaker for other Echo base systems like Dot or Show. But works well by itself/themselves and sounds great!

We are returning the Studio. Neither of us like it at all, for several reasons. First, it does not hear us or understand what we are saying and we speak ordinary plain English. I don't care to shout at my Alexa. Second, the sound is better but not $200's worth. Third, it integrated with the Fire Cube (which is also going back) and did almost nothing without repeated commands, I don't want to shout at my TV either. Four, one cannot see the lights and that's just dumb design. This is my fourth Echo, and I thought I was stepping up to replace my big ole first generation, but I am truly sorry I tried. I do not recommend and figure we need to wait for another generation or two, especially one with a proper design. I gave it a generous three stars, but I think it's a bad item, not yet ready for consumers who are familiar with Alexa and use it a lot.

I got two of these to be a 2.1 home theater setup. I already have a really nice, studio quality down firing 12" sub so I wanted to use a 3rd generation dot to add that into a home theater setup with the fireTV and the two echo studios. Sounds reasonable, right? No can do. Yes, you could create such a configuration if you buy Amazon's tiny 6" sub and you could use a dot to add your own sub to one echo studio but in its infinite wisdom, Amazon must have added software that only recognizes its own sub in a 2.1 home theater setup. Hopefully some day in the future Amazon will allow a dot to be used in the configuration... or multiple dots if you wanted to add rear effect amplified speakers that were not from the Amazon echo family by using the dot as a pairing connection for non-Amazon speakers. But for now, if you want a sub in a home theater configuration, you're stuck with an Amazon only setup. That said, the echo studios do work great in a home theater config and I will be replacing my Sony/Bose 5.1 system with these... also makes the wife very happy... look dear, no wires ;-)

I had been looking for a sound bar for my television and saw that this compared closely in price to many of the higher end sound bars I was researching. The quality of the treble and bass are excellent for the size of the speaker and the separation is vastly better than a sound bar. I made the right choice. Also, the 3D and HD music quality from Amazon Music is noticeable for those audiophiles out there.

Unfortunately, the sound was so good, I kept disconnecting it from the TV and taking it to other rooms. (Really upset the wife.) I now have two of these. The second is paired with a set of Echo Pluses and an Echo Sub. The quality of this combined set rivals the best stereo systems I have owned.

This device gets loud so it therefore cannot hear its invocation word very well at times. Other than that I cannot think of another negative. I did try and use the Atmos effect form Amazon Music HD. It was not worth the price at the moment. It is only a $200 device but unless you have a $2000 plus receiver and true atmos speakers I do not recommend the Music HD Plan as a great upgrade with this device. Now on my surround sound system with 13 speakers 6 of which are Atmos the sound of the few soundtracks on atmos are quite amazing. Especially synched with my hue lights. Nice party, but that is a different review. I would recommend this product as a great stand alone device for outside or a relatively large room. It also works well with the Firestick or Amazon Firetv as a soundbar that can be utilized.

My echo sound worked fine in small areas, but in a larger room, it almost was tinny and bass sounds were lost. This new one has a way of adjusting itself to a larger space and now I was getting the full range of sound. I use it for classical music listening mostly so tinny is unacceptable. It definitely is not Dolby, but it is still good enough to be very enjoyable.. for such a small gadget. One word of caution, I get my music from Sirius XM and use that more than not and I had problems getting that loaded, which was not Alexa's fault. The problem was with Sirius that had inadvertently disconnected my streaming function.. Alexa's Amazon support in helping me figure that out was first class and we got the problem fixed.

She either has covid or she doesn't like me. Over the past week I will ask her to play something or about the weather, out of the blue she will please unlock your device in a voice that I can barely hear. This is right after I've asked her question to which she has answered in her normal voice. So I called the support line and the lady wanted to hear it, so I held my phone up to Alexa and asked her a question and lo and behold she answered it, not it a super low voice and asking me to unlock my device. How do I unlock my device when I didn't lock it in the first place? Can someone tell me what's going on? ps I'm always nice to her, and I say thank you for the information.

I like that it saves space vs. using sound bars. I have it in 2 different rooms hooked up to my TV's. The sound is definitely better than TV speakers, which was my main purpose for purchasing them. If you have the 3D audio with prime music, the sound is awesome! You can really tell the difference. I really wanted to test that feature and I was not disappointed. I just hate that you have to pay extra to have that that feature, but I will keep paying for it anyway.
The thing I'm not too happy with is that I use AV cables to hook up my record player and the sound is not great that way, you can't enhance the sound or it will hum and sound quality diminishes. Also, I don't see any improvement with Alexa being able to hear me better. I still feel like I have to yell at her over the TV or music volume for her to pick up on my Voice. I was having some connection problems with the speaker disconnecting from my TV constantly, but it's not a TV that I use often so i'm not sure if that has been fixed.

Yo so many people lying about this speaker. This is NOT a 5 star speaker WHAT SO EVER
When this first came out I laid the full price for it so my feelings are that of what a 200$ speaker should sound like and operate like and this ain’t it.
It’s bigger than it needs to be. The Alexa ecosystem is awful and probably won’t be around much longer. Sounds half as good as a homepod but is twice as big. This speaker stays on sale because it sucks.

At my age, I spend a lot of time in the "Think Tank." I used to read a lot in there calling it "potty training."
Along came Alexa so I put a Dot in there. It sounded OK, but at times it would be garbled. I thought about adding a Bluetooth speaker, but I haven't had the best luck with them losing connection, spotty connection, etc.
I already have an Alexa Theater set up and knew how wonderful it sounds (near as good as my Bose system), so along comes the Echo Studio.
Wow... It is awesome and I love it.
Sound quality is very impressive, bass response is definitely great, and the highs are as clear as a bell.
I highly recommend it for those who appreciate upper shelf sound quality.

This is a great product. My only small complaint is that the microphone for voice recognition seems to get lost when the speaker is at anything greater than 50% volume. You really have to start raising your voice for it to hear you. Also if you’re not facing it and you don’t speak a bit louder it won’t hear you at all. Now the major pronto thing is that the sound quality is rather great. Definitely closer to the Apple home pods sound quality. While it still falls a couple steps short companies to Apple home pod, for the price and Alexa capability it’s totally worth it. Much beefier bass amd much clearer and defined treble and mid ranges compared to echo 2nd generation and echo plus. Wish there was a way that as the sound volumes increases the listening mic would also increase so it can decipher your voice from the music better.

Setup was easy, sound good, not great but better than the TV speakers. A couple days after seeing it up it disconnected from the fire tv. Took the attempt to re set it up. Ok no big deal. A week or so later, it did it again. Starting to get annoyed. Now a week later it dies it again, took 5 attempts to re-pair to the fire tv. Think you need a software update. This happens at the worse times too.

Our household has more then 15 Alexa products and were big fans. We ordered our second Studio(and last) and it just won't wake up when saying "Alexa". We were only asking to have the product replaced and Amazon refused multiple times. They continued to ask us to reset and reboot which we did and doesn't work after initial reinstallation. Be very careful ordering this thinking Amazon will honor this product like others.

The speaker claims 3D spatial audio- but it’s underwhelming. It doesn’t even handle stereo audio in a meaningful way. The unit is OK for audio fidelity. Having good bass response is nice.

And it’s worth mentioning the costs you’ll pay to stream such audio. First, you need Prime. Then you need Amazon Music Unlimited. Then you need Amazon Music HD. In the end, you’re spending hundreds yearly to stream audio to a speaker that underwhelms.

It doesn’t work well as a sound bar. If I have it on 75 volume or less it’s basically a whisper. I bought an optical/toslink cable in hopes that it would fix the issue but no luck. I’m using it with a smart fire tv also, still has poor sound on lower volumes for sound bar usage. At this point I may as well just use the tv speakers. I’m pretty disappointed with this product and don’t know what else can be done. Maybe further updates will fix it.

I was extremely hesitant to buy this "expensive Alexa" as I called it. After reading the reviews, I bought it for my father for Father's Day. I set it up for him (super fast and easy to set up) and played the first song. I was blown away by the beautiful sound quality! I used to lose only Bose products and when I compared the similarly-priced Bose with Alexa, the Studio SOUNDED BETTER! The bass was slightly better on the Bose (barely noticable) but the overall sound quality went to the Echo Studio. And it was cheaper! I played the same songs on both. The integration for the Bose was much more difficult than the Studio and there is a slight lag on the Bose (the Studio is quicker to respond to requests). Hope this helps!

Sounds great! When it works :( It regularly ignores our requests. It won't stop playing songs sometimes and must be unplugged to silence it. This week it has failed to respond at all until I just unplugged it again. It does sound amazing though with the companion sub! I will send it to the basement whenever a better unit comes out and I feel like dropping $$$ again. We had an original echo in this same location that never gave us trouble btw.

I really enjoy this speaker. I use it for casual listening, mood music and love it. I listen primarily to classic rock and blues as background music. Dont get me wrong, I do find myself occasionally quietly listening with my eyes closed. This speaker sounds great, it just doesn't have the detail of a high fidelity system. No suprise there as it's a tenth of the price. I did notice underemphasized mids in some tracks such as Stevie Nick's Leather and Lace, but overall I still prefer the Studio over my Sonos One. I can't help but smile when listening to Pink Floyd or B.B. King. It's a fabulous speaker!

Clear, wide dispersion sound . I started out with an echo, and now have 2 studios and sub. You can sit next to this speaker and it sounds the same as in front. We mostly listen to classical music and am constantly amazed with the sound clarity. For the first time I can tell the difference between a “good” sound reproduction and an excellent one(not all sound cuts are the same quality). I like being able to control volume by voice, iPad or easy access button on top. Also like the simple elegant lines.
All is very easy to setup with Alexa. My one complaint is that I like Apple Music because of library, but sometimes Alexa says Apple Music “not Available”. I will try again and it works.

pretty disappointed. my echo dot paired with echo sub sounds better.
This is not ready for prime time. I really thought it packed a punch, by the way a whole lot of reviewers were "blown" by it. Trust me after trying it for a week. i can tell you, the base is nowhere that powerful as how the you tubers make it seem. These are obvious paid reviewers. well this is my honest opinion from one end user to another. safe your money.

When these first came out I wanted to buy one but decided to wait until some reviews came it. Well the reviews came in and they were terrific and they went on sale so I bought one. I was not disappointed! It fills a room with music without being overpowering in any one area. I was so impressed I took it over to different friends houses and tried it there, even outside. I really don't know how it does it and don't care. I bought one for my sister (who already has 5 echo's) and told her if she didn't like it she could just give it to me. Within 2 hours of her getting it she sent me the money. A friend who has a restaurant is replacing her directional speaker system with one of these. A real game changer.

So I just got it and it sounds really good, I have all the levels from the dot to the echo plus and now this one. It is the best one by far reflected in the price, But I would have to say the Echo plus is still very good and so far (with0ut hearing 3D extra music enhanced sound) Its a pretty good upgrade. Honestly I wish Amazon would just include a few 3d songs for free so as a buyer I could listen for myself but for now it is quite good.

I am listening to every song i love as if every song is a new song i now hear. Every detail that had been mixed but no speaker before was able to reproduce... I played Cher's Dark Lady and half way i forgot i loved this song for 40 something years and thought it was a new song that i fell in love all over again as if it was the first time i was hearing... Imagine all the songs waiting to be heard for the first time? A lifetime of Carpenters, Basia, Monica Naranjo, Adele, Carly Simon and a lifetime of music to fall in love with for the first time all over again... Linda Eder! And Aretha and Patty and Liza and oh Evita by Festival... Its worth 5 sonos 10 boses and i cant wait to get another!!!

Good soundstage and audio quality if you subscribe to amazon unlimited + HD/SHD. However, this speaker sounds very ordinary with lower quality audio sources. It’s a studio speaker that reveals the flaws and brilliance of your audio source. Buy an alexa enabled Bose speaker if you don’t plan on purchasing an Amazon subscription service. Alexa Integration would be 5 stars if the speaker had a small lcd display to e.g. show title, album art, clock....

Good stuff:
- great sound for the demo “best 3D music” playlist, simply amazing

Bad stuff (hopefully all related to software):
- can’t be used as TV soundbar - audio delay is too big, compared on 2 different TVs with a Yamaha soundbar
- sound quality is good but there is no substitution for a stereo pair unless you pay for AmazonMusic HD and have the speaker centered in front of you, didn’t work for me as it was blocking computer monitor or TV screen
- in the middle of playing random playlist the sound suddenly gets garbled while being loud! It’s unacceptable, thinking about returning the echo studio if the issue isn’t fixed in a month time
- Dolby atmos only supported with fire tv 4K stick, you can’t get it with AppleTV 4K. This feature seems to be useless for me.
- equalizer settings don’t seem to change anything, I can get more treble or less midrange

I also own Echo for a year and it does not have any of the problem I described.

The Studio Alexa does have better sound than the others, so I'm happy with it. I listen to a fair amount of music and appreciate the quality. The only advice I would give is to put the speaker in your wish list or Cart, then "save for later". If you keep going back every couple of days, after a couple of weeks it just drops $40-$50 dollars - buy it right away as the price will go up again very quickly. This may be coincidental but I've had it happen on a couple of high priced items so I'll keep trying in future.
The "3D sound" I signed up for and the demo songs do sound slightly better but it's unnoticeable when playing regular music so I will likely cancel the service before the free trial period is up.

Wow! What a sound from such a small speaker, the bass is good and clarity is excellent. I had read many reviews that were mostly very positive, but kept noticing some people had paired two and were blown away with the results. Now don't get me wrong, One is sufficient and fills the room, but two, well it's incredible. I did start off by purchasing one, but with the deal Amazon have at the moment for $169 I decided to go all in and get the second. I am so glad I did! Easy set up and pairing was a breeze. I didn't go for the Echo Sub like many have, as my use is mainly for music and not for the movie experience. Also Amazon no longer carry the Echo Sub, but it still can be bought from other outlets. If I see one at the right price I may be tempted, but as for now, I am more than happy. These are currently being offered with 5 interest free monthly payments if you prefer to spread the cost. Good Job Amazon! Happy and Impressed.

More difficult to set up than I thought it took me longer and more attempts finally came together I am still having a problem with my Amazon music only plays for about a minute and then shuts off I have to go through my Spotify and use my phone to control the system I have nine devices in the house four small Echo dots one second generation echo two third generation Echo One first generation echo Echo sub wooferAnd last but at least the 3-D studio echo great sound when they all Play together

Both Google and Amazon have nice smart speakers, but both are far from where they should be. In the end, I bought a smart TV with Chromecast and Amazon Prime, and Google Max speakers.

Hopefully, either Google or Amazon will get there, but it's still in Beta, as far as I'm concerned. The sound is really good. Linking two Echo Studio and one Echo Sub is maddening.

Amazon's customer service needs to be revamped. In order to keep call time moving, Amazon constantly switches the customer from one agent to another. Each time, the new agent needs time to read through the notes. That's not customer service, but rather customer disservice.

I remain a loyal Amazon customer. I remain hopeful.

Been using this speaker for a few weeks now and completely enjoy it. I have it in my townhouse in a open room about 40’x15’ and it fills the room with perfect sound. I had owned all the other Echo speakers before this one and this blows the previous products away!

The Echo Studio sounds great, just playing music from amazon music or apple music or any other streaming services. Where it shines is with an amazon music HD subscription. It seems the music is coming from all around. The louder the volume, the better the sound, especially with ultra HD 3D music. If this will be your first echo device, you can't go wrong. I think I own most of the devices, and this is the best one yet hands down.

I own about 7 different echo devices, dots, spots, shows, etc. Along with 4 fire tv sticks.

I got this studio with the intention of replacing the built in speakers on my main living room tv, which is only really used with a Fire TV Stick.

Setting up the device was a breeze, just as all echo devices are. The real exciting part was when creating the Audio System for the Fire TV stick, which also was an incredibly easy process, and then I was up and running.

Overall, while I am not a sound engineer, I think the sound quality was pretty incredible. Granted, I’m moving from built in tv speakers, however, the bass was punchy and smooth, balance feels great. When playing music, it’s a fully immersive sound that fills the room. While it doesn’t compare to a full scale surround sound system for movies or watching TV, it does sound great and is a very easy solution.

As all echo devices do, this studio integrates perfectly with my existing ecosystem, multi-room music, etc. There do appear to be a couple bugs, biggest one I found was when asking this device to play Spotify, it won’t play it on that device but in an entirely different room. I’ve seen reports of this bug and assuming that it’ll be fixed soon, as Amazon doesn’t seem to let bugs like this hang around too long.

Overall, a great device and I’ll probably be getting another shortly to pair them in stereo.
The music is so clear and surrounds you. The Elvis Presley Ultra HD is the best I've ever heard. I'm 77 years old. So I've been listening to Elvis music for a lot of years.

The quality of the alexa functions are great, but listening to music is the issue. I have both sonos speakers and now the echo studio, i think the quality is in the sonos. I think if Amazon has an update to fix some issues, i think it would be a great speaker. If you use the studio for surround sound from your TV, most times the mouths are off quite a bit.

Overall i would purchase a sonos speaker again just because of the quality and reputation they have.

I really thought this unit was going to knock my socks off, but it didn't. I does have good sound, much better than any other Echo I've owned, but it doesn't have the fantastic sound I read about or watched YouTube videos on. I've also noticed it doesn't seem to "listen" as well as the tower Echo I have, not sure if it has less mics or not, but I do have to repeat myself more that the other Echos I have. All in all a nice system, just not sure it's worth the expense.

I’ve wanted a home theater for many years but have never been able to afford one.

When the Echo Studio came out I was interested and I purchased one.

When I found out that it could be used as part of a home theater set up I was very excited!

I already had the Fire Cube so I added a second Echo Studio and the Amazon Subwoofer.

At first I was very hopeful despite the many negative reviews that I’d read about using that set up as a home theater.

Sadly it turns out the negative reviews are correct.

I’ve had nothing but trouble with the Studios going offline for no reason on a very frequent basis.

And there is no reset button that I’m aware of so it means, in my case, climbing over furniture to unplug the Studio from the back of the device since I can’t reach the outlet where they are plugged in.

If this reset was only necessary rarely I wouldn’t mind as much but it’s gotten to be at least every two weeks if not more frequently especially lately.

Also on the Alexa app it keeps showing that the sub needs attention I have no idea what attention it needs but if I click on the sub the warning triangle symbol goes away until the next time I open the Alexa app and scroll through devices.

And the Echo Studios do not play nicely at all with the Amazon Recast.

That’s a daily nightmare with the audio when I watch a recording stuttering repeatedly and breaking up so badly that I have to keep rewinding the recording to try and hear the show.

Very annoying! 😡

I have to reset the Recast which is another pain as often the Recast claims that it’s suddenly not on the network so I can’t restart it via the Fire Cube TV.

Which is bizarre because I’ll check the network at the time and everything is fine, no settings were changed etc.

So then I have to unplug the Recast to get it to reset.

I wish that the Studio at least had a reset button that would cause the Studio to do a reboot as opposed to my having to climb over furniture just to unplug it and reboot the Studio.

All in all my dream of having my own home theater setup remains only that, a dream, because the Echo Studios and a Sub are no substitute for a real home theater set up.

I wanted to be happy with the Echo Studio but I’m not.

It needs more work to be a home theater system.

As a single stand alone speaker it may be adequate but that’s not what I was looking for, I wanted a home theater.

Your experience may differ but I will not recommend it as a home theater at this point.

Thank you to anyone who takes the time to read this review I know it’s quite long.

Sound quality is fantastic. But... it works for a bit then cuts out. When trying to fix it- its a 'network error' - and I've tried all the usual stuff and everything people suggest online with resetting everything from the router up, using the alexa app to remove the home theater group and remake it... then it works for an hour or two, then it cuts off again. Gotten to the point I just enjoy my bedroom tv and ignore the big living room one. Everyone does. I killed the shared living space.
And its really limited to Just the firestick- (I've also reset that stick many times) which is a bummer.
I wish that it came with a wire so that you had the backup option to just attach it directly to your tv.
Going to be trying it out with "AmazonBasics Optical Toslink to Mini Toslink Jack Digital Audio Cable" and see how That goes.

This unit is a very good value since it incorporates the ZigBee Hub. I purchased the Echo Studio since I decided to begin a project of automating my house. With one exception (the C by GE product), all the best of breed that I purchased worked great with Alexa.

I have two complaints, one I knew from another owner. The low end sounds contrived. This is to be expected since the are faking the base with a relatively small woofer. This is the small shortcoming I noticed. Not a deal breaker but it would be nice...
