My biggest complaint is that Alexa in an Echo Studio is a bit hard of hearing. I have to speak very loudly in order to execute the command. My Echo Plus, Echo, Echo Dot and Echo Show are acceptably sensitive to inputs.

Other than that, it is doing the job. It is so cool to automate your house.

I thought I might “like” this product, but I ended up LOVING it! We had an Alexa dot but I wanted something with better sound quality, this had really good reviews so I was hopeful. After we got it home and set it up it was the perfect stereo system for our living space and we love how well it fits our space. Our neighbor drove by one day and could hear it from outside and asked what kind of stereo we were using. Very happy with the product. Highly recommended.

I tried the echo 3rd gen pair with sub and it was good. 2 of these studios IMHO is better. Overall sound is better. Echo sub was kinda disappointing. It's small and cheap so it does what it's suppose to I guess but for my limited kitchen area I wanted as few devices and wires as possible. A pair of studios sounds great but pricy at 400$ for the pair. But compared to Google or Sonos or Bose at the same price, these studios win as a pair.

There is a lot to like here. It really does sound outstanding, especially when you utilize the 3d sound; however, I sent my set back.

The problem is I really wanted to use these for a home theater. I see a lot of talk on the web about this and they do integrate fairly well with the Fire Cube. The imaging is awesome and the volume is perfect. What I found ruined the experience was the lack of bass.

Bass put out by the speakers is tight and accurate - it's quite good. There just is not enough of it for a small home theater. The experience is just ruined by it. Pairing this with a Echo Sub would be perfect, but that is discontinued. AMAZON PLEASE BRING BACK THE ECHO SUB!

With a built in 24bit DAC and excellent sound, Echo Studio is a winner. I spent significant time researching and in search of a upgraded bluetooth or wi-fi speaker to pair with the newly released Amazon HD music service. There's always give and take with Hi-Fi purchases (in my opinion) and this was no different. Although there were a few speakers on the market that boasted slighter better audio performance, it was at a price point more than twice the Echo Studio and none the a 24bit or higher DAC built in. I have found the sound performance excellent and having the convenience of Alexia, it was a no-brainer. Currently, I am satisfied with the bass performance, I find no need for the add on sub-woofer. I will likely purchase more.
Set up was simple and when I purchase another one and if I decide to pair them, the Alexia app makes the pairing process.
Like anything else, I also see some opportunity for improvement. I was disappointed there was not a built in Ethernet port. (I purchased a USB3 Ethernet adapter, however not tested it yet, 5G Wi-Fi is doing the trick) This speaker is not as visually appealing as a few of the other hi-fi spearkers I was looking at however, as stated above, none had the total benefits of the Echo Studio.

I got the Sonos One for Christmas, but was really interested in the Studio so I bought one to put side by side. On it's own it sounds great compared to previous Echos, but playing the same song right next to the Sonos One allows you to hear that it is not as clean/crisp. It sounds kinda muffled. I expected the lows to sound a lot better on this than the Sonos since it has a 5" downward firing sub where the Sonos is just a single speaker. Lows sound good but not by much.
The biggest disappointment is that even the microphones to invoke Alexa aren't as good as the Sonos or even my older Echo, not sure what's going on there. I'll stick to the Sonos and send this one back.

I got the Echo Studio to use with a TCL ROKU TV. We have the TV in a custom made enclosure and there is no good place to add a sound bar. The Echo Studio can be connected via blue tooth if you use an iPhone as an intermediary (the TV will NOT connect directly to the Echo Studio via blue tooth). Using the iPhone as an intermediary works fine, except there is too much delay - the sound does not match the speaker’s lips. Because of that, I connect the TV to the Echo Studio with a cable, and that works just fine.
The sound on this system is quite good, especially for the price. However, if you are really picky about sound quality you may want to consider something more expensive like a Bose system.
I also use the Echo Studio to just play music from the TV or my iPhone. Again, the sound quality is very good for something in this price range - strong bass and treble, and plenty of power.
All-in-all, this is a good unit and it is more than adequate for many situations.

As an upgrade from the first generation echo, I expected the studio (with accompanying subwoofer) to sound much better, more bass and much improved sound quality. I was let down. The sound quality is somewhat better, but not anywhere near the $250 I spent for the new echo studio and subwoofer. The bass does not have a volume control either.

I may end up liking this 5 stars eventually, but not now. The sound is very good. I was using the Echo. There is one problem I have not solved....... when I have Amazon music stations playing, it will play for a while... then all of a sudden it makes horrible noises that continue. I don't know how to describe it--- maybe like people talking or noises underwater.. and it is loud. Garbled noises. It looks nice. Bigger than I expected. One other thing I do not like is I can't see the light on top like I could with the Echo. I suspect the noise problem has something to do with the connection, but I have no wireless problems with my Echos, internet, or Roku TV.

Sound is ok. It is better than Amazon's other options but it won't blow you away. Stereo option while "easy" to set up did take multiple tries for it to work correctly. I also had quite a bit of difficulty getting these to work as part of a multi room group. I ended up having to delete all my groups and start from scratch after which it worked flawlessly. I'm also taking a star away because Amazon still doesn't have a way for one to listen to music they already own on the multi-room group. Paid apps exist to be able to play music you might have on your computer but it will only play over one speaker at a time which really limits the utility of this speaker ecosystem.

Like a lot of folks, we cut our cable and phone subscription to save a bundle each month and instead bought an Amazon Fire stick to watch tv through Amazon prime, and subscribed to Netflix and Hulu. (We also have mesh wifi for improved wifi coverage.) We then bought the Echo Studio which immediately 'found' our Fire tv and played sound from our tv. Great! Don't let anyone tell you otherwise, it is perfectly good quality sound at a very good price (I waited for it to come on sale), and at least as good as expensive soundbar. (No one noticed when I replaced the soundbar with the Echo.) And the Echo Studio can be had for about half the price of the competing speakers and integrates very easily with other Alexa devices after running the quick automatic search. What's more, we just play our Spotify tunes all day through the Echo speaker -- and we find it is more than adequate to fill a very large living room while I'm working in an adjacent office. Plus, we could always add the Echo sub-woofer at some point in the future if we want more heft but for now it is than adequate. We don't use voice recognition often, but no problems so far. *** However, one grumble: quite a few times we've noticed an irksome delay with the tv -- that is, the lips of the actors on the tv move and there is a slight but irksome delay before we hear their voices through the speaker. In other words, the speaker doesn't synch precisely with tv. If there is an easy solution for this, please let me know! Thank you! ***

Seriously? $200 for a smart speaker that worked for about 6 weeks then constantly lost connection and went offline. Must be a common fail as Amazon decided to only allow a 30 day return window when all other Alexa type products have a year. Amazon offered to replace with a refurbished one. Refurbished = Broken and repaired. I know what kind of "technicians" test and repair these things. Hard pass. I could understand this if it had been a year or two under warranty but 6 weeks?

First, sound quality is great. However, I am extremely frustrated that the Echo Studio will not pair with my Toshiba Fire TV!!! The Fire TV is built in to this Toshiba model. I specifically bought it so that it would be in the same echo system as my other Alexa enabled devices. So, now, If I want the Echo Studio to serve as a home theater speaker for my TV, I have to buy a Fire TV device to put on my Fire TV. Seriously!!!!

Not to mention that on the Studio, Alexa often doesn't respond. I have tried, "Alexa, find my devices." and she never responds. I have tried, "Alexa, check for updates." and she never responds.

What gives? This is why I usually wait for subsequent versions to come out. I have learned my lesson. All I have now is a really expensive speaker that I can stream audio through.

I bought this because I wanted more wow sound from my Echo Dot. I am not that impressed. At lower volumes it does not sound any better than my Echo Dot. At higher volumes it doesn't have me saying that sounds great. Maybe I was expecting too much. However considering it's more than 6 times the cost of an Echo Dot it shold leave me feeling that I really have something exceptional. The sound is not that great. I'll keep playing with it and see if I can get it to perform at a level that makes me feel it was worth the extra $.

This is far superior in sound quality to the Echo 3rd generation, and a really good buy at the current discount price. Fills my moderate sized living room with solid feel at only half volume. Alexa responds very well even while noise level is moderate. Base is good for a 5.25" woofer. Upper and midrange frequencies very clear. A really good speaker. Best I've heard anywhere near this price point and I have a pair of BA bookshelf speakers of lesser sound quality at a higher price. Stereo feel of the Studio is better than the BAs somehow.
Ingenious design.
6 months after purchase, I'm extremely pleased with this speaker and plan to buy another one as soon as the discount price returns. The video reviews on this listing are accurate, this is a great speaker for the price.

I absolutely love my Echo Studio speakers... But as the caption said "Almost perfect"

The only issue I have with this along with every Alexa Echo is "her" constantly announcing where it's connected to via bluetooth at a very loud volume, all hours of the night or during Zoom meetings and online school. It is the most annoying thing ever and apparently customers have been begging Amazon for a firmware update to fix this issue but they have never cared to respond on the matter and for that I give this 3 stars. Not sure if they'll remove this review but it's just my honest 2 cents.

Great sound when working. Support and integration is spotty at best. I’m using this as a tv sound system, paired with a Fire TV cube on a Samsung 52” LED. Sound constantly drops from the Fire TV leaving me with no sound. It is supposed to connect via WiFi but the only way I can get better consistency (less drop out) is trying to connect via Bluetooth. This works better but still get dropped audio signal on occasion. My internet is Gigabit Fios on a Mesh router.

Amazon doesn’t seem to acknowledge the issue.

I’ve been posting here but no response from Amazon yet on why this is occurring.

I wanted to return but it’s more of a hassle and I disposed the box.

FIX THIS PLEASE.

Glad Amazon finally got with the program and offered “HD” & “Ultra HD” music, although I do believe Tidal has a very slightly better sound. In either case this Echo Studio rocks! Very nice, full, crisp sound with Amazon HD stream; this speaker will fill just about any size room. We have an open floor plan with about 1,200 sf combo kitchen, living, dining and family room and this Echo is all we need for a impromptu dance party.

I was looking for a speaker for my garage / workshop and had it narrowed down to this and the one made by that fruit company.
I was able to test the fruity model in the fruity store and was impressed with the sound. I was a bit leery to buy this without testing it, but I decided to try it for the sole reason that it works with all products and isn’t limited to fruity devices. It even has an aux input - every speaker of this nature should have this honestly.
Now the actual performance of this speaker in a 17’ x 25’ room is phenomenal. Smaller speakers made an echo effect. This speaker fills the room with sound without any such effect.

Utmost honesty, I have both Apple and Amazon/Alexa environment in my townhouse including smart gadgets. However, I initially bought Homepod and set it up that was not as friendly as I expected, when I found out that I couldn’t access Pandora, iHreart that’s what it turned me off and I did returned it back at Best Buy and bought Amazon Studio that was so much easier to activated and I was fascinated with its bass sound that I am enjoying it every beat of it.

I jumped and ordered this device as soon as I heard about it. Setup was SUPER EASY! If you accept to have your account added before it ships, when it arrives all you need to do is literally TURN IT ON. It will automatically connect to your wifi by using your password saved via your account profile and activate in seconds!

OK - so now to the sound. I used the sample HD playlist they let you stream to see how that sounds. It fills the entire room, with rich tones and dynamic range. I cranked it to the loudest setting and noticed something. The sound was still clear, but it was not blaring and distorted. The sound just sounded clean and I enjoyed every song. I walked to different rooms around the house and it actually travelled through. I can only imagine pairing 2 studios, which I may do at some point in the near future.

I also own an Echo and the sound is loud for this device - but it lacks the range. It also feels harsh if you blast it. The studio has definitely improved sound quality.

As for the HD music, I did not subscribe since I have a Spotify account. So I made sure my account had the highest bit rate streaming at 320Kb and guess what, it makes a difference using the studio. I now enjoy listening to music whenever I’m home. It feels great having good quality audio delivered at your command. I’m happy with this purchase 😊

I'm not an audiophile, but I do listen to music just about all day long while I work. In the past, I've purchased high-end equipment from Bose and Tivoli. The Echo Studio certainly stands up to those brands, and for a fraction of the price. Setup is quick and easy, and the sound quality is a noticeable improvement over the standard Echo, of which I've owned several over the years. Very happy with this purchase.

The studio is rich and clear in sound. Remember to adjust the audio to your liking in the Alexa app. I've tried several genres and they all sounded fantastic with good sound separation. Good job Amazon, and in keeping the cost affordable!

We purchased this item during Prime Day at a significant discount. I was worried about the size, and yes it is bulky, but has an incredibly solid feel to it.

Sound does not disappoint; it is clear, powerful, and "carries" much better than my old Echo 1st Gen device. We can hear it clearly in multiple rooms without being extremely loud.

My one frustration was that as the Echo devices that conform to the room, it requires resetting if you move it from one to another for proper detection of room acoustics. That means I had to deregister and re-register; I am not sure why a command to reset the acoustics is not available.

My set up experience was quick and easy, contrary to reviews I read. Voice recognition is better than my 1st generation Echos. I wasn’t overly impressed with the default sound setting, but the user can adjust the bass, treble and mid-range sound to their liking and the size of room the speaker’s in. Buying it on prime day and using my points/credits on my Amazon Visa, I got it at half price. It’s still probably worth full price if you enjoy listening to music. I anxiously await more of Amazon’s music to be “3D.” The only bummer is you have to upgrade your music subscription to get the benefit of 3D music, but it’s just a few dollars a month.

I have an Echo Studio pair linked to a Fire TV Stick 4k. The sound used to be great. That last maybe half a year. Since then, the volume cuts out randomly. There's no easy-to-find advice from Amazon that fixes this. In addition to the audio completely failing, now sometimes just one of the Echo Studios goes silent. I have fast internet, and I have no problems with online services using other computers around the house. But the thing things annoyed me the most is the constant lag for audio when using the YouTube app. None of the other apps I use on the Fire Stick 4k has this problem. Again, nothing from Amazon other than a suggestion to restart the device. If a software update should solve these problems, I'll gladly add a few more stars to this review.

If you are looking for the best sound, including best bass, built in to an echo the studio is the one to get. While it is an impressive step up with wide ranging sound it still doesn't compare to have a surround sound system. If you want the best audio you need to connect your echho to a high quality surround sound system. Still, this was sooo much better than previous versions I kept it and like it very much.

Your browser does not support HTML5 video.
 The sound quality on this Echo Studio is absolutely AMAZING it is super loud to the point where it shakes my whole room and my desk like crazy. Although the sound quality is good if your watching YouTube videos it is slightly delayed by some frames so it doesn't completely match up with the persons mouth if you ware watching videos which is kind of annoying.

One More Thing: The Alexa wasn't connecting to my windows 10 via Bluetooth so I contacted Amazon support and it turns out it the firmware wasn't working with windows and within 1-2 days they updated the firmware so it now connects. So, the delay could be a firmware thing but it's most likely just the speaker being slightly delayed, otherwise its a great speaker!

The echo studio sounded great right out of the box. We literally unwrapped it in front of the Christmas tree, plugged it in, and started listening. We've got an open floor plan with cathedral ceilings and the sound filled the room. No matter where I stood the sound quality remained. We now have it set up in our family room as the home theater and can't wait to get another to stereo pair. The only drawback that I can see if the ability to pair a studio with echo dots for stereo surround.

Very disappointed, I have purchased various echo products this is the worst. I would not purchase. This is the second unit since the first one would cut off, disconnect, static sounds. Only to receive another unit with the same problems. I wish I would have spent a few more dollars and purchased a competitor. I had to contact customer service 5 times before getting the first one replaced. At one point they even recommended I switch the outlet connections to fix my problems (come on). I’m convince that Amazon is not being honest with the review ratings. I hope to post a video displaying the issues.
I basically have a non portable $200 Bluetooth speaker.

Easy to setup and use. I'm still exploring the things it can do, but I'm most interested in streaming high fidelity music. The basic Amazon music streaming sounds a bit thin. Spotify is quite a bit better and the sound is quite good at low to moderate levels. Perfect for background music. As I turn the volume up, I notice some truncating of the highs and lows. I have not tried Amazon HD and know the bit rate is higher, so I expect a bit more improvement, but I can't imagine that it will reach true high fidelity sound, which is how I think of studio sound. I'm happy with the unit. The price/performance is good. Just not 5 star good.

I’ve had my studio since June. In all that time it has never been able to reliably stream music from spotify. Volume controls do not work from the app. Constantly have to disable and reenable the Spotify skill. Volume of music will stay loud while alexas voice stays soft. It’s the buggiest echo interface I’ve ever used, and Amazon clearly has no interest in fixing these issues. Sounds nice when it works, but if you want to listen to spotify on your $200 speaker, get something else.

UPDATE
As of December 2020, Spotify issues seem to finally be fixed. But the speaker is still very buggy. At least once a week, it just stops working and needs to be rebooted. Just seems to struggle with basic function and connectivity much more than any other echo I’ve owned.

The sound is also... fine? It’s not bad but not close to what you can get from a good Bluetooth speaker in this price range (and poorer than some that cost less). It’s definitely not $100 better than a standard Echo, which is what I’d recommend buying instead.

I'm Not a fan of Apple products, but I do have 4 Apple TVs in the house - Terrible Remote!
I wanted to buy a 4k Apple and thought I would give this 4k Fire Stick a try, I also purchased 2 Echo Studio Speakers to go with it as the full TV sound package.
I have spent hours trying to get my Spectrum TV to download on this Fire Stick... Download the Downloader... Go to the Spectrum App... Download this... Download That... what a crazy mess!
Apple has the Spectrum App on the opening screen, Menu, Guide it all flows.
I just watched a movie that wasn't available on the Fire Stick, so I watched it on Apple TV, but you cannot use the Echo Studio Speaker if you're not watching the movie on the Fire Stick... So I just watched a Great Movie, with the nasty flat-screen TV Speakers... Right next to $400.00 Echo Studio speakers that aren't turned on because I'm not using the Fire Stick. Not a good experience!
**Update... Called Amazon Customer Service for help... "Sorry, Spectrum is not compatible". It is all being returned, Remote Cover, 4k Stick, 2 Echo Studio Speakers... $450.00
The Speakers sound Amazing! For the 30 minutes, I listened to them before putting them back into the box.

This Echo Studio was purchased with an Echo 3rd gen to provide linked sound from our TV (using a Fire Cube) in the living room and another room (to listen to audio from the TV) and while the literature on the Echo speakers are fuzzy on the ability of these two specific speakers to link together, it is implied they can. Wrong. They cannot. Strike 1. After weeks and weeks of owning the Echo Studio, we have now RECONNECTED a Bose Mini Soundlink to the Fire Cube because after weeks and weeks of factory restarts, reconnecting, linking and pairing, pairing and unpairing, and countless hours on Amazon troubleshooting chats (the SLOWEST customer service chats ever), I have given up on the home theater pairing. Strike 2 and 3. The connections are tenuous, drop constantly, and even when the speaker is linked with the Fire Cube, the sound doesn’t come through the speaker and remains on the TV. So frustrating. The sound link between the speakers for multi room music seems to be fairly reliable and therefore, we have decided they can be used for music but not home theater. We’ve resorted to a less expensive, smaller and older Bose speaker for the TV that is flawless in its linkage and provides adequate and trouble-free sound. The $300 in Echo speakers are, for multi room music only, overpriced and I would have returned these speakers a long time ago except we live outside the US and sending these back to the US is prohibitively expensive, and during these COVID times, almost impossible.

I would not recommend this speaker to anyone. Find something else. Anything else. Because clearly among all the things that Amazon does well, building a reliable, technologically capable, hi fidelity home theater speaker is sure not one of those things.

Great speaker with great bass. Several other High end speakers don’t support Bluetooth but the Alexa Studio does. A primary use is Amazon prime music & bluetooth on my various Apple devices. I’m very glad I purchased the Alexa Studio.

I use this in my living room in an open concept home. The unit fills the area well - and there's a setting on set up that allows it to optimize for the room acoustics. As an Amazon Alexa enabled device, it is easy to set up and integrate into an Amazon ecosystem. The sound quality is significantly better than an Echo plus, but not up to par to a Bose or Sonos...yet. However, at the price point and with the full Alexa capabilities, it is worth your consideration as part of a smart home set up.

So, like me you have tried the pathetic Sonos One with Alexa where you can't change the wake word and even if you could the mic array sucks and it never hears you. You tried a BeoPlay with a Dot and the Beoplay is crazy base and doesn't maintain connections. This is the perfect Echo device for good sound and good Alexa experience. Mic array is the best since the first gen of Echos. BUY. BUY. BUY.

I've been an Amazon Echo user since the day the 1st Generation unit was released. Since then I've purchased additional units to include Echo Plus, Show 1st & 2nd Gen, Dot and the Amazon Tap.
For a while now, I've had multiple units connected in a group for music throughout my apartment. Since I started using the Studio version, I no longer use the Group for music, because the sound from just one Echo Studio immersses my entire apartment with spectacular sound.
The Studio also syncs better with the FireTv Cube for great TV sound than previous Echo's.
I still use the other devices and have no gripes with them. But the Echo Studio is truly the best of the bunch.

You need to be standing up to see if Alexa is listening to you which is a big hassle. She already hard of hearing. The color ring is to far recessed on the top to see if Alexa is listening. Back to the drawing board. Hey it's just the first version. The second one will be better and we'll all have go buy the newest one.

This was not available when I wanted a good speaker with Alexa, so I got a Sonos. The sound is good, but not as good as the Echo Studio and the Alexa integration on the Sonos is awful. If you want a quality speaker for streaming audio in your house then I would get the Echo Studio hands down, and if you want Alexa its a no brainer. Even after the big Sonos v2 update, it still had horrible integration. There is no need for Sonos now that the Echo Studio is available.

I purchased this Studio to replace a 2nd or 3rd gen Echo and Echo Sub. I expected to eliminate the need for the sub, altogether, and also expected the Studio to sound much better than the Echo, given the size, 3d audio, etc.

Boy was I wrong. The Echo Studio did not impress right out of the box, like I thought it would. I have finally been able to pair the Echo Sub to the Studio (after trying for two days) but I am still disappointed by the lack of noticeable sound quality. I am contemplating returning the Studio, as the improvement in sound is negligee at best. I will continue using it over the next few days and decide.

I have several Echos. Nearly one in each room for various reasons. However my Gen 2 standard Alexa sounds excellent. We wanted to add one to another room, so we decided to replace our Gen 2 with an Echo Gen 2 with a Studio. We were looking forward to the improved sound. To be clear this thing is MUCH bigger than a standard Echo, our old one was on the coffee table, this one had to be moved to a side table, it's big. Don't get me wrong, the sound is good, but I expected more bass, and much better sound to justify the double in price. I would say it's closer to a 25% improvement in sound. I would say with the size and sound, it's not worth the additional price.
Love it. Although there is a lag between when I turn on fire tv to when sound picks up.

The Echo Studio is a pretty good sounding smart speaker for the price and size. I like many things about this speaker, but it could've been better. So far the smart home hub feature has not worked for the three Phillips hue bulbs I own. I use to have a phillips hub but returned it when I got an Echo Plus. I sold that Echo last year and haven't had a way to control my smart bulbs since then. I am disappointed to say the Echo Studio does not work as a hub for my lights. There is a chance they are all malfunctioning or it is an operator error. As far as voice commands go, I recommend putting it about 12 inches away from any walls or solid objects. Since the speaker has 360 sound it will echo (pun intended) back to the mics and require you to pretty much yell to get Alexa to respond. I originally had it next to a wall and had experienced this so I can say for sure the speaker responds better being at least 12 inches from walls. The last thing I can think of that I really wanted but didn't get with this model is the ability to measure inside temperature like the Echo Plus does. I mean come on, really? I would have paid the extra 25 dollars for this convenience and to he honest I expect this feature from a semi high end speaker. You probably are wondering about the speaker sound at this point. It sounds great honestly. It is truly like a miniature home theater system with out the true stereo quality you get from surround sound speakers. There is a significant amount of bass and it actually blends well with the mids and highs. I can feel it vibrate my floor, but I should mention we have raised floors which are better at transmitting the vibrations than a concrete floor. I would give this speaker 5 stars had the hub feature actually worked and if it came with the ability to measure inside temperature like the Echo Plus. One last thing is not part of the review but more of a suggestion; if you get the Echo Studio, do yourself a favor and subscribe to music HD. I got my first month for half the cost which will normally run you 14.99/month for the cheaper subscription. The sound difference between regular Prime Music and the HD subscription is kind of like the difference between a regular speaker vs bass boosted headphones. Everything sounds more balanced and clear and you hear the sounds you normally only hear with a pair of headphones or a high quality speaker!

I purchased the Echo Studio when it was on sale 169.99 and was excited to try this thing out. Well the excitement was short lived. The Bluetooth would connect just fine through Windows 10 PC (connected to my tv via hdmi) and would work fine until I asked Alexa to play a song. Once that happened the Bluetooth would disconnect and proceed to play the song forcing me to reconnect it. This happened every time right on que. Sometimes when the Bluetooth was reconnected there was no sound at all despite Windows 10 showing it connected. In addition the Bluetooth connection would also drop at random moments and while the speaker sounded pretty good at first that was short lived as well. One moment I had a great speaker and then for no reason it suddenly sounded like a cell phone speaker (no woofer/mids). Resetting or unplugging was no help. My Echo Plus was connected in the same fashion and produced none of the above problems working flawlessly. As mentioned in other reviews the placement of the light ring is annoying since you cant see it at eye level (where most people would probably have it) and the voice recognition would sometimes not work. Also I figured I would update the software to possibly fix any problems but the Studio reported back that it had the latest version. When I checked Amazon website the latest Studio software version according to Amazon site is 3389730436 however my Alexa app shows the software version as 3590965380 so I'm not sure if that matters? Well I decided I would give it another try since maybe I got a lemon?

I proceeded to initiate a replacement ticket and was directed to a customer service chat. I was told this was not possible and that I could return the product and just buy it again. When asked about the sale and if they would honor that price the customer service rep just repeated that they could only return it. I asked why and again was just asked if I wanted to return it. This product and process was not what I usually experience at Amazon and the only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because the refund process was great as usual. Now I have to decide if I will pick another one up during the next sale which will most likely be Prime Day but this experience has left me looking for alternative options.

As a person who wants to use it as a Bluetooth speaker only, I found it very good in the aspect of sound quality. Its subwoofer gives it a totally different performance compared to other speakers.
However, I do find it hard to use sometimes with the connection logic. First, I need to download the app to start to use it and a lot of functions are only available through voice control. For example, I tried the radio function in the app but when I close the app in the background, it continues to play the music and I have to unplug it.
Overall, I think it gives me the best sound experience in this price range($150-$250) e.g better than bose home 300!
but I wish that there could be a function to let me use it as a pure Bluetooth speaker.

I wanted an amazing sounding system that could control the music and the volume with my voice command...and boy does this do the trick! The sound is brilliant. I bought two studios and the subwoofer- don't skimp, get the subwoofer too - you'll be extremely happy that you did. I paired the studio(s), the subwoofer, an echo, and an echo dot to create an "Everywhere" network throughout the house.
"Amazing" is the word to use for this. Friends who have Sonos are jealous of how great my Echo system sounds and how easy it is to play the music you want. One drawback - if you're having a party, everyone starts screaming "ALEXA play...." I'd say it's worth that one drawback. Definitely GayGuy Approved. A+

When it works it’s fabulous but there are to many issues. While watching Marcella or Queen of the South on Netflix the sound is immense and theater like. One drawback the sub is inoperative when watching tv, hopefully firmware will correct that. When listening to music such as Caribbean Queen by Billy Ocean and Do It Again by Steely Dan the sound easily fills my 19x26 great room. Two Echo Studios are paired with an Echo sub and they have plenty of power and punch for a $600 system. Even though listening to tv and music with this system is enjoyable there are to many headaches. Sometimes while sleeping Alexa will cycle the speakers and a tone is heard or you can hear her talking which is very annoying. At times sound will come from one speaker only or an echo can be heard on Netflix. Connectivity issues abound as well. The system will work flawless for days on end. Then they all loose connectivity or one is connected and the other is not or both indicate connected but no sound is heard. Mine are connected via Bluetooth and if the issues continue I’ll connect them via Toslink cable.

Can not do stereo with other echo devices if you bluetooth to say your computer. Devices outside the echo studio connect stereo via wifi, not bluetooth. It will only be in a stereo mode (studio, 2 echos) if you play from amazon music or such. Not blueyoothed to anyother device like a computer. You cannot change the input to output like you can with the echo plus and echo. It is input only. Amazon doesnt tell us these things, or at least any place I could find. Overall, I'm happy with the echo studio, just disappointed that the stereo setup will not work while the studio is blue toothed to a device such as a computer so i can play my own music.

I have been using this speaker for a week now. Sounds better than I expected. I bought this to put in my bathroom which does not have the greatest acoustics of course. It runs the sound test on its on, was simple. The sound is open, the 360 does add a little extra to a song. It doesn't sound quiet as sweet as my Mirage Speakers but close and for much less money. It is definitely worth the sale price of $199. Now If JEFF BEZOS would please direct his team to design a higher end version of this speaker with WiFi 6 built in and be capable of combining 6 of these for a full wireless surround sound system that would be SWEET and I would preorder one.
UPDATE: I have been using this speaker for a little over 3 weeks and the more I use it the more I like it especially with ultra HD songs, now upgraded to 5 stars and plan on buying another for my kitchen when it goes back on sale.

for me the echo Studio is genuinely a personal assistant. But it sound quality is such that I find myself listening to my favorite music. Alexa does so many things it would be impractical for me to go into all of it but one of the things I like is its ability to learn or should I say it adds more things that it can do for instance I was complaining to myself that I have to say Alexa for every single question it started getting annoying lo and behold 2 months into owning her she asks would I like to enable the multiple questions mode which means I can continue asking her without saying her name as many questions as I'd like the machine offers many opportunities for this type of situation as you get used to it like practicing martial arts the teacher keeps adding more things that you can do I highly recommend this piece of equipment even if you're going to college or you just want to get smarter about your everyday things for instance I am learning the phonetic alphabet, alpha, bravo, charlie, Etc. I'm also learning the periodic table. Obviously Alexa is teaching me all of this and they add many many things as time goes on for instance at the time of this they haven't added it but they told me it would be ready in another month sodoku I'm assuming that they meant audio sodoku I don't know but that should be interesting now for the bad unfortunately she has 10% cannot understand what I'm saying that might not sound like much but if you ask the same question a half a dozen different ways and you still don't get the answer you're looking for it can be annoying the only caveat from that is sometimes when she doesn't understand I learn something new and that'll take me down another road and I'll ask questions about it do yourself a service go online and look up dozens of people tricks that you can do with Alexa and things you can do the more people you watch and learn from and as she teaches you your mind will truly be blown from this machine!

Incredible speaker! So impressed with the sound quality - and power - what a difference from the previous small BT speaker that I had in my office. Set-up took a couple of attempts - but once the speaker was connected - wow - impressive. I paired it with a Echo Sub - and while I definitely had issues with the Sub (see my separate Echo Sub review) - the pairing of a Sub with the Studio is a must for the full immersion of sound. I listen to loud-angry-metalcore music, and the Studio does not disappoint.

This is basically an oversized version of the Echo 3. It is bigger, fatter, perhaps a bit louder, but the sound quality is no better and the voice recognition and bass response are actually worse. I thought I was upgrading from the Echo 3 and was profoundly disappointed in this device. Even after upgrading to the HD music subscription, the sound is thin and tinny, with no bass to speak of and a far cry in terms of quality than what my old Sonos One produces. Echo 3 is a better, much cheaper option if you’re opting for an Amazon smart speaker.

A big disappointment that I can’t see recommending to anyone.

I am so impressed with this device. The sound quality is amazing for such a small package. I then learned I could use it as a sound bar with the right Firestick. Then I learned I could hook them up in stereo and get Dolby Atmos for my TV. Just today the Echo Studio went on sale for $169 I had to buy my third Studio so I can enjoy the clean crisp sounds in my bedroom. They offer a subwoofer that I don't think is necessary because the bass is booming. Way to go Amazon!

I originally got my first Aleza, an Echo Dot for the living room. One of the main reasons was music. I was very disappointed in the Dot. Returned it for the Studio, and am very happy with it. My house is not huge, 1,350 square feet, but I can play the Studio loud enough to be in a neighboring room and hear is really well. I have since gotten a few GE light switches for it to also control. Very nice.

I had a 48" TV in bedroom where I was a bit underwhelmed by TV speakers. And I really wanted Alexa capability so I could croak out in the morning, "Alexa, what time is it?" This solved both problems. Sound is decent. It can't compete with the $2000 sound system downstairs, but it's only $200.

I had a little difficulty testing it with the free version of Amazon Music. Some tracks didn't play. (and why, oh why does it need the TV to play music?) I also tested what I THINK was a 5.1 stereo file. The stereo separation effect was minimal.

Definitely not a price point you'd normally expect to pay for a smart speaker. However, this thing rocks. It's a beast too, weighing in around 10lbs or so. That weight is due to the quality speakers and magnet drivers that the device uses. I wouldn't say it's Bang and Olufsen quality, but it's very good. It's able to detect the location of your voice as indicated by the ring. It supposedly adjusts the 3D sound based on room design, but I'm not sure how you prove that. It's also very loud if you want it to be. Love this thing and I think if it was about $30-$50 cheaper it would be the best deal on the web.

It's a good speaker and is good for the price but, given it's size, I was expecting it to perform more like a Sonos Play 5, but it's more in between a Play 1 and a Play 3. Glad I have it...

I will also say that I wish it came with a metal wrap like the Sonos because I'm a bit nervous that the fabric on the top and sides will get dirty or dusty, which prevents me from putting it in a lot of places I'd like to have one, but I'm using the echo dot for those places.

I like it. After the wife got out all connected, works great with my fire tv cube. I have it paired with an echo sub. We have it in our master bedroom and it fills the room adequately as the speaker for the TV. Together, the sub and studio were about 300. The soundbar and subwoofer I had before were more, a sony, and the new setup is better. The fire tv cube automatically added the remote to the studio. Can't do better for the money. It's not a movie theater, but it's a great little home theater feel/sound. The alexa Integration features are just as good at the other speakers which is a plus. Very happy.

I purchased this speaker because of the dolby atmos feature. But in the last year that I had it amazon have released hardly any atmos content. I even think I read an article about how they basically have up on atmos content. I was sold for the atmos and have have only watched jack ryan with atmos. That it. I have two of these this for nothing basically. It would be nice if I could watch movies on vudu and take advantage of the atmos but amazon doesn't allow that.

The sound quality for music is better than the basic Echo, but it's not in the league with a quality speaker. The sound lacks "presence." It sounds like it's in the distance or the sound is coming through a window. I tried my favorite speaker evaluation songs, and I was disappointed on each one. I have a set of Klipsch ProMedia 2.1 THX computer speakers ($119) that provide much better sound.

I bought the first series Alexa when it was released so I thought it was time for a upgrade so I did my research online and read about all the BUZZ on this new model called STUDIO so I went to my favorite electronic store and took studio for a test drive........WOW I have to admit I was blown away not only by the sound quality with the bigger woofer and added speakers which I started to draw a crowd because I really wanted to hear what this baby could do but also by the built in hub and all the things it could control which my favorite electronic store has a GREAT display area set up in one area, needless to say this NEW studio Alexa came home with me and I couldn’t be happier. So Amazon one again you hit it OUT OF THE PARK with this upgrade keep it coming you make life so much more enjoyable!!!!!!!!!! So if you haven’t figured it out yet I HIGHLY RECOMMEND STUDIO!!!!!!!!!

While it commonly fails to pick up my voice compared to my other devices, it makes up for it in sounds quantity. Those thing will fill the room with sound. I plan to purchase another, add a sub and replace my home theater system with it. One odd issue I have been getting though is occasionally it seems to get possessed by a demon and plays odd demonic sounds. I found a priest who delivers holy water on Uber eats though, which I can order through this speaker at a moment's notice.

I have a 3rd gen Echo, a couple of 3rd gen Echo Dots, and a couple of Echo Inputs connected to powered speakers. The Studio provides some next-level sound, comparatively, and I am very happy with the quality, particularly when using all together for whole-house audio. I was very pleasantly surprised by the audio synchronization between my Bluetooth connected Bose Mini Soundlink, directly connected bookshelf speakers and the Studio. I expected some delay somewhere in the mix, but nope, it's right on. I've struggled with the notion of adding an Echo Subwoofer too, but the lows provided by the Studio are quite good, and I'm not sure it would make much of a difference. I do have the Studio placed fairly close to a corner, so sound clarity suffers a tiny bit, but it's pretty large, so leaving it out in the open is not ideal in my space.

Can't skip songs when playing Spotify and when you ask Alexa to play Spotify it plays it but it plays it with commercials like you don't have a premium account don't know why but it doesn't make sense also be aware that you may be forever changing the volume on the Alexa studio and from your phone because it doesn't connect together you Alexa maybe at one volume and your phone might be at another overall the quality of the sound is good but there is a lot of bugs that need to be fixed especially with Spotify it wants you to use Amazon for your primary listening but not everyone likes it it's not user-friendly on the app you have to go through several obstacles just to get to the device settings and overall my opinion about Alexa is she doesn't listen well especially when asking to play something thru Spotify.

We had an Amazon Alexa Show 8 in the kitchen, but I wanted it for my room and we wanted a rich speaker that wouldn't be dominated by the sink faucet, dishwasher, and washer & dryer, so we got the Echo Studio with 3-D Audio. The setup with my Alexa phone app took only one minute and the music is a huge upgrade from the Show 8. Also, unlike the Show 8 which has a wall-wart, the Studio has a streamlined 2-prong power supply. We now also have the option of taking the Alexa Studio to the living room if we are ever (whenever that will be) entertaining, so this is a worthy upgrade in the sound department.

I have Echo devices throughout my home. Dots, Echo, Echo plusses, a sub and a Studio.

This studio fills the space it's in with premium sound. Great low end for everyday listening. In concert with the Echo Plusses and sub that are in the multi room group with this Studio my home has great balanced sound for hip hop, r&b, pop, podcast, and radio. I think this could be overkill for a small bedroom. Our floorplan is very open and therefore it's challenging to fill the entire space when full sound.

My only gripe is the price point. $200 is a bit much for a speaker. I purchased this on sale for about $160 when I had an extra $20 in my home budget.

Sorry to say but in the store the speaker sounded great. I put it into my home environment with normal furniture and artwork,,, it sounded tinny at best. Tried to love it... I really tried... but had to send it back.

Same height but about twice the diameter of the regular Echo. Also sounds 4x as good in terms of power output and clarity. I do not use the hi res audio option ( I tried it as a free trial using my laptop with a hdmi cable to my receiver and floor standing Polk audio speakers) I honestly couldn’t tell which songs were 44 kHz sampling vs 192. Maybe if I was younger I would have been able to).

I did notice that streamed audio from my IPhone didn’t sound great, ostensibly due to compression. Maybe because it is clearer, these differences are more apparent.

I’d buy another one.

Let's just say I've been. Waiting some time deciding what I want as a home audio system. Sonos products look and sound great but I ultimately decided to go with the 3D studio for the more bass sound over highs. I think the studio offers a good balance that's adjustable enough ( we'll come back to these said adjustments in a minute) to get the highs, why not as crisp as Sonos, pretty close indeed.

Ok so let's be clear, the easy setup that I watched tons of videos before the product arrived wasn't easy. Yes it connected to WiFi and adjusted based on the placement of my room but getting it connected to my fire TV was almost a phone call away to tech support. Actually I was on the phone waiting for tech support when I somehow miraculously connected it. It's a moment you will realize as a Firestick 4k owner that your Firestick does not update it's software automatically.

The speaker itself is a little bulky but honestly it makes it look more of a beast than the Sonos product I was considering. The one deciding point was the ability to connect other Bluetooth devices directly to the speaker and I'm glad I did. That feature is the most useful as someone using a phone, tablet, computer and fire TV to listen to music or watch movies it switches effortlessly between whatever audio I decide to play.

The audio setting which allows some tweaking to the bass, treble and mids is probably my only complain for the moment. I definitely think there's limited options for adjustments for the echo studio. There should be some pre-sets to assist with adjustments for movies, music and games. There definitely should be a way to adjust the individual tweeter's that create the 3D sound, that by the way you don't get to hear unless you subscribe to Amazon music service. The surround sound provided by the stereo spacial enhancement does help to mimic that pretty good. Also note adding thrid party software such as the Dolby and Atmos on my PC when using this device showed great improvement. It's unfortunate I can't carry that over to my Firestick and some other devices. My other complaint which I will contact support about is when I adjust the few setting options they give me it doesn't save and keep it. At some point when I open settings option again it resets back to it's original options.

Overall I enjoy the speaker and can't wait to purchase the subwoofer and a additional echo studio to complete the ultimate home audio.

it sounds good but the bad part is u gotta buy 2 of them for it to sound like a 2.1 because u can listen to the studio in hd or ultra and if u dont have the sub then it sounds like some of the voice is lower than the band...and they say the more u buy (and u can connect 100's of units and subs and the sound will then feel like a big theatre) it sits well on my dresser and beside it is a show 10 but my review is 2 thumbs up for the echo! 😎

Got this as a Xmas present and upgraded from the gen 1 echo to this one. It is a complete night and day difference. I'm not an audiophile by any stretch but I can hear the difference in sound quality between this and the gen 1 echo. The sound on this speaker is so much deeper, richer and clearer. The only downside is that the light ring isn't visible on the side of the device and the response ding isnt as loud as on the gen 1 so I can't as easily tell if the echo heard me. With that being said it does a very good job of hearing me and understanding what I'm asking. There has only been a handful of times where it didnt hear me and its when it was blasting music. I would definitely recommend if you are looking for a good sounding smart speaker.

Sinceramente después de muchos meses de uso No me gusta la calidad de los echo studio. Integre 2 echo studio y el FireTV 4K para armar un teatro en caso y es un desastre. Presenta una mala sincronización entre el audio y el video. El sistema ATMÓS todo el tiempo dice que presenta pérdida de sonido. Y no precisamente es mi proveedor de internet o mi router ya que tengo equipos nuevos de alta calidad que superan los $400 dólares y aún así el sonido es pobre por tanta interrupción del sonido. Compré el sistema SONOS y estoy feliz y contento. Y todo el sistema Alexa lo tengo tirado en mi ático ya que es basura.

I love my Studio! It's my favorite smart device so far. The bass on this is excellent. I bought mine as soon as it was announced in 2019. This speaker looks good anywhere you put it. Amazon music service works flawlessly on this device. I even bluetooth my phone with it and use it to play the sound to some pinball games for maximum affect. We also use the drop in feature with a granddaughter who loves to check in. To summarize, this speaker has added true value to the home in multiple ways. I look forward to see the coming developments of Alexa and this speaker-bot. With all the mic's built-in, the guard feature is worth the expense by itself.

I am picky about my sound and have a dedicated music room for my "Big" Stereo. However, my office was lacking... I got the studio and it is pretty good!! Four-star rating because it does not respond to the app to adjust the bass, treble, and midrange. You can slide the bars but nothing happens. Also, it does the room calibration on setup but not when you unplug it and move it to another room as promised. You would have to remove it and set it up again. I am hoping they work this out it is pretty good as is....with tone adjustments and room calibration it would get a five-star review.

The Echo Studio doesn't sound as good as the Sonos Play 5 (that I used to own), but it comes close enough to me that I am VERY happy with my purchase. After having them for over a week now, I may get a second one so I can stereo pair them. The Echo Studio sounds better (my sound preference) than Apple's Home Pod and even the Sonos Move. My only wish is that the light ring was positioned at the bottom instead of the top of the speaker like the new Echo's are.

The Echo Studio is a substantial upgrade to previous Echos.

1. Deep, full base.
2. Can be modified by a basic equalizer in the Amazon Alexa app on my phone.
3. Tailored its sound to my PC room for a great sound.

I upgraded to Amazon Music Unlimited HD, as standard Amazon Music Unlimited sounds very dull in comparison. It was worth it to me to spend an additional $50 annually for the major improvement in sound quality.

The only negative that I have noticed is that the vocals on some songs seem a little weak, but this really doesn't detract from the Echo Studio's otherwise stellar sound.

I may add another Echo Studio this summer, and pair them in stereo, as other reviewers have suggested. These units may not be audiophile quality, but they are a terrific value for the size and price. I enjoy listening to all genres of music, from classical, rock, country, easy listening, blues, jazz and RB. There are many songs available to put this unit through its paces, and a good one, which is also a fun listen, is "Das Spiegel" by the Chemical Brothers. I don't think anyone would regret this purchase, especially when used with Amazon Music Unlimited HD.

This speaker is AMAZING. When visiting my hair stylist, he turned this thing on and the sound blew me away. I had to see where it came from because the sound was so vibrant, clear, and amazing. This small speaker is PERFECT. Immediately I purchased while there, BB had for $199 but it came with 2 other items and the next day, on sale for $169 with extras so price was adjusted. I received and the setup was a bit much but it sounds-adjusts to the room. I love and since I'm able to pair with my appliances, i love even more. Highly recommend and the sound is far better then any of the other high priced speakers.

I really enjoy listening to music on the Studio and especially the hi quality music from Amazon 3D. I have recently paired this speaker with my Fire TV and enjoy the sound it produces.

That works so well with Alexa and was so easy to set up and to use of course, it can replace for many a sound bar and in my case, a larger sound system.

My only complaint is, and this goes with Apple too, I can not pair it will an Apple HomePod or with my Apple TV. While I realize it is competing items and systems, it would be nice for us who have both, to be able to use with both.

This is a very high quality unit. The sound is quite good. It does require more volume though to sound good then the standard Echo device. IMO at lower volumes the regular Echo sounds better. For a large room the Studio is a must unless you have multiple standard Echo units. The sound of the Studio is huge and clear when you get past half volume. At low volumes the Studio lacks bass were the standard Echo does not. The Studio is worth the money IMO.
It is quite larger in size and hosts 5 speakers instead of the single speaker in the standard unit. 2 standard Echoes might be a viable option to 1 Studio.

There’s many fine reviews that leave little to add. One point of personal view though is the Amazon prices that are fixed to their products. Whether it be speakers, tablets, or earbuds I feel that Amazon is extremely fair in their pricing of products. I’m an Apple guy owning IMac, Ipad, and phone. The thing is Apple’s pricing is in my opinion extremely greedy, I mean something isn’t right when a new phone comes in at $1,000 plus. Given that, as long as Amazon attempts to approach pricing fairly I will always remain a loyal customer.....

I had the upgrade from a dot to a smart speaker. The sound was good, but not home theater quality. Then I got this studio and it has been a really nice upgrade addition to my electronics. The sound is amazing and well worth the price alone. Just being able to play music on a level of surround sound is really nice. The big kicker was that I was able to connect the studio to my Samsung smart television with bluetooth. So the thing essentially became a soundbar to boot. For the reasonable price it is well worth the money.

I love my Echo Studio. It truly has high fidelity sound. The highs are crisp and the lows are loud. Midrange is clear (voices). My brother has a regular Echo and the Studio is amazing sound compared to my brother's. The Studio automatically adjusts to the room acoustics to best put out Hi-Fi sound. Just one Studio fills the room with music but I added an Echo Sub to my Studio to power up the bass. They are awesome together. I even want to use it instead of my ear buds at night because it sounds so good. Amazon has outdone itself! Also, see my review of the Echo Sub - you'll want one.

The Echo Studio is an amazing little speaker. When I first unboxed it I wondered, how much sound could this speaker put out. To my amazement, the sound is pretty awesome! The bass is very strong, the mids and lows are great, but the highs no so much. However, you can adjust the setting through the Alex app to give a little improvement for the highs or as much bass as you want. With that said, the Echo Studio is a great addition to any home-theater. Currently I only have one, but will soon purchase another one as well as the Echo Sub. Even with only one speaker, it can fill a mid to large size room with great sound. It connected to my Fire TV Cube quick and easy. I can't wait to purchase the other pieces to setup my system. If you are on a tight budget and don't have thousands to spend, believe me when I say, you won't be disappointed. The sound coming from this little speaker is incredible. I'm pretty impressed and would recommend the Echo Studio to anyone!

This has been my biggest Echo device disappointment. The Echo Studio works horribly when you pair it with a Fire Stick. The sound constantly cuts out, every 30 seconds or so.

I searched for a solution online only to discover its been a problem for roughly a year already. How could Amazon *not* come up with a fix for this?

Both the Studio and the Fire Stick are only 15 feet away from my router and the Fire Stick never had a problem before I paired it with the Studio. I'm going to give it another week or so, but if it doesn't clear up I'll be returning it.

I had a studio and I got amazon hd and the speaker came to life. The echo + and dots don't support the hi fi sound of amazon hd. I purchased a 2nd studio and the sound was fantastic. I have a dedicated music room with klipsch and svs subs etc. And the studios do justice for decent hi end sound, for living areas. You can really tell the quality of hd compared to mp3 and the like. A pair of studios make a great budget stereo speaker for music or movies.

I love the sound quality and its small form factor. My only complaint is this: I have my computer feeding through the unit via a physical jumper from the audio output on the computer to the hard-wired audio on the Echo Studio. When I wake up in the morning and power up the computer to watch the news, the sound comes through perfectly . . . until I bump my phone and it comes on. Bye-bye audio from the computer. I have to access the Alexa app to disconnect the Bluetooth and then wait a bit for the Studio to remember it has a line in. Not a big deal overall, just a small annoyance.

I’ve waited having one studio over a year and the next over six months before a review. I do like the sound, however I’m sick of constantly having to unplug everything and having them sinc up again because the studio just can’t seem to keep in line. Amazon I would expect much more out of your technology. I’m constantly having to fiddle with a costly sound system that does not deliver. And that’s with having Amazon’s Eeros wifi, that makes you pay extra to “seamlessly connect to other Amazon devices. This is the reason people like Apple more.

Quite the step up from my Echo Dot. First off, the sound is great. Bass can be a bit much, but can be adjusted in the app. Also, seems much more responsive than my Echo Dot. Takes up little space for the amount of sound it produces. Paired it with my Fire stick 4k, and it improves the audio immensely. A bit pricey, but compared to a decent sound bar, you get a lot more value, considering it can replace your Echo altogether. Overall, I can definitely recommend the upgrade, especially if you are in the market for a sound bar, and use (or plan on using) Alexa integration in your home.

The Echo Studio is excellent for music beyond any of the other Echos! I have almost every version of Echo, including the newest 10" Echo Show. I also listen to music a lot on my Echo Show 8", and it sounds great - especially in my bathroom. I got the Studio as a gift for my hubby's birthday to use in our enclosed sunroom, and the sound is amazing. I liked it so much, I ordered one for my living room!

I’m really enjoying my Echo Studio. It really pays homage to its name with excellent volume and sound quality for a single speaker in a 14ft x 14ft x 8 room with mixed reflecting and absorbing acoustics.
Not only the baseline sound is very good but I can tune it further with bass, mid, and treble controls.
I’m really enjoying listening to each one of my favorite songs and re-enjoying it again.
Aside from the playback quality it can listen to me even if playing really loud so I can control the playback by just saying “Alexa...”
Amazon really hit this one out of the park! Great job!
This is going to develop a following!

I bought the Echo Studio to provide a high-quality music source as well as a hub for controlling things using Alexa. The Studio has more than fulfilled my expectations. It fills my living area with great music, it’s volume, clarity and fidelity are all superb. Of course it also controls everything with excellent speech recognition and instant response. The music sound quality is noticeably better than smaller units. The sound is rich with full bass. It does not have the window-shaking power of systems with separate bass-reflex speakers but provides both as much volume and bass than I can tolerate. If you use Alexa to play music, and appreciate great sound, it is totally worth the cost.

Best investment ever.
I can be on a different floor and the sound quality blows me away, It is comparable or better than the Bose Sound Wave imo. I paired the Echo Studio with a Dot for surround sound.
It feels sturdy and solid, doesn't take up much room. Alexa sometimes has issues but it very well could be my wifi when it flashes red I just unplug it for a minute, then it's fine.. I listen to all types of music, audio books and used an aux cable from my TV, it's been turned up quite high with zero distortion. I loved the 3D music experience with the free trial.

This definitely sounds very good for the money. And works great streaming radio or playing music through my iPhone. I was hoping to get a second one to use in stereo for a home theater, but have just canceled due to issues pairing it with my new Samsung frame tv. I have gotten it connected to my tv with the optical cable and with Bluetooth, but pairing is inconsistent. With the optical cable the audio has just stopped randomly playing and reconnecting doesn’t work. If I try again a few days later it works again, but still very annoying in the middle of a movie. Alexa also can’t find my tv with voice control, so I have to use the Alexa app to connect, but you have to reconnect every-time you turn the tv on, and occasionally it won’t connect through the app either. Never had these problems with connecting to my phone, only with the tv.

I have two in my living room as my sound system for my TV. For the price it's pretty great sound system. It also connects to my PS4 via a bluetooth dongle with no issues at all. I even set a voice command to have it connect when using my PS4. For movies it's pretty amazing for movies and works perfectly with my fire tv.

Only downside for me is if I just ask alexa to play music directly it will only play from one speaker.. if i use the amazon music app through fire tv then I can get them both. Since the fire tv is what allows them to pair together it makes sense though.

I recently moved and have been looking at the Studio for a while. I'm so happy I pulled the trigger on this bad-boy! Shortly after plugging it in, it performed a room test to optimize the sound. Once completed, I had it play one of my favorite songs. It did NOT disappoint.

The sound is SO good, my 20-year old son heard it and immediately purchased one for his apartment. The bass was so loud, his neighbors had to tell him to turn it down one-night last week. If you're looking for great sound at a fair price AND Alexa integration, don't wait, just get it.

The unit seems solid and well built, but I was expecting better sound reproduction. I personally would have liked a better bass response rather than having to purchase a subwoofer. The highs and mids are good. I have had a problem with the device being seen by the Alexa app on my wi-fi network. It does work over my wi-fi but I’m unable to link the device to control it under the smart home skill.

I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised. It's not as good as the Homepod in sound quality (but honestly, Siri is still terrible) and not nearly as good as the Google Max speakers (the best of the lot) but, for the price, they've come a long way. I paired two together for a decent, acceptable sound. Clear mids and highs, the bass is adequate and not too "boomy" or muddy. The pair can get pretty loud without breaking up. Decent speaker(s) either by itself or as a pair when they go on sale. DO NOT waste your money on the sub-woofer. That's a joke and Amazon should be embarrassed by that failure.

Have many speakers. Try many speakers. This echo studio sound quality doesn't surprise me at all. The only thing it wow me. It's the set up sound. After that. I'm sure I will only pay less than hundred bucks for the sound. Even echo input with my old computer speaker sounds much better than this. LoL 3d music!!??? No difference at all..

Incredible! I just replaced my Sonos 5.1(Play bar, Sub and SL’s) with this one. I was very reluctant to try echo studio home theatre in the beginning but after reading so many tech articles and watching YouTube positive response I decided to have it a try. The sound quality is just phenomenal and beyond my expectations. I always had an issues with Sonos play bar with low mids and vocal. This echo studio setup has great mids and vocals.

If your living room is too big like mine (20x20) you definitely wants to pair echo sub with it.
Such good sound quality, super happy with this purchase

The Echo Studio smart speaker came well packaged and in a timely manner. Easy set up and fairly easy to add Spotify and Apple Music services. The device is solidly built and weighs a couple of pounds. The device responds to my voice even when I have the thing on max volume. The bass is deep and I haven’t heard any distortion of the other speakers. Alexa can be a little bit annoying when it doesn’t understand the words I’m saying so I have to ask it a few times using different ways of saying the same thing.
Over all I like this device and I’d certainly recommend it.

This echo studio is within ear and voice shot of a first generation echo that we also own. Often both hear the same command but the echo studio almost always hears it wrong and the first gen echo hears correctly, even I'm standing right by the studio. Sometimes Ive asked it to play music and I hear some very loud static white noise instead. The sound quality is disappointing given the hype. the bass is "better" (boomier) than the standard echo but the gen 1 echo still has better overall sound, much clearer highs and mids (vs even the gen 3 echo plus which we also own) than the echo studio. I've tried the published tricks for the studio to improve sound and the improvement is marginal. I hope some future software updates will improve it but in it's current state its a not a well conceived product.

I'll be honest, I bought this for the native hub integration. My Smartthings hub got some sort of firm ware update or something that caused half my led lights to stop responding. The hub became unusable. So the Studio connected to most of them, but not all. Some of the really old non zigbee are done, but they were really old. All of the silvania br30 color bulbs instantly connected to the studio, and all the AGSHOME ZIGBEE Motion Sensors connected perfectly. Really wish Echos had this hub from the start, these off brand devices are always horrible, but now they all work.

I had wanted to order another Echo Sub to pair with the Echo Show I use in my office, but it seems those are no longer available. I'd not heard of the Echo Studio, but took a chance and ordered one. The set up proved easier than any of my previous Echoes. Which is simply to say it worked immediately with little effort from me. I'm using the Echo Show for most Alexa purposes, so just created a speaker group with the Studio, and turned off its microphone. This combination is doing just what I wanted; great sound quality with the two working in tandem, and the bass coming from the Studio is a great improvement.

It is not a $500 studio speaker, but close enough to be well worth the price and taking two into your home, for music and for Alexa smart speaker functions. And it can pump out a lot of volume without perceivable distortion. I am so glad I bought them, two of them. Buy two of them. Set them as a Stereo-Pair. They will fill the largest living room with super clear sound. Just say, "Alexa, play Run by Leona Lewis" and these two stereo speakers will blow your mind! Or say, "Alexa, play WBUR" and use them to listen to "the radio". I am completely satisfied with these.

I've been using the original first generation Alexa/Echo for years and have been waiting for a unit with more volume/bass, now I have it! Yes, I like it for music (although vocals in some songs can get drowned out a bit) but for listening to audio books, or just asking Alexa/Echo questions, the voice is too loud has way too much bass and sounds unnatural/muddy. Also, I use the timer all the time while cooking, it always blasts way too loud. Hopefully Amazon can tweak the settings for lower volume for everything other than music, and more natural sounding voices.

I have to press setup like every day and go through the process of setting it up on my phone. I like when it actually works. Extremely hard to keep connected with Bluetooth from phone. It cannot pick how it wants to play and from what. Alexa app on my phone constantly interrupted my "Alexa" commands! Then echo says "no internet" When I say Alexa both my phone and echo respond. I use Alexa at home and with my car.

I love the device and the sound it produces but there's a very annoying problem with Alexa Echo Studio recognizing some music artists. For example, it would not recognize famous singer, Jack Jones but repeatedly played Jax Jones. It also does not recognize foreign sounding names either. I contacted support and was told the device is new on the market and there are issues that still need to be resolved. Really disappointing because I bought it thinking it would play what I wanted.

8 months later as of July 31, 2020, still no improvement in Alexa Studio recognizing a number of commands. Often trouble recognizing my playlists. I sometimes need to spell the name before recognition works. I speak clearly, loudly and slowly and even that sometimes doesn't work. The sound is wonderful but Alexa's ability to recognize what is being asked is very unstable.

I initially place the Echo Studio on the top shelf of my work station. This was OK while I was sitting at the workstation. It wasn't until I walked away from the workstation into the middle of the room I realized how much fuller and vibrant the sound was. I relocated the Echo Studio to lower shelf close to level of my ears while sitting and it is a VAST improvement.

I have a few other Echos so I was familiar with Alexa and this device handles Alexa like all the others.

With the home automation, you need to have a home automation system (I have Wink) that integrates with Alexa. This is not clear in the Echo Studio description. It infers home automation directly with Echo. This is the same function as with the Echo Dot.

This is surprisingly a great addition to my home entertainment!!!! At first I was a little skeptical because I've always been a BOSE fan but I have to say for there first try at a high end room filling sound system there pretty close not quite there yet bit I'm sure just like all there other speaker products they will nail it on the next generation model...

So I use this speaker oll over the house.....yes it sometimes doesnt sound as good in spots....but it's meant to be a 3d like speaker for all around....so placing it near walls and stuff would effect its sound. Ive used this speaker out doors....and it can really rock an outside party. Soooooo loud. Sounded more amazing outside to be honest.

As always there are flaws.....but these flaws are tyoically based on Wi-Fi. Like lower end Wi-Fi that cant support too many items. I know the 3.5 is optical....but it says aux too so I tried it....and it in fact works....but at half volume. The only app I use now is Amazon music. But even with that....i dind myself searching for songs.....unkike YouTube where my songs typically pop up when listening to other similar songs. Amazing music varied so much each time I chose the my music playlist. I never liked ANY of the songs.

All in all this speaker is pretty good. I ordered an toslink to mini toslink optical to see how it sounds for home theatre. Love love love this speaker. Gonna order another for 400watts of power.

It’s a decent speaker, and works just like other echoes, but the selling point for the extra $120 was to get that awesome sound during our movie watching.

Here’s what you need to know, if you have a Fire TV Edition Television (Insignia, or Toshiba etc...) this will not give you the home theater experience. Also, if you connect your TV via optical cable, the TV remote control will not pair with the echo studio, so you won’t be able to adjust the volume with your remote. It’s got good sound, and I like listening to music on it, but home theatre on Fire TV editions is a big no-go.

This purchase was a leap of faith into the world of smart speakers that turned out to far exceed my expectations. As always, the studio was easy to set up (took less than 2 min) and the resulting sound was absolutely impressive, complete night and day difference when compared to older echo. Although the bass was strong, clear and added the needed depth I was so impressed with the studio that I purchased the echo sub along with a second studio to create a true stereo environment feeding off of my prime music HD subscription. With the price point, quality and ease of use, Echo Studio is an absolute win for Amazon...and for me the end user.

These speakers are a great value for the money, easy to set up, sound great and overall just an awesome way to transform your home into a theatre like experience. In regards to the reviews from the audiophiles trashing the quality; they're just completely off for what these studios are meant for. Actual studio speakers are meant to sound flat for production purposes. A home entertainment system, unless you're going to pay crazy money, is meant to be loud, clear and not distort. These are great for music and streaming in a living room to give you that theatrical feel. If you want to install an actual theater in your house, then yes, go spend way more money on better speakers.

The sounds is really impressive for the price point. I have studio monitors in my music studio that cost hundreds more per speaker, and what can I say? I'm just impressed with what they're delivering for the price.

My current set up is a Fire TV Cube with 2 Echo Studio speakers. One placed on each side of the television for a true stereo experience.

When listening at really low volumes, I double checked a few times to make sure the sound was coming from speakers because the stereo imaging really is that good. Dialogue centers right to the TV and the ambiance is great, not to mention the panning of sound effects from left to right (you'll feel it when you see that plane fly across screen, bullets fly from one side of the room not to mention movie scores sound great). The room analyzer really is fantastic and uses your walls to reflect sounds for a great experience.
