The speakers are balanced and my only recommendation for the EQ is to open up the Alexa App, throw your "Highs" all the way to the top (to the far right of the slider), your mids to the middle and give yourself just a little boost for the bass. Now we're talking! If you push your bass or mids too far it's going to sound muddy. Again, these aren't studio speakers and I think the EQ provided is more than sufficient.

I've tried watching with just one speaker to see how it sounds. The speaker auto adjusts to the room and does give a convincing stereo feel to your experience, however, if you double the speaker, you double the power—this means you're gonna get way more punch and I can't recommend it enough. If you're on a budget or on the fence, just try one.

Overall the sound is good, set up is easy and EQing them on the app is a breeze. So big checks for all of these things. Within 30 minutes (read about the delay below) I was re-watching favorite action and sci movies just to hear them in my living room and I was really impressed with the quality of the highs, mids and even the bass. I don't understand why one would invest in the Echo Sub — just get 2 Studio speakers and the combined power of them is going to give them all the "UMMF" you need. The woofer in these guys is plenty at higher volumes.

In comparison to the apple home pods: As someone who almost exclusively uses apple products, I couldn't be happier with these. Apple is just charging way too much for their speakers for slightly better quality and they will sound not much better to the untrained ear. It's simply not worth the extra money.

So why aren't these getting 5 stars? Well to be honest, I wasn't aware that they would only connect as a studio pair with Fire TV over wi-fi. Read that carefully. Yes, they still have a quarter inch in (like for your headphones on your phone) and they are blue tooth enabled, but in order to take advantage of using them in stereo they need to be connected over wifi and so does the sound source. Therefor, you aren't having a party and letting people just connect to the pair to play their music (unless it's one speaker at a time). Not a big deal if it's mainly for entertainment, but I do wish I would have known.

In addition to that, one of my primary frustrations was purchasing the Fire TV Cube so we could easily stream 4k media without longer buffering or drop outs. Well, the way you do that is by connecting your Cube to your ethernet. Unfortunately, the stereo pair has to be connected to the Fire TV over Wifi, so that means the Cube has to be connected to wifi as well. They will NOT work for your cube/firestick if you're connected over ethernet. This was a bit frustrating and caused some minor hiccups in my setting up... so instead of 10 minutes it took me about 30 to delete and reinstall the pairs.

So this leads me to my one BUYER BE WARE: if you are trying to stream 4k, make sure you have a good internet speed and if not you better have your modem nearby or you'll want to buy a wifi router to plug in to increase the signal near your TV, firestick or cube. In the end, I had a router next to where my TV was to extend our wifi throughout the house, but there's NO WAY everyone has this set up and I would have been really upset if I had major issues watching 4k. Luckily, I have not and I don't have super fast internet (about 55mbps) so I'm hoping most buyers are not put in that position.

With that said, I do believe some of this could be fixed with a firmware or software update, so I'm hopeful. If they do, I'd change my review to 5 stars.

Overall navigating and using Alexa is what it is and there's plenty of reviews about that elsewhere. One thing to note: if you have the cube and 2 speakers, they do not overlap well when listening for voices. I highly recommend you mute 2 of them (I muted one speaker and the cube with the microphone mute button on top of the unit) so we're only giving voice commands to one speaker.

In summary, if you're looking to add theatre like quality sound and punch to your living room, you cannot go wrong with these guys.

Make sure you have descent internet for streaming 4k (55mbps or higher) and don't be afraid to play around in the Alexa app to tweak your set up to your liking.

Even as someone who lives and breathes audio, I was impressed. Not because they are the best sounding speakers but for what they deliver, how easy they do it and for what price they are doing it at.

Definitely not impressed with the sound quality. I made the decision to purchase based on various online reviews rating it closely to another product I own which is a Marshall Kilburn yes I know the Kilburn costs $100 more than the Studio but reviews were comparing them as close. Next i know the Kilburn is not the best measure but I happen to own one because I love the convince of being able to carry it around and take it outside. Lastly If you have a large room 20x25 with vaulted ceilings it just doesn’t fill the room. It gets loud but again it doesn’t seem to surround you. If you have audiophile grade or even close to audiophile grade equipment I would recommend going with another option.

I was hoping for room-filling sound with range and volume but left disappointed given the size and sturdy feel of this Echo device. For my ears, and I’m no audiophile, I feel that I get something more pleasing out of the Echo 3rd gen. I was incredibly surprised by this but when I realized I didn’t like what I was hearing out of the Studio, I replaced it with the Echo 3rd gen and was pleased. Would the sound be rounded out and more full with the Echo sub? Probably. But if I’m going to have an Echo sub to accompany my Echo Studio, why not just get the Echo and add a sub? I am sad that the Studio didn’t blow me away. I’ve compared it to a Sonos One and at the price, the Sonos One out performs the Studio in my opinion. In the end, the Studio probably more accurately reproduces audio compared to the Echo, but it’s all about function for me and the Echo suits my fancy and happens to be considerably less expensive.

I bought the Alexa echo studio And it was delivered today. Set up took no time and the sound quality is powerful and clean. I have a background in music and studio engineering and although a single speaker doesn’t always deliver what a more complex system can deliver, I’ve never heard a single speaker that does more than this one. I love it. It’s so simple practical and powerful.

I absolutely LOVE our new Echo Studio! We were upgrading from a 1st generation Echo. The sound is amazing! Super clear with nice deep and rich bass, stereo sound. You don’t have to scream Alexa’s name to get its attention...even when playing loud music. It’s a zillion times better than a first generation. We also bought the Echo subwoofer to go with our Echo Studio. Though you do not need the subwoofer as the Echo Studio sounds awesome on its own, we just wanted that extra bass..it doesn’t disappoint! We love our new Echo Studio and hope to get another for our bedroom soon.

I really like the relatively small and unobtrusive size of the studio. It really does a good job on it's own, however, I think it kicks up a notch just by simply pairing it with a couple of echo dots also in the room. If I had a couple of Echo's paired instead I am sure that it would even be a richer experience than it is now. I am curious as to how the echo sub added to the mix would improve the sound. Currently the bass delivered by the Echo Studio alone isn't bad at all. Maybe I will make that addition in future, but right now I am quite satisfied.

Downgrading from 2 to 1 star. Sound, even when using an optical cord, comes and go sporadically when watching shows on Recast.
So disappointing. Going straight to eBay.
___________________________________

Very difficult to sync if trying to use as a speaker for your tv (especially with an Amazon tv) Ended up buying an optical cord and cannot adjust the volume expert through my phone. One would think amazon products would be compatible.

It does have decent sound for the price. However i would be happier buying a Sonos instead.

Update ; The yesterday the speaker started cutting in and out using the Fiber Optic input while watching TV and after a 3 email volley a new speaker arrives tomorrow (YEA to customer service).

What do you say when the speaker is smarter then you?
This is a GREAT sounding speaker that initially sets it self up... great, then you try to tweak it like utilizing BT from your Samsung Series 7 and nothing works, after 1 week still can’t make it happen. Then try switching between optical cable from TV to Amazon Music and back. Not happening YET. This is a speaker in progress at this time. It’s good and worth $200 it’s just not a refined product yet.

Audio is slightly improved over the echo plus but I expected much better quality as some of the reviews compared this to higher end speakers.

A heads up that even though it can come pre-setup — You’ll need to unpair and setup any zigbee devices again since they’re only tied to the selected Echo which is a lot of work if you have a lot of devices and routines setup.

If it’s replacing an echo plus, it takes up not much more space but the power cord is a a few inches shorter if it was already stretched to be on a table or stand.

it is essentially an echo w/ a small built-in subwoofer. the sound is certainly superior to an echo alone. I use mine in an area that takes the place of where I had an echo to make the sound in my house more subversive when I tell echo to play music on the "everywhere group". I used the displaced echo to create a stereo sub pair elsewhere.
I wold imagine that creating a stereo sub pair w/ 2 studios would sound great.

It's an ok device, but not that much better than the 2nd gen echo plus.

Pros:
-Like the other echos, it's all-around a great smarthome device.
-Decent music compared to the smaller echos.
-I can tell the audio quality has slightly more range than the echo plus and can be moderately louder than the plus.
Cons:
-Despite having more audio range the music doesn't actually sound that much better than an echo plus. This is not really acceptable when the device takes up twice the space. In some scenarios, the audio is worse. Disabling the sound enhancement feature helps the audio quality for most songs. I can tell it was updated at some point to work better, so you can leave it on now, but still needs more patching.
-The Alexa voice level is under volumed compared to the music volume.
-The ring at the top is slightly too high for proper visibility.
-The microphone does not pick up commands as well as the echo plus that was located in the same spot. Not just when music is playing either.

This is a great speaker to listen to all your music on. It has five speakers and 300 w certainly a very loud speaker and sounds great from all angles and directions.

Make sure to subscribe to the HD Service as it's great.

I did run into a little static problem after I upgraded to the HD service but simply saying to the studio to check for software updates it did an update and fixed the problem.

This is my favorite speaker among my many different echo devices. Get 2 of them for an incredible stereo experience.

Maybe future versions might incorporate an echo show style screen as well.

Quite a bargain for $199

I have 6 Apple Home Pods grouped into 3 pair. I would say that the echo studio sounds as good as a single one. The first echo studio was defective but Reggie at Amazon customer service was outstanding. I am completely pleased with the purchase and it cost far less than the home pod. I am buying another one this week. Buy with confidence.

Alexa is always amazing. We are so in love with this speaker! It gets LOUD! The bass is awesome! I am not an audiophile so I'm not going to ramble on but for us "regular" ppl this is stunning. I don't necessarily recommend it for apartments since even taking the base to its lowest setting is still pretty intense. The only issue, and it is pretty minor, is that it seems to have some difficulty when we tell it what playlist we want to hear. Considering that we only have one right now, it's frustrating when she comes up with random lists. I'm going to change the name if our playlist to see if that helps

Amazon has done a con job here. Although the speakers are great and Alexa works well, it only plays what Amazon wants you to hear. It's free music library is limited. It's related functions, like security, or light control, are designed to get you to buy more Amazon products. They have not disclosed enough here. There is enough to enjoy, despite getting sucked into an Amazon vortex.

The main point of this thing is supposed to be it's increased bass over its predecessors. Does it have a bit more bass? Sort of. No matter what I do with the EQ, it still just sounds empty. The bass is dissapointedly lacking. I don't get it. It has a decent woofer speaker, but it's just not there. The homepod and Bose SoundLink mini 2 sound so much deeper than this thing. I guess it's proof that a bigger cone doesn't equate to quality bass.

I'll be returning and going back to just the plus.

My Wife and I had a problem setting the Echo to our WIFI, but after contacting Amazon Tech support we were able to connect. The sound of the music is incredible, and the base is great for a 5 1/2 in speaker. The sound fills the room of the four speakers making each instrument clear and realistic. I can't praise the Echo Studio any higher. Love the amount of music available from Amazon.

All I can say is Wow! The sound is amazing. I have had various Bluetooth and other all in one speakers like this and this is the best so far. None of the others could fill a room like this can.

With Spotify already attached to my account I can actively switch between any Echo including the Studio with easy control through the Spotify app as well as with Alexa voice control.

It is now about 4 months old and going strong.

I bought this as a gift for my daughter. It was a lot bigger than I imagined it would be, especially compared to my other two Echo's. But bigger in a good way, it does take up a little bit more room, definitely wouldn't sit this on my home office desk like my other Echo. I called my daughter on a Saturday and she said the sound was great and get her dancing all afternoon while she cleaned the house. I'm not looking to upgrade my 1st generation Echo with this model. I do have to mention that Amazon did a good job of getting this to me earlier than what was given when I purchased it. The box was slightly damaged (one side came unglued) but the speaker was not damaged and all the items were in the box as indicated. So I'm am happy customer!

I've found that, ultimately, the Echo Studio is a good product. You just have to be sure your internet connection and your WiFi is set up correctly. I was having a lot of problems, until I checked my modem (not the router). It's seems that Xfinity had stopped supporting my modem, and I didn't realize that. After replacing my modem, I have had a good experience with two Echo Studios set up in Home Theater mode with my tv.

This is a much larger speaker system than the standard and smaller Echo units. It is heavy (as it should be for a good bass speaker magnet), and quite loud. Do not compare this to a dedicated audio device costing a lot more. It is quite good for the price, totally helpful in that it has full Echo functionality, and easy to install. It is heavy for its size, so shelf placement and support needs to be carefully done.
This is for streaming music as you do something else and still want to hear a full-range sound. It is not a replacement for Home theater, except perhaps for a very small room.

I bought this on the recommendation of a friend who is invested in the Sonos product line (I found them lacking) but he assured me this was far superior. While I will admit the sound quality is very good I was disappointed in the lack of immersion. I'd consider picking up a second unit and the matching sub but according to the description it wouldn't support audio from the television. Even then I'm not sure it would be much of an upgrade over my current setup of just a pair of old Boston Acoustic bookshelf speakers and their sub. For now the Echo Studio will sit in the dining room and supplement the kitchen Echo Show.

I'm not sure what these negative reviews are about I had no problem setting up, as for sound quality I'm a Dj after adjusting the eq I think it sounds great. Have I heard better sure but don't be swayed by the negative reviews, I almost didn't buy it because of them but I'm glad I did. Also FYI this is pretty big, a bit bigger then a coffee can.

I got this to go in my garage to play music and TV audio. I have a 2 car garage and it works okay for this. The volume of sound has to be set at maximum to enjoy music. Any lower and it becomes too low to hear.
-I've discovered that the volume issue is the volume level from bluetooth connected devices. The volume from streaming services is much louder.
I only wish a person could augment the Alexa voice to respond differently. Like wehn I ask it to play jazz, instead of saying 'Sure....' I'd love to make it say 'Ok Daddy-oh...'
Just more personalized.

I was looking for a decent speaker for my library. The ECHO studio is quite a bit larger and heavier than an ECHO, but basically functions the same way. I was hoping for better base and sound quality than what I got. I would say the studio sounds better than the ECHO but not that much better. I don't think this speaker will blow you away if you like to listen to music.

I pondered this so hard since I am biased towards my Sonos Play:5 which sounds so much better and Google's voice recognition works so much better. However, the Dolby Atmos really enhances the sound and fills my 15'x10' office and I got this on sale for $159 (with 2 Hue light bulbs). With Amazon Music HD, it integrates so well and you don't have to ask Alexa to ask Sonos to play specifically from Amazon. I do prefer quality, but for ease and the good integration with Amazon services, this fit my requirements in my office. As for voice recognition, sometimes Alexa in general just doesn't quite understand some things (especially if you have an accent) and searches aren't as good as Google home's. When I deep listen, I go to my Sonos setup.

Update: reduced to 2 stars, as the integration with firetv is definitely getting worse.

So far I enjoy them, with the exception of some things... I use them paired with a fire tv and not having the cables around is awesome! The issues I have are:

- I have 2 in my family room and an echo show in my kitchen... sometimes I want to play music in my family room and the one who picks up the commands is thr one at the kitchen
- The audio stops playing sometimes, so I need to reset the fire tv device
- The sound quality is lower when compared with Sonos, Google version of their sound bars

Using this paired with a Fire TV Cube. My wife says it sounds better than the LG sound bar and sub that was living under our LG TV. The sound really is able to fill a large living room and can get plenty loud.
I'm updating this review as the optical connection is unreliable. The sound through the optical input drops out and restarts repeatedly. This is a great speaker for use with the cube, but can't seem to handle being connected to the cube and a TV at the same time.

This device was purchased to use outside and on decks. For that purpose it gets the job done. Plays plenty loud and it's easy to follow the party around the house,just unplug and go. Set up was effortless.

Inside the house though, the sound falls short. Everything sounds diffuse, and the speaker seems very directional. I have found no instances where the speaker 'disappears'. The breathy tone/delivery of music on the device makes me wonder if the high bit rate of Amazon Music HD isn't totally wasted with the Echo Studio.

I bought this because of the audio in jack. I run an audio wire from my PC out to the audio in on the Studio. I have an Amazon Music HD subscription which allows me to download Ultra HD audio to my computer for playback on the Studio. The sound of the Studio is outstanding, but I didn't get the full benefit I wanted until I adjusted the equalizer on the Alexa app on my phone. I brought the bass, mids and highs over to the plus side and that worked for me. The sound quality of the Studio is great. I'm very happy with my purchase.

Great echo device. After having an echo 1st generation for years, it was time to upgrade. Since we listen to music so much, I wanted one with better sound and this has that in spades. Listening to music through the Studio is a much better experience. Bigger (around) and heavier, but that is and should be expected. It's not audiophile quality, but that's fine - it's more than good enough. Even though the bass response (which is tight and loud) is fine, when the echo sub is available again, I'll be adding that. Very happy with the echo studio!

I returned this item. 10 days after installing the voice recognition speaker worked, however the music stopped playing unless I unplugged it then re plug it in, then it only worked for a short time. Customer service walked me thru a complete reset of everything. It worked for 2 days then back to the same problem. Tried another customer service agent who was clueless wanted me to wait 4 days for an answer as to how to resolve the problem. I asked for an exchange which she was clueless about or just didn't want to do. Ultimately I returned it. I look forward to trying another one someday. Just my experience.
When it worked I loved it.

Have to say that the Echo studio looks nice. I didn’t have any issue setting it up nor any problem with the device. In fact, I plugged it in and my Alexa app on the phone immediately recognized the device and automatically set it up. Whole process took less than 10 min. It is easy to use and fits my need to have all my Echo sync together to create a smart home. The only downside is that the sound quality is not as impressive. Of course, the bass and sound quality sounds better than the regular echo, but I kind of expected more. That is why I only gave 4 stars to the product.

I bought two and a sub to replace my 17year old home theater it sounds super great for music and fire stick 4k. I tried using bluetooth for spectrum tv stuff was awful. Cant hook to theatre group and awful lag. I'm going to try hulu they have dvr and premium channels. I'm paying 84 a month now but hulu be more like a 100, but sound through firestick is really great. Be worth 17 a month.

Sound is excellent with 3D (only available on Amazon), very good with other stereo sound sources such as YouTube, Pandora etc. If you use it in home theater mode, you are limited to what apps are offered for prime members. Not a deal breaker unless you want to want Peacock for example. I would give it 5 stars if it can be used as a TV speaker and switch seamlessly between Alexa home theater mode and stand-alone speaker connected by bluetooth or mini toslink to other sound sources such as TV, phones apps, music players etc.

I love this speaker. I wanted it most for the sound quality and it’s great. I only wish it would play louder (I’ll have mercy on my ears). I also have it hooked up via Bluetooth to my TV and that sounds so much better. If I can do with it what I wanted to do, it’s easy to use. I know I can do more with Alexa but I’m still figuring this out.

When you first get it, the sound is flat like a big wet fart. SOLUTION: Just tell Alexa raise treble (3 times) and raise mid range (2 times) and raise bass (1 time). I wondered how good Alexa would be on being my research analyst assistant . . . . well, there's a long way to go. Very light subject topics she seems to handle well. Anything esoteric like stock market factoids seems to leave her stumped. I have yet to research government economic analysis . . . starts tomorrow. I think things will improve enormously, a simple reflection of "Moore's Law."

Great sound, but I have had NOTHING BUT HEADACHES as an Alexa device. Everyday, "Sorry, I'm having trouble understanding right now." I've tried moving it 3 or 4 times, resetting, re-calibrating, YouTube tricks, Google research, NOTHING. All of my 3rd generation echo devices have to do her job, and they work every time perfectly. Why couldn't they get the software to work on this huge device? It should work better....SEVEN MONTHS of trouble, and it's too late to return. Whatever......good sound though when it wants to work.

This speaker is fine but I bought it hoping to use it for music but also as a speaker for tv. It has a problem when you use it with a 3.5mm cable where it won’t go back to tv after you do any Alexa commands without unplugging the cable and plugging back in. Lot of complaints about it online. Should have some my research. It’s basically just a big echo because there are better speakers for sound quality.

Stereo with 2 studios only works with streaming not Bluetooth ( plenty of headphones play stereo with Bluetooth with 2 separate speakers).

Also like others, when streaming it either stops and says it has a hard time or doesn’t stream at all after confirming the command. My iPhone on the same WiFi works just fine streaming. Maybe a first gen chip problem. Streaming will work when initiated thru the alexa app.

Not ready yet

I bought this too I have a smart speaker for a warehouse, to do things such as routines and announcements, as well as play music of course. I was very surprised at it's size and weight. You immediately know this thing is build well.

The sound it put out were incredible. The way it maps the room is perfect. However by far I am most impressed with the speed of setup. Having a echo dot I already had an account and everything. All I did was literally plug it in, open the app, make a room, and BOOM it was ready. Scary how easy actually.

I'm most confused how this is only $200

We were very thrilled to try the new studio, so when the Studio announced that you could hear the great quality by asking Alexa to play the 3d music playlist, with my son in the room with me, imagine my shock when the very first thing I hear is Cardi B and her WAP or Wet A** P****Y song lyrics start echoing through the room! So many obscene words and I was so shocked that this is the first thing that Amazon wanted new owners to hear that I couldn't speak for a minute and had to pull the plug to make it stop. I am all for freedom of speech for artists and people to listen to what they want, but was not at all prepared for this to be the first song that Amazon plays from a playlist to highlight a new product. As a parent I was not at all ready. Please correct this!

I really like the quality of sound. It's definitely not super loud, but it does the job for a small or medium room. As long as you don't expect Bose quality and power [you get what you pay for], this thing is great. I actually think it's like the poor man's Bose! It integrates well with other Echos but they have to be 2nd generation or greater, and they all have to be on the same wi-fi. The app has a basic equalizer you can fine-tune the sound with (just mid, highs, and lows).

It's a lot bigger than I thought it would be. It's the size of an exterior paint can. However, I've gotten used to it and it's kind of cool-looking. Overall, worth the money.

We have four echo devices in our home. The echo studio is the latest. It does have solid sound. My main issue with it is the number of volume settings. I haven't counted, but it may be nine or ten levels. The A/C comes on and we need to increase the volume. It goes off and we need to drop it. A half setting (3.5) would likely reduce that problem. When you can't find the right volume level to begin with it just requires constant fiddling. It is much larger than our echo and the black color is not pleasing. The tiny volume buttons are black on black, so I never use them because they're impossible to see.

I honestly cannot hear the difference between the studio’s sound quality and my normal echo tower. (Not the dot mind you, huge difference there)
The light ring is almost impossible to see on the studio so you don’t know if she didn’t hear you, isn’t responding or the volume is just too low to hear her response so you end up repeating yourself a lot trying to get functions to happen. Overall not worth the money unless you’re a crazy audiophile and can detect minuscule differences in sound quality. For the average person, save your money and get a regular echo.

Honestly, for the size and price, this little speaker is AMAZING.
I bought one to connect with my fire tv cube for home theater use and to play HD and 3D music off of my Amazon Music HD subscription. It worked so well and sounded so great that I ordered a second one a day later. Now I have two and can use for proper home theater effect (including Dolby Atmos -- which is very, very cool, btw!).....and with two I can enjoy stereo when streaming music.
The low end that even ONE of these echo studios delivers is pretty awesome. With the three midrange drivers facing L, R and one toward the ceiling it really does make these units sound larger than they are by bouncing mid-frequency sounds off of walls and ceiling, very spacious and full sound.

Highly recommend. Five stars!

I realize it's also a potential listening device and someone can be listening in; if they are they get really, really bored at my house, but I really enjoy it's use. It's great to call up any song, artist, or genre music I wish to hear, and it has very decent sound, especially if you have a pair of the studios and a base unit. Their use is growing all the time; like controlling electrical devices, lights, television channels, etc. Unless you're someone whos paranoid about privacy I recommend Amazon Echo Studio.

I bought an Echo studio to use on my patio for summer gatherings. The sound is okay for a portable speaker, but like all these types of portable speakers they desperately need a complimentary sub woofer. Like with my Samsung sound bar, it has decent sound, but it sounds a heck of a lot better with its two satellite speakers and matching sub woofer. For whatever reason Amazon appears to have stopped making the sub woofer for the Echo studio speaker and so I sent my Echo studio back. I'm Still looking for a good sound solution for my patio.

If you have a firestick hardwired into your network and the studios which are wifi - THEY WILL NOT CONNECT OR WORK! Yes they are on the same network but one device is wired (using the amazon network adapeter) - Big fail - need to fix that bug. Likewise if you use a VPN App on the firestick to say access ATTnow TV or something - THEY WILL NOT CONNECT OR WORK! this is because the firestick thinks it's on a different network due to the VPN - another big fail and bug that needs to be fixed. I should have just opted for the sonus soundbar system. Amazon test your product before you put it features out there that should work!

I have an Echo and 2 echo dots, and traded in the former for this new product. I am so disappointed, I wish I could have my old Echo back. Alexa is very slow to respond and often cuts out and delays in the middle of a sentence. (It is not my home wireless, because the echo dots continue to work flawlessly.) The sound is strong for playing music, which is the only reason I didn't give it one star. However, the overall performance is so disappointing and underwhelming for the price (actually, at any price.) Don't bother until they work out some obvious bugs and issues.

I HATE IT. IT HAS MANY DEFECTS AND HAS HAD SINCE I RECEIVED IT. I hired a very knowledgeable man, who has the same model and loves it, to set it up when it arrived. i EVEN HIRED SOMEONE TO DO A FACTORY RESET but that didn't help the problems among which are:
the radio simply shuts off for no reason at all. this is extremely annoying.
the volume has WIDE fluctuations without my telling it to change the volume, even in the SAME song or station i'm trying to pla
often when i tell it to change to a specific voume, it doesn't do it.
there are other problems also.
this is a LOUSY PIECE OF EQUIPMENT.
I KEPT IT THIS LONG BECAUSE I WANTED TO MAKE SURE it wasn't just me making some kind of mistake, and that it wasn't the ratio station that was to blame etc.
I WANT MY MONEY BACK. What do i have to do to GET my money back?
NO I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS UNIT, NOT EVEN TO SOMEONE I DON'T LIKE.

The wife and I have many devices from Amazon and we always said if they come out with a premium device we will buy it. So we were happy to see this come available. I ordered it and it took about month to get it because of back orders. I was very excited to get it in our home and start streaming music. We play a lot of music here. We mostly play classic rock but it will go all over the place. We play everything. This device sounds good but we really expected a bigger jump in sound and volume. The range is good but not there for us. If this is your first device you will be blown away. Pair this with music unlimited. For us we expected more room filling sound.

The sound quality is better than my Echo, but not a lot. The main problem is if I want to use them both to play music they not only don't integrate, but Alexa tries to sell me a $14.95/mo subscription to be able to stream simultaneously. This may be compounded by the fact of having an Amazon TV cube in the same room. And if I ask Alexa to do something I never know which one is going to reply.
I'm considering returning the unit as it makes the Echo sort of useless even if I take it upstairs or to another room.

The only issue I have run into is when you have the Studio set up as a home theater, you cannot play music. I read this in other reviews, but not until after I purchased. I have not found an answer anywhere on how to correct this, so I just use it for music but would love input how to use as a home theater and also ask Alexa to play music. A review I read, the reviewer called Amazon for support and they were not able to address the issue. I will update my review if I ever call Amazon support and the issue can be corrected.

Holy smokes this sounds awesome for how puny it is. I have huge klipsch atmos set up with my home theater already, this was purchased for another room. When you first get it, it tunes/optimizes the echo based on your surroundings. Then you can sample some 3D music. It sounds terrific, bright and clear with solid bass but not overwhelming. It also can be paired with another echo studio speaker and used with the fire TV for theater sound. My daughter instantly wanted one after hearing the music. It really fills a room.

I've owned several speakers in my life, but this is the first smart speaker I buy. Here are the things I liked and disliked about this Echo Studio.

Things I like:
- The sound is excellent. Is not perfect and is not the best sound I heard in a speaker. Given the 199$ (or 169$ if on sale), this is great value for money. The bass is punchy but not extremely powerful, and the mids and treble are somewhat muffled and covered by the low frequencies. An adjustment with the Alexa app makes a big improvement.
- The "Stereo Spatial Enhancement" really gives the sound a nice touch. I can feel the speaker fill the room.
- Alexa's voice recognition is almost perfect. It always heard me, even several ft away. The problem was when whispering. 30% of the time Alexa just wounldn't recognize me.
- The ability to connect via Bluetooth to a phone or computer is simply a must. The Homepod does not have this capability, but Echo does.

Things I don't like:
- The sound is loud, but not as loud as one expects given the size and weight of the speaker. Other speakers are way smaller and give the same or more volume.
- Alexa's skills may not work on all devices and/or regions. As an example: I have two smart switches from Xiaomi and I couldn't make them work with Alexa (I could with Google Assistant). Also, Spotify (and maybe even other platforms) is not functional in regions outside US or Europe. I live in Argentina and had to change my location before connecting Spotify with Alexa.

Overall, given the price I'm absolutely pleased with the speaker. Having read other reviews, I'm convinced that pairing two studios with an Echo Sub makes a powerful and great sounding combo, for not that much money.

I did a lot of research on the Studio and various soundbars in this price range before settling on this and the Vizio sb3621. (I got the studio when it went on sale for $169). I hooked up an echo dot to the sound bar so they would have equal amazon integration. They are both excellent values but the Studio sounded better for music. The sound was more balanced and was certainly better at lower volumes. The soundbar w/sub was great if played loudly but this was probably due to the impressive bass and when played at low/mid volumes the bass either dominated or just didn't fit with what the bar was putting out. The studio's bass was sufficient for me but I could always add the sub down the road. We ended up hooking it up through a firestick and now our TV plays through it as well. It's not the same as our home theater set up in the basement but it's great for what we watch most of the time. I"m not sure about the 3D music effect but think if I ever paired it to another one that it would be an amazing set up.

I've bought 2nd Echo Studio to make Stereo and Surround Sound but last only 2 Days that every time I have to Pairing after Wifi Router reset. The Echo Speaker functioning is not the issue but the Alexa App for Android is terrible to set it up easy. Also, once I connected the Audio Cable the Pairing is dismissed.

I still didn't try to connect my Home Therter System using Sony TV with Bose Sound Touch 300 System yet that Amazon will push me to purchse the Amazon Fire TV Cube for sure.
Pairing the Echo Studio is miserable and no fun at all.

After many trials to pairing of the Two Echo Studio, I've replaced and relocated the Router center of the Echo Studio from other side of Room and It is now working as Pairing. As result, Echo Studio [Built-In Wireless Adapter] is performing very poor signals. The Router must be placed near to the each Echo Studio units to success Pairing and maintain the Pairing mode.

Playing Amazon and Sportify (Favorite Songs) Music from my Computer to these Echo Studio is not possible unless via Alexa Command, I've installed 3.5mm Audio Stereo splitter from the Computer Audio output and using 3.5 mm Audio Cable to connect to both Echo Studio to play any music from the computer including YouTubes.
The Result of using the Audio Cable is lot Clear and Better Sounding than via WIFI and much louder as well.

I'm finally happy now enjoying with TWO Echo Studio with/without WIFI however, Amazon need to improve the BUILT-IN Wiress Adapter as well as Server Capacity. Also Highly recommend to Totally Upgrading Alexa App.

I'll be studyed how I can make these two speakers with Bose SoundTouch 300 Speaker System and Sony TV for Home Theatre System without Fire TV Cube.

First I've owned Marantz, Emotiva, Definitive Technology and various other high end gear and used to a dedicated 7.1 system. I thought the Studio's would be more of a novelty but after all the great reviews I bought a pair. I connected by dual 15'' subwoofer to them through the 4th gen echo dot line out and holy cow these sound good. I mean like really really good to where I'm considering just selling all my other gear [except the sub]. If Amazon could create a version or software upgrade to ad a few more echo devices as surround speakers that would be just amazing. Sign me up. Amazon card ready and willing. Cheers.

Update: 5/23: Revising my review since the issues with audio loss requiring me to reboot the Fire TV Stick 4K and the Echo Studio a few times a week are gone. Most likely it was a bug that was fixed in a software update to one of the devices. My only complaint now is that the only multichannel input for non-Fire TV devices is optical and thus limited to DD and not DD+ or Atmos.

Original Review: I bought this to improve the sound from my TV. Since I use a Fire TV Stick 4K as the only source, I was excited to give it a try and I really love the integration with the volume control from the Fire TV remote controlling the Echo Studio perfectly. I'm also happy with the sound quality and really enjoy it when it is working. The problem that brings me to two stars is that the audio will occasionally cut out when playing from the Fire TV Stick 4K and the only way to recover is to reboot the devices. Thinking it was network related I tried a different access point with WiFi to both, ethernet to just the Stick 4K, ethernet to just the Echo Studio, ethernet to both, and the issue does not go away. It happens often enough (every 2 days or so) that I had to go back to the TV speakers to stop my family from complaining so now the Echo Studio sits collecting dust.

The sound quality is quite good. I have spent a lot of time in and around the music industry, from managing a very successful club in the 80's to having several musicians as friends and acquaintances. I have been around many high dollar sound systems and I have one of the best in my home now. These small Echo studios put out high quality sound that rivals my $30,000 sound system. The only thing they lack is the massive volume my other system is capable of. But for a room of less than 20' X 20' these studio's are more than enough even for those who demand quality sound performance. .

This probably has just as much to do with Apple as it does Alexa's programming, but seriouisly, it shouldn't take me 30 tries to get it to my play my playlists!! I get so upset at it that I started yelling at her, which if course doesn't help the situation and I have to get my voice back under control. I try all different combinations of saying things to get her to play. Sometimes it works instantly. Great! But it should work, oh, maybe 90% of the time.
Please hook up with Apple and get that working!

The sound quality is astounding, specially from such a small device! While it is quite a bit bigger than a normal Echo, it's 6.75" diameter footprint is still far smaller than almost all subwoofers, much less speakers with a subwoofer, 3 mid-range and a tweeter. Speaking of subwoofers, I've owned several over the years and I've never heard one so crisp and clear, including some that cost several times as much.

Highly recommended even at the full retail price (I got mine as an Amazon refurb).

I got a Studio in December 2019 and returned it because the mid range was weak. This was fixed per other reviewers so I bought another one and retested it. It works great now for my favorite songs plus the instrumentals and bass sound as good as before. It gets really loud but I turned it down before my neighbors could complain. It is in our large family room for the entire family to enjoy.

Even better when discounted to USD149. Now what to use my Echo Dots for other than as alarm clock?

Pro: The sound quality of these speakers are really exceptional i love them. I bought two of them along with two speaker stands and they look great in our living room. The speakers are well made and have a very sleek design.

Cons: Voice recognition is not as good as the Echos or Echo dots. I dont know if it's because Amazon focused more on sound quality when designing these but my experience has been that these speakers do not hear as well as their cheaper counterparts in the Amazon smart speaker line up.

Voice recognition and sound quality is great. It was so great I decided to buy a second Amazon Echo Studio. My delivery showed up and I raced downstairs like a kid at Christmas. I Opened the box and took the speaker out of it’s nice presentation bag. Plugged it in and created a home living room group. Threw on some dirty bird house music which has very good low end and through Spotify they were bumping! It wasn’t until later that I open up one of my DJ apps on my iPad Pro and try to connect them both through YouTube that I realized I made a mistake. There’s no way to pair or daisychain these off of Bluetooth they will only play out of the Alexa app or through a fire stick. I think I'm going to do is buy a dongle with a HDMI out and use a fire stick. Currently that HDMI out is going to a big screen for visuals but we'll figure it out at work around.

I upgraded my Echo + to the Studio for 2 reasons. One was to get 3D music and better sound from Amazon Music which this works well for. The second is to utilize the Studio to get Atmos from my Toshiba FireTV. This is where I was let down. It turns out that the stereo integration only works with Gen 3 TV's. My TV is a Gen 2. It would be nice to get a firmware update to the TV to allow integration so I can use it for Atmos. Music does sound great though. I may pair it with an Echo sub for better bass.

This was received as an upgrade to the original Echo that we've had for several years. The sound quality with the subwoofer is pretty amazing -- we do often use it to play music and it's a noticeable upgrade. Also the response rate with the old model had gotten somewhat laggy lately and this responds right away. The only minor improvement would be to keep the light up circle around the edge or elevate it slightly in the middle so that it is easier to tell when the device is actively listening/responding.

Easy to set up, rich sound and much more bass than you get with any other Echo device, however, I would still like a bit more bass. Have not paired with TV yet - that set up seems confusing as to which Firesticks it works with or not, but hopefully will get that figured out sooner than later so I can try the surround sound feature.

I can only speak my truth on this one. I wasn't sure what to expect. All I know is that the echo plus that we purchased for our son sounded great on its own. However for someone that likes sound right in their face with definition. The echo plus wasn't enough. When I came across the echo studio I definitely had to see what it was about. Like all excitement I couldn't wait. Once delivered and after powering and connecting to our network. All I can say it was More than worth the wait. I've watched and read quite a few reviews on this particular device. Long story short none serve this product justice. With that being said nor will mine. This is going to be something that you'll definitely have to judge for yourself. Although let me say this in regards to price point sound quality and capability hands down beat some of the high-priced dollar setups that are out and available. Put it like this if you were to put one in each room along with two plus a sub in your living room there's no reason why you should miss a beat while moving throughout your home and in some cases even in your front or back yard just saying.

Great speaker, but I'm having problems connecting my TV to this studio echo throght Bluetooth, I had a echo plus and others and works perfect with this android tv, but the studio has issues with Bluetooth connection maybe will be fix with a firmware update. Also the led ring on top of the alexa studio in a zone of this ring has a problem with the leds, the blue color its fade, i got this alexa on a quick promotion moment, for a good price, i thought was a new product, but seems like was a refurbished or something.

After experiencing the Echo for years at friends' homes, I couldn't wait to get my own... the Echo Studio takes it to the next level, and the sound quality is amazing! If you love your Echo, you're really going to love this! We have plans to connect it to wireless speakers throughout the house, but even by itself, it fills the house with sound! Love it!! Unfortunately, the Alexa app makes using the Echo Studio a less than amazing experience. I can't believe how wonky and difficult the app is. Not user friendly and ruins the joy of simply creating a playlist or editing it. Have a question? You'll get caught in an endless loop of non-answers. I don't understand how such a beautiful product can have such an awful app. Alexa even misspelled the name of my playlist, and I can't even change it! If she misunderstands your music request, you will forever be looking at that mistake in the app with no way to delete it. I've asked how to delete, and it seems I can't. Stupid. Technology is great when it works. This app needs a total overhaul.

This unit has excellent sound as a loudspeaker and it will fill open areas with nice music.

Our home has much Alexa enablement with firetv sticks, 8 Alexa echos and lighting. I mention this as this unit in two different rooms experienced confusion with an echo show picking up directions. We adjusted the configuration to make this work but i mention this as this seems to be an Amazon opportunity for teams to do better testing on products.

Primarily, i purchased this one over Bose for the intent of sound quality and Alexa integration. My only caution is on two small points. First, the unit lacks the low volume quality sound that my Bose units have. I am picky but this is comparable pricing to Bose and I can redirect my audio to my Bose at low volume and have a much more relaxing experience. Second, the unit lacks universal micro volume control. The volume jumps from too much to too little for some scenarios. Other than these two details, the unit will rock at mid to high volume with the best speakers.

I received the Studio as a Christmas gift off my 'wish list'. I was expecting better enhanced sound than from my original Echo which I am pleased. I was blown away with the Studio response that fills my cathedral living/dining and even kitchen area. It's so good, I may pair it up with another for better stereo enhancement to replace my stereo system. Comparatively for the price to a Boss or Sonos, you can't go wrong with a Studio with full Alexa features.

I purchased this when it went on sale for the first time since bowing in. Upon setting it up with my subwoofer(which was an easy setup). I just didn't feel it was impressive enough. I had been playing two Echos that were paired with sub. After comparing the two setups I concluded that for my use. The Echos beat it hands down. Had I purchased two Studios and paired with the Echo Sub it may have been a different story, but the size of the Studio did not lend itself well in my opinion to purchasing two. Not a bad product, just not what I had hoped for.

We have been having trouble with our Sonos speakers staying connected lately and Alexa was never able to find them when we wanted to use them so I opted to get a Studio. Honestly, the Sonos gen 1 speakers sound better to me. Even after the room setup, which is a pain to re-trigger if you move the Studio to a different location, it still sounds fairly lifeless.

The mic has been discussed all over on various forums, it does not pick up nearly as well as our original Echo Dot. This was a swing and a miss for me. The Sonos speakers are acting better now with a recent update so I avoid using this for music listening. Mileage will vary depending on what you are looking for and expecting but I was hoping for more I suppose. If you want real sound, skip this and get a Sonos or decent bluetooth bookshelf speakers.

Also, our Alexa system recently lost one of our plug in lamp switches. Worked fine until last week. Not sure what they did at Amazon but why does every tech company assume we need software updates? It was working. I doubt this is directly related to the new Studio. Just odd it happened soon after installing and setting up an Alexa Studio.

After watching countless YouTube reviews about this speaker, I took the plunge and bought it. At first the sound was good but not great (It maybe because I have the speaker in an open room) but my biggest issue is syncing this speaker. It's always out of sync, I even purchased AmazonBasics Optical Toslink to Mini Toslink Jack Digital Audio Cable for a direct connection "STILL out of SYNC".

Well Packaged - nice to have the bags with handles so you can draw it out of the box without fighting with it.
Easy set up - especially if you already have devices = does it automatically.
Three problems though:
1. Won't let me control volume from the app as it should. (Yes, I'm on the same network..)
2. Also won't let me change the name from the App. I can do it from the Website however.
3. Good Base... especially if you could adjust it from the app... Again CANNOT adjust sound setting from the app as you should be able to. Big drawback. Cannot adjust at the device either, so what's up with that? Any suggestions from anyone in the know?

It is so much better than the previous Alexa! Quick on recognizing our voice and responding to our commands and richer sound quality. It is bulkier than the previous versions, but the sound is so much better that is worthy. The voltage covers 100 to 240V - which seems to be a common question. I added a picture of the specs.

I have two of the Echo Studio speakers paired with an Echo Sub and now my all of Spotify music and TV viewing through my Fire TV 4K streaming stick have deep, rich sound that fills the room. It has enough volume to block out any background noise that Manhattan can throw your way. I like the sound and the Alexa integration, I wish I were able to give each Echo Studio a separate wake up command the way I was able to do with my Echo Plus stereo pair, but both speakers seem to act as one now. Another grip is how long it takes for the audio to resume after I give a command while content is playing.

I'm a sound guru, and I was hoping this speaker (2 of them) would sound good enough to use as left and right hooked up to my TV setup for movies/theater in living room. My first disappointment was the sound quality. Just not a good mix of lows and highs, sounds imbalanced.
Then, the base just wasn't enough for me even at full in EQ.
Thrid, and most importantly, there's just not enough volume coming out. Full blast is what I would expect for medium volume. Granted it would be a little better with 2 of them, but I'm just too disappointed to keep it. Sending back.

After having a set it up myself without any help from your service department it works very well I would like to see that your service people do not know what they're talking about and it's hard to understand many of them with their accents. The girl kept trying to send me a new one but there was nothing wrong with the one I had the system takes a while to upload everything into it and make everything function properly the only other thing is that it's very weak when it comes to connecting it to outside source through the plugin the audio is not as loud as it should be I believe that is one thing they should work on, but overall the product is good it works fine with Amazon music but can use it as a second source from something that you want to plug into it desires much to the listening pleasure.

A great sounding speaker and I can stream music from my Plex program on my computer, which makes my selection much more tailored to my tastes than the Amazon channels. Early in the morning, it's a little hard of hearing and I have to repeat my request twice. It's a lot like asking your children to do something.

I bought a pair of these for two reasons. First, to use with Amazon Music HD for which they are excellent, but secondly as an experiment which was successful. In my eighth decade I began to recognize hearing difficulties with the dialects in BritBox and AcornTV. Realizing that hearing aids would be a good idea, I purchased some last summer which helped some. This year I wondered if it also might be my 50 year old six foot high speaker arrays. These speakers work well for music, but, due to aging components, don't clarify dialogue. The Echo Studios restore the crisp dialogue that I want. Now, depending on the program material, I can choose to use either system, but I certainly could get by with the Echo Studios alone.

I wanted to get a sound bar for our bedroom. Something with decent sound, however, I didn't want to get a sound bar with a separate subwoofer. I read about this new speaker and I thought it would be the perfect solution, not quite. You are able to connect this to your Cube of Amazon 4k fire steak and connect wirelessly and the sound is good, however, your are only able to access the full sound potential through the input for you Amazon Fire device. So if you have not cut the cord and are still using cable you are not able to access the full sound potential on that input. I did order the 3.5 optical cable and plug that in but the sound was not good. I heard no difference in the volume set at 5 or 10. The sound is definitely better through the Amazon device.
I called tech support and they were not much help. The answered I received was, I don't know if that would work some people say it does and good for them. I realize this is a new product but it seems the tech group with have a basic working knowledge of their product.

As a stand alone speaker this sounds good, but not as good as the Sonos one.

I purchased this product from BestBuy after listening to a demo in the store. My girlfriend who has been hard of hearing since birth told me she could hear a drastic difference right off the bat from our current Gen 3 Echo. That was my major selling point. I listen to a ton of music and eyeballed it for my kitchen listening, but was unsure about the price until the bronze ears of my woman heard a golden tune. 10/10 would be elated by hard of hearing girlfriend again.

The Echo Studio is head and shoulders above any of other Alexa devices in my home. I am running two of Echo Studios (Left & Right) along with an Echo Sub. I'm extremely happy with the rich, full, clear sound quality. The speaker optimizes itself for the room acoustics as part of setup.

At $199 it represents a very good value. The sound quality is on par with other much more expensive wifi smart speaker systems that I also own (not sure if I'm allowed to name the brand). Both sound great but the Echo Show costs less than half as much!

Update 12/7/20
I moved the studio and subwoofer to another room and it is working perfectly. I am guessing my echo + was to close, so the studio was getting hung up.
I can not recommend this product. I got this and the echo subwoofer at the same time. When it works it is great. But majority of the time it does not work. Simple question like "what time is it " and it gets hung up and doesn't respond. Music is a maybe, sometimes it work sometimes it does not.
Not worh the money if you ask me. Just get the echo plus no problems their.

This has great sound and I am glad I purchased it. However like most wireless speakers today it doesn't seem to go as loud as I would like it to truly fill the large room I have it in. Also it is quite heavy so it isn't something you are going to want to move around from room to room. Also, I can't figure out why Amazon doesn't create these Echo's with a rechargeable battery? I purchased a battery base for my previous Echo but there isn't one designed for this version of the Echo.

I have a pair of old sonos 5. I'm very disappointed with sonos for not supporting the old sonos five, so I decided to buy the echo studio. Man I'm so glad I bought it. Aside from looking very slick and nice, the sound is quite amazing. Better than sonos. I'm waiting for the echo studio to go on sale again so I can purchase another one and connect them directly to my fire stick . The sound is very loud and crisp, u have to listen to believe it. I just hope amazon does not become like sonos...

In my work from home office, I had an echo dot hooked up to a mini shelf system via mini jack. It sounded great, but takes up much room. The echo studio was ready to use in just a few minutes. Sounds great. I may move it to living room to replace bluetooth table radio another dot is hooked up to. That radio was only used with the echo as the receiver doesn't work.
Two of my dots are connected via bluetooth to surround sound receivers so I can put it almost anywhere.

I was and am severely disappointed in the sound quality. I thought this was supposed to be a decent sounding speaker but it is not much better than a transistor radio from the 70s.
I need to use my smartphone hotspot as a source of Internet and have done this successfully with a couple echo dots in the past. This was an absolute nightmare to set up in such a manner but I was finally able to accomplish it.
Overall it has been an unpleasant experience to get it up and running and the resulting sound as I mentioned is terribly disappointing.
Everybody's idea of good sound is different and you may not be as demanding as I am so others may be quite pleased with this awful sounding trash can.

I hoped to use this as a computer speaker. I like to listen to music in my home office and I wanted good sound.

However, there's no input for a standard 3.5 mm speaker plug, so the only way to connect to a PC is with Bluetooth. But the lag is about 1/2 second, so when I watched a video with people speaking, the delay was really obvious and distracting. This probably wouldn't be an issue if I just wanted to stream music.

Also, every time I woke the laptop up, the Echo shouted "Now connected to ___ computer" at full volume - super annoying. According to the support forums, this can't be turned off.

I'm returning the Echo Studio - I guess it's just not designed to be a computer speaker.

I have two standard Echos that have been around for a few years. The Studio comes nicely packaged in a soft cloth storage case (with cutout handles). All I did was plug it in and wait a minute. It fired up and connected - likely as I already had the App working. For a little tyke, the Atmos sounds is deep and rich. I've yet to connect it to compatible smart home devices it supports (and may not given that I already have controllers for them). It's good value for the money.

Loved it. I preordered it and got it October 8, 2019. Loved it. It worked great in our family room which is large. But this last month she had problems connecting to the internet. I knew it wasn't my internet because I have an echo plus in the kitchen and she she great would overhear us asking the studio plus (who was having trouble communicating) and would answer the question. I unplugged the studio, I reset her and then last last night she won't even turn on. I know she is getting power because the microphone light is on. Sad. I missed the chance to return it by 4 months. I did not get the extended warranty because I have had such good experiences with Amazon products. But if you are considering one, I would get the extended warranty.

I recently replaced my 2 year old Echo Dot (2nd gen) with an Echo Studio, and I am very glad
I did. While I was happy with the dot, it’s amazing what sound it can put out of a tiny disc, I knew it was
Lacking low end. As expected the Echo Studio has nice full range sound, more clean volume, than the Dot.I listen
To compressed audio, not HD, and it is fine for that.. I already have a nice stereo system for HD music,
But if I didn’t I’d consider buying another Studio for stereo, and adding sub woofer. Truth of matter is
Really this studio single speaker sounds pretty darn good, to these old ears..
also, the microphone pic up is as sensitive as the Dot, it can hear me in the next room...

Well made, easy to set up for basic use, exceptional sound quality given the price and size. However, if basic setup leaves you with any questions, it is hard to get answers. There appears to be no separate support as you have to go through Amazon Device pages to find FAQs and there is no link to chat, phone, or email support. You can post questions to forums and get a response is a day or two, but that seems a little weak given that this is an Amazon core branded product.

I bought one echo studio a couple of months ago. It sounded pretty good so decided to buy another to pair for, what I thought would be, great stereo sound. Unfortunately, there is a software glitch that Amazon needs to FIX. When paired, the studios will work nicely for just a few days. Then they will drop audio consistently. It is so annoying I stop using them as speakers. The problem cannot be fixed because it is a software problem. AMAZON! PLEASE FIX!!

This is an excellent speaker for the price. The sound quality is immediately noticable compared to any other echo; excellent bass and aural separation. I am very happy with the purchase and would highly recommend it. A friend has a Sonos setup, and I think the Studio is fully comparable.

Paired they constantly drop amazon music. I even bought a new router still the same thing. They play fine solo I know that since one the devices will drop my WiFi and connect to another Ssid for no reason. I have called amazon at least 10 times but no fix.

I am not an audio techno geek but I do appreciate nice sounding speakers and great music. The stereo (L/R channel) technology is still fairly new but these were a snap to pair compared to the Bose Soundlinks. Also being able to pair the speakers to a third subwoofer is really really nice. If you are looking for full dolby surround with full sound immersion you will be disappointed so go spend your $4k and run wires. That said - for $500 to have wireless, left/right an a sub that sound pretty amazing these will suit your needs and probably exceed what you expect. Very very happy with the whole setup.

I gave this to a relative as a Birthday present. I set it up and made sure it was working. I just went over to her house and found it doesn't work, she says it never did!
She apparently tried it months ago, it didn't work and never used it.
I just spent an hour trying to get sound out of it and zero, nothing.
It's apparently just a paper weight now.

The sound is great. Does everything our first Gen Echo did, except for one thing, and that’s proving 360 degree sound. We keep this on the bar separating our kitchen from the living room, so have to rotate it towards the kitchen or living room to get the clearest sound. I really want good sound in both at the same time. My intention was to get two of these, but I am not thinking I may be happier to return this and just get too Gen 3 Echos and add the Echo Sub, so I can have clear, stereophonic sound in the kitchen and the living room at the same time.

Absolutely sounding amazing wish it was more affordable for more people pretty big price tag I wish it was affordable so I can get too of them so I can make surroundsound worth the money if you love Alexa sounds good 👌🏼 I recommend if you do not own Alexa and you are into music worth it

I was quite impressed by the sound quality. Fills my room. I have a small living room but it’s filled by this speaker. It’s neat to see the sub moving in the gap.

I was amazed how easy the setup was. Plug and play.

I have a very old Bose system with 5 speakers and a sub. I’m planning to replace the entire system with just this Echo Studio. It does the job perfectly for my needs. It plays my music, it’s good sound quality, and it’s compact size. And has Alexa, which is great feature. What’s not to love about this speaker system?!

If you plan to use this for a home theater NO! If you plan to use this as a smart speaker for your kitchen or a small bed room. YES. If you plan to use this as a Bluetooth speaker for a television, NO!

Amazon, get with it. You practically own the planet. Your Alexa app is trash. Are you purposely trying to raise your customers blood pressure?! I have a Studio. I love the sound. I HATE the fact that 50% of the time it won’t do what I ask it to. Alexa, lower volume. NOPE! DENIED! And the ABSOLUTE TOP OF THE HEAP....NUMERO UNO REQUEST!!! SEPARATE CONTROL FOR ALEXAS VOICE!!!! I set my living room volume at about 3 for music. I then want to check a notification so I ask. I can’t hear her! It’s too low! Any chance you can implement that update?

I had to have this so I can listen to Amazon Unlimited HD and Ultra HD. Believe the Hype! terrific 3D sound! Plus the Echo Studio has a jack so you can plug anything with a standard plug! I ran a wire from my computer thru a DAC and plugged in!! Great result! No brainer, just get one!

Better than I expected. I’ve replaced a Bose airplay speaker with this device.

The setup was seamless. I just plugged it in and opened the Alexa app on my iPad and everything was setup for me automatically. Wonderful!

The sound is fantastic. Rich base with really clear mids and highs.

I’ve only had it for about an hour now but I am thinking this was absolutely worth the price.

The only con I can find is that the cord is about 6 inches shorter than I needed it to be (trivial).

Buy the complete setup,2 echo studios and a subwoofer and set them as a home theater, complete waste of money, after months of use the left one fails a lot,the right one won’t power on if there’s a power outage, you will have to restart, the lip sync is terrible, the subwoofer equalizer needs a lot of work, on low volume gives you a good bass, but if you raise the volume the sub doesn’t equalize well. I do not recommend this product at all.

I have several echo devices, 1st get, 2nd gen, echo plus and echo studio. The microphone in the echo studio is not as sensitive as the other echo models so I have to yell Alexa from across the room or put my mouth next to the device so it can respond.

****UPDATE 11/29/2020******
After 10 months of use and yelling across the rooom the echo started to emit garbled noises while playing music. I called customer support and they sent me a replacement refurbished echo studio. The refurbished echo studio doesn't have any microphone problems, which leads me to believe the first one I got was defective.

Overall, very pleased with Echo Studio. Incredible sound quality for such a small package. I'm not an audiophile, but I can remember a time when it took a rack of equipment and pricey floor speakers to get sound like this.

Voice recognition is a bit sketchy, particularly if you're some distance away, but overall pretty good.

Alexa integration is very good. I have 2 Phillips Hue bulbs, Fire TV stick and two additional echo devices integrated for audio and the 'drop in skill.

Pretty cool gadget!

Really have enjoyed this new speaker. It's got great sound, nice solid bass, great volume and Alexa built-in make it really a nice addition to my kitchen. It's nice to be able to just say "hey alexa play some jazz" while you're doing the dishes and have it sound great, or even with guests as you're all gathered round the kitchen area like so many parties are. Anyway, we love it, highly recommended, does everything it says it does, and sounds really great. I'll probably get a second one.

Great value for the money! I use the in pairs. I have 4 of them so far! I subscribe to Amazon Music as well as Pandora and the interface with both is flawless. I have music playing throughout my home on a Everywhere Group and I am really impressed with the amount of control and flexibility I have in controlling the music content and environment! My music is also linked to a Echo Show 8 and a Echo Show 2nd Generation and they also contribute to enhancing the whole house sound field. Amazon has hit a home run with Echo and Alexa!

I bought two of these and I use them in conjunction with TV's. I wouldn't say I'm displeased with the sound quality but it isn't overwhelming either. It seems to be a little better at recognizing it's me than older Alexa devices have been. I actually took a total of 5 other devices out of play by doing this. Two Alexas, two Sonos devices and a Vizio soundbar. It's a decent entry into the Alexa world but don't buy it thinking it'll revolutionize your sound.

Pro: Great sound compared to other echo devices.

Con: Needs a way to select input source. It has a optical input but you cannot choose source, like telling Alexa to play music vs the optic input device. I had to unplug and/or reset the device constantly for it to work with an optical connection. I ended up not using the optical input... Which means I need another speaker.

Another con is that it looks pretty ugly. No sandstone option... Why did they try to make it look like a huge dot?

Overall if you're replacing an echo or echo dot, this sounds way better. But do NOT expect to use this as a sound bar (or other media connected speaker) AND a free standing echo device.

Great sound, nearly rivals my home stereo. Controls lets you adjust bass and treble to your liking. Music is clear and crisp. I play a lot of music, both from streaming companies like Siris XM and I play a lot of individual picks of my own. When telling Alexa to play a song, the title must be exact as it is on the album. Contacted Amazon support and they have been very helpful in assisting me to understand how to voice my commands for certain songs. One note, Alexa only supports 2.4gh so ensure your connect to that channel. Overall for the price, the performance could not be better in my opinion. Can't wait to try it with 3D music as it becomes available without having to pay extra for it.

I really liked this speaker when I received it last month. I didn’t like the default “stereo spacial enhancement” setting. I thought it just muddied the waters. However, with the past number of firmware updates, I feel that this feature has been greatly improved. I’ve switched “stereo spacial enhancement” on again. This speaker just keeps getting better and better.

There’s one thing I really hope Amazon considers with the next Echo Studio: Place individual tweeters above the midrange drivers on the left and right hand sides of the unit. Remove the center forward firing tweeter. I believe these changes will give the Echo Studio a better, more realistic stereo soundstage.

I love the volume level and sound on this unit it rivals my Harmon kardon speakers. Also the voice recognition is better than my echo dot or regular echo. The only thing that was disappointing was when I went to demo it to my family Alexa asked me if I wanted to hear the best of 3D audio playlist..... of course I said yes... in a very poor corporate decision it blurted out the first song “Wet Ass Pussy” by Cartie B an absolutely terrible pick with the vulgarity in the lyrics. I emailed corporate directly they responded then nothing afterwards. Poor choice of “Songs?” to feature..... None the less the Echo Studio is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

After my first purchase of the Echo Studio I wasn't sure it was worth the price but the more I listened to it the more I appreciated the sound quality. When Amazon ran the special on this speaker I purchased a 2nd one for the bedroom.
$200 is a bit steep for the speaker but $150 made it more acceptable. Great sound with nice bass and you can use the equalizer on the app to customize your sound. I play them loud and they sound great! Rock On Echo, Rock On

I really wanted to like this, but I'm sick and tired of repeating myself to Alexa. It's like the Studio needs to wake up or something before it can respond. In perfect silence, I'll be right next to it, and ask it something, and nothing happens. I ask again in the same tone of voice, and then it works. Makes no sense. Happens all the time. It sits on the same quiet shelf as my previous Echo devices, but it doesn't hear nearly as well. For this reason, I like my 2nd Gen Echo Plus much better.

I am only slightly impressed with the audio quality but, hey it didn't cost "thousands" either. When the volume is increased it is possible to detect a better quality sound. Since we use our Echos mostly for background audio the quality is far less detectable. No complaint; just saying!...........Mike

I LOVE THIS DEVICE. and I love that Amazon has done what no other company has done.....update the Audio streaming format so that you get better than CD quality. You can actual tell a cow bell is being used on a song, instead of it just sounding like a pot is being hit. I have not heard anything about Apple doing this (3D) yet and they started the whole music library bit. So a BIG thank you to Amazon for the 3D format. This Echo has the best speaker sound!! I would definitely buy another one.

I ordered this to take the place of a second gen Echo plus in the kitchen.
Pros
-increased volume
-better low end, especially at higher volumes
-better clarity compared to echo plus
-speaker firing positions fills room better
-3D audio is cool if limited.

Cons
-bulky relatively speaking
-fabric finish may not hold up in certain environments
-comparable speakers edge it out to my ear(Sonos 1)

All that being said I really enjoy this speaker and use it daily for music, news, pod casts, timers and find it to be very handy and enjoyable. Acoustically this is still an excellent speaker and I would recommend it especially if you’re already in the ecosystem.

This is not ready for the limelight as a serious home entertainment center speaker, and it’s not for the sound. This thing will NOT stay paired to any fire device. There is a huge amount of lag, even while both devices are on a gigabit network, right next to each other and the router. The Alexa app will report completely different wifi networks than what the devices are actually connected to, which is the most ridiculous problem, and gets the most frustrating “Cannot connect, make sure the devices are on the same network” error message. YEAH, THEY ARE. It’s been a huge nightmare, and I’m considering completely trashing the home theater setup. The optical input apparently doesn’t work for certain devices as well, so this has become the most expensive dedicated PS4 soundbar. Huge disappointment.

Sound quality is amazing tho! Feels like you’re in a movie theater, even just on its own.

Echo studio has very good sound quality for the price. The 3D effect I turned off since there are no real libraries for the proprietary 3D encodings. But I am returning my unit, because when you play it loud, it will not hear your commands over the loud music! It will hear it, of course, but after you shout as loud as one can, and multiple times at that! Other have found solutions such as adding a remote control and such, but then it defeats the whole speak and command utility of such a device, and then we are back to the remote control jungle of the yesteryears!

This little speaker the size roughly of a large coffee can will fill a room with sound like a big stereo. It's actually amazing how well it works. Just one word of caution I had these issues with playback. Do not use the Tidal integration piece it doesn't work and you will get errors like I can't find your music. So stick to Amazon music or Blutooth and you will be ok. I wish they would fix that but I can see why they wouldn't because it's the direct competitor to Amazon Music HD.

This is by far the best echo yet. It's nice to finally have some solid bass without adding a separate sub. I'm also very pleased that fact that the sound and vibrations from the bass don't travel through walls that much so I can listen to music at a decent volume in a room with the door closed and not get complaints from others in the house. And with sound that is immersive, rich, crisp, and clear. The John Williams 3D playlist is amazing.
