I've only had this speaker for a day, but I'm loving it so far and I'm excited to see what else sounds great on this speaker.

Awesome sound. As good or better than a apple pod.

We have ours in the same room (den) as a show 10 and have the show 10 control it. Basically we setup a room “den” in alexas app and put both devices in it. Then set the speaker for The room “den” to be the studio. So when I tell alexa via show 10 to play music it sends it to the studio.

Only issue is I would like to be able to turn off the mic disbabled red lights on the studio when it is just operating as a speaker.

I used to have a Bose wave radio, the big one. For me the best sound I ever heard for 1000 dollars. Now this echo studio has very nice sound for the price (169 dollars). Probably will buy another one and use it with the fire TV 4k in my TV.
It got a hiccup, it stopped working for several hours, tried different outlets in different places. Requested a replacement and Amazon was great with it.
The funny thing is that after requesting the replacement the "bad" unit started working again.

The Echo Studio is a major upgrade compared to my old Echo gen 2 - the Studio puts out fuller and more spacious sound in my family room which which has high ceiling and open layout. The microphone is much more sensitive than my old Echo gen 2 in picking up voice commands.
I even compared the Studio to a Sonos One gen 2 which sounds tinny and less spacious in the same room compared to the Echo studio
Highly recommend the Echo studio for big room.

This is my 5th echo product and arguably the worst. Very disappointed in sound quality. For the money I was expecting much richer and deeper sound. To my ear it sounds much too tinny and “shallow”. Also when I tell it to play Michael Bublé it says playing MB on Spotify buts then does nothing.

Great product! I pre-ordered and received day one. I have it set up in my living room and listen every day. Great sound quality, even at max volume. $200 is a little pricey but if you listen to a lot of music, especially in a home setting, I highly recommend.

I bought to use primarily as an Alexa enabled speaker to use on the porch and deck when entertaining. It works fine for that. It doesn't always hear me when the music is playing though. The other Alexa's do a better job of that.
For the price, I probably should have gone with 2 Alexa's spaced apart.

I have two echo studios connected to a fire TV cube as a home theqter pairing. I like these when they are working, but I have been incredibly frustrated by bugs. I occat want to use Bluetooth headphones, but this inevitably breaks the home theater pairing. I have had major issues getting it to work again. I suspect the home theater pairing is not built to work with self organizing home networks (one SSID for both 2.4 and 5 radios). This needs to be fixed or there will be more and more customers with issues as this is pretter standard on new routers.

I asked for the Studio for Christmas, because I wanted to seriously upgrade the sound of my original Echo. While the studio sounds pretty good, it was definitely not a major upgrade. The other problem I have is that the volume is not that loud on this speaker. The Klipsh sound bar for my tv sounds way better and has good volume.
I will use it for a while and then maybe try a different brand speaker in order to get better sound.
Over all, I do not think this speaker is a good value.

Sound was decent out of the box. I'm a loyal Bose fan but decided to give this one a try before going the Bose route to replace an Echo. I am glad I did!! Once you set it up you can adjust the bass, treble, etc. using your App. This makes a big difference!! Decent speaker that fills the house (open concept with 30ft ceilings). It throws sound in different directions that you would normally only find in a much more expensive speaker. Impressive little speaker, especially for the price.

Sound was very clear and highs awesome. The bass was something to be desired. I had the bass up to Max and with pairing these with a second echo studio and echo sub I was not impressed.
I called tech support and they said it’s a common problem and they are hoping to have a over the air update to fix this. I returned mine and will wait until it’s right. For the money they should be much better. If they cost half the price I wouldn’t complain.

The first few minutes of playing Amazon HD music on this speaker just blew my mind. I've bought many surround sound systems that comes with 5 speakers plus a subwoofer to create that surround sound effect but this one speaker sounds way better....all in one speaker. When connected to my fire cube, makes streaming movies well worth it. I'm not a sound geek but this is the best sound quality speaker I've ever purchased...bass and clarity is superb.👍👍👍👍👍👍👍

I would give Alexa a 5 Star but if you change your Wifi password to another server, to say it's a pain would be a under statement. There is No drop down & Search, or Type in a Pass Word from Amazon.com or YouTube ( & I might say don't forget Alexa isn't working at that time ). It's so much of a Search that I don't remember all the windows I had to go to before I was there or I would tell everyone. I've had it for about year & a half & that is the only problem I've had.

Really great sound quality, Alexa functionality. I couldn't configure remote from Samsung Smart TV, Amazon Fire Cube and Echo Studio to work together. Remote works fine with TV, Cube and current sound bar but replace soundbar with Studio, remote no longer works for Cube or sound. However basic setup eg linking Studio to Echo is easy, can control both cube and studio via voice commands but shouting commands while watching movies isnt for everyone.

The audio cuts out when using it as a home theater speaker with a Fire TV. It was going to be a great solution to the audio for my projector with Fire Stick TV. However, I keep getting enough random audio drops to make it annoying. The new router is sitting in the same room as the Fire TV and the Studio. I don't know how to give it a better network. My mesh network doesn't have a lot of optimization features. I really don't want to have to set up a separate network just to get audio, but that looks like the only solution.

Love the sound of the new echo Studio. It has superb sound quality. Pairs with my Fire TV. I was initially concerned with the volume output. I have since retracted that opinion. Once I paired it with my other Echo devices it filled our entire home with crystal clear music. Absolutely ingenious.

Best sounding Echo device! It has all the features that a standard Echo provides but now with bass!!! Also a nice feature is that you can Bluetooth stream from your phone or tablet or laptop. You can also sync it with your fire stick 4K and have audio play the speaker.

If you love to listen to crisp clear music with great clear high ends, moderate mid range and good clear bass.
You won't get any of that with Echo Studio.
It is a very boxy mono sound with limited equalizer adjustments.
It has the potential of better sound but you must subscribe to amazon's hd music service to get it.
I was very disappointed in this sound as I expected to hear something wonderful and this is very far from it

Ended up replacement my high end Surround sound stereo and speakers for 2 of these and a sub woofer. These sound nice, while not as high end as Amazon would like to make you believe but still very nice, My wife and I are happy with the choice, as these are so much smaller than my stereo and speakers and with far less wires! All in all it was a good choice and a HUGE upgrade from the previous Echos. If I were still i my 20's I would say the sound quality is not good enough for a stand alone music system, but I am in my 50's and do not hear as well as I used to anyway so these fit the bill nicely

I bought 2 of these in February 2020, they were easy to set up and I thought the sound was pretty decent. But over the months I’ve owned them I’m becoming more and more frustrated with them, voice recognition is terrible, I have to stand next to them and yell. They are constantly out of sync, I am constantly unplugging them. I’m beginning to regret my purchase. My older Amazon Echo devices may not gave the sound quality of the studios but the voice recognition is much better.

I enjoy listening to high quality audio when I go to bed at night, so I decided to give Echo Studio a try. The sound quality is great. Bass is excellent, but not overwhelming. All of the Alexa functions work as expected. All in all I’m very pleased with my purchase.

This product is excellent in many respects. Everything most people would want to do with it it does very well. There are some caveats however: with Bluetooth the speaker volume is very low so you have to pretty much crank it up to max to stream audio from your devices to it. This means when you use Alexa it’s way too loud. There needs to be better control over various inputs as far as volume goes. Then the most disappointing: I wanted to use it for my television since it has optical audio in. I though great! Issue is that the lag time for the optical audio is ridiculous. You can’t watch movies or tv with it as the Audio source because of the delay. I’ve never seen a delay like this with optical audio and I am kind of irritated. If it’s paired with amazon’s products for streaming the software handles the delay but if you are using anything else you pretty much can’t use this for your television.

This speaker has some BASS response. It's pretty amazing how much you miss with speakers that don't have any real kind of woofer. I have this paired with a Fire TV Stick 4K to turn my TV into an Entertainment Center. I just ask ikt to play something from Amazon or Apple Music, and t does. The TV lights up yo show me what's playing, and when listening to Amazon Music, the lyrics appear so you can sing along! It's the best Echo ever for music!
I like this so much that I plan on ordering a second.

The speaker is great but the EQ settings do not hold on unless the app that was used to set them is left on. This sucks because we have it in a slightly enclosed space and we found it sounded better with the bass turned down a bit but we lower it with the app and then when the app is shut off the setting goes back to normal. The setting to turn off the dreaded 3-D setting is remembered thank god... We contacted Amazon via email they blamed it on a glitchy app installation which is nonsense we tried it on an android phone and two iphones each time the EQ settings reverted to flat.

Received this today. Set up was a breeze. Ran a bunch of songs off my playlist on it to see how it sounded. Bass is full and big, and the vocals are tight and crisp. This is a very nice upgrade to the Alexa speaker line. I highly recommend this speaker. My only complaint is that I wish it got a bit louder. It's great for filling a room with great sound, but it's just a pinch short to use for a house party. Overall very satisfied....!

We started out with one studio speaker to go with our echo plus. It became apparent that we wanted a matching set of Studio speakers to replace our 23 year old sound system. We are clearly not audiophiles, but are really pleased with the sound quality. It took us a while to figure out what it meant to pair them and set up a Home Theater with our 4-K fire stick. The interface between the Home Theater and cable TV is cumbersome. After a lot of trial and error, we think we have it understood.

IF you only get one you need it to be in front. I was looking to add on a speaker for surround sound. If you have one it needs to be placed to replace your tv sound. I wanted to add on to my tv sound not replace it. So I needed to so it would not be off and playing in one ear. So unless you get 2 its not something my ears enjoyed. They should have made them smaller but added 2 in a purchase. I would have loved if it would have kept my tv sound from my to tv and this a added speaker someplace else.

My review is based on speaker quality in the price range. For what the cost is, this is an amazing speaker. Paired with Amazon Music Ultra HD 3D Music this speaker is ALOT of fun. I have it as a bedroom speaker. I love music, and very picky about sound quality. I've owned alot of speakers over the years and this is hands down the best. Heavy hip hop bass is good (not great). Bass layering is absolutely stunning when it is HD music quality.

I have several Echo's and the newest generation (in my opinion) have a better/richer sound bass included. This device while not bad was not loud and clear as I was expecting ( was expecting a bose type quality since they were similarly priced) so in hind sight I probably should have gotten the bose speaker with alexa

I own 1st, 2nd, and 3rd Gen Alexas, so I had no hesitation in buying this unit for a room in my basement. The sound is full, and the quality is better than any of the smaller units. Yes, the price is a bit high, but it is consistent w/ regular, bookcase speakers w/ the added benefit of being a part of my Alexa network.

I have not yet tried the intercom feature, but as I have Alexas all around the house, am looking forward to it.

We had a 1st gen Echo in our master bathroom for listening to music in the morning and while in the shower. I didn't realize how tinny and awful the sound output on the original Echo was until we replaced it with the Studio. It was a sonic upgrade far beyond what I was expecting. Just wow. I love it because it's like having speakers IN the shower. My wife likes it because the music is so loud that she can no longer hear me singing. So that's a win-win. :)

First of all the sound quality is good, but it's not as impressive as I imagined. It's very sensitive to voice even far from it. However, this thing is really buggy.

1. For some reason, when I use it as a Bluetooth speaker, I need to double the volume. Also the Bluetooth is really hard to connect. I often fail to connect my phone to it.
2. I linked my Apple Music and sometimes it just wouldn't play the music.
3. The multi-room thing doesn't work well. Some times only one Echo has sound and the other is just silent for a while.
4. I also use Philips Hue Bridge to control my lights. Often I need to ask Alexa twice to turn on/off the lights (even though it says OK the first time)

So the one I got turned a solid green ring and wouldnt go into setup mode right out of the box, called tech support. They couldnt figure it out. Told me to hold down two buttons to do factort reset didnt work. Why i tried this i have no idea, but i unplugged unit and continued holding down the two buttons an replugged it in. Hope this helps some of you if you encounter this.bsound quality was full and sounded good. The bass a little muddy imn my opinion. If you dont yet own an alexa or want a high end alexa this is for you, we didnt like the setup failure hence we returned it

I have a large room about 25'x50'. One Studio at the end of room sounded ok, but far away. I decided to add 2 more Studios , 2 on each end and 1 in the middle. I hooked them up to Everywhere Group. What a difference. Sound is everywhere. Another bonus is, no more yelling Alexa for her to respond across the room. Alexa responds from closest Studio to commands. Now Alexa can respond on 1 speaker or all 3.
One problem during set up I found out was, all Studios must be registered to same person. One registered to my wife would not work in Everywhere Group. Registered that one in my name like the other 2, and all worked fine.

I have been disappointed with this speaker overall, now it sounds fantastic with amazon music in hd dont get me wrong but when listening to iheart and Sirius xm even at regualar volume levels there is distinct distortion, it just does not sound right. When use my little bluetooth speaker with my echo dot it sounds better than the studio, i do alot of music listening on some high end equipment so the echo studio just doesnt hit all the right marks in my opinion. And also the bass can be bloated quite a bit.

Not ideal as tv sound bar. Have new Samsung TV and not idea. 1. In order to use remote to control volume, it has to be Bluetooth. Optical doesn't let you use remote only voice to control volume. 2. If use Bluetooth, delay can't be fixed, used all settings but still not right. 3. If use optical, the tv speakers and echo actually echo so need to mute tv. 4. On Bluetooth, need to turn device to 10 and use remote to lower. This is bad cause a. Not loud enough b. When turn off tv the Alexa at a 10 which will when used for music wake the neighbors. Great for music

I wanted to love the studio but it just didn’t work the way I needed it to. I had it paired up to my TV via optical/Toslink and this was alright but I couldn’t control the volume unless it was with voice commands. Not only that but it would have tons of white noise coming from the connection and I tried multiple different cables. So I decided to pair on home theater mode and it got even worse from there. The connection was fine and I could control the volume via the Fire tv remote but lip syncing issues began to occur. I couldn’t watch Twitch or YouTube. I could only watch Netflix and Prime video. I wanted to love the Echo studio so bad. The sounds it produced were so rich in bass, treble and etc. I read reviews from way earlier in the year talking about having the lip syncing issue. Which to me showed that there has been no support for the issue at all... so unfortunately I decided to return the product. If you’re going to listen to music it’s great but other than because of functionality you’re SOL.

This is truly the best sounding Echo, I just love it. One big CON though is the lack of pairing compatibility with the rest of the Echo lineup. The Sub can pair with all of the other Echos, why not Studio? I imagine there's a technical reason for it, but unfortunately this is a huge limitation in my opinion. So if you want to use this as a sound system or home theater, be sure to know at the moment it's only compatible with the Echo Sub and other Studios.

We got this device because our Echo Show 5 completely missed the Mark with sound, operation, and microphone array. It could barely hear us.

The Studio is certainly pricey, but we get better sound quality and whisper sensitive voice recognition. I can whisper from all the way across the kitchen. By contrast, we had to yell at the Show for it to hear us and respond.

This is the DEFINITIVE echo experience in my opinion. Great job!

easiest to set up Echo, best sounding echo..wish we had ordered 2 to start..Amazing sound from the Echo Studio.. the vocals are amazing... at an amazing price for great sound and a hub to boot...now waiting for the second to arrive in December...Now have 2 WOW.

Once installed, along with the sub and an Echo I was very satisfied with the depth and fidelity of sound. I was particularly pleased with the way Studio and related devices (woofer and Echo) easily integrated with the Everywhere group.
My only difficulty with the installation was that I had to do it with an old Kindle Fire because neither Windows 10 app, nor the app on android (Galaxy 8) were adequate to the task.
I'm happy now!

I bought this because we are constantly listening to music whether playing guitar and trying to work out a song or having guests over for a cocktail (fewer now - Thanks Covid! :( ) . This thing has great bass and fills the entire first floor of my house with music. We can even set it outside and the sound carries great throughout the pool area. I didn't know how much I would like it but it turns out it was a great investment! Wish I had done it sooner.

Bought this and tried it hooked up to my PC via the optical cable input. The sound is just not very good, so I returned it. I found the high range much too bright, the bass strong but punchy instead of deep, and voice reproduction, e.g. jazz vocals, lacks body. In other words this speaker exaggerates both ends of the audio spectrum but is poor in the middle where we hear the most. It's certainly not the worst small speaker, but it is not very good either.

I have not been able to connect Studio to either of my TVs. I have a chair between me and Studio when I am in the kitchen. Studio can’t seem to hear me around the small obstacle. When I ask her to connect to devices I can’t get her to connect to either of my Samsung TVs. One has the new Echo Cube attached. So the integration into the Amazon family is terrible. It isn’t intuitive enough that I could send this to my parents as a gift and expect them to figure out how to best use the product. I can’t figure it out myself. I worked at Amazon for a long while and this is not the kind of product that Bezos would have allowed us to release. If you launch a new product it should be at least 50% better in its capability from the previous products to follow the corporate model of their hiring practices.

Chose this over the Apple HomePod because of the versatility and let’s be real: For Spotify lol. I use this thing every day for a variety of actions/uses. I put this one in the living room in an open room design and it’s loud enough and the clarity is great.

Update: After having this for almost a year i have yet to find a speaker that can close to this one post of the time i just keep it 10% volume because its so loud for those people who have ordered it and need to wait its well worth the wait

This speaker is great very loud but still sounds great this thing is so powerful that it was shacking the floor in the basement 2 floors down. and if you have a fire tv stick 4k or cube this speaker is a must. I may buy a 2nd speaker to make it sound even better. this is well worth the price of $200

The sound quality is good, the volume is horrible. I could easily listen to max volume all day long. Not a good party speaker, or soundbar replacement. It's just and echo with a little more bass. Also, I have to say everything twice to Alexa, on this device.

Deciding it was time to upgrade from our Echo Dot, and having added locks, thermostat and Hue bulbs, we decided to bite the bullet and order the Studio, both for its sound and for its integrated hub. Yes, it took a bit to get all the devices hooked up - not a fault of the Echo, but making sure the programs were integrated properly. Got everything working within an hour while I enjoyed the sound quality. We are quite pleased with the purchase

I got the Studio hooked up easily. about 3 months in it started to get what I call distortions every once in a while it would put out a loud screech. I thought this was a local event? But in Aug after the no return was up it started to tell me the device wasn't registered so looking in-app it all looked good still nothing then I had to discount it to get ready I was moving. I took it out in Nov to set it back up I can't get it to connect still not reg and won't connect to my WiFi reset to factory settings. I called the support he was reading from the manual did,t know anything was a total waste of time that's a whole hour of my life I wish I could get back! I can't find any kind of repair or exchange I like it when it works was great for the time it was under warranty if your smart get the extended warranty IT KILLS ME NOT EVEN A YEAR OLD ! its a great paper weight .

I'm using this as a "soundbar" replacement and it's connected to my Amazon Firestick 4K and quite often the sound just stops. There is no way to get it back on other than reset the device and sometimes that doesn't even work. It's really annoying. But when it does work, it sounds great.

Barely sounds better if at all than the Echo. If it was priced for 85 then I might have kept it. Not near enough treble. Returned after a few days. It is also taking a very long time to get my return. It is July 4th today and I returned it June 22nd at UPS it is showing that they have not received it. Amazon never takes this long. Getting frustrated

This Echo Studio is our living room/kitchen area unit. Remember to set up the equalization through the Alexa app for the best results. We were, and still are, impressed by the full and robust tonal quality of the Studio. Everything from the HD and 3-D sound from all genres are especially impressive. We listen to everything from Chopin to Paul Desmond to Led Zeppelin to Liquid Stranger in this house. It’s all good. Highly recommended.

Wow! Amazon hit a home run with this device. The sound quality is simply amazing for a device of this size and price point. They were able to keep the cost reasonable which I think is a huge advantage for the Echo, because it sounds every bit as good or better than more expensive devices from competitors. I did purchase a subscription to Amazon Music, which I was hesitant about, but it really does pair perfectly with this device. Still amazed they can get such a big, filling sound out of a device this size. No regrets on this purchase.

Echo Studio recognizing voice commands is very poor compared to the other less expensive Echo models I use. The Echo Studio sound quality is good and exceeds my expectation for a speaker of its size. Unfortunately, there are several bug issues associated with use of Bluetooth speakers. Most often when I disconnect the Bluetooth speaker use of the internal speaker will not resume and if you speak to the echo its light blinks as if responding but there is no sound. Also sometimes when I disconnect the Bluetooth speaker the Echo Studio will send its sound to another Echo in another room. Ultimately I will need to restart the Echo Studio. None of these issues are present on my other Echo Devices. So I give 1 or 2 stars due too to high device cost verses frustration level.

I started pursuing perfect sound in the 1960s. I had monster speakers, turntables with belt drive and 20-lb platters, Akai reel-to-reel tape decks, sophisticated receivers....but, alas, still the hiss & pop of analog. Eventually digital got sound right and the question was how big did you want it? Now all I need is an Echo Studio. But, never satisfied, I'll likely succumb to adding another and the sub in the middle. It only took sixty years to reach perfection.

I had been looking at 3D WiFi speakers for a while now, but hadn't bought any b/c of the exhorbitant prices. Some were being advertised at thousands of dollars. So when I came across Amazon Studio, I thought I would give it a shot because the specs were just what I was looking for plus it has the added Alexa facility. My thinking was if I didn't like it I could easily return it (Amazon has the best returns policy). Now that I have had it for about two weeks, I don't think I will return it. I play on it from my PC as well as the smartphone, and I play from all kinds of sources - from my library on the PC, Amazon Music, Pandora, YouTube, you name it. Good stuff.

This speaker has awesome sound for its size. I’m an audiophile, and have been for 60 years. I have a large home theater with B & W speakers all throughout the room. I have a Yamaha sound bar in my “man cave” and a Bose Revove Soundlink elsewhere. This Echo holds its own against all of them. Totally immersive sound playing Amazon Music HD and 3D sound. I highly recommend this device. And for $149 it was a tremendous deal!

I never could get the Sonos 1 set up completely. I'm not great at tech. but I'm not a complete .... I liked the Sonos 1 sound a bit better, but ease of set up and complete functionality has me keeping the Studio and sending back the Sonos. Once I get another Studio and the sub woofer I'll be done. Days of insisting on the best audio I could afford have migrated to really good sound and ease of dealing with technology.

Wow, sounds great! Extremely easy to set up and configure. It does everything Alexa is famous for and truly makes all music sources come alive. And when it is fed with a Dolby Atmos or Sony 360 tune, it almost defies words. Could it be magic? Utterly remarkable sound and a veritable bargain. Highly recommended for music lovers who wish to have an additional or primary sound source available for nearly unlimited titles. Absolutely love it!

The Echo Studio sounds is super for a speaker of this size. The Alexa usability is at best a 3.5 out of 5. The blue like it hard to see so it is hard to tell if Alexa heard a voice request or not. Also, i still have not been able to configure the unit as a HUB. Much better interaction with a TV would be appreciated. It is a large heavy speaker. At this point in time, I should have waited until the unit was a little more settled in
Love it. Amazon products are beating google products in terms of sound quality and ease of use.

These sounds good s long as you're listening to a song in 3D, which there aren't many to choose from. On non-3D recordings it sounds like the vocals are being sung through a can...it's terrible. I have two Studios with a sub, and I can't imagine how bad they'd sound with just one. The sun is pretty muffled without any real 'pop,' is more of a rumble than a hit.

There are so many issues with the voice commands and Amazon Music. Sometimes your playlists aren't found; songs cut off before they're over; songs and artists aren't found even when you're looking right at them in Amazon Music.

Customer service is a joke when it comes to their knowledge of the protect...they really don't know what they're talking about and it's highly frustrating.

Very easy to set up. The sound quality is awesome! I think the price could be $100 cheaper but I am curious to see how it’s also a hub for smart devices. I haven’t quite figured that out yet but I’m glad I got it and I’m also glad I can make payments on it over six months.

Not terrible. But for the cost I was expecting much more. Incredibly buggy with another echo device around. I’d ask a question in one room and have it answered in another device in a different room. Sound unexplainably stops working from time to time when watching Netflix or Prime video. Not much bass for music. Again this isn’t a terrible speaker but for the money you can find something better.

Honestly this speaker right here blows my mind this the quality of the sound is amazing and the bass is great I have the echo plus which is around 130 and this speaker is 200 and it blows the plus out of the water I’m currently using it as a sound bar for Dolby atmos and it’s perfect and for music it’s great .

While I wanted something to with bigger better sound, I really got it for my wife who is deaf in her left ear. We connect it Bluetooth to our Samsung TV and it's sitting on an end table close to her right ear so she's able to hear her TV programming. Easy setup but we already had an Echo and a Dot installed. The only negative is that there's an audio delay between the TV and the Echo Studio that I can't resolve.

It's sounds like it is the perfect item,.. Well almost perfect.. and tell you why..
I think that the designer should consider on *Echo Studio #3 version" If coming to the market.
***it's to put a *battery memory back up* so when you disconnect the power from the speaker
it wont loos the program it's in., and when you reconnect the speaker somewhere else we customers
don't need to go all over again trying to program the speaker back again.

I've been very impressed with the sound quality from the Echo Studio. We really like music in our house and it does it all VERY well. If you were blindfolded, you'd have a hard time telling that it was just a single speaker. The highs are crisp and clear and the lows are deep and not boomy or distracting. Very good balance of sound and is plenty loud. The Alexa integration recognizes your request much better than other Alexa enabled devices we have had in the past, even when music is playing loudly. So far, we LOVE having this in our house and I'm very impressed with the sound quality, which was very important to me.

Once I realized I could "cast" to my Echo Studio from Prime Music it has been freaking awesome! This little sound system is amazing and for the price... wow, just wow!

I have a southern accent so Alexa does not always understand me so I was getting aggravated with just wanting it to play one of my Prime Music playlists but "casting" from my phone has really been nice.

Bose has NOTHING on this little sound system!

This is far better then the first and second generation alexa speakers. Bought 2 to get the stereo sound! I now have 6 total and the sound is crisp throught out the house! These are not first generation or echo plus..... these are the studios that are bigger and far better.

This echo is top shelf. Its a great price for what it is! With amazon music subscription the tunes just keep coming. The Highs Mids Lows are all perfect and you can tune it individually with echo app on your phone. I just bought my second one and connected it to the fire stick 4k and talk about superior sound for movies and tv. Im waiting for my echo sub to come in and i believe it all connected with each other will be the best you can get for the money hands down! Great job Amazon!

I'm not much of a techie, so I can't get into all the specifics. But, I can say the device sounds awesome once you get it connected. I did have a couple little hiccups getting the smart lights to work, but was finally able to get everything connected. I'm sure this thing can do much more than I'm using it for, but, I was primarily interested in just playing amazon prime music. And, for doing that, this device works beautifully.
Just installed yesterday. It is a keeper. The wireless system helps me to de-clutter my entertainment system.

Great sound and great quality. I have all of my echo speakers in a single group so that I can play music throughout the house and the echo studio adds some definitive bass to the overall sound. Even on its own, it is a GREAT speaker. Going forward, I would really love to see Amazon integrate that tech into a full time outdoor speaker. That is really the final item missing from their lineup.

No discernible difference in sound quality from the previous model. Especially not for a $200 speaker.

Secondly, the previous model paired with my echo sub quickly and seamlessly.

This echo studio took 2 chats, 2 phone calls to Amazon and it wouldn't pair with the echo sub.

I like the sound and quality of Echo Studio. I especially like its ability to receive and output Amazon Unlimited HD/Ultra HD (none of the other Echos have this capability). BUT, these is no option for directly connecting output from Echo Studio into an external stereo system. The 3.5mm jack is strictly for input into Echo Studio. I run Amazon Unlimited HD/Ultra HD through a Sonus Connect device on another stereo system -- sounds great! I was hoping to go with the Echo Studio for this system, but not possible. The Echo Link is not an option either; its DAC is too limited and cannot process HD/Ultra HD. So I returned my Echo Studio and will bite the $350-$400 bullet for a Sonus Connect or Sonus Port. Expensive, but at least they work.

Amazon didn't disappoint with this speaker they gave you exactly what they stated simple yet good.
There are a few things that could make this speaker stand out from the rest. But in this market of speakers they are all locked down by there echo systems which is a con on all of them in the market. hopefully Amazons team will rethink and let go and this speaker will be a heavy hitter in the market already congested by the mini's (systems).

I replaced my main music echo with one of these and wow what a difference. Adding the subwoofer really kicked up the low end and widened the sound field. I liked it so much i purchased a studio for all my rooms and then setup a group so when i'm streaming music it is in every room. Makes the house really rock!

Love all our Alexa , this one does not stay connected to new Samsung tv as speaker , hard to set up as Bluetooth speaker , we have two of them and often will go off line . And had to get reconnected . Will not find Wifi , does not always follow set up with app. .. sound is quite wonderful wen it works . Hope they working on a connection fix . And able to really use it easy as a Bluetooth tv speaker .

This is my very first Alexa enabled smart speaker. Was about to buy the Echo 3rd Generation but opted for the bigger sound of the Studio and it did not disappoint! excellent build (built like a tank!) and sound quality impressive!

Sound is loud and crytal clear. to top of it all, Alexa is very impressive and very accurate. It can control also other smart connected home devices such as camera's lights and TV. Was able to control my Vestel TV using Alexa in my Echo Studio!

An excellent buy if you are looking into the Smart Home category.

I have the echo spot and the Alexa buds. Both ok products- not great - just good. However, I just received the Studio today and I love it! Very high quality sound, responsive Alexa and works seamlessly with the Alexa app. I have an Apple HomePod, and that has excellent sound quality. The Studio is pretty close to it. This is the best Alexa product out there right now. Very pleased so far...!
Update: Still love so bought a 2nd to stereo pair. Works perfectly and sounds amazing!

Unfortunately I’ve been living with this for a year. It very often does not hear us. it’s microphone is somehow not sensitive enough compared to our other Alexis. I believe there was a speaker out when we got it but I wasn’t sure the sound just did not seem very balanced but after about five months The sound quality kept deteriorating now the speakers are just raspy and some songs that seem to hit a certain frequency play so poorly we can’t even listen to them.

I"ve had the second generation Echo alexa for a few years. Music was why I bought it. Since then Echo's features have been expanded. Recently I found the new Studio. The best sound yet. We love it. There's a lot of you tube reviews you can watch. My only issue is the remote for the studio is not available. I was able to buy one for my older Echo, hoping it would work with the Studio. But no good.

The remote is really needed. I don't think they made a TV without a remote in 30 years. Hard to yell commands to alexa when you have the volume cranked up.

Other than that issue it's the best Echo Alexa music platform. Come on Amazon, get this issue resolved.

I purchased this with plans to replace our Google Home Max as we are an Amazon Alexa home. Incorporating it into our home was easy and all of our smart devices work well with our setup compared with the problems we have with Google Home. However, when you compare both sound quality, base and volume/loudness, the Google Home Max blows the doors off the Studio. There is a dramatic difference when you put the two side by side. Considering the Studio is more expensive than the Max - I returned it the same day I received it. Very disappointed in this product.

Sound is pretty good for such a compact speaker system. The only thing I can say is in the instructions it states:
" For best sound place at least 6 feet from any wall". Well, that is most impractical for just about any room. Six feet from a wall is usually also six feet from any AC outlet. I guess if you can re-arrange the furniture to place the unit on an end table at the end of a couch, you could probably manage to meet this requirement. But other than that I would say it provides a good sound and is easy to install and is functional.

I would like to say that I was skeptical of this purchase after reading everything. But I am glad that I did, I am very happy with the Studio. The sound was great, the ability to use all of the echos in my house as an immersive sound experience is amazing. I have had no issues what so ever with the Studio. Set up was a dream, I was listening to my favorites with in 90 seconds of it being plugged in.

It seems like my echo dot 3rd gen picks up my voice better and also is louder when responding. The echo studio has amazing sound quality while listening to music but when you ask Alexa something her response is not as loud as the 3rd gen dot. I wish they would do an update so you could set Alexa to respond at a high volume level of 9 or 10 and have music/sounds set to play at 8. That would be nice.

I love the idea. Little tough to control the volume from Spotify I have to actually go into the Alexa app or talk to the speaker or walk to the speaker to click the button to control volume. Sometimes there’s a delay in the Alexa sub and the song from the speaker. For how big the speaker is I was expecting better sound from this especially with the sub. Sounds weird but the bass only really comes through when you have the volume low. The higher the sound is the less base there is. And the bass is not really good to begin with. The apple HomePod speakers has more base than the sub and Alexa speaker combined. The Alexa speaker is louder overall though just way less bass. Overall speaker quality doesn’t cut it. Don’t waste your money. I’ve never been so excited for a product yet so disappointed. Maybe someone else had a different experience

The good:
Quality build and feel, good size, easy operation, Alexa integration including multi room music and sound quality except for voice reproduction.
The very, very bad:
No matter how I adjusted the sound, the voice reproduction was terrible. Always sounded like it was in concert hall mode and lacked the warmth and natural sound I desired for my type of music. I played the same music on my Echo Show 10" and the voice sound was very much better. Although the Echo show 10" does not fill the room like the studio speaker, it produces better sound overall.

When I played the first song through this speaker my eyes widened in surprise. This larger version of the Echo puts out surprisingly good bass. I couldn't believe what I was hearing. The Atmos speaker system gives good clear sound with the ability to adjust even mid tone levels. It's easy to set up and I can work my smart lights through it as well. I'm very happy with it and glad I purchased it.

Alexa requires some things to be said in n a specific way. I don’t talk AI. I have music on YouTube, but that doesn’t integrate. Some frustration with Bluetooth Alexa Dots. Voice, my sic will have lay on one at any time. Just bugs that require better human integration, setup..

Excellent speaker just as good as a Boses (which I have). My daughter bought it for me as a gift and I am playing this more then my Bose with a Subwoofer on my computer. I am a Jazz fanatic (real Jazz not that smooth fake stuff) and It connects to my Amazon Prime music and sounds great. I no longer play my CDs just sit and tell Alexa to play a play list an artist or a specific album and enjoy.

Oh my God it sounds so much better than the Echo plus. It really fills up the room with a sound. I'm going to get another one so I can pair them up.
I think the microphone on my echo plus work better but maybe it's because the speaker is louder.

So my plan is to get another one and maybe get a subwoofer for Christmas. I also did the high definition quality through Amazon music and I can actually tell the difference.

The studio is a really nice speaker but it is still a small speaker. The sound quality at low volume is good but if turned up, it is ok at best. If you set your expectations to this being a smaller driver, you will be happy with the purchase. I would not upgrade a standard echo to a studio if you were solely basing your decision on sound quality. The difference if there but not impressively different.
Love the quality of sound! Truly magnificent for the money. Out performs sonos for sound unbelievable. Love this product and actually ordered another one since we loved this one so much.

We wanted to upgrade our smart speaker arsenal at the house and purchased the Studio! Wow! What great sound and of course, Alexa integration. We use it along with another Echo (3rd Gen) and a Dot to give us whole house Alexa coverage. This allows us to control our vast array of smart lighting, thermostats, cameras, etc., from just about anywhere. The Studio really provides room-filling sound for an affordable price!

Bought one and loved it so much I bought a 2nd one for stereo. I am hearing instruments and vocals I have never heard in music that I have been listening too for decades. Bass is strong and rattles the windows. Highly recommend.

I bought both the HomePod and the Echo Studio to try them out together. I am totally in the Apple Ecosystem and I wanted to choose the HomePod, but I couldn’t. The sound of the Studio is just awesome...and it’s changeable with a slight EQ system in the app. I have Alexa all over the house because it integrates with more. I was going to add the HomePod specifically for sound and keep Alexa for our smart home. I am returning the HomePod...which TOTALLY surprised me. The bass is much better and the the overall sound is just awesome.

sound quality is ok. Better than listing to music on your phone but not better than the music channel on the TV.
For some reason there is a delay when speaking with Alexa through this thing. I asked her a question while standing about 5 feet from it and I could hear my Dot answer the question from my bed room (abut 40 feet away) and finish before this thing ever started to answer.
In short, Buy a good blue tooth speaker and an echo dot. This isn't bad but its not good either.

I love this speaker. I was looking for a great sounding (audiophilish quality) speaker that had alexa and tons of features.

This speaker has don't everything I wanted it to do. I keep it connected to the bedroom TV and I use it to play music every day. I saw some reviews about people having trouble playing music on it. I have had no issues at all. I tell it to play music on pandora or Spotify every day and it works great. Sounds great with movies too. I have considered getting the echo sub for added bass but it isn't really a necessity either because I have a full 5.1 home theater system in the living room if I really want to enjoy a movie. The echo studio works exceptionally well as a soundbar type of setup just sitting behind the bedroom TV and and I likely will put more of them in other rooms for multi room audio.

I was looking for a bass speaker actually to complete my home entertainment set-up with two ECHO 3rd Generation and a FireTV Stick. I had not seen the Subwoofer available for some time. There was nothing I saw advertised or warning about compatibility in the arrangement I described and based on reviews I had read about the sound I ordered. I was dissappointed when I discovered that I could not set it up with the configuration I was seeking. My room is small and I dont need extremely loud sound but was looking for a Sub for surround sound. So while the sound may be better than an echo 3rd Genb it did not meet my requirements for Surround sound Home Entertainment.

Not so sure about this yet... has it for 2 weeks or so now... still undecided...
Pro"s
1) bass is definitely improved over previous devices
2) doesn't break up at loud volumes unless you push it to 10
Con's
1) doesn't seem as responsive to voice commands like my echo plus
2) still not sure about the studio quality sound, but it is better

No good, only highs and pounding bass. the mid is extremely lacking, result in shilling sound not very pleasing. It can get really loud for a giant ball room though. 3D music is meh...not much difference. I prefer a good stereo good, balanced sound.

The system works ok with certain fireTV apps and not so great with others. I get constant sound syncing issues with non-amazon apps. I use two echo studios for theater sound and have another echo plus. It worked together for awhile then stopped working together. I have reset the systems over and over again. It's always a shot in the dark when I want to listen to Spotify. Sometimes the music plays and other times it's silent. I wish there was a better integration system with using multiple Amazon echo products + FireTV without having to buy $100+ equipment. At this point I should have gotten a regular home theater speaker setup.

I was hoping for a superior sound quality from the Echo Studio, but I was disappointed when I listened for first time. Definitely an upgrade from the Echo Plus, but I wouldn't call it 'studio'. Another downside is the zero visibility of the alexa light indicator on top of the Echo if you are not watching over the level of the device. Lets say, if you are sitting and the Echo is your eye level, you will not be able to see the indicator lights. On the plus side, the included ZigBee hub makes this a worthy upgrade from the Echo Plus. I think a more fittingly name for the Studio would be 'Echo Plus II'. The 'studio' is a little misleading.

This speaker sounds fantastic, right up there with the Sonos One and arguably as good (but not better) as the Apple HomePod. The Alexa integration and built in Zigbee hub help with connecting devices. It also can serve as a simple Bluetooth speaker. Very versatile, and can playback 3D sound (ie Sony 360 Reality Audio) if you have an Amazon Music HD Unlimited subscription. I highly recommend.

The studio is big and heavy compared to my older echoes, and the sound quality is improved. I have very poor hearing, which means that the volume must be turned high, and that can result in poor sound quality. The studio ameliorates that problem somewhat. I’ve been too busy to try the free trial period yet for the upgraded Amazon music service the studio is designed for, but I will do that sooner or later.

I bought the echo studio hoping for a soundbar equivalent speaker, but it's really just the same as an echo with some bass added. I would go for a similar priced soundbar with dolby atmos. If you need the alexa functionality, look at adding the echo input adapter.

This is awesome. The only thing stopping me from buying more is the fact that if paired in stereo,from exiting I’ve read, I cannot use it to play anything but amazon content. I want to be able to pair two together and play stereo from an auxiliary source.

I had an original echo on the 1st group to roll out years ago and finally upgraded. The studio sound is much better and with now being able to use it a home theater option it works very well. I went with the option of getting a Hues Phillps Smart Bulb free, I already have a light set up in the house but it does not handle dimming. Overall well worth the cost. I'm definitely a Echo family as we a also a Tap and Auto.

Don’t believe everything you read about this speaker. No matter what they claim, the sound is pretty much directional, but it’s a beautiful sound coming out. I have ordered another one to stereo pair and since I had two echo pluses paired I’m pretty confident this will make a significant difference. Expecting the new one tomorrow and will follow up after pairing.
Received number two a couple of hours ago and set up was a breeze including pairing.
The sound in stereo is just plain awesome. Abbey Road blew me right off my chair. 😁

I have been an audiophile for a while and own and have owned top of the line products from parasound amps, rotel , carver and more. speakers from martin logan to klipsch.
the amount of great sound these little things put out is amazing!
i have 2 of these in a pair with an echo sub and for $530 total you cant beat the value. sounds better then a lot of other systems that cost double and it can do wayyyyyyy more!

This is the third Echo I’ve gotten. Each time I got a higher quality version, and I am really blown away by this Echo studio! Echo Dot is fine for a bedroom or bathroom, but Echo Studio is great for dining or living rooms- where you spend more time, entertain, and just want to really enjoy the sound quality. I know you could pair the dot with any Bluetooth speaker, but the Echo Studio being all in one package is the simplest interface. I only wish it came in more colors like the dot as my decor is more neutral.

I didn't know this speaker existed until I saw it in an ad. It was in a bundle with 2 other items that were free with purchase.
I had been using a regular Echo for our family room. This Echo Studio makes a world of difference in the sound of our streaming music! It has a large woofer, multiple mid-ranges and a tweeter. This is a heavy speaker! The sounds are so good and you can adjust the equalizer through the Alexa app on your phone.

I really wanted to like this speaker! But something is just off. Its very tinny no matter how I adjusted the 3 settings. I also tried using it as a home theater speaker paired to my fire cube tv. The audio delay was terrible! Even after going through the hassle of adjusting the audio lag it would be off again the next time you turned on the tv. It also frequently lost connection to the fire cube and had to be re connected. Or just stop working in the middle of a show.

I heard the Echo Studio and was impressed. I was also interested in getting a Zigbee controller. I've had the echo Studio for about a month now and I enjoy its sound quality. But I'm thinking I probably won't use it as my Zigbee Controller as I'm not sure how I would share with my Google Home devices that I also enjoy. If you are looking for a great speaker I'd put this on your list.

I bought 2 of this echo studio and I'm returning 1 I managed to pair them together and the sound was great, but later was having tech problems that only one was working and the other won't than after minute it work again, I give up trying between only you get stereo sound for streaming on amazon music, Spotify and other in the Alexa app and fire tv, stereo does not work on Bluetooth again the sound is good but it's not Wow amazing for the price I guess it's an okay speaker.

I’m going to have to agree with the most helpful review that this Echo really shines when you pair them. We enjoy the increased immersion when watching our TV and when playing video games. If I had to nitpick, I just wish that you can pair two speakers over optical. Instead you must split the optical signal, but that would make it just two speakers each running its own set of channels.

Middle-age guy here, I have 2 3rd generations and two dots. I have one echo hooked up to my surround sound system to play and it sounds really good!!!

But when I got the echo studio it blows everything else out of the water, the 3-D experience Is great, but I listen to a lot of classics which are not digitalized, and they sound great on the echo studio as well.

I am very pleased with this purchase, and would recommend it highly!!

Great sound for a great price!!

The Echo Studio is incredibly awesome. The music fills the room fantastically. I feel like I’m at a concert because the sound surrounds you. I love to hear my music loud and the sound quality is incredible. I love having the ability to request any song I want to listen to with Alexa fulfilling it immediately w/my Amazon Music HD subscription. This is my first Alexa product and I’m very satisfied.

Richer, deeper bass make this a great speaker for music. The integration of Amazon Music Ultra HD lets this speaker shine. It has a bigger footprint than the Echo Plus it replaced. I wish the treble were a bit more pronounced, however. As for whole house Echo integration, it doesn't always recognize that I'm speaking to it rather than the Echo in the dining room one room over. That makes it a little frustrating, but we have 6 in the house now, so sometimes the wrong device responds. Otherwise, if it were the only device, it definitely sounds better than all others.
Only sounded good if you buy the HD subscription for $14/month....not worth it.

I have been waiting for the right time to buy this, and I am glad I did. I kept going back and forth on buying it mainly between do I need it or do I want it, well I figured I want it and need it, the sound quality is amazing in my apartment. I have been playing more music now that I am stuck at home cleaning and it's perfect, the music quality is better than my car system. I just wish we could stream other music via bluetooth. Hopefully amazon fixes that with an update. I am glad I bought this and my next purchase will be the subwoofer.

I was initially very impressed with the studio. After many months of music enjoyment it developed an annoying software glitch making it unlistenable. It will randomly get very loud and distorted.

I would have to reduce the volume manually which would create another problem. The next song that was played would be too low to hear anywhere in the house. I would then increase the volume and go about my business untill the process would present itself again and again and again.

Thinking I had a faulty studio I requested a replacement from Amazon and they promptly sent one out. It too developed the same problem and now is used as a place holder for one of our dots. The dots operate flawlessly.

I do not recommend you buy a studio at this time. The dot works without issue in my home. It is a shame because when the studio works the sound is far better than the dot.

This is a great sounding speaker with exceptional voice recognition. I also have an Apple HomePod and I think the sound quality on the HomePod is marginally more refined than the Echo Studio. The Studio seems to be a bit too heavy on the bass tones but it’s still a great way to fill a large volume of space with a ton of sound. Perhaps some way to tune the equalization would make it perfect.

This unit sounds great on its own. So good, I bought another one. When adding to speaker groups with other Echo units, it does not work too well. Each unit gets confused on what is playing through the speakers, and most of the functionality of "Echo, what is this song" or "Echo, turn the volume to 6" do not work. So I find myself saying "Echo, play my music on all speakers at volume 5" and it's hit or miss. If anyone knows how to correct this, please let me know.

I am thrilled with this additional Echo device added to my collection. Echo Suite makes your smart speaker sound like a Bose quality stereo. It is also very good at hearing my voice requests. This is my main source for everything from music to news to podcasts. LOVE IT!! Set up was really a snap, especially if you already have an Echo and the Alexa App set up already. No brainer to set up & connect.

I use the Echo Studio to stream my music throughout my home. Very nice quality sound with clean thumping bass and nice highs. My only hang up is that you should be able to link it directly with your smart tv or bluetooth speakers with no problem but the Echo Studio does not have that option but I hope that amazon will update it's firmware so you are able to utilize the above mentioned feature.

I pre-ordered this a while back and have been meaning to write a review when I received it. It is small but powerful. We live in a small condo and keep it in our living room. We love that we can pair it to our phones or simply ask alexa to play our favorite songs! Great for our many get togethers we have with friends!! We originally had the smaller echo dot but this is so much better! glad I purchased it!!!

Just received this and was stunned by how good the sound is. I have a house filled with Sonos speakers including Play 5's which I really enjoy. But the sound of these is excellent, very similar to the Sonos, and I have always found Alexa to be very helpful. The setup was also so easy since I also have multiple Alexa devices. I highly recommend these based on the price/quality ratio. It's a steal.

Alexa, where have you been all of our lives? LOL My husband and I love our echo / Alexa. The sound quality is amazing for such a small product. I grew up with speakers that were larger than me sometimes, yet this small product sounds better than they ever did. We also subscribed to Amazon music, which is a must have. We are very happy with Alexa, our menage-a-trois! LOL

Speaker sounds amazing. Any bugs that others have had, has been resolved! I have an echo dot, echo show, 3 echo flex, and the echo studio. I used to stream through my surround sound with the subwoofer. No need to do that anymore. My echo show and echo studio provide amazing sound and I don't need to revert back to that again. It is very convient and sounds great! High quality!

I have two linked together and it really does have a three d kind of feel. I do wish I could link them to the echo sub to give it more depth or two more speakers to do real surround sound and have more of a feel that your in the show/movie.
I bought the Echo Studio to link with my Firestick 4K. I tried for hours to link the two and it never HAPPENED. So I returned it. Don't buy it.

The sound is very good although not $100 dollars better than the Echo 3rd gen. If you had (or have) other Echo devices it’s nearly impossible to switch the new edition to “primary” device. So, unless you subscribe to Music Unlimited, you won’t be able to access Amazon music with it. The “music everywhere” feature that allows you to play all Echo’s at once sort of comes and goes. So, it’s a nice sounding device but the system makes you doubt if it was worth the money. Probably not.

I was impressed at 1st, but have been without any sound system/speakers besides my aging Logitech 5.1 PC speakers. I gradually became frustraited by the inability to customize the sound to the music I was listening to. The basic "Bass, Midrange, and Treble" just dosen't cut it. Amazon needs to introduce a full sound equalizer on the next release. The bass was very good, the mids were meh, and the treble was very weak. Given this I have decided to return my Studio. I was at a big box store today and heard the Apple HomePod - despite being a bit smaller the sound was exponentially better.

Got this as a gift; didn’t ask for it and was like,”Why do I need one of these?”. Well I do have a Smart bulb and a Wyze plug and now I can turn lights on and off when I am away. I can tell Alexa to turn on the living room lights before I get home at night. I can be lazy and turn on the lights when I am reading! It is so fun. I play the “Question of the Day”, and music for studying and I can order from Amazon(such a dangerous feature). I love it and am setting up Alexa to make phone calls with a voice command. I am new to this Echo studio stuff, but I like it. And I can turn off the microphone so Alexa does not write down everything that is said.

We have Alexa units throughout our home, with this being our “anchor” unit in our main living area. Installation was easy. Sound is good. We’re having problems with this unit responding to commands. When we ask “her” something, we often get no response. So, we ask again a bit louder. Lots of times, an Alexa unit (typically a Dot) in another room will hear and answer. We call this unit our special needs Alexa. We’re pretty happy with the Alexa system overall- and when this unit “hears”, it responds fine. For the money, maybe another Echo would have been as good a fit.

I don't know why I buy this thing so late. It sounds really good and for sure worth the money you pay for it. Amazon music HD is also great and their combination provide you with a unique easy to use and versatile experience of HD music. I had different versions of Alexa at home, but this one is totally a different experience, even compared to echo plus. Worth every penny.

It won't play on any of my Apple devices. I guess this is Bezo's Revenge? I went through a number of tech experts at Amazon, only to be transferred un-knowingly to a non-Amazon support, who started to wreak havoc on my Mac i.e deleting important personal files, movies. This tech support would not help till I agreed to pay them $189.00 and to subscribe to their IT support. I've been a customer of Amazon since 2003, I love Amazon Prime and every other service they provide. So let the buyer beware. Oh it does tell me the weather forecast.

I like this speaker but it would be MUCH better if you could connect with other Echo products. I have the show and several "dots" and being able to connect them all would be great. I have all of the others connected and use them more than this one speaker.

I have been looking for a good Dolby Atmos theater sound system that was cheap for a long time. This speaker was my solution. I bought the Amazon fire TV stick 4k so I could have this speaker connect wirelessly. The sound is so good that I am going to buy another one soon so I can have full Dolby surround sound. Don't hesitate to by this!

Initially, I did not think that this sounded that much better than the regular Echo that it replaced and it does take up a lot more room. However, waking up this morning in my bed, I could listen to NPR much better than with my traditional Echo. Setup was incredible easy. Setup was totally automatic. All I had to do was open the Echo app and it installed automatically.

Ok Kids....it's only been a week or so....doggy down!! I haven't used it that much, but so far it's solid...good pick up....smooth sound....I need to run it thru some everyday stuff and get a better handle on it...you know like the Atmos thing...
I will say it presents itself well. Just check back in a couple of months!
Thanks...and yes I love your products!
Vg

Wow! The sound just fills the room and you can feel it. We’ve placed this in a fairly open space in our family room, the sound truly fills the whole space just like how those humongous speakers fill up a concert hall/stadium with sound!!

If you have a subscription to a service like amazon music unlimited or tidal or any other service that has 3D audio tracks, it sounds even cooler!

The bass is really punchy, I guess this was also made keeping in mind some people might use this as a subwoofer (?) so that’s a plus too.

All in all, highly recommended!

I love the sound that comes out of this speaker but if you have more than one Echo product you want everything to play at once. Sadly, Amazon does not play Slacker or LiveXLive everywhere. You can only play it on one speaker at a time.
The days when they would add sources regularly seem to be coming an end.
MAC

The quality of sound is great if you’re streaming music from your computer or phone. The room sending auto acoustics seems to work well. Problem is I bought it (and new 4K firetv sticks) to create home theater and it doesn’t work for crap as many have mentioned. Often comes up with “having audio issues” and suggests you lower the audio quality. Lower the quality makes no difference and found cuts in and out. Some suggest this common problem is caused by network issues but placement makes no difference and all the other streaming devices have no issues. It also takes sometimes a minute for the studio to acknowledge you’re playing from fire and that it needs to start audio.

The Echo Studio works very well with the Alexa platform. Great integration and voice recognition. Sonically it is very close to my Apple Home Pod... at a much lower price. Compared side by side to the Home Pod, the Studio has much better bass depth and response than the Home Pod making it much more “room filling.” Clarity in the high and middle frequency range on some vocals is sometimes not quite as crisp as the Home Pod, but I’ll take the minor trade off and give a thumbs up for the great bass response and room filling sound.

There is only one reason for a one star review and it's because Amazon refuses to fix the connection issues with this product and it's firestick 4k

I have 2 of these paired as a home theater with my Firestick 4k. When they work, they are quite impressive. However they frequently drop the connection and lose sound. I have done everything Amazon support has recommended, including spending more $$ and replacing a fairly new 4k Firestick. Amazon refuses to correct this problem and it feels like they've kicked the issue down the road to avoid either replacing or returning them for a refund.

Should they fix the issue, there's no question that these would be 5 star worthy. However they are not ready for prime-time
Love it! Incredible sound! Highly recommend it!

I bought this to Bluetooth to my Galaxy view 2 tablet TV to get better sound. I've worked on it for hours but still the video and audio are out of sync a second or two. There is a thread and the forum about others having this issue with multiple devices.

I have moved it to my home office to use for music and answering questions and hopefully they will come up with a fix. I will then give it all five stars

When Alexa is responding, I love it. Unfortunately, every day there are times when I get no response, and have to go over and press a button to get Alexa to respond. I desperately want to love it, and this is my first Alexa device. Have not decided yet whether I'll keep it.

VERY UNINTUITIVE HOME THEATER SETUP GROUP, FAILED TO ASSOCIATE MULTIPLE TIMES UNTIL RESET LOCATION AND DEREGISTERED AND RE-REGISTERED. NO LIVE HELP, AWESOMELY OVERPRICED. SOUND QUALITY MIDLING. SAD I BOUGHT THE PAIR. PAIN IN THE REAR TO SET UP WITH FIRE STICK 4K; INITIALLY STATED NOT COMPATIBLE??? DROPS CONNECTIONS AND SYNC WITH 4K FIRESTICK REPEATEDLY. DON'T EXPECT THIS TO WORK SEAMLESSLY AT ALL WITH YOUR ALEXA SET UP. AGREE WITH OTHERS ABSOLUTELY NOT READY FOR PRIME TIME

I very much enjoy how it fills the front quarter of my home with full and rich music quality. I have two large floor speakers that I don’t need anymore and may gift them to an aspiring DJ. It also does excellent with routines and controlling smart devices. Should be marked as a flagship of smart home speakers due to all of its capabilities and integrations. #moneywellspent

I love that you can hook it up to the fire cube so I can use the remote I can hook it up to my original sound system but now I definitely want another Echo Studio to pair together, but just one still pumps major sound

We replaced an Echo Dot with the Studio and moved the Dot to another room. The Studio has good voice recognition, even from across a pretty large room. So it makes it easy to use Alexa, including to turn up or down the volume. Sound quality is good, and much better than the Dot, but it isn't comparable to full-size HiFi systems. But those are way more expensive and larger.

Thought this would work well as a sound bar for my new LG TV, especially as it is Dolby Atmos capable. Loved the sound and considered ordering a second for stereo quality. However, I eventually noticed that the sound was not syncing with the lips while viewing TV. There is no setting available to tune lip syncing. This device connects to the TV through bluetooth (which causes a sound delay) or through an optic cable (which will not carry the Dolby Atmos effect). An HDMI connection would have been ideal, but it doesn't have one. As a music speaker I think it works well, and Alexa is very responsive, but not capable of substituting a sound bar. Returned, sadly.

I think the product is amazing with a few caveats. First it should be way more plug and play like apple products. I have the studio, subwoofer and fire stick and to get them all to play together it took 30 minutes and a few YouTube videos to get them working. I have tried to take just the studio to a friends house to show how much I liked it and have been unsuccessful in getting it to play which definitely doesn’t help in the selling point. However all together and hooked up I enjoy it very much. Fills the room sound is pretty good and makes movies enjoyable for the small size and lack of cords. Definitely recommend.

Much better than any previous Echo device available. Don't get me wrong there are better sounding speakers out there but we won't get into it right now. Let me just say this, if you want to have better sound experience with Alexa integration get this unit, sounds very good, plays loud and will sound satisfying for most of the music genre. Good range, and decent sound all around.

This thing was like the twice the size of what I thought it looked like in the pictures. It's a beast and blows the echo dot out of the water for just shear volume and sound output. I'm not super technical when it comes to sounds, low and highs and tweeters and all that stuff...I just know that this thing is a beast and love having it as the primary echo in the kitchen.

The sound is acceptable. Alexa response time is slow compared to the other 4 dots and the studio and the plus device I have. I was really looking forward to the zigbee hub to control my lights and other home devices. This unfortunately did not happen for $200. I believe amazon needs to do some software development or change the touted features of the device. Not so happy with the devices actual functioning and integration. I could have purchased a number of other devices for sound and music.

Having purchased an studio from a brick and mortar (because Amazon sold out!), it's been an excellent replacement for my 2nd gen echo. Huge improvement in sound across the spectrum both audio quality and room presence.

main issues i have is the price is about $50 too much. All our other rooms have echo dots connected to powered bookshelf speakers..... much better audio quality for less $$$.

But for its footprint and as an upgrade to a old echo, has been great.
The sound is so much better and clearer then the other echo plus I was using. You can hear the bass more. So far I am very happy with it

Your browser does not support HTML5 video.
 Great sounding device but for some reason, voice recognition is not great. This Echo Studio replaced my Echo in the same spot but it is not as responsive as my Echo in my normal voice/volume.

Sound wise, it is awesome. Although in my opinion, my Bose SoundTouch 10 and Harman Kardon Onyx 3 still sound better.

I have to admit to being much more impressed than this device than I ever imagined. If you have Prime, this is a great home speaker, and a digital assistant. Sound quality is excellent for the price- can't imagine much better. I'm listening to a Dianna Krall album right now and it feels like I'm in the studio with her. Maybe not quite as pure as the HomePod, but darn close, and half the price (I got mine on sale). I don't think you'll be disappointed.

When I started using Amazon Prime Music, I knew I needed a Bluetooth speaker. At first I bought a cheap used one to learn how. When I decided to move up in quality, the Echo Studio was just being released, so I waited. It's friggin' awesome. Sound quality is very good for a small speaker and amp. Alexa is a pretty effective and easy-to-use music assistant. I could have saved some money and bought "something less," but I'm glad I didn't.

I already had 1 Echo Studio, which I enjoy streaming Amazon HD Music to, particularly with 3D music option, so I bought 3 more Echo Studio's this time! 2 as gifts for my daughter & son, who graduated college over the past 2 years, & the 3rd for myself, to create a pair for true right & left linked stereo sound. Amazon HD streaming music sounds so good on the pair, but lacks a bit of the big base drops in some songs, like "Long Way Home" by Tritonal/Helene, that I more distinctly hear & feel from my upgraded Infinity stereo/speakers in my Jeep Wrangler Sahara. I am planning to buy the coordinating Echo base unit for $130, & pair with my 2 Echo Studios for a nice wireless system to stream music to, & also output sound to wirelessly from my 77" LG OLED TV!

This is another product I want to love that thinks it is a few updates from greatness. I have four of them I purchased over the past month set up into two different theater groups. I have added an Echo Sub to one of the groups. Since adding the sub, these things seem to have a mind of their own. When it malfunctions, I only get output from the Echo Sub. Other times I will be listening and the volume goes up in the speaker group (Studio x2 plus Sub). Then it won't respond to turn down.

Overall the sound is impressive and good enough to brag to your friends about playing a Dolby Atmos trailer on YouTube. I just get frustrated that I can't get them to behave and constantly have to reset them at least once daily.

I bought a second Echo Studio because the first one sounded so good I wanted a pair, eventually getting the sub to complete my home theater configuration. But to my dismay Amazon techs tell me that you can only hear them synchronized through Amazon music or another music app but not through the firestick 4k. That sucks. And they give you a Phillips color change light bulb but you have to buy another gadget in order for it to work. What a joke when they're so many color changing bulbs that just screw in and link up to your Alexa hub.

If you are looking for a good sounding speaker most speakers at this price point have much better sound quality. If you want an alexa speaker that sounds ok this will work. I would not purchase this speaker again or recommend it.

Maybe i came into this with too high of expectations? i currently have a couple Echos (3rd gen) and i am really impressed with the sound quality from those devices so when i saw this Echo Studio for twice the price and great reviews and details i was expecting studio sound with a good amount of Bass. I'm definitely satisfied with the bass improvement but outside of the bass improvement the overall sound quality is similar to my echo 3rd gen. 4 star speaker, bot not 5

Only issue is that at times is loses connection with my Fire stick. Have 2 studios and they don't always sync up with the home theater group that includes the Fire stick. Little fustrating, have to play spotify music, then stop it, then fire stick will sync. It's odd but it works. When both studios syn with Fire stick, the sound is awesome!

First, understand that I am old school ... vinyl off a single action fully manual turntable through a Class A amp and above average speakers for serious listing. I bought the Echo Studio, actually 2 of them, for casual listening ... background/dinner music if you will in a multi room installation ... I will be getting a third so the main floor of our house is completely covered because I am pleased with what they are for what they cost ... with the additional benefit of Alexa.

I am an audiophile and was very surprised at the sound accuracy and range. The Amazon Music library is phenomenal and we placed on our kitchen island to listen to music while we eat. Alexa has excellent voice recognition and while I haven't remotely capitalized on its capabilities, I love the music quality. The Echo provides a lot of value for the money.

Paired it with another studio in my den and wow! The left spkr and right spkr designation is wonderful. The only down side is, in my opinion, I don't have the ability to set individual equalizers and volume to each speaker. Whatever adjustment you make on 1 also changes 2. This would be helpful in fine tuning balance and eq sounds. I'm very happy with these.

Amazing product...... there were a few days where optical had audio cutouts, but was fixed with firmware update.

The only real issue that has yet to be addressed is that a dual unit stereo setup can work for firetv streaming, but not via optical/aux for tv/bluray/other hardware audio. However this wasnt really built with that in mind. If they did however make that possible, this could possibly replace my livingroom home theater setup.

I have to be honest, I was hesitant to make this purchase due to the price point, but I'm so glad I did!! The quality of the sound is theater grade, and you pick up so much more with it.
