I had family over to watch the Polar Express this weekend, and they were all impressed with the sound, even noticing previously unobserved details in the movie because of the heightened sound quality. I'll be purchasing another to complete my home theater experience ASAP!

Pleasantly surprised by this unit. I didn’t find it to take up quite as much space as I had expected from the other reviews but it really does sound great. We use it as a smart speaker for our kitchen area and it sounds beautiful on podcasts or music. We’ve taken it outside and used it as a speaker for our outdoor projection screen it even does a really good job with that putting out a good amount of volume to fill an outdoor space. For the price, features, and sound I would say it’s the best smart speaker out there of this size.

The Echo Studio Hi-Fi speakers are seriously powerful and affordable. Amazon has done it again...definitely worth the investment. The easiest way to set up the speakers to the FireTV is to press the plus sign (+) and then select “Set Up Audio System” and Alexa will handle the rest.

Slow to respond to voice input, doesn't automatically "calibrate" every time it was place in a new room as it indicated it would during setup, tiny woofer means tiny bass no matter the price tag, 3D audio a gimmick.

Slightly better audio than the Echo Show, but a disappointment overall.

I would have rated it higher because the quality of sound is great, but dissatisfied with service. Paid $199, during shipment it dropped to $169. Was supposed to receive HD plan for a promo period, called and was told I didn’t have the right Amazon music plan, so there was no HD sample available. Customer Service person was New and had no clue of anything, kept being put on hold so she could talk to her supervisor with each question,shouldn’t just let me talk to them, to get the answers I called about, was on hold more than not.

So the studio is actually a great quality speaker for the price, HOWEVER I am now on my second one after getting the first one replaced and I am still having the same issue. The issue is that the speaker sound cracks heavily when connected to my phone especially with heavier bass songs, however it sounds fine when I tell alexa to launch spotify via wifi within the unit. However you lose the ability to control it from your phone and have to give her voice commands to get specific songs or playlist to come up. I honestly think this speaker fills a nice gap in the alexa device ecosystem however i’m disappointed that it has an issue with one of the main reasons you would want this speaker. Will most likely return.

Finally an all-in-one unit that you can enjoy streaming from. It's only going to get better from here but this is the next step in getting a great sound from Alexa. Make sure you adjust the audio settings in your Alexa app. All of the Alexa devices come with Bass, Treble, & Mid set at ZERO unless you change them manually. Makes a world of difference...

I wanted a echo studio for a while. Now that I have it, I can say that it is a ok buy. Don’t get me wrong, the sound is clear, and it does get loud. But I also have a regular echo connected to a echo sub, and the over all sound is better. Adding a echo sub to complement the echo studio I think is beat for large rooms.

This is by far may favorite of the echo line so far. I have a 5.1 2000wt system that I'm replacing with 1 echo studio.
The 5.1 system is a little louder, but the sound quality on this studio is amazing. Then the integration with the multiroom music through my house, and how it links with the fire stick... I definitely recommend getting one of these.

It sounds great for music, but Home theater mode on fire cube keeps getting out of sync. I end up having to un-pair it and re-pair it in alexa to fix. I also hooked up with tos cable, which sounds great, but the first time alexa plays any kind of notification, it turns off TOS input and the only way to get it back is to get up, unplug the cable, and plug it back in. I hope they can fix both of these in future software updates. Until them, it's just a big great sounding alexa.

When I first received this speaker you had to turn off the Stereo Spatial Separation to get better sound, recently Amazon sent out a firmware update that fixed that issue. Now the speaker sounds amazing.

I’m believable. Don’t let the size fool you about sound . This speaker is easy to use and really fills up a room.It has a 3.5 mm plug in . Even and older tv that had the red and white audio out rca jacks or optical out , you can buy for $8.00 dollars a connector that will plug in to your Studio Speaker. I have the rca adapter and I assume you can get the optical one.

I love this thing. The sound quality is awesome. It was a present for my wife and she loves it for playing her music on it. While I can't stand most of the music she listens to (pop tunes, etc.) it does sound great. I've also used for my music (mostly metal) and it sounds great for that too. Very easy to set up, especially if you already have other Alexa devices on your network.

Got mine today, it was a breeze to setup. I just plugged in and both connected to my Wifi without any input from me. I grouped both studios I bought with my echo sub in my living room to get an awesome sound. The 3D music was awesome and the home theater sound thru my fire tv was great as well.

I bought two Echo Studios. They're both used for my downstairs home theater system. When I'm able to hear it, it sounds incredible. But my main concern is that the connection always drops. I am kind of disappointed. It's been like seven times since it's lost connection to the fire stick and the TV. I have it set up for optical out from my TV into a splitter and connected to both Echo studios like one of the review video shows. But for some reason on some days, one studio loses connection. On other days both lose connection and no sound comes. Even Amazon Alexa doesn't work. If anyone knows any tips or tricks on how to connect it, please reach out

I am really happy with this purchase we wanted a sound system for my office and this was a perfect choice. You really hear surround sound. I was looking for something for meditation and this was AMAZING!! So happy with this purchase totally worth it!

Nice speaker; does have its connectivity issues though. Worked with the bluetooth on my tv for about a day then wouldn't connect at all, tried optical but then you have to disconnect and reconnect the cable every time you turn on the tv otherwise it doesn't work and then have to get up to control ther volume directly on the speaker. Nice for music and such though

My nephew recommended this speaker as it compares to the Bose speakers in sound quality in the same price range, with the added benefit of using Amazon Prime music, Alexa to connect with other features in your home and the ability to share a song with someone who has an echo device in their home. It also adjusts to the size of the room it’s in, and can be moved anywhere in that room with great sound. It does need to be plugged in. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is there is a delay in using Bluetooth to connect the speaker with my iPhone and Mac.

Well this product sounds good not amazing but good. What drives this product into the abyss is Amazon prime music along with Alexa who seems to be dyslexic at best. Horrible. Amazon prime music even sucks on my $300 Beats headphones.. pops hisses and the bit rate is noticeably slower and of poor quality. Sorry but next time I’ll pay more for a Sonos system and play my own music.

I have had 4 different speakers for the kitchen over the years. The others have been from just ok to above average, but the Studio has great fidelity for its size and Alexa makes a great cooking partner. It is not for critical listening for the audiophile but it is outstanding for everything else.

So far I have been very happy with Echo Studio, it responsiveness to commands and the sound quality. I want to get one more so that I can have stereo in the Living Room but am waiting, in the hopes that there will be a sale on it again around Christmas, either on Amazon or at Best Buy. I love the Amazon payment plan that they offered - to pay over five months.

The sound is so good. I placed it in several spots and in different rooms trying to decide just where I was going to finally put it. It automatically adjusts to the room and surroundings. It had a great sound no matter where I put it. Crisp, clear sound with near perfect balance. This thing has great sound quality even at high volume. It's a keeper.

Pairing 2 of these Studios in the basement has been amazing at each end of the basement. Great build quality and a ton of sound in one unit. Even found some book shelf speaker mounts on Amazon that almost look like they were made for them! Boom!

I’m impressed with the sound quality, given the little package. The bass on this thing kicks, even all by its little self. Connectivity was easy as we already have several Echo devices, so as soon as I plugged it in, it configured itself. This is going to be my favorite Echo device hands down because music sounds great coming out of it. It’s just as good as Bose or Sonos, but your cost is subsidized by this being an Amazon device.

I bought an echo studio to create a home theater with all my echo speakers as surround and I'm deeply disappointed. I have been an Echo person and I set up my home so all my device are alexa-connected. However, this time around im not happy. Sound is okay but would've been better I
With more speakers. Why wouldn't you update your system so you can connect all these devices to play as surround speakers. Why can I play multi-room music but cannot do it when I watch on my fire tv? You have to buy another echo studio or sub to do it. It's frustrating! I know you have to sell the echo studio and sub but for all of us who owns several echo devices this shouldn't be an issue. Sonos, Bose and Polks system are able to do it. If I have known that echo studio is a lame duck system then I would've bought sonos.

Sounds good,not great though. Equalizer is ineffective. I probably would have saved the extra money and
Bought a newer version of the device I already had. Bass is definitely improved

I bought one to use with my FireTV and so far I am not disappointed. After having decent LG soundbar and a standalone amp with some bookshelf speakers I think the Echo Studio sounds better and I can hear dialog much better. I will likely be pairing with a second one and I am not sure I will need a sub.

This is a great speaker that does what its Supposed to do. I am just trying to figure out why in 2020 do we still have wired speakers?

And also can we please get an update that we can keep the backlit buttons on CONSTANTLY? Its a pain in the a** to have to use a flashlight in the dark to locate the buttons.

Other than that everything else is quite lovely, the sounds, features, e.t.c definitely a must buy!

I have this device paired with a base unit and it is constantly cutting out. And it's not like this just happens once an hour. Sometimes it happens multiple times a song, and it happens at least once or twice an hour. I don't have my Alexa and sub very far away either. The sub is on the floor right under the Alexa. I can't recommend the sub/Alexa combo to anyone. Especially considering the cost of this set.

purchased to primarily pair with my Fire TV as a surround system. sound is good, but the integration with Fire TV is horrendous. Random disconnect from the stick in the midst of watching has become beyond frustrating and without a simple workaround for fixing it. Old sound bar is coming back. This is by far the worst purchase I ever made on Amazon!

Wow ! Have always been a Bose fan but was so disappointed with my Bose 500 Alexa speaker. The microphone had a hard time hearing me and the sound was meh. Just upgraded to the cheaper echo studio and wow, the sound is ten times better. Music sounds great. And it linked to my other devices with no issues. (Not sure why some had problems connected to amazon music mine worked instantly). 5+ stars

I followed the provided instructions, but found that it wouldn't pair with my Fire Cube TV. I called tech support, and Paula helped me resolve the issue. Turns out that the Echo Studio just needed a software update. I've been SO HAPPY with the Echo Studio ever since!

Amazing sound ... what a nice upgrade. Now I am conidering getting a second one for more stero sound. My only complaint is .... that now I can't see the glowing circle on th top as easily as before .... it must be recessed a little. But that is not enough of an issue to make me not appreciate the quality and difference in the sound. I Love it!!!

I am new to Alexa driven products. But I did not want my first Alexa speaker to sound like a $20 Bluetooth speaker from Wal-Mart. I was pleasantly surprised. The sound is crisp, and the bass is just right. I have had the speaker for about a month now, and I wish I had more time to listen to music, but this is a wonderful addition to my home.

I have a number of Alexa's all over my home. I absolutely love the speaker integration so I can play music all over at the house at the same time. And upgrading to the Echo Studio makes it even better. This is an excellent sounding speaker and really lives up to were expectations! I have the Echo Sub linked to one of my Alexa's and this new Echo Studio sounds even better than that. I'd highly recommended this if you're looking for a high quality, great sounding speaker with the added benefit of Alexa capabilities.
It’s about as good as my Bose SoundTouch 10 but it’s all directional so that makes it ideal for my great room, where I place it in the middle, between the living room, dining room and kitchen.

When the speaker first arrived I did not like it what so ever and was very disappointed. A technical service member reached out to me and had me do a factory reset. Well, that fixed the issue. I also figured out that from my phone via Bluetooth you have to have the volume turned up as well. I plan to dive into what this truly sounds like now that it is working right.

Placed our studio on top of our china cabinet. It fills the room with music. Never distorted, even at high volume. Voice recognition works well. Was easy to connect it to wifi and our other Amazon devices. Can't rate tech support because we didn't need it! This device is capable of playing 3D music if you purchase the 3D plan from Amazon.

Sound quality is awesome for this speaker, I paired two of these speakers to listen to music mainly and the sound quality is great. I first purchased the Apple HomePod but found that these work much better with all my music services. Waiting for the Subwoofer to be delivered to add some additional bass. They work great with your Amazon 4K Firestick. Get a pair for the best sound !

what a great speaker. it has really good bass and great volume. It's better than lots of sound bars and if you use a couple of these in the front and then some satellite speakers as rears, you have a pretty great surround sound system. I'm using just one echo studio in front and then 2 echo 3s in the rear for now. hope to add another echo studio up front soon.

I have been looking for a sound system that is comparable to Sonos 5 or HEOS 7. The Echo studio as a pair plus the subwoofer is the answer. I have heard from other reviews that the Echo studio as a pair without the sub are good. That’s true. But when you add the subwoofer, you really get the added “ umph” that compares to Sono or HEOS. The speakers pair easily. The subwoofer is a little harder but it connects with a little bit of fiddling. The other benefit is that you can run the pair in the same room for stereo or put one of them in another room for mono playback. Sometimes I play them together and if I throw a party, then I can move one to another room and they play the same music with both having Alexa capability.

Other reviews are accurate when saying sound is MUDDY and no way to adjust. Not to mention bass is only heard at high volume 8 or above. also true you can't see the ring if a couple steps away so you never know if it heard you. annoying. Cant believe they couldn't do better after having been doing echos for so long. Super disappointed, i also paired with echo sub and just is not worth the price as was expecting way more umpf.

Love this. I bought the regular Echo and liked it so much I wanted another so after reading a bunch of review I decided to get the studio. Big difference in the sound quality. Everything else is the same in regard to how it operates. The Studio is a lot larger. I like that you can pair it with another studio and the Echo Sub which I may get at some point but at the moment one is just perfect.

If you are in the market for premium sound from a speaker that doesn't require much room, this is the product for you. I would definitely purchase a second. The sound quality boasts rich heavy bass and premium highs and mids. Upon its first setup, the speaker will calibrate by sending out sounds to gauge the the size of the room and equalize the sound to fill the room with sound. I definitely recommend this product.

This was an upgrade from my previous Echo.
I saw an add for the echo studio and had to get it. I'm glad I did. It is an impressive piece of sound equipment. It sounds really nice and is a huge improvement over my previous echo.
I also think the Alexa app works better too. Responds to commands better.
I'm glad I brought it!

Aside from the hardcore audiophile... I suspect this speaker will be more than enough for the average person who wants big and crisp sound. We bought this for our home gym and it's great. I may upgrade other echos in the house if Amazon ever adds these to the trade-in program. It's really a great sounding speaker even at its highest volumes.

Wow the sound is really superior. I can't believe how great it is. It hooks up immediately almost by itself. It is automatic in alot of ways. For those that are not tech savvy this is the Alexa for you. It does my light my tv my coffee my intercom to my roommate through another echo speaker it does everything and it hooked it all up by itself all I did was plug it all in pretty much

The free Dam Philips Hue lamp is useless without a $63 Philips bridge. Just a tease and a waste of time.
Thanks for nothing Amazon, not only a useless piece of junk, but wasted my time to figure out that echo was never going to discover it.
The Echo studio is nice, but the Philips hue bulb scam ruined the experience.

This speaker sounds really great. Before this I listened to music mostly in my car only (not a headphones person). It's so nice to be able to listen to music in the house again and have it sound good (instead of just using my phone) I bought one for my mom and dad for the anniversary and loved how it sounded so much I got one for myself too

I bought primarily for my TV in my bedroom. After listening to a display unit, I decided to go this route and am very glad I did. Setup through the app was easy to connect to my Firestick 4K. The audio sounds great and really fills the room. I really like that I can control the sound volume from my Firestick remote. I have been trying to get used to voice commands to control my TV but I am getting there :)

I've never been so impressed with an echo product that I had to immediately go write a review for it but this echo did it. For a single unit the sound from the echo studio is incredible. I would easily spend 4x the price of this echo for a sound system that would come close, and this comes from someone who spent years installing professional audio systems for homes and events. Absolutely excellent when convinced with high bitrate amazon music.

As so many have mentioned already, the sound this thing produces is incredible! Love listening to it all day as I work from home. If it was only a speaker, I would still buy it for $199. With the additional features of Alexa and the Zigbee hub functionality, it's a no brainer. I've ordered several additional Echo Studios and look forward to putting a pair in stereo mode.

I compared both the Apple HomePod and the Amazon Studio Echo.I’m a Apple fan and i tried to love the HomePod but the Echo Studio simply blows it out of the water and Alexa is light years ahead of Siri.

would not connect to apple music properly. would not play my apple music playlists. Spent much time trying to set it up and it to play apple music... should not be this hard. Additionally, if you use as bluetooth speaker to stream from phone, cannot add another bluetooth speaker with this method. for me useless as someone who uses apple music primarily and looking for a multiple speaker set up. For Amazon Music users can imaging would be a better experience.

Se escucha espectacular. Mucha fidelidad.
Probé varios bocinas y niguna se escucha como esta. Ni bose ni sony, ni la q vende Ikea se compara con esta. Por fin compré una q se escucha súper bien. La recomiendo.

Surprisingly large. Really thumps out the bass. Amazon really excels on the connection process. So fast and easy. There is a 3 D sound check. Microphones are sensitive enough to pick up voice without shouting. I got it marked down on sale, so great value. Next day delivery in my area. Bought it on a Saturday and got it delivered Sunday.

PROS: Can get really loud, which is what I was looking for, plus better fidelity. Voice sensitivity is very high too.

CONS: Big and Ugly.

I compared to a Sonos One and while it beat the Echo Studio in most areas, the Sonos had a slight edge in sound quality, tho at a lower volume level. And it was much nicer looking!

I am not a true audiophile, but I do like my music, and the sound from this speaker is fine for what I am looking for. I have multiple Echo devices, and this unit is a perfect compliment for whole house music at an inexpensive price (relatively). I mostly bought it to use as an inexpensive soundbar. The sound is perfect for the room I have it in, the issue is that the sound keeps cutting out every few minutes for a second or two, but I have yet to hear it cut out during commercials. I have searched the net, and this is a known issue for over a year, and I have yet to see it addressed properly. I have had the Studio for only two days, and I will check it more thoroughly, but may have to return it as I don't need and expensive Amazon Echo.

Really expected more. The first gen Echo had decent sound from a tiny speaker. Moving from the 2.5" (I think) to the 5.5" (I think) I thought it would fill the room with good sound. In short, it sounds like poor equilization and we didn't really enjoy music on it. Moved it down to the kitchen. So, it's basically a $200 Echo Dot now. Bummer.

I have two of these that I use with two Echo Subs and Two Echos - I have them grouped and the sound quality is excellent! And since I use the set up with my Amazon Music account - it works out perfectly!

The echo studio works well and has a nice sound. I received a free light bulb with the purchase and love that too ! I had trouble with the light bulb staying connected with unit and called customer service for help. The employee was very helpful and did an excellent job not only fixing the problem but also answering other questions I had

Great product!!! Set it up in my living room and hooked it up with all my other echo devices. Now I have bass and more sound and all my devices can play together as a group. Now I can go from the living room to the kitchen to the bedroom and hear the music all around the house

I am using the echo studio in conjunction with my fire tv cube.
For a single speaker it fills the room with outstanding sound.
Like all amazon speakers it was very easy to setup.

I didnt care for it
i found the audio to be poor
notifications annoying
setup as more difficult than it should be
voice recognition did not live up to the modern expectations
I love that I can move it anywhere in the room and get a beautiful volume out of it if you move it in the TV outside on the deck you can watch TV out of the open it’s amazing

I use this mainly for music, I have a few other connected speakers and it sounds really good, the music is noticeably clearer. The bass is a little lacking in my opinion but it does have a little bit of bass. I ordered 2 for my small living room but it was too small of a room to make a difference, so keep that in mind if you want to order 2 for stereo pair.

It's great.....when it works..
The 1 star is mainly due to it works with my Chromecast...
Otherwise it's Alexa play Spotify...."Sorry device offline"
Alexa play XM Channel 41...."Sorry device offline"
Alexa play Amazon Music....."Sorry device offline"
It won't recognize the audio cable from the TV....

I don't have this problem with Echo Plus...
It is a fine purchase for a decent intelligent integrated Alexa Atmos speaker. I wanted more bass but it seems Amazon is no longer restocking their Echo Sub in the USA markets...what a shame...

It'd be nice to be able to sync and control the Echo Studio's volume from ur phone (I use my phone, or whatever other device). What happens is u have to manually and separately adjust the speaker's volume to High so u can then adjust the volume from ur phone (or tablet). So when ur done listening to music from ur phone (or tablet) via bluetooth, the Echo's volume stays High and Lord have mercy if u trigger Alexa. Yes it's going to be super loud so cover ur ears. I'm sure the scientists ar Amazon behind the technology in these apparatuses can very easily fix this so I'm hoping they'll read my review. Excellent speaker for $199. I highly recommend it. Indeed, indeed, indeed.

I'm really impressed by the Echo Studio. The music is clear with good bass depending on your settings. It has no problem filling a large room with great sound. It's very responsive even with the volume maxed out. Still manages to pick up your voice when speaking Alexa. Far better than the Apple Homepod and a hundred dollars less.

It is a great sounding studio speaker. Full sound can adjust equalizer, and just beautiful sound. I’m pleased that I ordered it. Plus it s Alexa. I do not think you will be disappointed , but keep in mind exactly what it is and supposed to do it’s not a bose SoundTouch 30 but ispts not supposed to be. It’s an excellent choice.

I really like the sound quality for what you get out of a standalone speaker. I will say the only thing I don't like is it can't be used as just a Bluetooth speaker. Has to be connected to wifi and your alexa has to be set up. With the bad out of the way. I'll say the quality is great and comparing it to my echo, jbl flip, and Samsung sound bar and powered sub. The echo studio has more clarity, full range of sounds in the experience.

I bought two echos studios in order to pair and use as a home music system. I was sorely disappointed because it doesn’t really enable you to connect two Spotify accounts at once (like Sonos does).

Spent hours on both Amazon and Spotify support to try to figure out, and it simply wouldn’t work.

Don’t recommend if your household uses more than one Spotify account (Spotify connect will only work with one of your accounts)

Even setting up Amazon household did not fix the issue

The sound is pretty good, but not as good as the Sonos that I replaced my two studios with.

I did not dislike the second batch of echo studios but the first was a night mare The end of November I ordered three echo studios for Xmas presents that never arrived. I was then told that they were lost in the mail and I would be receiving a new batch and if the old ones arrived I could just keep them because they were claimed by Amazon as lost. Well I received both orders and kept one of the lost echo studios for myself. It did not work and upon contacting Amazon and they had turned the lost echos into bricks. How embarrassing if I had given it as a gift. I should have been told of this situation. Now I have to throw them away. I really do think you owe me a new echo for this mess caused by you. Rosemary Bentley

I just got this little bad boy up and running and oh my goodness this thing sounds great!! Just bought 1 so far, I already had the sub and 2 of the Echoes and it sounded really good. So far with the 1 studio and sub it sounds a lot better then the other setup. I recommend this product to anyone that listens to music because it sounds amazing! I’ll be adding the 2nd one before to long.

Very easy to setup and sounds fantastic especially for the price. These are not to be compared to studio monitors or professional audio gear. It’s a smart speaker for everyday use and for that purpose it’s excellent.

The sound that this puts out is amazing. In combination with Amazon HD music this is a winner. I have had a HomePod for over a year and it has been good; but the echo studio I think is far superior. I wish that I could trade my HomePod in and buy another studio. Music that is labeled 3D is stunning. Well worth the bucks!

This is by far the best smart speaker for sound quality, but I think if you're buying it to experience Dolby Atmos surround sound it's okay it's not really going to give you that kind of experience. But it's really good sound quality especially paired with Amazon music HD.

The initial setup took about 30 seconds, followed by a few minutes of changing the settings on my Alexa app. The result was an amazing sound quality, far superior to any other Alexa I have ever heard. The sound is amazing, authoritative, and bold. The only one drawback is that this Alexa is huge, a little bit bigger than a pineapple, and it is heavy. Aside from the added size and weight, it is nearly flawless.

I have a about a 3200 sq ft home with several echo devices that I always thought sounded quite nice, but the echo studio is really something fantastic. The bass and depth of sound is unreal. I plan to purchase another for the opposite end of the house. Just those two alone would fill every corner of my home with awesome sound.

My Echo 1 attendant's voice is louder than the voice on this device, which is what I use the most. However, for music this device is much better. i do not like the light ring placement in this device. My device is on my fireplace mantle and I cannot see the light ring from my seat in my family room, where I could on the other device. These are fairly petty but I had the other device in this location for 4 years (still operating fine in another room).

I have owned and operated a recording studio for over 47 years, I do know good sound when I hear it! With a Amazon ECHO STUDIO, I do hear "very good sound"!! Well worth the price, loaded with features and very well made from very good quality components! I can make requests from just about anywhere, and ALEXA responds absolutely flawless! ALEXA can hear every word said, even over a high music volume level. The only way to not be heard is you must turn off the microphone, just a touch of the microphone on/off button for total privacy. You will not need a manual to get started, just plug it in and meet ALEXA. You must have a manual to learn all you can do. They should of included a manual in the box, but they do not ! Check U tube for more info. ENJOY!!
Came with a light bulb that doesn't work. It's so frustrating. They send a free light bulb that requires you to purchase a bridge for. What a scam.

Great design, great sound.
I needed to play with the EQ quite a bit to get the sound I wanted - the default EQ setting (flat) sound wasn't very good.

So far, I’m loving this speaker. The only
Shortfall I see so far is when playing my own music, the volume level dips very low. This wasn’t so with my echo. Also the Alexa app freezes when using the studio when trying to skip a song or play over. I don’t know if that has anything to do with the speaker.
But I like the quality of the sound of this speaker.

The Echo Studio that I've purchased, is the first Alexa device I've purchased. I have used other smart devices but decided to go with an Echo Studio. The sound quality is exceptional. I'm still learning about Alexa, as a voice assistant, its capabilities, etc. And I've only had the Echo Studio for a little over a week. So, at this point I am very much a novice still. So far, it's great.
I truly love the upgraded sound on my Echo Studio! It's truly an advancement over the past iterations. I love the 3D sound quality and the bass a great deal. Very happy with my purchase!

I always buy the best because that is MY M.O. to do. However, I purchased a 9.99 alarm clock with an Alexa Speaker built in. You cannot tell the difference in quality between the 199.00 dollar one and the 9.99 one. UNCANNY. I am keeping the expensive one because hopefully it will last longer. But, I wouldn't bet on it.

I had been eyeing this for a while to replace the Echo Plus we have in our living room (this moved to our bedroom). The sound it produces is great and fills the room with the bass which is a nice plus compared to the Echo Plus. Sometimes the voice recognition doesn't always pick up when playing louder than normal music, but that is probably expected to some degree. The small foot print is nice as it can sit just about anywhere, as long as its not obstructed by overhangs or on the side.

I'm overall happy with this speaker. Sounds great! Loud enough and a nice size. Much nicer sound than my echo dots. I haven't played them since getting this one. However, Amazon 3D music should be included though especially if you already pay for prime. Cannot get full benefit of speaker. Had 3D sound but only if you pay for package with is more than most TV subscription services.

By all means this is an excellent speaker. The mids and highs are clear, natural and well balanced.
However, I definitely cannot say the same about the lower end of the frequency spectrum--the bass is weak!

If your technical team could only correct this issue via an OTA update, either by directing more watts to the subwoofer, modifying its frequency range, or simply raising the volume of the sound coming from the 5.25 inch woofer. The technical part of how to do it is obviously the perview of the engineers.

I am only a professional musician and producer, so I DO know what good bass sounds like!
AMAZON, Thanks for developing the BEST of the best electronic devices! The new Echo Studio is "WORLD CLASS"! It is easy to use and the sound is EXCEPTIONAL!!

Yeah, I like everything about this speaker so far. The sound is really good. I am upgrading from the bose mini so its a bigger sound. I also own two sonos1 for my surrounds and use them for playing music. Since I have a sonos sub also, the Studio cant compete, but the studio is mobile. I like the Apple speaker for its size, but the studio rocks

I wanted to get the best possible sound for the TV in my bedroom. I decided to couple the Echo Studio with the Fire TV stick. With a simple setup to use the Echo Studio as a Home Theater speaker for the Fire TV, I am now enjoying truly incredible sound in a small space! And, apart from TV, the sound of my music over Amazon Music Unlimited is now really incredible! Best Alexa smart speaker I have ever used!

At least that's what it feels like...the speaker is large so you will need to give Alexa her own space where she's not in the way. Still on a learning curve with her but so far we enjoy using Alexa and the speaker sound quality is nice, better than the smaller speaker options, although the smaller options aren't a bad choice if you're not into loud music.
Totally fills my kitchen with great crystal clear sound . Added echo sub . Now even better, easy pairing, great with amazon music app ,even hears commands with music up

After the return period, I've had the time to play with AI, Alexa is below IQ. Came from Google home, wanted better sound (google nest speaker?) so I went with Studio. It isn't anywhere near able to hit volume 11... and it can't "process" anything properly... even within amazon music. Sucks. RUN!!!... Take it back, I will sell.
Great sound and bass

I have a Google Home Max that's way larger than this. As a Bluetooth speaker it's alright since it lacks some volume, but as a streaming device with Alexa Cast and Dolby Atmos source for fire TV, it's sensational. Connection with TV is a bit on the unreliable side as sometimes picture and audio don't sync up. But excellent for music and podcast. definite recommendation, when it's on sale!

I had an Alexa right next to a sound bar and thought this could replace them both. When I plug in the 3.5mm aux in from the TV, it is very quiet compared to Alexa’s voice/other volumes. I am very disappointed. How can such a simple feature be done so poorly? Am I doing something wrong? Is there a separate volume for the Line In? (TV volume on 100 out of 100)

I hooked this up directly to my tv to get surround sound. The sound goes in and out on HBO all the time. Ruins watching shows. You can’t keep the tv sound on at the same time as the echo studio because it echos. Super disappointing buy. I have spent soooo much money on Amazon Alexa products and am really disappointed with this. I would return but I threw away the box immediately because I had faith in their products.

bought one had to have two replacements sent because of distortion - sounds like interference but there are no other devices around to cause this interference. Total 3 Alexas had to be returned because of sound distortion. no more replacements would be sent. it looks great but for $200. I want a speaker with clear sound. Alexa sub works great it played bass even when Alexa wouldn't play sound.

Pro: quality sound, good price, Alexa integration
Con: confusing to set up, especially with Echo speakers in the house, Alexa has trouble explaining Amazon Music options and specific songs. Amazon Music has layers of options, unlike Apple Music. When I add up the costs of the layers, Apple may be a better buy.

But...It will only pair with another Echo Studio . Wish it could pair with other Echo models (i.e. Echo Plus, Echo) for left-right stereo, without having to immediately go out and buy another Studio. Also, because it is integrated into Studio's essentially flat top, the colored status light ring is easily visible when looking from above, but difficult to see when looking at unit from the side. If put on an eye-level shelf, you can barely see the light ring if you are sitting, and cannot see it at all if you are lying down.
Absolutely love, love, love this speaker!! Incredible sound!

Acquired Studio as third Echo device for bigger speakers and built-in hub. Excellent for room filling sound for our smaller “great” room. Compact design provides all we need at good price. Setup was easy but we are very familiar with app. Not really an all on “smart” home but light bulb control and Homeguard is what we use. Highly recommend!!!

I have a pair of these studio speakers and they are linked together in my home office only 3 feet away from my 2G / 5G network and every two weeks they drop the signal and have to be re paired up and in plug and plug in again to connect. Otherwise you lose the stereo affect and it just goes away. Good sound though

I really liked my single echo studio and decided to get another to set up as a stereo pair. I set it up and really enjoyed the sound quality UNTIL... horrible gaps ruin the transitions in Abbey Road / Dark Side of the Moon, etc. NO GAPLESS PLAYBACK. It's a catch-22 - you can get gapless playback by pairing bluetooth, but then no stereo.... stream over wifi, stereo sounds great, but agh... those gaps...

This is now my third Echo. I had the original and then the following models. I finally bought this one bc I thought that this one might pick up on my voice better than the last, it doesn't. Its a bit better, but the first one was bomber. It never struggled understanding what I said, even from a good distance.

This studio echo though does have good sound quality.

Overall It drives me nuts, but at this point a necessary evil in the smart home world we live in.

I've had this for a couple weeks now. All in all I would say it's good. I just have a couple issues. First, the sound quality is good but still lacks. I realize it's a $200 speaker, but i was anticipating a little more. The bass isn't quote what I was hoping for.
Two, it's bluetooth or optical in for the inputs and it doesn't come with an optical in cable.
Third, if you change inputs to bluetooth, you can't get back to the optical in to use it as a soundbar without either unplugging and plugging back in the cable or resetting the whole device. I heard that was supposed to change, but they've been saying that for quite some time.
The sound is incredible in this Echo Studio. Sometimes when you listen to music, the sound will go down but ask Alexa to turn it up, the volume goes up. So far we're happy with it.

I wanted to upgrade my first generation Echo to the latest and greatest model. So fat, I have been really happy. The bass is definitely tighter and more powerful and the treble sounds richer. It is quite a bit bigger and heavier so factor that in if you decide to purchase one. The Alexa app is as clunky as ever but adding the device was pretty easy. Overall, a definite improvement !

I do really like the speakers but they do not have enough volume to use as a home theater or a loud jam out time. I feel like I'm using a tv in a hotel that has a limited volume control. If I had it in a bedroom it would be fine. In my living room I want more. I'm hoping that this issue will be updated at some point. If not I will have to find some different speakers for my loud needs. They do sound good, don't get me wrong on that.

The performance of the speaker is quite good, in line with the advertising. However there was annoying start in the bass when at lower volume. I checked with tech support who were helpful. They agreed with me that the static is an issue. Tech support authorized an exchange. The 2nd speaker had similar static issues but occurred with less frequency than the original speaker. I like the overall performance of the product in spite of the static issue. I’m hopeful they can find a fix.

Got this for couple of days now. Tried connecting it via toslink with my samsung tv. Sounds will goes on and off in the middle of watching netflix. Another issue is it will always go offline after couple of hours of not using it. Despite restarting my modem and my echo it does the same thing. Tried to reset and install if many times. Called customer support did everything they told me but seems not to fix the issue.

Movie theater style sound. I believe it would really be nice with to working in tandem. For a small room its perfect. Nice bass and beautiful highs. Update bought another one. Works fine in the fire family but don't understand why the 2 speakers cant work in tandem with digital out to one. Thinking of returning the 2nd one since only 1 will play with my ps4 and cable.

Well when it actually works and stays connected it’s great but we can’t even get through one entire show before the speakers disconnect. It’s very difficult and frustrating that we are unable to get through a 30 minute show!

I dont care about alexa is vs siri etc etc...

This review is simply for the ones who care about it’s audio quality vs the homepod.
Homepod is by far superior with a deeper cleaner punchier bass, way better voice clarity, and just hits those instruments a whole lot better.

It does have a good sound, but I'm afraid I can't give it has high praise as others. I use to listen to music when it was analog and through JBL speakers. Nothing better (fidelity). Anyway, Alexa was not that smart. I keep having to have adjust volume between tracks. So I have to keep asking Alexa to either raise the volume or lower it. If anyone knows how to remedy this I will change my rating. Apart from the speaker, Alexa still needs a lot of work. I have her hooked up to my fire stick 4k and she still can't carry out some pretty basics commands on the apps I loaded, e.g. YouTube. I'm going to keep this only because I may have a party and it is loud. I may one day buy some JBL's again but for now I'll keep the studio.

Wow !! Amazing sound. I like that you can pair it with another set of speakers (echo only) but not that the two speakers need to be identical. I guess it makes sense. Without pairing to other speakers it sounds amazing. It can be added to a speaker group with dissimilar echo devices. Adds a tremendous deep rich sound with crisp base. Not muddy or over done on the lows. Very satisfying.

I ordered this as the main source of music for the whole family that would live in my kitchen. I ordered the Sonos one first in that speaker was all high range and middle. Then I ordered the speaker thinking it would have more bass which it did but I was still not happy as my echo show eight has better sound. I have Ordered the echo show 10.1 in hopes that it will be what I’m looking for

Sound is perfection. Vocals are pitch perfect and instruments are spot on. Crisp vocals and everything sounds as if you are there. Everyone hears differently, so unless you've had a hearing test recently confirming your "audiophile" ears are pitch perfect... do NOT listen to anyone! They sound great to me. Judge them yourself. I highly recommend the Echo Studio. Beautiful sounding music for your ears.

Got this as a gift from my best friends! It performs amazingly well in all environments around my house. I have large vaulted ceilings in the first-floor area, and it provides not just room-filling sound, but HOUSE filling sound. Took it to my finished basement where ceilings are lower and the design is like a speakeasy type bar/lounge. It sounds so good I am ditching my other audio options and relegating them to just the media room. The way it adjusts to the room is amazing and if I had known it was so good... I would have bought it for myself when it launched! Needless to say, I will be purchasing another to be permanently used on my first floor.

Sound is fine, not the depth I imagined but just fine. Problem is that it will arbitrarily shut off and discontinue playing. When we request to continue playing Alexa say ok, then doesn't play. Sometimes we have had a garbled song to which we have to shut it down. We called a help number that was very good in helping us reboot the system. But a day later it is doing the same thing. Not sure if it is not cooperating with our internet but we never had these problems with the Dot.

Sound quality is good. Stops playing music when phone call comes in and does not resume. My other Alexa devices also stop when phone call comes in, BUT they resume playing music when phone call ends. Also, this device mysteriously cuts out or stops playing once in awhile. These flaws are not substantial, but none of the other Alexa devices I have has these same flaws.

I’m an audio guy and I would recommend this to anyone I know and don’t know. I work in a warehouse and the sound carries about a good distance of the building. I’m very impressed. Not much impressed me, on a small scale, but this has a great sound. Might be a Christmas gift for my 3 sisters, aunt, 2 cousins and gf! The audio is awesome!

For me it's all about the bass! For it size the bass response of the Echo Studio is equivalent to the little echo dot - that is not acceptable! I was very disappointed when I activated my Echo Studio and did not get the sound I was looking for. hopefully Amazon can provide a subwoofer that is compatible with the Echo Studio.
Amazing sounds, designed and ease of use and set up. Wish it was a little smaller though... but I would definitely recommend this over the Apple rival!!!

Sound quality is fantastic but as far as listening.... I need to repeat numerous times my request before Alexa attempts to respond. Then all I get is a spinning blue light. Works great if you push the action button and make a request.I have had no issues like this on my other Alexa devices. Love the sound quality for my music . Do not like the issues with the Alexa response

Unfortunately, this unit was quite glitchy. The sound would randomly cut out. I gave it a good rating because when it worked, the sound was rich and beautiful. Also, it was easy to pair with the firestick/fire TV. I believe the unit I got must mave been defective. It took longer to arrive than anticipated. Perhaps something happened during transit. I am returning this speaker and I plan to replace it when I'm able to.

Really torn on this product. I'm an early echo adopter and have purchased 7-8 since they came out. This is by far the most expensive, and capable. But it just doesn't seem capable enough to justify it's $169 price tag. I enjoy listening to it, and I'm going to keep it, but I'd feel a lot better if it was priced $40-$50 less.

I have 4 and I set all in my living room. Set two groups on stereo and set a multi room.

I never listened nothing like. I’m honestly impressed in a positive way. Is like the sound come from inside. Each sound is like perfect. I can’t believe this. I be paying my credit card with pleasure. (Almost)

The sound from this Echo Studio is awesome. I have been using an Echo Dot (3rd generation) for music streaming — mostly Sirius XM stations. As good as the fidelity from the Echo Dot is, the Echo Studio blows the Dot away.

Through the Alexa app, it has a Stereo Spatial Enhancement that fills the room with sound like adding additional speakers.

Control (volume, station selection, pausing, etc.) is equally easy via either voice or through the app.
This speaker used to work but now it does not play. It recognizes the command, but no music is played. I tried rebooting it and reinstalling the app but it still does not work.
I was expecting this to have amazing sound based on all of the hype, when frankly it didn’t sound any better than the regular echo that I already own. Which is why I returned it

I bought it originally for the home theater feature with my fire cube. As a standalone echo device to listen to music, the sound is great, but im not sure you need that much response to play music in the living/family room, i think a regular echo would do as good as a job. My issue is the sync with the fire cube is not good. It is clunky to sync voices with tv providers or movies. The sound is not as good than sound bar and subwoofer through the fire cube. I even bought optical cables hoping that would be better.
Summary
As stand alone its good
For home theater needs a lot of work

I like this product very much, that said, the quality of sound is somewhat boomy, the bass is a bit muddy, the crispness, and brilliance are not there. As I said, though, I like the product, particularly at its price level.

the connection sound system option for home theater system only works with matching speackers. Like, I had to buy two studios and a studio bass amp to get the set. Was hoping that all of my alexa devices would connect for movie and tv play. Sadly not the case. they will all connect to play multi room music though. Hoping for an update!

Great sound quality when it works, but I’ve noticed a lot of cutting of the sound when used as an ATMOS streaming theater speaker with Fire Cube... it’s really distracting. I have a very fast (fiber optic) ISP. I feel like the problem isn’t and shouldn’t be my bandwidth.
I’ll update this post if the problem stops.

The first thing I noticed was that the voice pick up for commands was sharper than my old echo. The set up was almost totally intuitive and automated. I barely had to do anything to get the Studio up and running. The sound was so incredible that I had to get one for my girlfriend to put in her living room for entertaining company.

The optical auxiliary input can stop work anywhere from 1 day or a few days, and can only revive by unplugging the Echo Studio for a complete restart.
It caused a lot of misery for someone that simply wanting to use Echo Studio connecting to TV as a soundbar instead of having 2 different speakers in the same room.

I bought an Echo Studio a year ago and liked it. Much better sound than my Echo Plus and, of course, the Dots. Since then, I have been curious about how two of them would sound as a stereo pair. It took me a year, and a good sale, to finally pull the trigger on a second Studio. All I can say is, wow! The sound blooms across the room, with a huge soundstage and awesome imaging. Well worth it. If you’re considering buying a Studio, consider buying two. Your ears will thank you.

2 echo studios Along with a 4k firestick setup as home theater. Excellent for what it is but in no way a replacement for Even a mid rage home theater in a box. For a condo or an apartment this is enough as long as you are not expecting high fidelity sound. Don’t get me wrong it sounds pretty darn good for what it is and serves its purpose 100%.

Sounds great BUT: Voice recognition is maybe 20% of previous echo devices. Probably due to chubby body design that hides microphones. Also doesn’t hear very well at all. I’ll often speak to it and echo in bedroom will respond while echo in same room doesn’t. Very frustrating. I’d ask for a refund if possible.

Sounds great but if you want home theater and then you have to buy two. This does not hook up with two echo dots to create home theatre, disappointing since there is no echo sub anymore. Also you have to yell at Alexa to get a response, not what I want to do to listen to music. All around with echo I am dissatisfied. For the money invested its not worth it. The app is near pointless and very basic.

Fill a big area with rich sound. Deep base and great high end. Thinking of getting another for true stereo. Had a setup problem, tech support was great. They could not resolve, needed to research with a third party. Received return call exactly when promised. Problem was not with the Studio but my setup. Great product.

Was really looking forward to this! Unfortunately it can't be paired with echo dots, can only pair with either my soundbar IR my TV but not both, etc. I had the Sony 500 and returned because I thought I would be able to pair this with other Amazon products for better sound around my place but since I can't, I'd rather pay the extra $$ for much better sound quality from Sony. Disappointing.

The only downside is the woofer is so strong, it might shake or vibrate things on the same shelf, stand, etc. I had it on my large glass and metal 3-shelf TV stand. I had some pictures and some other knick-knacks on various shelves. Had to move a few because the base from the studio was rattling them.

I bought this to use in my office since I’m now working from home. I wanted better sound and the Echo Studio does not disappoint. The sound is clear and it’s range is far better than any other home assistant that I’ve heard yet. It does have occasional issues with voice recognition, but that’s in the Alexa software, not the device. I’m sure Amazon will continue to improve in that. Frankly, though, it may be overkill for my office and I may swap it with the first generation that I have in the family room.

There really aren't enough great things to say about the studio. The sound is pristine, and volume will light up a room (and your neighbor's too). Excellent speaker. I wanted to go back to my very much loved Marshall blue tooth speaker but I'm so happy I went with this! Highly recommend, worth every penny and then some.

The product itself is amazing! Amazing sound and deep bass. But... I ran into a problem where the damn thing is stuck with a SOLID green light (not flashing or spinning) I know what those are. I contacted support. And guess what? They have no idea how to fix it! Wonderful right? I wasted my time chatting with them. So now I’m stuck with a round brick until I can fix it myself.

We now have four echos. When listening to our echo dots, the sound was not quite what we were looking for. We already had a regular echo and were quite happy with it. I wondered how much better the sound would be for an echo studio. The sound is great. The bass is quite good and we can enjoy any kind of music without sacrificing any range. We are very happy with our Echo Studio.

The Echo Studio is a Great sounding speaker it has great mids and Highs the Lows are ok you would need a Sub woofer to get Better Low sound. The Mics for alexa are pretty good they can here me across the room. You would need two if you wanted stereo or Home Theater from the fire TV. Overall it's a Good speaker!

Good sound quality, but can’t compete with Apple’s HomePod. To get that sort of sound, you need to
subscribe to Amazon Music Unlimited to get the HD sound. That’s the only way it can compete
sound-wise tO the HomePod; but, a major sound advance over the Echo. Alexa integration is seamless, tho.

It’s a great speaker sound is awesome , but I brought it thinking I cane create home Theater by connecting the studio to my echo plus. YOU CANT DO THAT you need 2 of the same devices
So I am disappointed, and it doesn’t make sense that you can’t Create a home theater connecting the echo studio and echo plus together they just want you to spend extra money to have two of the same devices

I have linked it with the Amazon bass. Each room has echo units in them. If I use the Everywhere command the sound is OK. But alone the sound is so so. I was hoping for a wonderful, deep sound that would rock my world. It gets confused time to time. The other echos will continue to play but the studio drops out. After a few minutes it comes back on.

The Echo Subwoofer sounds better. The only reason I got the echo studio is beachside the subwoofer is no longer available and thought it would be comparable. There is too much treble even when treble and mods are turned all the way down and bass all the way up. I would rather have more subwoofers than the echo studio

echo sudio is not compatable with fire tv i bought 1 year ago. i feel amazon should have warned me of this before i purchased it since they have a record. i wanted to use as a supplemental speaker and this is not possible. i also feel the sound is not a major improvement over original so what is the point. disappointed
My Echo Studio is the best speaker in my home. For only 200 bucks you dominate your room by filling it with a deep bass roar along with the clearest mid ranges and highs!

I have 2 Echo Studio Speakers Hooked up thru my 4K Fire Stick. Its setup for my Home Theater, And since These speakers support the Dolby Atmos and 3D Sound. It is Awesome, The sound is Incredible the 3D music is also Awesome. I'm Super Happy. It was so easy to setup thru the 4K Fire Stick which you have to use with these Speakers, Well worth it. Movies sound just like it does in the theater. Every different sound coming from a different part of the room. Fire Sstivk works great and has very fast processing. The bass is Incredibly good Especially when the Dolby Atmos is being used in a Movie. For the size of these Studio Speakers they are a real bargain. You really need 2 of them to get the full sound Capabilities.

I had really high hopes for this speaker, I have had 9 different echo devices (multiples of first 2 generation dots, first two generation echo's, echo tap) and this is by far the worst with me having to repeat myself to ensure it has heard me. The sound is good, but not as rich as the sonos. I find myself wondering if I should return it because I'm just not feeling like I got $200 worth out of it every time I have to repeat "Alexa, what's the definition of insanity?"

Sound is great I have 2 units hooked to an echo sub and they sound great. I was going to use them for a sound system with my 4k stick but, I heard about to many problems one being sound syncing. That would annoy the heck out of me so I just use them with my Amazon HD music and they sound amazing.
You are enjoying the echo studio as an upgrade to our original Amazon echo. The sound is good but just not sensational expensive for what it is.

I read reviews here where people said that the Studio sounds like the regular Echo. Not a chance. This thing is way better than that. I tried it in the middle of my living room, and it sounded fantastic, but I had to move it out of the way and onto my desk. Still awesome. I think I'll get another.

I’m giving this three stars because mostly the aux audio is horrible! DO NOT USE THIS AS A SOUNDBAR! However, I would recommend use it as a Bluetooth connected device. It’s great to connect to phone, computer, but never to a TV. When connected via fiber optic the audio constantly drops. One second you hear sound next it drops. I even replaced the fiber optic connection - same thing! I was trying to avoid spending money on a sound bar because of the studio - but it worth having a reliable sound bar.

The sound quality in this apartment is AStronomical. I’ve used some quality speakers in the past and this is definitely in the top five speakers I’ve ever used. I was honestly pretty shocked. I have used the Apple home speaker in the past and assumed that it would be of lesser quality because this one is much cheaper and when I plugged it in and it analyzed the room for the best sound quality I was already more impressed. The voice recognition is also infinitely more sensitive than any of my other Alexa devices. If you’re having second thoughts...don’t. Grab this, you’ll love it.

Underwhelming. Had so much potential but speaker didn’t deliver the claimed Dolby Atmos sound quality. Tried it for a week and a half listening to Amazon Music 3D audio tracks and various HD songs. Used Spotify Premium on it too.
The VIZIO SmartCast Crave Pro SP70-D5 speaker sounds much, much better than this.

I will be waiting for the second iteration of the Echo Studio though.

Ah spent over ah weeks time of alexa telling me.. hmm ah don't know what went wrong...or hmm something went wrong. ..and im standing there like an idiot' thinking im somehow supposed to resolve this ?when ah don't know what the problem is...7 days it did this ...soo ah cant do that right now anymore... so packed it up went to the grocery store walked up to ah stranger handed it to him..and fiona appled and said "this is bulls***!@#$%" said thanks and walked away..in the mean time instead of being productive ah was talking 2 a speaker...

I had the original Alexa Gen 1, but it was stolen from me in a house clean-up by one of the crew members! This one has a better depth of sound and a larger footprint, which is with a Pro or Con. Still waiting on the Subwoofer to be back in stock as it's a little lean on the bass side, but not bad at all!
It sounds as good as my regular echo. I was not impressed

Really keen to love this product. Have it paired with a second studio and when they work with my 4K TV its an incredible experience. Dolby Atmos, really detailed, amazing, 3D sound. But product is still very glitchy and buggy. Often cuts out for no reason. Seems to get overloaded easily. I'm sure the bugs will be worked out. In the meantime we have a product that allows us to glimpse what could be...

What an improvement in sound quality! We listen to music a lot and now do so on the Studio because of its ease of use and size. The Dots are nice for the commands, info, etc, but the sound quality was just ok (what else could you expect from such a small speaker?). The Studio is a big improvement.

Sounds amazing in my living room, easy to set up. Only draw back is that it does not have AirPlay 2 compatibility so if you are using an iphone, you have to do everything by voice which is kind of a pain, but the sound quality rocks.

UPDATED: Phone can just Bluetooth and you can use it just like airplay 5 stars now!
Able to work better by itself and have not tried to match it with other devices yet or paid for 3D music, whatever that is

3D tracks from Amazon Music sound amazing. Probably too much speaker for the sized room (home office), but I am liking Amazon Music HD so much, that I haven't used my Spotify account for quite awhile. Sounds so much better than the plain old Echo 2nd Gen I had before (traded in for $30 credit).
Echo’s just keep getting better. The sound quality in this newest echo is amazing. We have it in our family room. It was also play HD music. Just love this new one

This is very impressive speaker. Sound quality is excellent. It produces plenty of volume and some impressive bass to go with it. So far only using amazon music standard. Should sound even more impressive on HD. The microphones work very well. Picks up my voice at high volume levels. Was very easy to set up. No need to input wifi password, as presumably it was shared from a prior echo setup. The built in hub works very well with the Philips hue light bulbs. Does everything well. Highly recommended

The Echo Studio works great as a better sounding Echo. The voice recognition is great as always and it sounds better than a standard Echo. The music integration works without a problem.

I was not impressed with the sound quality. When compared to an Apple HomePod, the sound is just mediocre. I felt that mids were muddy. The speaker lacks that pop you get from the home pod. The bass was much weaker in comparison.

I like the Echo Studio except the sound quality leaves something to be desired. As such, I don't feel it's worth quite what I paid for it. On the whole I am barely satisfied but I'll keep it just the same.

I really like the sound from this device. No, it doesn't compare to a quality home stereo but it does a great job of filling a room with music - and good sounding music. I have this playing tunes on average 6 or more hours a day, especially during our pandemic-filled, stay-at-home year of 2020.

I have issues the make it work and connect to a Samsung 8K TV via bluetooth.
Because I can not tell if it is going to sound good or not

I have 2 Echo plus and a sub and decided to test out the Echo Studio pair with the sub and wasn’t the biggest fan. I tried changing up the sound settings but the music consistently sounded flat regardless of what I did. The vocals of songs sound much clearer and punchier on the echo plus than they do on the studio. Honestly after testing them, I don’t think there’s enough change in sound quality to justify upgrading to them. Also, as a disclaimer, I live in a small studio apartment so perhaps putting the speakers in a larger more open room would allow you notice a bigger difference in quality.

Excellent product, excellent price at $200. From the perspective of an average Joe who is no audiophile but likes music (and is overall generally a snob), this is a great product. I put the Echo Studio in the living room and it is able to fill that part of the house with quality sound even at high volumes. Connect it to Spotify and off you go. Very impressed.

I have been connected to Alexa since she was first introduced. I have two early versions an Echo Spot and a couple Dots, and then recently purchased Echo Studio. They are all synced to play Prime music throughout the house. The sound improvement when I added the Studio is nothing short of remarkable! It has equalizing capabilities as well. Easy to setup and start using immediately.
We've had both Echo 1 and 2 - this is way better. We have an open kitchen / dining room and this is in the center. Covers both rooms great

Definitely worth the money. Prior to the studio. I owned a Bose speaker that I returned because the sound quality was not very good. The studio to my surprise blew the Bose away.. I paired this with a Echo sub and will purchase another studio from even better audio. This is a fantastic set up and would even make for a good home theater system.
Excellent choice to have good sound quality in a small, handle but, the best thing, intelligent device
Very happy with the studio. Gave three stars on integration because I assumed it would integrate with anything Alexa but I guess not. Sound is great and the extra bass is a Very welcomed.

Had to buy from target as no stock on amazon but would have if could have arrived on time.
Wow?, awesome sound, room filling sound that smoke checks all the other brands. If you are looking for bluetooth speaker this is the one. Also it is very good Alexa device but not why I got it.

This is the best Alexa speaker I've ever had! I wish I could buy four more and have them do dolby/dts surround but I think that's beyond its capabilities. Maybe in Echo Studio 2.0 we'll get surround sound! I am also using the Echo Studio as a speaker for my desktop pc and its way better than the last pair I had for the pc.

Did not sync with my LG OLED TV. Need to use my 4K fire stick I had for my older TV. That was a deal breaker for me. I wanted the Atmosphere sound but it is only possible when using a fire stick. Plus with the zombie apocalypse going on I couldn’t reach anyone to help make this worked. Packed it all back up and sent it back.

I bought one to test it out and was very impressed. I immediately bought a second one and we took them both with us to the AirBnB we rented for my daughter's wedding. She had several playlist saved in Spotify, and we synced her account, ran it from my phone, and Voila! No DJ required! They filled the great room with amazing sound.

Rich, full sound. Good bass. I had a first generation Echo before. This one blows it away. Microphone works really well. Can hear me even when playing music loudly. I learned when I got this one that the bass, treble and midrange can be adjusted too. Cool. Easy setup; no problems here.
The setup was easy and sound quality is fantastic. I have both this device and and the Sonus one and love the quality of sound across the entire range.

Does amazon make any money of this speaker! The speaker provides a 3D sound experience if placed at the right spot. The speaker is one of the best devices amazon has made in my opinion. It’s a steal!!!

Love the sound, the bass effect and it’s humble looks.

Your browser does not support HTML5 video.
 I didn’t accept this from Amazon echo studio.
And it scared the sit out of my little one when the sound starts to warble.till the time you don’t say Alexa stop.cannot connect iPhone with Bluetooth setting .
I put the video of the sound .
It was great until the bass and midrange completely disappeared. The equalizer doesn’t make any difference. Restarting and resetting to factory specs didn’t work.
Great sounding speaker, still fully functional as an Echo device. A bit bigger than what I thought so I had to place it in different spot than my previous Echo Device, but the sound is worth it.

Great sound and deep base, I moved my echo plus in the the master bathroom with dots in all of the other rooms inside my 1600sq home. With my open floor plan the studio encompasses the whole first floor in sound on about 70% volume. When I open a window to the rear of the house I can hear it clearly while out grilling.

DO NOT BUY!! Echo products do not last, they put in poor quality speakers! They have a max one year life span if you really actually use them! Please spend double the money for 5X the life span so you’re happy with your purchase! Sonos or home pod!

As long as you are ok with the confines of mainly working with Amazon music it's an excellent speaker. It works with other services but not as easy to use as with Amazon music. The HD and 3D audio songs sound really good, the speaker fills space nicely with balanced sound. I don't have any other $1,000 or $10,000 sound system to compare it to, but it certainly serves it's purpose for me.

I was a bit skeptical about buying a speaker that at first looked to good to be true.. yes i watched all the videos and reviews and fell in for it. Honestly greatest speaker available right now. 3-D Audio is still quite new and not much is out there for it but it definitely brings audio to a a complete different level. This speaker is mind blowing. The bass is ridiculous and keeps the music clean and crisp. I am in love with this speaker..

Finally! I have been looking for the right sound system. I wanted small but powerful with clear rich sound...and Echo Studio delivers it all. And when you move it from room to room it adjusts to the acoustics! No matter where I use it it sounds awesome!!! I wish I could give it more than five stars

I have 5 echo dot 3 and one echo dot four. Then I bought the studio....OMG.....wish I had just bought all studio alexia’s ! The sound is fantastic better than any of the others and well worth spending the extra bucks . Feel like ur at a concert! Guess I’m rather impressed.......

It’s a bit bigger than I expected but looks good and sounds very good.
My brother and I bought if for our Dad, who loves classical music.
The separation is incredible.
You hear each instrument so vividly.
When we pull into his driveway these days, he’s usually got the music booming and he’s loving life (at 80 years old) just that much more!!

I wasn't sure what to expect with Alexa Studio, but this handy Hi-Fi device is quite the awesome compact Studio speaker. The sound is incredible, with TONS of bass! Alexa can hear me just fine from across the room and even from another room if really required. Nice little unit, good value for the money I feel!

Over-all love this so much I bought 2 of them.
Sound is perfect for my apartment. Along with my fire cube it completely made My t.v. room.
Sound level can be low but you hear evey detail.
But, more about music with prime it rocks.
How ever I've ran into a glitch. On the cube to the studio's the sound will randomly drop the audio and then resumes. Only with the TV. Been to support but still not resolved. Other than that. There no other issues. (The dropping may be due to all the networks in my buildings.)
I've set up other for clients with no problem.
Doesnt respond well. Doesnt work well with firecube tv. Sound quality is not very good. idea is good but it's just not ready for prime time.

It covers more space in the house than the echo dot; so we hear it better in other rooms near by without it shouting at us at its own location. That is impressive. We still have more to learn about it, but its initial purpose works great

Little background..i have had an echo since 1st generation. Love it big fan.the only reason i dropoed to 4 stars is that i dont kniw that the size and quality of the studio echo warrants the design. For the larger foot print and price tag etc...i dont feel like its equally advanced in the delivery. With that being said its still amazing..i jyst comparing to my other echo.

Besides upgrading from my Echo Dot, I also eliminated my external computer speakers and now also utilize the Echo Studio as my primary speaker. Definitely impress with this speaker but disappointed that I have to pay additional $$ for Amazon HD Music streaming to take full advantage of the speaker's full capabilities.
The Echo Studio plays constantly. It has the best audio quality. We have a Tap, an Echo and a Riva. The Studio far exceeds our other devices. Looking forward to many years of great music.

After reading other reviews I didn’t know what to expect. When I opened the box I was amazed at the size. It was a very simple set up and after I turned it on I must say I’m very happy. Don’t get me wrong it’s no sound system it is a speaker but it’s works great even was able to group it with my others

Good sound and features. I just feel like for $200 the sound quality could be better at higher volumes. I've spent the same amount on other speakers that were much clearer at higher volumes. Don't get me wrong this is much better than an echo dot but might be better off going with something else and using bluetooth from alexa to stream.

This replaces a Sonos Move that we had on our deck. The Sonos would lose connectivity so often it became useless. It wouldn't hold the connection with the Sonos soundbar or subwoofer and it would interfere with other Alexa devices in the house. The Echo Studio solved our issues. I have never tried to connect it to the other Sonos equipment we have but I have never lost a connection, it doesn't interfere with my other devices and it sounds great. I'm sticking with Alexa. No muss, No fuss.

Wish it sounded better. I was a bit disappointed when playing it in a speaker group and it didn't sound as good as the other speaker in the group, 3rd generation Echo.
I tried the sample 3D sound clip and immediately killed it. The selection sounded like a bunch of screaming demons.

Useful for alarm, timer, radio, smartplug control That's it.
1. sound is not even as good as bose soundlink (5 times smaller)
2. bluetooth frequently breaks up, almost unusable.
3. you need your phone for all bluetooth connection, is this a joke?
4. the search is not "intelligent" at all. only 50% chance you get things you want
5. jokes are not funny at all
6. This big thing has to be plugged in and it's not even a subwoofer

They really are nice - we have 3 pairs in 3 rooms. They help my elderly mother hear her TV better than her doctor-ordered TV-Dex hearing aid sound streamer which sends the sound directly into her hearing aids. The sharp clarity filling the space is much easier for her to hear; the Dolby Atmos sound is really outstanding, especially in our large open area! You really don’t even need a subwoofer. Sounds very good for everything we play - TV news, Amazon Music HD, music videos, movies, etc.. I am impressed in part with the value for the cost, as I have a pair of high end speakers which cost many times as much, and don’t sound that much better than the Echo Studios.
I have an echo so took my echo studio out of the box plugged it in. Waited a few seconds for it to play it start up sound. And that was all it took for set up.

I love this. It adjusted itself as far as sound in 3D when setting up. Easy to set up other dots as left and right if needed. Sounds are awesome almost as good as the speaker I paid over 500 for from Bose. Will definitely consider replacing some of the dots I have if the price falls again I bought this during Prime Day.
Echo Studio surpassed my Lofty/Great Expectations. It has pristine,superb audio quality which pulsates/permeates my room. Do yourself a favor/kindness and buy one.
Had issues but the sound quality is really what made me give up. If they improve the sound I would put one in every room. Come on you guys "can do it"

My kids purchased this for my birthday and surprised me by giving it to me the day before. The sound quality is awesome! Due to the Pandemic I am working from home, so on the days when I am here alone, I turn it all the way up and have a party by myself!
I can also connect my fire TV and I have surround sound.

Home-run y'all. If you need an HD hands-free digital assistant that listens, does what she is told, and then some, this is the gadget. Get the Amazon music package and you will love the sound as well. For only $13.00 a month, it is not worth stealing MP3's off the internet.
I like the treble and midrange but was expecting more bass. Create software update to increase the bass.

I bought my first Echo in pre-sale. Since then I have this Echo Studio, an Echo, 3 Dots and a Tap.
Beside the wealth of information I get daily, I now get really good music quality as well.
I would recommend Echo especially the Studio version if you enjoy music.
