The sound quality Is great, if you’re planning to use it with Bluetooth or WIFI it is great!, But when using it in Aux in mode the sound complete cuts off mid movie and it is really annoying, I’ve noticed the issue happening a lot during quiet scenes or when the movie is paused for like 5 seconds, the echo just dies and won’t turn on unless you replug the optical cable, so if you are planing to use this as a Sound Bar please NO!, stay away! Unless the issue is fixed which it hasn’t and I’ve been using it since December of 2019.

This is exactly the speaker you would hope would flagship the Alexa speaker line. The base and volume missing from the other single speakers is front and center here. The microphones are also more sensitive, and of course it comes with a built in hub. Living single is not living alone with Alexa around so indulge and enjoy.

Doesn't respond well with other Amazon devices like the Echo Show. Dont know if Echo Show is the root of all problems, or if the Studio is. Either way the integration of the products across our smart home has become a source of frustration instead of making our lives easier.

Only brought for 3d music sound quality not so special and barely any rock and roll no Pink Floyd 3d songs to choose from. Only 1 3d rock playlists. I called to complain claimed Rock and roll 3d songs being added. FALSE! No Yes No Asia groups that are made for 3d. Do not buy if expecting a good selection of 3d music

Garbage!!!!!! Waste of money!!!! Such a racket!! I am a LONG TIME Amazon customer. I have an echo device in EVERY room and was super excited about this.

It does not work with my FireTV because my tv is considered too old!

I can connect it via Bluetooth but the sound quality is absolute garbage!!!!

Get a regular echo and you’re fine. This is a waste of money. I’m sending it back.

I am a believer. This speaker sounds fantastic, I have owned mostly Harman Kardon Onyx. This speaker does more than compete , even my significant other notices the sound quality and that’s a big plus. I did have some problems with my sync to Apple Music, and the tech department was less than helpful. I was able to figure it out although I almost returned it. All in all very happy with the sound.

Works better than expected, paired it with the sub woofer and do not regret doing so. Only thing I don't like is the sub only works when streaming through Amazon music, does not play sub when streaming from phone. Works very well with the 5 Ring cameras that I use.

Unreal bass sound! No woofer needed! I had to go into the Alexa app and turn the bass down. Unreal bass from this little thing. I set up two on each side of my LR and with the app I made them work in stereo with each other. Super, super happy. Be sure to go in to the app and set your preference for bass, mid, and treble. 🐸

I purchased two Echo Studio smart speakers right before Prime Day while they were marked down AND still available. After I set up the two speakers and stereo-paired them, I added my Echo Show (2nd Gen) to the group to create a whole new sound system for my living room. The sound quality is amazing, especially when I’m streaming 3D or Ultra HD music. Songs that I have been listening to for years now sound better than ever before! I also used a Toslink to Mini Toslink digital optical cable to connect one of the Echo Studio speakers to my LG smart TV, so now I have the equivalent of a TV sound bar along with great streaming audio from Amazon Music HD, etc. Christmas came early this year!

Well, my original Echo stopped functioning. So, after ordering and returning a Show, I purchased this. This sounds so good! I can see why some have purchased 2 plus the sub to make a stereo sound system. Easily handles loud volume and it has very nice bass for a small device. Small is relative here as I was surprised how large and how heavy it is compared to my original Echo. Incidentally, it does everything else an Echo device is supposed to do and does it very well. This one’s a keeper.

Your browser does not support HTML5 video.
 I love the sound quality of the Echo Studio. Paired with my Echo It produces fantastic sound in the room. With all the Amazon Echo features this is a great add on to the house. Set p is plug and play along with the Alexa App on your phone.

The sound quality is excellent. When the unit calibrates for the room acoustics, it plays a 3D sound file that sounds awesome. But playing back Pandora music stations, it doesn’t sound much better than the Echo Gen 3.
This device really needs the Amazon HD stream to make it shine.

Everything about this speaker is great, except one major issue. When paired with a 4k Firestick I continually have sync issues. It varies from app to app so you can't use the delay feature. Maybe with the next version the integration will be better, but for now I would suggest getting a separate soundbar.
Sounds great if you're jamming...however for normal everyday listening there isn't enough thump with that speaker alone. Sending it back...not enough low end range.

This unit is everything I was looking for and more. The sound quality is exactly what I thought it would be. I use it to connect my firestick 4K so I can get my TV through it. My movies sound great. This was definitely worth the purchase and I will be purchasing another one as well.

I use Echo Studio as a controller for smart home devices, a standalone Internet radio speaker, and a speaker to pair with my laptop for better sound quality. The sound quality is quite good - except for the lag-time with the laptop. A little research shows this problem to be fairly universal, and explained by Amazon as being a fact about Bluetooth, a "laggy protocol." In other words, Amazon chose a "laggy" protocol, and has no solution for it.

The closest thing I've found to a solution so far is to stop the video, unpair Echo from the laptop, pair up again, then re-start the video. Not great.

Warranty good for 12 months. Product stopped working after 13 months. Like it was programmed to last just long enough. We didn’t use it very frequently becuase the sub always needed to be reconnected in the app. It did sound decent when it worked. More trouble than it was worth half the time.

Could a s/w update make the Action button reconfigurable so instead of its current function (arming for voice input) it would Pause/Resume what it is streaming? Of course in Pause, it should stop consuming streaming data.

Otherwise great device, great sound.

The speaker have an average sound quality, voice recognition is below par compare to first gen Echo. There is an annoyed announcing message everytime bluetooth device connect to (can't be turn off). Bluetooth get disconnect intermittenly (not sure if the problem of just a deffective unit). I have to returned the unit because can't stand the annoyed message (now connecting your device xyz...such and such). This happend quite offent in the midle of the night all on it own.
The item sounds great and has a a lot of power. The audio features are great. I would like the cabinet to be twice it's size to be able to handle the subwoofer correctly.

I have two Echo Studios in a group and they fill the room with clear vocals (midrange) and just enough bass to sound great. Best bang for your buck without spending a small fortune. If you are an audiophile or require extreme bass you may need something different.
Good product and service we really recommend and will buy again

The fact that I can't create groupings of speakers the way I want - is ridiculous , That Alexa goes offline or sleep at random is unacceptable - Still learning how to get over some of these hurtles - but for the price - these issues should have been resolved prior to going to market. Over all - it is a a good starting point that with updates I hope will get much better

quality as it should be from a "better" one. Let me start by saying this is my 3rd Echo device. Actually, the smaller Amazon Echo I had in the past sounds better than this unit. If you really want an improved sound then I'd pair 2 Amazon Echo units with THIS subwoofer.

The sound is definitely way better than other Echo devices, and fills our kitchen with great sound. The voice recognition -seems- like it doesn’t always operate quite as well as the other echo devices but it very well could be just because I have the volume up a lot louder a lot and maybe base is interfering. Otherwise, it’s an Echo with a subwoofer and we like it a lot.

After a week of owning this Echo Studio, I am very pleased with its sound and performance. I purchased a optical cable to use with my Samsung television. Great bass and good treble performance too.I may purchase another one soon for stereo. I recommend this.A+ transaction.

This is a wonderful product, hard to find so I ended up buying it at an Amazon prime store… My only disappointment is a week after purchasing it it was on sale for $30 less on the website… Bummer!
I really did not know how to return it, and I did not want to drive through Atlanta traffic to return it to the prime store… I wish they would’ve told me it was going on sale sooner.
That being said I really enjoy the sound it really fills up the room!
The sound factor is truly great! It will adjust to the acoustics of the room! IT WILL SUPPORT YOUR APPLE MUSIC!

I love this speaker so much, I purchased another one and the sub woofer! It was an easy set up through WiFi and Bluetooth. It sound on my computer is awesome... I have an old Bose system on my TV set in my bedroom and I’m patiently waiting for it to die so I can do the same thing! Awesome!

This device is amazing and is a complete 180 turn from my bad experience with the new 4th gen small ball echo. The sound quality, voice recognition, and build of the Echo Studio is top notch. If I can find it on sale again for $150 I would gladly buy another one.

i spent more money for this model, but if i find that the sound quality is no different than a regular echo.

am i doing something wrong?

Integrated Alexa kept stopping music playback regardless of whether router was on 2.4 or 5.0 GHz band. Often did not respond to voice commands just gave a glowy circle. My echo dots perform without flaw so I'm a bit disappointed and will return it. Good sounding speaker tho.

Love the sound range on the studio and still learning how to get the best from it. It's at it's best when paired with the subwoofer, and configured in the everywhere group. However some other configurations don't work well yet. I think the app needs to be upgraded.

I spent 169.99 and bought 2 speakers they are very good speakers , however they are a bit bulky and for that reason I returned them i found a very good deal on the BOSE 500 but they are still 50 - 80 dollars more than the Echo Studio , if you have a larger area and size is not an issue , I would say buy the Echo Studio speakers tweak them with the Alexa app and you will really enjoy the outstanding sound from these speakers

They price on this is hefty for quality sound. The sound quality isn't significantly different from my previous echo from a few years ago, back when the only choices were "Echo" and "Echo Dot". If I could go back in time I could save about $90 by not going for this supposedly premium version.
Studio sounds every bit as good as any one of our Samsung Soundbars.

Was extremely shocked by the purity of the sound that came out of this item wish it was a little cheaper I would buy two but such as it is 200 bucks but it works great with my Smart plugs still having difficulty connecting with harmony but I think it’s my programming need some clarity was disappointed no owners manual think that should be included with the price you pay

Terrific sound - which was my main purpose for purchase. I wanted a "stereo" quality sound and was torn between this and a well-known much more pricey option. I am so glad I went with the Studio. Not to mention, it's just a fun item to have! We regularly use to play games, which there are many to choose from

So far I love the sound great with home theater. The biggest problem is the Alexa app .I was on the phone with Eddie from Amazon fire tv for over 6hrs to get fire stick 4k to hook up with studio ,we tried every thing . I used the Alexa app on my I phone could not get it to work. The next day Eddie called me back and I had a Samsung tablet which I. installed Alexa app on it and I connected the two the first time I tried. they need to fix this on the I phone Alexa app.I would like thank the fire tv assistant Eddie for his efforts to correct the problem . He was awesome .

It’s a good product. The integration with smart devices like Hue isn’t easy or perfect; getting it to understand scenes and settings from Hue is finicky. It tries to sell me things a bit too often. But being able to ask for music, make purchases, etc is a great convenience. Sound quality is good.
Nailed it. Use this as a home theater speaker for my FireTV. Can also be paired for voice control while acting as a speaker. Very good Atmos playback.

Superb sound quality. Better than two 3rd gen Echo Plus in stereo mode. Then only con, not available in sand stone. The setup is a breeze. I would recommend this speaker over the 3rd gen Echo Plus. I look forward on getting another to have them in stereo mode.

I have been a dedicated Echo purchaser (have bought 6 for my home and office and given them as gifts). When the studio came out I was among the first to own...but for whatever reason when you give a command echo studio repeats the command but nothing happens. It’s highly frustrating - especially at the price when compared to the other models that do work well. Maybe I got a Dud instead of an Alexa.

The sound is clear and well balance, is easy to set up, but is not as loud as I expected. I put it in my home office which is pretty small and even there the ECHO STUDIO doesn’t feel loud at all. If you like your music loud like me, then look for another speaker.

Only 4 stars because of BT interface would have been 5 otherwise. The only thing I don’t like is the Bluetooth interface. What ever you connect via BT I.e laptop or phone, you will have 2 separate volume controls that are independent of each other. One on your device and one on the echo. On my Bose and Harman/Kardon units once you pair a phone or laptop if you turn the volume up on the device it also turns the volume up on the Bose and vis versa.

I've been thinking of upgrading to this for some time. The music quality and the HD music really is worth it for me. Since purchasing I've had to unplug and plug back in for Alexa to respond a couple of times (something I've never had to do with any previous Echoes or dots), so that cost it a star. Still, it's a much better music experience than your ordinary Alexa provides.

I didn't expect such a huge unit, with such amazing sound. I purchased this for outside use. The sound is awesome being outside.

The only issue is, when you have the unit cranked up, good luck with Siri hearing your commands. Other than that, I love this.
When I read the description of this product I was very impressed, But although good it isn't much better than my original Alexa.

This speaker is amazing. Good bass plus clarity. Alexa is not that intelligent though. Pair it through your phones Bluetooth to play your already purchased music with having to pay for a subscription. Once paired via Bluetooth you can command Alexa to play your purchase Apple Music!

I felt this device (echo studio) was very limited and only gave rich sound through the amazon music app. I have a fire stick and a fire cube and four echo dots. For the price i paid i was expecting rich sound with using the fire cube which i felt was limited to adding additional speakers. Also the echo studio's maximum volume was not as loud as i expected! I am very happy with the four echo dots i purchased and they preform well for the price. Will be returning this item (echo studio) ! For 200 this speaker is useless!

We were amazed at the full quality of sound from our new Studio. The music library is fantastic. With the availability of SiriusXM, my we can now listen to sporting events not available on TV. Keep those innovations coming but it will be hard to improve Studio.

This unit has lousy sound. Very tinny sound with no base, The regular echos that I use have much better sound especially in the base area. This unit is suppose to high quality fidelity sound but fall way short. Sound like a cheap radio unit that yo pay nothing for. I would skip this unit altogether and stick witch the basic echos that are under $100.
Excellent upgrade from the standard Echo. Incredible crisp sound and it fills the room perfectly at any volume.

Great product, well engineered, great sound from small package. Outstanding performance with my amazon prime music account, and excellent price and delivery. Echo studio has so many features that I haven't explored.
I highly recommend buying this product.

For the size and weight of this device I had high expectations. When we started it up for the first time and we heard the little jingle, I was impressed but that's where it stopped. All other typical functions work as expected but listening to any music no matter the genre is disappointing. My echo plus sounded better. I thought maybe it had an equalizer but I couldn't find one. I'm gonna keep it a few more days and if I can't improve the quality of the sound, then the echo plus is a better option for me for the money.

Loyal Alexa customer I have all the device’s. This one however I sat next to my new 60 inch Samsung Tv within one week the tv went out. The tech who came out said it was the magnet in this that had blacked half my screen out. Maybe Amazon should post a warning ⚠️ about this!!!!!

I purchased the Echo Studio for some better sound/volume than the Echo Dot that I have. It does provide that for sure! The sound is much fuller than the Dot with way more bass, maybe even a bit too much as it seems bass heavy. The Alexa part works pretty well but it seems like Alexa has a harder time picking up my voice than with the Dot, but maybe because of the higher volumes? It also seems better able to connect and stay connected to my WIFI than the Dot, so that's a plus. Overall I'm satisfied with the speaker but there could be some improvements made, like being able to set-up the sound via an equalizer to customize it more to my liking.

After a few days, I returned this. I had no trouble pairing with my Fire Stick and the HD music sounded pretty good. However, it would take about 30 seconds for the Studio sound to come on when watching a show and sometimes it cut in and out. Sound wasn’t as dynamic as I had hoped.

So far so good. It’s a tad on the bulky side but the trade off in space for sound is worth it. It really does fill the room. It functions as it should as an Alexa product. It has all the features of an Echo plus which I already own. This is great addition to my Alexa family of products.

For a standalone with all over speaker integration, great sound!!! However I purchased mine under 150, now at about 200 bucks, sure does make a difference and keeps me from buying a second... otherwise the sound quality with out tweaks is superb! You decide.

Its great, awesome actually!
Although it was supposed to come with free Hue light bulbs, it didn't but thats on Amazon, never heard back about them. But the Echo Studio is incredible. Great Awsome sound, I've been using it alot more than my Denon X3500 lately. I Love my Denon, I'm just say I've been using the Echo because its a new toy, the sound of the Echo is incredible and I have running everything in my entertainment system. Get it, put on some Pink Floyd and let sounds fill your room!

The echo speaker is absolutely incredible. Sound quality fills the room and setup took seconds. Definitely recommend dropping the extra $100 into their top-of-line "studio" version.

I bought echo studio after flushing >$1000 into a Sonos sinkhole. A system so hard to set up and so unreliable with iPhone that I literally gave up trying and am trying to find a place to offload the system so I never have to see it again.
The sound quality is much better than the previous echo, but I still wish it was even better. Overall, I happy with the device, but the mics do not pickup voice commands as well as the previous echo.

The fact that you cannot change the volume with the Fire Tv remote is an unbelievable oversight. Had to get that confirmed by customer service...!
I returned the speaker, great sound, but not good enough to forget about the volume control. I bought an Apple HomePod instead.

The sound is great. I swapped my Echo Plus with the Studio in the kitchen and the difference is well, hearing is believing. The Studio handles the large room much better. The only reason I gave a 4 star for voice recognition is that sometimes Alexa doesn't respond and requests have to be repeated. Never happened with the Plus or the other Echos scattered throughout the house. It could be because I crank up the tunes when no one is around and Alexa wants to keep on rockin'. I want another one but don't have anymore rooms to put it in.

Synchronous paring between two Studios and a 4K TV Stick - can control each with the other. Imagine asking Alexa to play a song on the speaker and seeing the lyrics on the TV... and then hear exceptional Dolby Atmos level sound with what is playing on the television. Stereo sound is fantastic and Alexa is extremely responsive. Bravo.
Echo Studio sounds excellent, the speaker is easy to set up and Alexa can hear you from across a room.
I was very disappointed with the sound quality. I have 4 echo plus units and they sound almost as good as this one and take up less space.

I have 2 echo studios paired with an echo sub and positioned on opposite sides in the middle of the room. The directional speakers make this one of the best options for home theater system without the wiring. I have heard full Sonos systems and they are impressive but for the price I do not believe there is a better option than what the Echo Studio's offer. I have it all streamed from my Fire TV cube, which used to be hooked in to my soundbar via HDMI. The sound bar will not work with the home theater option enabled, I hope sometime in the near future this will be an option as it would allow a 5.2 system!

An excellent speaker. I can’t stress how amazing this echo studio is; I’ll keep it simple:
(1) beautiful crisp sound
(2) excellent subwoofer
(3) Beautiful crisp sound
If you love listening to music on a daily basis, stop thinking about it and get the echo studio. I highly recommend it.

Your browser does not support HTML5 video.
 I like this speaker and the sound quality is good , the voice recognition need some improvement . I have to repeat myself 2 to 3 times before Alexa hear my voice. I use this for music and others. So buy it
Me encanto para mi mejor inversión muy buena calidad de sonido me gustaría comprar otro debe ser espectacular 2 juntos lo recomiendo

great sound, outdoors on my patio. i like the Alexa integration & WiFi sound quality. also, can use Bluetooth for access by my Android phone & PC running Windows-10 Media Player. very happy with this. in considered comparable Bose & Sonos, glad i chose this one.

I love the studio the sound quality is good and Alexa understands as much to be expected. The only problem I have been running into is the paid for voice I.e. (Samuel L. Jackson) it barley recognizes the voice and responds after repeated attempts. I also use the studio as a sound bar and it does excellent!

Solid build provides a good sound at all levels. I was pleased with my 3 other Alexa/Echo devices. The Studio is worth the extra cost to increase the richness of the music. It is our primary source of music playback in our 1000 sq. ft. open floor plan LR/DR/Ki

Great speaker all around. The only issue I see is you can’t see the “thinking ring” on the top of the unit. If your eye level with the speaker you’ll have no idea that it is listening to you. Other then that it adds a good amount of sound to a room.

The Echo studio is an amazing device the sound quality and base that comes out of this thing has me shocked every single time I use it. Voice recognition works for me even when I’m rocking out. My only complaint is that when I open the Alexa app to adjust the speaker volume the music will skip for a split second not a huge deal and definitely not a reason to skip out on the studio
If you want to crank it loud it handles it well ! BUT if you want it for background low music Like I said sounds like a transistor am radio No bass ??

The sound is very good. But the Alexa portion leaves a lot to be desired. It consistently forgets how to do or how to connect to other devices, it doesn’t work nearly as good as the dots and plus’ that are spread through my home. I regret my purchase daily

The design is fairly bad. It’s very difficult to see the light on the unit to tell if it’s hearing your commands. We have the Studio in the same exact space as the old gen 1 Echo used to be and we almost have to shout sometimes for it to register.

This speaker is really excellent. It has nice bass sounds, adapts to the space it's in, and Amazon support is quick and good. Only thing I don't know is how giftable it is, really. That all depends really on what you want to spend for a gift.

Good quality sound, works well as a link to Alexa, but unusable as a Bluetooth speaker. Whenever the Bluetooth connection drops and reconnects automatically (which happens naturally every few hours), the Studio will yell out at top volume "NOW CONNECTED TO <computer name>". This cannot be disabled, cannot be turned down, and ignores 'do not disturb' mode. Users have been complaining to Amazon for a year now, but there has been no response from Support.

This is annoying enough during the day, but when it happens at 3am, loud enough to be heard from every room in the house, it makes this absolutely unusable.

Speaker is by far very good quality and sound. I have owned several harman kardon speakers and this one blows them all out of the water . Fidelity at its best in a reasonable size. I will be purchasing another one together with alexa sub to pair them up and use as home theater substitute. I own a denon 9.2 with klipsch speakers , this studio will not replace mybcurrent setup but when i cant blast music or movies studio will come into play and even use it for family gathering. Definitely way bettrr than a sound bar with sub

This sounds amazing especially with the echo sub. I’ve had some issues with my Fire Cube losing sound for a few minuets, or until I regroup it with the studio and sub. However that problem seems to have largely gone away, so I’m guessing a firmware update has addressed it. I am planning to purchase more of these for my home.
Worth the money! Great sound. Alexa works even when the volume is all the way up.

The studio, in the den, does not pick up commands as well as the Show 8 does in the open kitchen so the kitchen tends to answer and provide music playback although I’d prefer that would not happen. Also the sound quality is not on par with, say, Sonos UNLESS you pay the premium Amazon 3D music and I prefer not to fall into that trap. Would I buy it again? Probably not
This thing is badass. Great sound and control of other devices. I’ll be adding another to my home as well.

I wanted a device to listen to music when I‘m in the pool, BBQ, etc. I was considering a BOSE wireless speaker but I decided to go with the Echo Studio since I have other alexa devices and I love the fact that I can ask alexa to play songs/playlists etc. ( I do have a covered patio so the it does not get the sunlight directly, plus I bought the warranty just in case). The Echo Studio is amazing, quality sound even when blasting. I love it, I’m glad I bought it.

I am using this as a soundbar for an Insignia Fire TV via Bluetooth and I could not be happier. I live in a small-ish space and wanted some deeper sounds than my other Alexa devices. I have one in every room and this is by far the best sound for the price I have found. Very happy with this purchase.

I also own a 50" Toshiba Fire TV 4K and was hoping to link the new echo studio to that TV. I was disappointed to find that the Toshiba Fire TV 4K is not compatible to use echo devices in home theater mode. I do have other TV's for which I use Firestick 4K and this works great on those. The sound is very clear and compared to my gen 2 echo, the studio is in another league for richness and clarity. Would definitely purchase more echo studios if they only worked in home theater mode for the Toshiba FireTV's. Amazon please upgrade the OS on the Fire TV's to include pairing echo's in home theater mode.

Overall sound not bad for the money. Worked fine while it worked. Then it stopped pairing with internet. I reset to factory settings - didn’t help. I have two echo dots that work fine. Had to send it back. Amazon required I go to an Amazon drop off center to return and issued a gift card instead of crediting my card as requested. I’ve been a Prime customer for years - returns usually not a problem. They are now. Disappointing. Next electronic gear I buy will be direct from manufacturer or Best Buy.

The sound on this is amazing! My son in law purchased this I was so impressed I bought one for myself it just fills my home with beautiful sound. I don’t see how anyone could give this a bad report unless somehow they received a faulty product.

The studio performed beautifully! As far as sound quality it is above what was expected.
Just out of curiosity I linked it to my tv via Bluetooth, it had issues lining up the audio and video as expected. I recommend using the optical input.
This product has connectivity issues. My WiFi works great but every time I come home the studio doesn’t work and I have to always reconnect it.

The Echo Studio is a great upgrade from what we had. The sound is wonderful, you would think you have a $5000.00 stereo system. When you set up the ES it will figure out the size of your room and make sure you get optimun sound. Our kitchen, living room, and dining room are open and the sound is still great. The bass that comes out of that speaker is GREAT!!!! If you are upgrading or this is your first time buying an Echo, the Echo Studio is well worth it. Oh by the way, it's MUCH bigger (wider) than what is looks like the photo on Amazon!

We first had a Google home, and decided to switch to the Alexa universe. She is half as smart as Google. They have some serious bugs to work out with Alex! One of our most frustrating problems is connectivity with Spotify. Extremely buggy.

The echo studio as a speaker is a 5/5!! But Alexa is a big part of any echo speaker and has to be rated as such.

I purchased two and once they were set up and balanced in the room, music is everywhere. Great range from highs to bass. Have Bose surround system and these have have all that plus easy access to lots of music via amazon music. The HD and Atmos on firestick is a real kicker. Just a great set of speakers!

This little powerful speaker really fills the room up with clean ,very clean music. Really can not ask for more under $200, worth every penny and more . My Klipsch speakers (which are valued higher each) gets less use these days. Also the Alexa app for this device controls multiple other speakers. Including my Bose which in my humble opinion has a clean sound as well but not like the Studio.

The 3D sound is truly amazing, but there is very little music in the library that can use it. So that was a complete bust for me. But even without that the sound is better than any other amazon echo I've tried and I am very happy with it.

When my mom brought her first home she was gifted 3 echo dots and she loves them but one of them lost its bass so the sound was distorted. I purchased her the echo studio for Christmas and shoot I love this speaker. It has a lot of bass and for a device that only goes up to 10 this speaker is loud. I have a Harman Kardon speaker and this one is right on point with mines.

This speaker is built high quality, it's heavy, it's beefy, it sounds like butter, beats like honey, total bang for the buck, best deal in town, homerun, no brainer. You won't regret it 👍

Plus, the Alexa thing is pretty fin cool. She sounds hot, lol.
The sound quality is excellent. I am extremely happy with my purchase.

The sound quality was quite disappointing. After all the reviews, I was expecting a step up from my Echo+, it wasn't. My Echo+ has better bass. I really thought about returning the Echo Studio but decided to keep it. The hype isn't reality, this thing is average.

It took a couple of days for the Echo to settle in -- we needed to find a good place for it. Once we did it sounds great and Alexa finds most music we ask for -- using apps I forgot I had in some cases. All in all an excellent experience (after a couple of weeks) and the price is super.
This speaker is the Bomb! Excellent sound, easy set up! No issues whatsoever! Love it! Another great Echo device!

My son tested it head to head against his Apple Home Pod (the one that's about the same size) and they came up on par with each other. Minor differences here and there, but in the end it's really about which eco-system you want to be in.

My only problem is I love bass maybe more then the rest. Bose speakers do that the best for me. So after reading a out the studio that's want I was expecting but it's not on the same bass level. With that said it's really a good buy it has bass just not enough for me. It sounds really good I would buy another one if something happens to the one I have.

What a sound this has!! When you put the Echo Studio in any place in your home it will adapt the sound to where it is in your home, so if it is in a small area, it will adapt, in a bigger area it will adapt, we have used this to play hard rock, country, slow any type of music it sounds great, the bass is awesome as well.

I am a huge Alexa Echo fan, period. And I really enjoy the Echo Studio's sound quality. That said, I was hoping for a more powerful sound. In fact, I've been on a quest to upgrade the sound - I do like my music to be loud and clear in the house - and was certain that this going to do the trick. It's gotten me closer, but, still not there . . . . .

I am replacing my entire stereo system with Echo speakers and this provides a good base to start with. I don't even miss the 5 channels of my former system as the studio has great presence and some music has the 3d effect also. I love being able to listen to the same music as I go from room to room. Ordered an Echo sub today also to pair with it.

I have come to rely on this for my lighting. Between my Echo and my Kindle, I control most of the lights in the house. The sound is quite good. I enjoy the Serius app on this machine. If you have some discretionary money, spend it here.

A GREAT disappointment. Truly one of the WORST purchases in my life. Within 6 months the Bluetooth & WiFi connectivity stopped working. Can’t even use the speaker wired with an audio cable. The app is STUPID and useless.

Complete waste of money. Can’t wait until Apple comes out with a similar product because EVERYTHING Apple just works flawlessly.

When I received this unit I was surprised by its weight. It is definitely solid, which is one reason the audio sounds quite good, with a lot of depth as well as clear upper tones. No, it may not have the range and register of a high-end system, but it plays very well within the Echo family. Installing and adding to my Alexa app was also very easy ... easier, in fact, than setting my my Echo Dots. I set it in a corner of my living room so it is out of sight, but it still fills the entire room with a rich and balanced sound.

The speaker sounds good, but it will only connect to one Amazon Music account, so only the person who purchased the speaker can stream high-quality audio. Anyone else who wants to use the speaker can either ask Alexa to play something or use a different streaming service. Spotify was the only other service I found that would cast music to the Echo Studio, all others had to go through Alexa.

If you like shouting orders at Alexa and hoping she finds the right music, this speaker is fine. Otherwise, I wouldn't recommend it.

Got this while it was on sale and I’m going to grab another one the next time it’s on sale. I’m a Apple addict but I can’t spend $350 on a speaker especially when this is as good if not better. I’m still trying to figure out how to connect the speaker to a smaller echo for the home theater but other than that this speaker has been great!
The only complaint I have is it could be a little louder. I use it in a workshop and would like it to be a little louder.

As an owner of the original Echo, I’ve added multiple iterations including the Tap. I bought this for the room where I primarily listen to music with high expectations. Those expectations were exceeded! It sounds great with all types of music. Thankfully, I have not experienced the voice recognition issues that others have mentioned. So far, it’s been awesome!

This things sounds amazing! Blew my mind.. I read and heard all the reviews and once I heard it in person , I was blown away... had to order a second one so I can have the whole Atmos effect! Couldn’t be happier! Adding the subwoofer next

Sound is great! Could use a bit more bass, but otherwise sounds good. The only issue I have, which is likely an app issue is playing music in a group. For some reason the studio will disconnect mid song. No issues if its the only device playing tho.

Amazed at how good this speaker sounds! Paired it with an amazon remote so now I can control it from anywhere in the house, the sound really does fill the room! It’s easy to move, I find myself taking it from room to room because I love how it sounds! Alexa can understand me better than other echoes.

Set up in under 5 minutes. At first the sound was odd and flat. After playing different types of music it adjusted itself to my room, and blew us all away. I would give it six stars if someone came out with an equalizer app and the ability to direct the spatial stereo per the music manually.

I really didn't understand what the appeal of Alexa was until I bought this for upstairs music. Paired with Amazon Music this is just remarkable. In addition to music, I now have three devices tied to it and I love the convenience.

I've been using the Echo devices for years; always looking to upgrade. So when the Echo Studio went on sale, I purchased it quickly. The sound quality is very good and I like that it self-calibrates. Is it an improvement over the Echo Plus? Yes. But I wouldn't say it's night and day. The bass could be more pronounced which is what I was expecting. Perhaps that will be addressed in the next generation.

Beautiful rich sound and setup completely automated with Alexa app. We knew when we turned it on and it tested the room acoustics (which sounded like the Dolby Sound promo in movie theaters) that we were in for a treat. Absolutely incredible!

Love the sound. In addition to listening to music (streamed or bluetoothed), I also use it as a "soundbar" for my TV. There are two issues though... the first is that the Echo Studio can not hear you when the volume is turned way up (understandable, but it should have come with at least a simple dedicated remote), the second is that several times per week it stops working altogether and has to be unplugged to be restarted... not real good for a device that is intended to be on 24/7.

It works well and this unit certainly has more bass but they have no business using the word "studio" in it's name. The mid range is just eh and the high range is almost nonexistent. (yes I used the app to makes changes, didn't help)

Great sounding echo, the best by far. It sounds good with standard Amazon Music but comes to life with Amazon Music HD. The only thing so far is that I wish there were more options / adjustments on the equalizer than just three channels. (Bass, Middle, Treble)

There are so many things that become available but perhaps the best has been the ability to just ask for the music and whatever I ask for comes with just my suggestion. Makes that completely easy to constantly have the music at the volume I enjoy.

Everything else like turning on and off lights, changing the temperature and listening for the doorbell are a great help as well. Getting the weather, news and virtually all information I ask for is wonderful

Living with the Echo Studio in my home office the past couple of months has been a great pleasure. Between the ability to stream radio and Amazon HD Music it's a perfect background companion. (Does not have to be played loud to sound good.)

This studio sounds amazing. I have 2 studios paired with the echo sub and it rocks. The voice recognition works very good even when the volume is turned up loud. Would definitely recommend getting it if your on the fence. Won't be disappointed.

It's an Amazon product so of course it integrates well - occasionally after power outage has an issue reconnecting to the wifi - sound is by far the best offered in any in the echo line - not quite as good as my amp driven infinity speakers

I’m not using this as much as I thought I would. It was easy to set up mostly but I’m still having trouble with linking m certain lightbulbs. Sound quality is pretty good but I’d like a little bit more bass. I’m sure when I do more integration and I get used to using it it’ll be fine.

Bought two Echo Studios and they sound great paired together and in our everywhere group. Also paired with Fire TV as home theater but when paired with TV it disconnects the internal TV volume.
Waiting for next gen Echo Sub to add to the pair of Echo Studios!

This is probably one of my all time favorite things I have purchased for myself. It sounds superb. For the price, I don't know how I could have done any better.
Listening to my all time favorite singer, Gregory Alan Isakov, is a pure joy with the Echo Studio!

This was my first Echo product. I say “Echo” because when I would call her Alexa my spouse looks at me like I moved an ex girlfriend back to our home. Calling her Echo works ok except when certain Geico commercials come on the TV. The Echo 3D Studio will not replace your nice surround sound system BUT the sound is plenty sufficient for most entertaining scenarios. Sounds as good as any speaker, that size, you could pair with your phone. Alexa (uh.... Echo) seems to respond quicker with this unit. My Echo Dot is a tad slower. Easy to set up. Highly recommend.

For over $200 it was what I mostly expected. There is room for improvement. Also if your home theater receiver has Bluetooth it gives this product more versatility and improvement in sound quality (depending on your sound system).
It’s like hearing your favorite music for the first time. I was hesitant because of the price, but it’s worth it.

First off it works great set up took like 6 mins.
Sound quality is fantastic. I would definitely recommend if your looking for alexa capability with good sound. As a added bonus it controls Phillips hue bulbs no need for the hue hub.

The sound is very good. Pretty good base with addition of Echo Sub - but only after a period of self-adjustment. I got better base a day after pairing with two Echo Studios for stereo sound. Alexa has some difficulty understanding song/artist requests. She often responds to my request by playing something else. I have Amazon Music Ultra and created my own playlists - “My Music” within the Amazon Music account - and Alexa will too often respond to my request to play a playlist of my own creation in “My Music” by playing instead an Amazon Music curated playlist. All in all, though, I am enjoying.

Great audio and easy setup. The only gripe is trying to locate which songs in the Amazon music library are recorded in Ultra HD. Haven’t used the smart home hub functionality yet but I’ll update this review once completed.

After a Echo Dot speaker blew out, I decided to try the Echo Studio. I was NOT disappointed. This small device packs a powerful room filling sound for our favorite music. Thank you Amazon for continually improving your offerings. This ne is a keeper!

This was a nice addition to my echo collection. It is a great speaker, and a fully functioning echo. I use it for listening to music plus I have it connected to my fire tv via bluetooth and to regular tv via an optical toslink.

I'm primarily listening to music or streaming radio on this device during the day and it is an endless source of frustration. The sound is perfectly fine, even great for my purposes. No complaints there. The connectivity, on the other hand, is terrible. Bluetooth is so inconsistent that it's unusable. Playing Spotify through this speaker is only slightly more consistent, but if you want to switch to the next song, that can be waaay to much to ask of this device. My little old first gen Echo Dot was a champ at this in comparison. Why is this technology getting worse?
Good quality sound at high levels. Equilizer on phone for Echo doesn't work. Electrical interruptions short out the Studio. Hard to get back on

Greatest speaker for its price point and it’s abilities. My one year old loves sitting in front of it and letting the sound of the music just get wrapped around her, which is the best way I can describe the sound and experience of the speaker. I listen to a mix of things as well and have not had a terrible experience with any. Even familiar songs so much better on here. Also, for those of you that have it, definitely play the 3D songs on Amazon Music on the Echo Studio!

Picked mine up on Prime day. Looks good and has sounded great everywhere I have placed it. It won't be the loudest speaker out there, but excellent value at this price point. I put it in my living room and have had it up to 65% and was loud without being too loud. We could still converse and enjoy the music.

Wow sounds great
Love it
Fills the room
Ultimate

The sound from one Studio is good but put two together and wow outstanding. I had to call support to pair my set and they were very helpful and easy to work with. Over all this has been and continues to be a 5 star experience.

Not a single complaint, well from me at least, my neighbors downstairs say otherwise haha.

The sound quality is amazing (after the update) with spacial enhancement. The bass is great, I use it as a home theater for my Samsung TV, and honestly if I had a house, I would buy 3 more. Don't let the negative reviews fool you this is a great buy, best speaker I have ever owned, especially for the price.

This is not a HIFI stereo but it sound pretty darn good ..perhaps even better if you had two of them but I am pretty happy with this one, and it is in my honest opinion way better than my regular Echo (1st gen).
I will add the subwoofer for a deeper bass and will update then.

Great sound for the money. The size is ok but it is a tad heavy. Not a bookshelf speaker. I was in the market for a speaker and thinking of getting a Apple HomePod. It’s a bit pricey and only plays Apple Music. The echo studio plays it all and was $100 less. Great buy. I’m very satisfied.

It's a Godsend for music lovers. great bass. turns on my tv, my lamp(I'm short and if I'm comfortable in my spot under covers I don't have to reach over and out to turn it on/off) or get out of covers all snug and warm. ;-)

Kept disconnecting from WiFi. Didn’t recognize a network with 100+ meg download. Finally called the techs, halfway through they disconnected me, never called back.

Would most assuredly never buy again or recommend.

I’m not a speaker aficionado but what I hear sounds great to me. (Sometimes I wonder what people are expecting - something recording studio level?) Deep bass. Vocals are clear. Background tones are bright. I recommend it especially for the price.

This echo studio sounds great. I stream music from several sources. I have mine connected to an echo sub. I am not a sound snub. This speaker is not perfect but if you want something that sounds great at a good price buy this

I am super happy with my Echo Studio. It sound looks and performs amazing. Music comes alive, Movies are better and awesome. Works perfect with my fire tv cube 4k and paired with a Echo Sub brings thunder to my room. Worth every penny.

Very good sound quality for such a small unit. Cannot compete against audiophile systems, but let’s be realistic, it’s not meant to. Much better than the standard echo / echo plus by a long shot and can easily fill a large area with sound crisp and clear. Well worth the price and I contemplate buying additional to replace normal echo units for other areas where I like to listen to music.

- Like the more base tone in this unit
- Size is good for putting in most places in the home or patio
- Easy for my spouse to set up and configure
- Liked so well purchased another unit, so have the great sound quality in two rooms

I am impressed with it ,but it is difficult to pair. Kind of upst that the price went down very shortly after purchasing. It would have been nice if they would have offered that price to me, since the timing of sale was so close to my purchase.

Using this speaker in my Master bedroom with a square footage of 800 square feet. The quality of sound that fills the room is very impressive. From Sinatra to Nora Jones to Celtic Woman and Mozart, all sound incredible. I'd like to see them come out with outdoor waterproof versions of these to be pair for my courtyard.

I loved my version one Echo but decided to expand and upgrade. The sound from this blows me away. It’s clear and has great bass. I was considering the subwoofer but it’s not needed.
Amazon hit it out of the park with this one.

Hi fidelity? Not really. Somewhat better sound than a standard echo, but to claim it is "hi-fidelity" in my opinion is stretching the truth quite a bit. If I had heard it before I bought it, I wouldn't have spent the money.

The speaker sounds great, and when connecting it to the fire tv stick, it added the surround affect like larger systems. Another good thing is that its able to hear you pretty well at higher volumes. The build quality seems great so far, but time will tell.... in the meantime, i love it!

Sound is better than a traditional Echo, but still not great. I am disappointed in the sound quality. I've realized that spending the same amount of money on some dedicated speakers that you can plug into a standard Echo produces much better sound.

I love it! I really don't know why I waited so long to get one, but I finally did and I'm totally in love with it. I'm still in the process of figuring out just what Alexa can help me with so it will keep me entertained for a long time.

This speaker is even better than I hoped it would be. There is no other single speaker that produces the stereo separation that this speaker does...and it's down-firing woofer gives it a meaty sound that so many of these speakers lack. Spacious, accurate, airy, and deep...all at the time. Best wireless speaker I have ever owned. Buy it.

I loved my early echo-where I pushed a button to communicate. I was hoping to upgrade my whole house to this-but the new speakers turn red if you don’t want them listening. I returned them all. So sad!

Tons of great reviews on here so I bought two...needless to say they are very underwhelming. Not that loud. Not much punch to them. Cuts out sometimes. Volume drops sometimes. They interrupt each other when speaking to them. Equalizer isn’t great and impossible to tell if the setting “stick” since in the app they always look reset. They are pretty much just blah. Not sure what is better at this price point though...so I will probably keep them. Added the echo sub too....that little thing is wayyyyy too loud for their speakers. Even with bass set to minimum.

After listening to this, everything else sounds muted. The clarity is just amazing! My ears cannot distinguish between the 3D sample vs normal music. Solid build, crystal clear sound and voice recognition is amazing! Love it.

I really enjoy this speaker. The way it fills the room is very surprising. It analyzes the acoustics when you first set it up and then it fills the room and sounds like way more than it's actual size. Very glad I purchased this.

I have to hear it by myself... stunning crystal clear sound. If you read this, stop reading reviews and try it. Ah, if you want to pair it with another speaker for HOME TEATHER only with another (2x) Echo Studio is your solution. If you paired Echo Studio with Echo dots, it works only for music or multi-room music and it sounds awesome.
Can't see the indicator light from below a straight line of sight - which is actually an issue. Can believe they didn't think of this!

I like this speaker a lot, but do notice limitations. I appreciate the tight bass and clear sound. I do not hear any difference in the 3D music nor do I get a tremendous sense of separation between the two channels supposedly bouncing off the walls.

I'm glad I bought the speaker and am enjoying my first Alexa experience. The real win in this purchase was the three month free trial of Amazon Music HD. This is my first experience with a music service. It is a wonder to be able to listen to virtually anything I can think of.

It’s now my primary sound system. My Bose 901s are on the basement as they take up a lot of room.
Alexa is great and getting greater.
I’m adding a sub to really push the bass. It doesn’t need it but I’m patriotically recycling my tax refund (although it’s getting smaller and smaller-(same pay, more taxes, less disposable income, but WTF?).

The sound quality is really good and it outperforms any other speaker system I have used. It has pretty seamless integration with the my Fire TV and pairs well with other Echoes. I especially like the way it balances sound

If you use the firetv then definitely buy this, or you listen to a lot of prime music. Sound is good... basically just what you expect; sort of tubby sound, fills room. Its good for the price. BUT if you want to use this connected to any other device def do not buy. For instance bluetooth, or by cable... dont bother... total garbage. Whoever at amazon made this should most def be fired.

Sound is amazing (this replaces a Google home mini). The only thing I don't like is that it keeps kicking me off SiriusXm, saying I'm streaming elsewhere, which I'm not. I reached out to customer support, and they made me go through various steps, and promised that the issue would not repeat, but I keep getting kicked off. I'm glad I have other ways to listen to Siriusxm.

My wife and I decided to replace an older clock radio in my bedroom and was headed down the Bose path but went with the Studio instead. We are happy with the decision. The sound is very good. It suits our needs well.

Wonder sound quality - great bass, great midrange. But, wow, it's so much bigger than my other Echo devices, but that's OK with me. Sounds better than a Bose (I know, Bose kind of stinks, but some folks love the brand)
This unit appears to be defective and the attempt to get a replacement is VERY cumbersome. After a lot of time on chat, no option but other than to return.

In my first review, I was very disappointed with the sound quality and mics, not some much better than my Echo Plus. I decided to try it in stereo, and now we are talking (or listening?). I even ended up buying the Echo sub, and now the sound is beautiful.

Great speaker for its price point. I bought it during prime day and for what I paid it is def worth it. I was expecting it to be a bit more louder but for small room or living room it will fill up the space. I didn’t quite notice the 360 degree sound but overall I was satisfied for what I paid.

Found it very difficult to work and set up with our FireCube. Its so big that it looked terrible setting in our family room. Doesn't blend in and hide. Just too big for that. The sound quality was not as good as Bose Solo 5. We returned after one week trying it.

The speaker is great a bit to “deep” for my taste but it can’t be adjusted. To create any sound effects such as stereo definitely 2 would be best but it’s price is steep. Overall it is powerful and does the job well.

I love it. I have had And Alexa since the prototype. I have the first generation or the original that was only given to limited people. I loved her then and she’s only improving. I am so happy with this new generation. She has a nice sound quality that adheres to whatever room or space you are in. And the thing I like about this new model is that when I say Alexa even if the volume is superhigh she’s always listening so that she can stop and listen to what I have to say. Well done Amazon.
Really like the sound. Better than I imagined. Really powerful speaker.

It’s pretty good. But not a great audio device. It’s my first Alexa product and it’s pretty neat and all that. So the Alexa features are cool. There is some lag time between my phone and the device as far as turning volume up and down which bothers me because often when you want to turn down the music there is a reason for it. Maybe it’s just me. I absolutely love Bose products - and know that Not everyone agrees with me on that. But I can’t imagine anyone fighting with me that the echo studio stands up against likely any quality audio device.

Alexa Studio is about the size of a one pound Foldgers coffee can. It recognizes voice commands great. The surround speaker is really nice. I love that I can just Say, Alexa, turn on country music. Alexa, set sound to level 3. And, whalaa, she does it. Will buy again if this one should stop working.

I received this item October 2019, it’s stopped working today! I had really no problems up until it stopped this point, it sounded great! I tried to return it and the window for return had closed! I’m will call customer service tomorrow and see what they’ll do, if anything!
This thing sounds amazing and I think much better after the last update I would definitely buy another one hands down

I was very looking forward to having this speaker. At first, the sound was very good. But, when I watched some Amazon Prime shows with the speaker, unfortunately, sometimes, sound cracks. I turned on/off several times, but the problem persists. I guess it is a great speaker for the price, but I am disappointed. :-(
Sound overall is very good, but bass is a bit flat when compared to my 5.1 soundbar system.

This is going to be simple. I love this speaker. Sounds quality is awesome. The way it bounces sound off the ceiling and walls truly is incredible. This really fills my office with music. Love it. Well worth the $200 for someone who loves music and having Alexa right there.

Music is crystal clear and sounds great.

Pairing with a firecube is mixed. The sound is great, but it's impossible to set at a level where you can hear dialog and the movies sound doesn't blow you out if the room.

There is a vast sound difference between dialog and music or effects in the same movie.

I originally wrote a favorable review of these, but it's hard to like them when any music you play on them eventually stops even when I didn't tell it to, or even when music is set to repeat. A regular old stereo can do that, but Amazon has a big problem if they can't make their devices at least stay connected.

This is loud! I upgraded from an echo dot. There is a night and day comparison between them. I can listen to full music with zero speaker crack. Very easy to set up. I migrated the dot to a bedroom. Very happy with this speaker edition.
I love it the music that comes out of there is amazing and atmos sound wow

Way bigger, crisper sound than standard model Alexa especially the bass. Not any artists or genres I enjoy to listen to get excited about the 3D feature yet but hopefully more songs will be added to the catalog soon.
Too expensive for something that never gets simple commands. The sound is great but not worth the poor performance.
Not nearly as good as I thought it would sound from all the positive reviews.

Great speaker. I too was skeptical about this "3D Audio" but it does work. Really start to hear music notes and instruments not previously heard on music I listen to regularly. Definitely needs to be placed with space, meaning nothing in front, behind, on top, or on the sides of the speaker. This way you get all the sounds. Highly recommend!!

A great replacement for our echo dot.
Sounds great and loud enough, but I was hoping for bone-shattering sound

Overall, the sound quality is pleasant. This product suffers from 2 issues in my opinion. The sound volume could be more robust. I just can't crank it as loud as I would like. When set up in a multi room environment, the volume gets out of sync and it's difficult to reset to normal.

More 3d music content from Amazon music would be nice. This speaker does sound impressive when playing a 3d music source, albeit it's wimpy volume.

I've bought numerous Alexa-enabled speakers, including the Sonos One, the Bose 300, in addition to the Apple HomePod. The Amazon Studio is without a doubt better than all of them. The sound is incredible. Don't hesitate to try it yourself.

Generally, it works great as both a stand-alone unit and as a speaker for the Fire TV Cube. However, once in a while, the video - audio get several SECONDS out of sync with a reboot of both devices usually clearing the problem. I downgraded Sound Quality for this issue.

I love this speaker. The sound quality is awesome. I have this in a very large open living room and the music fills the entire space. My kids gave this to me as a gift. It was a great surprise. I love it, and have it paired with my other Amazon Alexa devices in my home.

When it works, the sound is rally great. However, the connection with FireTV drops twice a month and you need to redo the theater setup all over again. The "smart" utilization/skills are still very limited. Please note that you will not be able to use when you miracast your training on your Peloton bike (only the sound but not the sound +tv) . If you want to play with new technologies, it's a really fun speaker. If you only want a speaker to work every time, then there's cheaper/better options.

I love the sound on this speaker, it rocks my house great base and all around sound. I am still getting to know Alexa. We fight from time to time and she never takes the bait..lol my music sounds superb, I like setting reminders and alarms...
Great sound. Very loud

I will say i was not all that impressed with the sound quality until I upgraded to amazon music HD. There was a noticeable difference following the upgrade This is our first alexa product and we are finding it much more useful than we thought we would. Highly recommend this if you’re looking for an alexa product with room filling sound.

Great sound for about 1,000 sq ft area (indoors). I can finally hear Muse with the sound quality and volume they deserve.
Installation note: set on firm surface for best quality. A rickety table is not ideal

Despite the intriguing design, I found the sound quality lacking. The Alexa features did not make up for sound quality for me. I returned it and ended up paying much more for a competing product. But I consider myself an audiophile and sound quality is more important than price for me in most cases.

About a month ago, I bought Amazon’s top-of-the-line Echo device, the Echo Studio. And I have to say, I am impressed! If you subscribe to their HD service then you have access to their entire library including a wide selection of music in HD, Ultra HD, and 3D. The presence, clarity, and bass response from such a small device is remarkable. To listen to something like Puccini’s “Nessun dorma” or Queen’s “Who Wants to Live Forever” is a religious experience!

We have always loved the echo for playing music in different areas of the house but got tired of moving her around. When we decided to invest in a second one, the studio sounded perfect for our musical needs. We were not disappointed! She sounds better than the system in our brand new truck.

Far superior sound and volume to regular echos. I have it also hooked up to the tv and a firecube and it significantly improves the experience with a virtual surround sound system in compatible movies and shows.

Just didn’t live up to the hype of “Oh my god! The sound is amazing!”, that I’ve seen on some YouTube channels.

It’s better than the Echo Plus for certain, but it should blow you away with sound quality.

Nunca escuché un sonido con más claridad en un equipo de casa y respecto a su relación calidad-precio; he oído monitores de estudio en este rango de precios que no tienen tanta claridad y potencia; tiene bajos poderosos que no sacrifican la claridad.
The Sound is incredible truly a Experience That is remarkable good sound Quality and tone pitch and Clear and distinguish -

The sound from this device was even better than expected. So nice I purchased a second one and paired it to have stereo sound in my bedroom and connected to my Fire TV Stick. Rich lows and crisp highs. Set up fairly easy and takes a little while. Overall very impressive for the price.

So far we love the two studios we purchased. We set them on either side of the couch and they fill the house with incredible sound. The bass is impressive for how small they are. We’re thinking about picking up a few more.

This speaker produces great sound- I don’t think it could be beat at this price point. I love it. I am glad we upgraded for our living room, it makes a huge difference!
I was raised by a dad obsessed with speaker sound. We had tube amps, the huge speaker wire and thousands of dollars worth of equipment- all that stuff. The sound quality from this little speaker does not really compare to that and I am not sure it “fills the room,” but it is better than anything I have had in my adult life. I highly recommend.

I really like this Alexa. She sounds great . It has very good bass and crisp highs. I was thinking about buying the additional subwoofer but its really not needed unless I want to rattle the walls. I love the sleeping sounds. The ocean waves are most relaxing and help me fall asleep.

Could really hear the difference in songs mixed for Dolby Atmos 3D. The question will be if this format eventually gets widely adopted for music. If not, this speaker will still be a good value for its price range.

I have been very happy with my new echo studio system. I purchased two studios and the subwoofer. It make a great stereo system, with two stereo separation and deep bass. It was pretty easy to set up with the echo software, but I would suggest going on line to get the specific instructions for pairing the speakers.

Great sounding speakers, setup was terrible, had to contact Amazon to accomplish it and the tech tried to tell me it wouldn't connect to a 4k fire stick. I told him to read the on line directions, that it was designed to work with it.
Finally got working and sounds great.

I'd been eyeing this for a while, and finally pulled the trigger on Prime Day to take advantage of the 25% discount. I'd previously had two (2nd gen) Echo Pluses (I think same as the current gen Echo) in a stereo pair with an Echo Sub, and I replaced that with the two Echo Studios. I'm not an audiophile, but to my untrained ears, it sounds much better than the Echo Pluses. I'm very pleased with the sound. Although some reviews said that the microphone isn't as good as the Echo, and that Alexa sometimes doesn't hear you, I have not encountered this problem.

Thanks a lot Amazon! I went into Best Buy to buy a single light bulb and after hearing the Echo Studio they had on display I ended up ordering one (Best Buy didn't have any to sell).

Super happy with my purchase, love the sound.
Sounds really good, but after adjusting the equalizer I wish I could get more base out of it....

Sounds good but won’t work in conjunction with both surround sound and fire TV had to pair with just fire tv. Now I have to move my old home theatre to the basement for the movie room. Wish it would pair with both to enhance the steep experience.

When music is at reasonable volume, Alexa is too quiet. When Alexa is at a reasonable volume, music is too loud. It has a lot of difficulty actually hearing people speak, such that I have to repeat myself several times or, especially for the women in the house, it never gets what they say right even after training.

It does the job of an Echo fine when it does work, and the sound quality is better than other echos, but I don't think it's worth the price I paid for it all together.

This is a great value. Provides great sound for the price. I use it in my dining room and fills the space nicely. This is no high end audiophile speaker but at the $200 price point I think it's hard to beat.

Great product by Amazon! The sound quality of this device for the price especially is excellent, I did alot of research to decide this smart speaker over the sonos 1, plus I have plans for an Alexa powered smart home in the future for lighting my gaming room and this was a necessary addition for sound 🙏

Will you really actually read what I say let’s put it to the test what I loved everything what I disliked I’ll wait for Echo studio to point out where hopefully you’ll put lights on the button so you can see when you’re reaching for them just like the echo thermostat which has a motion sensors to light up so I can see what I’m doing. Just a little thought.
Awesome sound with deep bass. The best sounding Echo so far.

Es dispositivo presenta un sonido espectacular y en las pruebas con música 3D el sonido separado es un espectáculo. Su principal uso es para música, pero igual se controlan todos los dispositivos en casa. Aún me falta probar el equipo enlazado al firestick. Reconoce los comandos de voz sin dificultad, incluso desde otra habitación.

My Studio is fine, sounds great. I'd highly recommend the Studio if it wasn't for my wife's. My wife's has a low-level ticking/grating sound even when not playing anything. It's rather annoying. Can't hear it when the music is volume LVL 5 or more, but below that... We will be returning/exchanging hers.

I bought this because Alexa is just so easy to use and you. The sound is fine If you like you like the way Bose speakers sound. I personally like how Ultimate Ears sound better. More of a balanced bottom mid range and treble...if you like more of a bass sound /bottom end than this most likely isn't your speaker.

Love my Alexa. I was hesitant at first to purchase one. But I needed music to help me through this pandemic. Alexa sound is perfect!! I'm not sure if I'm getting complete use, but when a favorite song comes on, it lifts my spirit. Pricey, but hopefully will be used for a long time. NOT happy about the 15.00/month service so I am not getting it. Can only afford so much. Wish there weren't "add ons" to everything!!

The device has no problems per se, however it's one of the most priciest echos around, and maybe I am not doing something right but this 3D sound sounds as good as my nose sound bar so don't really see the point, maybe it's juts a bigger speaker than the regular echo

I recommend this product! I like the sounds that come from it/makes u feel immersed into the movie/music. I just wish it could be a bit louder but it proves to be a wonderful upgrade for your television audio cheers...

Sound quality is good, but voice recognition is an issue. Alexa doesn't listen, or respond well to my requests and commands, I sometimes think I am speaking to my ex-wife. Maybe I should ask Alexa if she has a headache?

This product works great with your Amazon Music Unlimited subscription, with the 3D upgrade. It sounds best with the available 3D music. With all the other music, I found I had to turn up the volume more to get a better quality.

Sound is great. Alexa’s ai needs more work but that is to be expected considering technology is ever growing. Integration is its downfall. Does not work well with existing Apple and google programs, and you can’t use the device as a Bluetooth speaker!

I purchased this echo to put outside by the pool and it works great!! The sounds are very clean and clear, and Alexa is able to hear us talk to it even when the kids are splashing about. I would highly recommend this item.

just received yesterday, really got high hopes for this device , the sub was such a disappointment the Bluetooth never really connected it was a waste of money for me, wish I could return but anyway make sure you buy 2 year maint. plan with any Echo device

We really like this speaker. It adds depth nicely to the music we stream from Sirius or Pandora. I bought the Alexa outlet, and it now turns on & off my plugged in Christmas tree with a simple command!

I have it in my RV and it rocks play all my music through my iPhone my music library and XM app!
Won’t need to pair with another on it gets loud as you want it to with crisp highs and midrange the base a tad weak but gona order the sub to see what happens!

I really wanted this two work...
I bought one Echo Studio and it was okay. Then I decided to buy the second one a day later for the Stereo Pair. Worst decision and waste of Money! I can't listen to Spotify at all. A song will play and ten seconds later it drops and I have to hit play again. Such a huge inconvenience for anyone who just wanted to listen to their Spotify playlist. Just might end up returning both of them and Buying the Sonos One with Alexa as well.

Through much fanfare I was very excited about this product. I purchased two of them to make a stereo pair for my fire cube TV and echo sub. After two minutes both speakers stop working and all I hear is the echo sub. Even restarting the television and the echo cube nothing seems to fix this issue. Unplugging the units and powering him back up still no affect. I hope this is a update fix in the future. At this point I am just very frustrated.

This is an awesome device but if anyone can answer this question get close To your studio and pick a song that's 3-D Do you hear a buzzing or hissing noise when ever it plays anything for instance play 7 ring by ariana grande's when the audio starts then stops In between you start hearing it Better if herd with higher volume

This Echo Studio doesn't sound horrible but it also doesn't sound much better than my Echo gen 1. The subwoofer component is nice but I don't think there is much value in this model as a stand alone unit at $170-$200.
Unbelievably great. A whole new way of listening to music

If you don't already use Amazon music do not purchase this product. It is nothing but a constant ad machine pushing you to sign up and once you do it continues with more ads to upgrade to the better quality audio membership. Pairing with my echo sub is a nice touch but for the cost of both you're better off getting a system from an actual audio company

you sold a unit that is known to carry sound output which it does well,however you can not get a surround sound with one speaker.so when i went to connect external logitech speakers to this to my astonishment YOU CAN'T.totally sad thinking on the developers side.even with my echo dot 1st gen i can hook up external speakers to get more of a surround sound.very dissapointed.thinking of returning it. when it comes to music this was it's purpose.

Amazon’s Alexa Studio model is certainly a much improved device over previous devices. The fidelity of all sorts of music is enhanced to the point that it’s beginning to sound like what was originally produced by the respective artists. While it’s a step in the right direction there is still plenty of room for improvement with the software and equalization schemes.
Coupled with music subscription and it is great. Full sound. Looks really nice. Love the integration with other smart devices. Does not work great with TV as there is a lag between video and sound.

Overall good sound quality. I thought they would play louder though. The one negative is it seems I have to speak louder for Alexa to respond. These are replacing 3rd generation Echo Dots and Alexa responds to those from quite far away.

When my echo broke I decided to buy the apple home pod. I have many apple products so it was a no brainer. I hated it! It's fussy, doesn't connect multiple phones in the house and set up wasn't easy. The echo studio is much easier to connect and the sound is superb. It's also $100 cheaper.

Love the studio combined with multiple echo dots it makes for a great whole house system ready for another one wish I had caught the Amazon sale before I bought the first one but definitely worth the money

Really like the studio the best. I have 2 first generation echos and 2 2nd with a subwoofer and 2 studio all stereo paired. The studio is by far most pleasing. The 2nd generation with subwoofer is very good also.

Its cool but this is not a 'speaker' if you just simply wanna play some musics, you can not connect through bluetooth so it means you cant play the musics on your phone, yes it will connect to you apple music or Spotify but it doesn't play it through your phone, you can not control your music on your phone without using alexa app, personal I like to pause my music or control the volume using my phone. Its really annoying you cant just click a album on your apple music to play, you have to tell alexa to play specific things

I love my echo studio! I am a music lover and listen to music everyday. I was looking for an upgrade from my echo dot and I decided to purchase this. The sound quality blew me away! This thing gets loud! This is definitely my favorite purchase of the year. I highly recommend this product.
Excellent sound with great voice recognition. Worth every penny and may buy another one.
With 5 existing Echos around the house, I was more than excited to experience the sound quality from this ""3D sound""" device. NOT impressed, certainly not a Bose, and waiting for the 3D to happen.

The sound is fine. It is a little louder than the echo, but not worth the extra cost.

One problem is with Alexa this in general. When I try to set up groups and I have to change the location of the speaker. It doesn’t seem to allow me to do that. It is very convoluted. I’ve given up on setting up groups. Amazon really needs to fix this. It should be pretty simple.
It’s Echo... it’s wonderful. The sound is crispy and HD. It takes the whole environment full of music. Love it!

Wow... oh my god... This speaker sounds absolutely amazing when playing music from Amazon Music with HD, ultra HD, and 3D Music. I highly recommend you use this service to maximize it’s full potential. Probably sounds just as amazing with optical audio in. I can only imagine what 2 linked together would sound like. This should cost twice as much, (and probably does to Amazon). I highly recommend this device, you will NOT be disappointed.
The Amazon Studio is a new standard in home music. We started with the Amazon Touch, then the many types of Echo's. The Studio exceeds expectations and is ear food for the music lover. Wow. No, WOW!

The sound is remarkable. It blows away my 1st gen echoes, my 2gen echo dots and my echo show. The Dolby Atmos makes this speaker fill the room with amazing sound for one unit. Well worth the money!!!!!
