Easy home theater integration with Fire Cube. Excellent sound. My previous home theater setup I had a Sonos speaker, the Echo Studio sounds as good or better, and is so much easier to use. Great value. I'm thinking about getting another.

The audio quality is on point! The sound from this smart speaker fills up my entire living room and kitchen. No matter what genre of music I throw at it there is no distortion and the clarity of mids and highs along with the bass kick is tuned perfect.

The availability to connect to the phone is intermittent. Volume control works also only works occasionally. As a device for music this does not work well. As an Alexa device it works very well, but you don't need to spend anywhere near the price tag to get this functionality with other low fidelity devices. I'd stick with a low cost Alexa and separate speaker system. It is unfortunate, as I was hoping I could get what was promised and have both.

The sound quality is very good for the cost. The set up was relatively easy and the voice recognition works well. I was under the impression it would work only based on my voice. However, Alexa will work from anyone's voice. Could just be my misunderstanding. But this thing is EXCELLENT!!.

Within a month the cap for the subwoofer fell out and the bass went bad. About a year in it stopped playing music. It will light up when you say "alexa" but it wont playb anything. I would have to unplug it and plug it back in to get it to work. As if earlier this week, it completely stopped responding beyond lighting up.

The sound quality it great when it works. The stability of the connection is less then satisfactory and Amazon help has not been helpful at all. I have talked to them on several occasions with no resolution and during my last attempt they told me someone would contact me their escalation team. No one ever called. I would not recommend purchasing these for your home if you plan on using them as part of a home theater..
Can’t believe the sound quality at this price point. Sounds amazing. If you love your Echo device, you need to upgrade to the Echo Studio and fall in love with Alexa and your Echo all over again.
I have paired this with an Echo Show in the kitchen so that music plays out of the Echo Studio, but I can still see timers and other such information on the Echo Show. Works great and sounds great.
This is my 4th Alexa device and this one is probably the best. Sounds incredible with room filling quality sound. It also does a great job of hearing me call it out, even when playing music loud.

The sound is awesome but the interface is lacking. Alexa only allows volume control 1-10. You can not say mute without turning the volume to 1. You can not adjust the volume with the Alexa app. Maybe I just have not downloaded the correct app or skill. I looked but did not see one for the echo studio. I also bought an optical cable which does allow tv over the echo studio but it does not interact as well as I hoped. I also like that it’s a hub and is suppose to work without the internet but I have not tested it yet. Hope it is a hub for all my echo devices
Quite bulky on the counter. Sounds better than our OG Echo but not as good as anticipated given hype, Dolby Atmos, etc. having the indicator lights recessed on the top is less convenient as well.

Better than I expected. Sound is full and clear and pretty awesome for a speaker of that size and price range. So far I haven't had any hiccups regarding connectivity or pairing. Instructions to pair or connect the device are pretty straightforward but require a little bit of reading. I got mine connected to my fire TV 4k as a home theater set up and I love it.

I've had the regular Echo in my kitchen but sometimes you just want to blast your favorite song and the Echo just couldn't cut it. The Studio fills that gap. However, when I moved the Studio to compare it along side my regular home stereo in the living room it fell way short.
At $200. just a tad of buyer's remorse but it's the holidays and I deserve it. (A discount of 15% or more would definitely eradicate any of that remorse).

Great speakers wish you could connect4 more speakers to it to get a real surround sound i have the echo sub connected to it . But at this time thats the limit . I found that when set up as a home theater with a fire cube 1 speaker in each of the echo studios are mute. Not sure why. But none the less it is basicly wireless system except for a outlet plug . And i love the fact that you can relocate these anywhere that has an outlet nearby without reconnecting or moving a bunch of speaker wires.

I am still evaluating the “Studio” I suppose I am comparing it to Bose “Wave” devices. Thus far, no issues. I can’t tell a lot of difference between standard audio stations and the Amazon Ultra HD. I will revise the review as soon as I have time to give it a full test run.

This is the best sounding Alexa yet. Please add a model with a rotating clock or screen like the dot 3 and show. It replaced an echo dot 3,which had the clock, and my wife misses that. Spectacular otherwise..

I got this to use as a speaker for music, control my smart home and be a sound bar. Unfortunately if you play music on it then wanna use it as a sound bar you have to unplug the device then plug it back in. For the price I would expect this to be seamless
I was very disappointed that it wasn't compatible to my fire TV edition, But I do enjoy the quality of the sound when I listen to my Amazon music. Thinking about adding a scoend one. Next year.

I put it in my gym and it sounds like a dance club in there. It's gonna to be hard to workout cause all I want to do is dance :- )
GREAT BASS, GREAT CLARITY. WORTH THE MONEY -- IT ROCKS!

I first purchased the Echo Dot then a colleague of mine suggested I buy Echo Studio. This speaker has some amazing sound. The louder I turned up the volume the better the sound. This booger puts out 3D sound that enables you here the song in studio quality. I just might get another one.
Got the Studio during the Prime Day sale and sure wish I had purchased two or three of them. Sound quality is excellent. Will be getting another one soon and will pair with the one I have now.

I’ve lived with them for a few months now, I can’t tell you how great they are, and no muss no fuss.

The only sound system that compares is klipch with 1..k watts Macintosh amp.

Yeah, been that like long. I’m telling ya, 2 of these baby tubs is fantastic - paired of course. If just one of you enjoy you them like i do I’d be happy, sure, i can afford more but honestly I don’t need my studio monitor headphones any more, yes, really!!

Excellent sound quality, really above and beyond the standard Echo or Echo dots. I have mine set up in a living room, with two echo dots at the other end of the room. The dots serve as satellite/surround speakers; the Studio really brings out the deep bass and clear highs. It's like having an audiophile type speaker on a budget. Very happy with this.

If you are hoping to play Spotify on this, the app won’t allow you to link your account through Alexa App. The only way to play your Spotify is by using the Bluetooth. That means you can’t use Alexa voice recognition to play your songs.
Big fail. I guess amazon is trying to push their own music streaming service.

What a great device the only issue i have is integration with youtube music.

If you guys emable youtubemusoc integration this product will be the best smart music system.

We used Echo at a friend's house and really enjoyed the experience. We purchased this model for the deeper sound. We now use it on a daily basis. It's easy to request a certain song or particular music group or genre.

I like it but the microphone doesn’t work as well as the dot. It’s in the living room and probably 20 feet away from the kitchen dot. I often have to repeat instruction to the studio and sometimes when I do it gets picked up by the dot in the kitchen instead. Always had a great Alexa experience but If I’d started with this studio I would have never continued on because it’s frustrating to repeat things frequently to the studio.

Got this one hoping Alexa could hear us better, but our gen 2 dot has better voice recognition and it's really frustrating to have spent so much on something and it not be at least better than the old cheap version. The sound quality of the speakers is great though.

I use this speaker now in addition to my surround sound system. I like the surround sound system better although sometimes I just want to hear music immediately without going through all of the steps to turn on the system. The Echo Studio has a very good quality, deep clear sound which I can turn on in a matter of seconds to hear my favorite music (Amazon and Apple) in my living room and other rooms if needed (I have 4 other echo devices so being able to hear everywhere is sweet. I also like the small size and looks. Hard to go wrong at this price.
Setup was easy and sound is excellent. Looks nice on my coffee table.

Alexa is a game changer for me. I tell her to play some of my favorite music and call people on my contact list and she does. My favorite part is when she plays for me rain and thunder on loop mode all night just like I like it . It’s very calming for me and helps me relax after a hard day of work. She’s a must buy...

Oh my goodness this thing thumps!!!! The sound this speaker gives is leaps and bounds above anything offered by Echo speakers to date. Pair this with a 4k fire stick to get incredible surround sound out of this one speaker. Highly recommended.

Got two paired with an echo sub. The sound is significantly different with the pair and sub - impressive! Along with HD subscription from Amazon music - Period Classical music with channels by composer - Nikolaus Harnoncourt, William Christie, Karl Richter, etc... - sounds magnificent!
The sound quality is superb. But I feel the voice recognition was better on my original gen 1 Echo. And it's strange that there isn't a remote any longer.

Overall this is a nice product. The sound quality is a little lacking for a speaker this size. I ended up putting it in my place of work in my office. It is a nice upgrade over the Dot I was using at work.
Absolutely sounds amazing. Worth every penny!
I got this Echo in January it worked fine but know I’m having problems with it every time.

I was disappointed at the sound quality, the echo studio has room sensing technology and 1 additional speaker over the regular echo. With the technology and extra speaker the studio, should easily outperform an echo 3rd gen (that’s 1/2 the price). It didn’t. 😕
Excellent sound quality and it was very easy to set up. The mic pics up Alexa requests from the next room.
The sound is great. I’m a HiFi guy and musician with a $3000 analog stereo. Hopefully that gives this review street cred

I give 5 stars because it a great speaker, it can play high quality music and pair with your firestick as a theater system although extremely small lag in the voice (corrected in lip sync in my tv) I would check and compare with other new speakers.
Received this as a Christmas gift. We have several Echo devices in the house and this one by far exceeds the sound quality of all others. Just perfect!

I was looking at lots of more expensive speakers to put in my bar room. I went to a local Best Buy to listen to different speaker. The Studio blew me away, especially for the price. Didn't buy it there of course, got from Amazon.

I have had this over a year with daily use I easily have it play 6 plus hours of music a day. This is a fantastic speaker and by far one of the best Amazon speakers. It's not bulky and it has great sound
The Echo Studio adds a good deal of bass response to Echo line. It sounds full and rich for such as small speaker. Highly recommended if you are looking for a fine sounding Echo device.

Love the ease of use of this new product! Is it an audiophile’s hi-fidelity product? No. But the sound is pretty amazing from a speaker with this small of a footprint. We have a very open concept house and it is able to fill the space. Try it out, you have nothing to lose.

Not sure why but we keep losing connection and we’ve had our internet and WiFi checked. She’s just stops playing, mid song. Otherwise, we love it. I started with one, because of the price but I’m planning to add more to my studio to get the full effect.
Sounds great and does what it’s designed to do. Incredible sound quality
It works just as well as the Echo and other Alexa units however it is not Studio Sound quality. It is far better than the older Echo (Cylinder type) but is it worth the $$, maybe not.
Great sound even at low volume levels. It does have a large footprint, but certainly worth it for the sound. Very pleased with this purchase. Sounds remains crisp at all volume levels.

The Studio constantly cuts out and can’t stay connected more than 15 minutes while playing music or audio. I have tried multiple networks and locations, still no difference. Contacted support but I haven’t been able to get a solution yet. When spending this kind of money on a premium Alexa device you would expect seamless function.

I liked voice recognition,Alexa integration and sound quality. But I don’t liked one thing that is I use Android and iOS devices and without Alexa app in Android, Bluetooth get connected easily for streaming music but from iOS,Bluetooth in echo studio never connected connected even with Alexa app set up too.Bluetooth name never shows in iOS. May be I need to have monthly subscription with premium.

Very good sound quality when it works, but way too unreliable. I have been using Echo products for a few years and this one is less reliable than any of the others that I own. I need to unplug it and “restart” about twice each week. I also had to go through a process of removing the home theater group and the recreating it to get music to play. It randomly stops responding, or sometimes the light ring indicates that it is working, but there is no sound.
I researched a lot before buying the Echo Studio. I don't regret the purchase because we are an Alexa household and I think it's the best option but the sound quality is not what I expected it to be.
The Echo Studio has nice full, rich sound, with full bass and excellent volume. I must get another though, because the only thing missing is stereo. I can't have music without stereo.

Great sound, Easy setup, looking forward to making my Wink obsolete and having this be the home hub. Sound is amazing definitely multiple steps up from the plus. I had to move pictures off the shelf because the base was vibrating them enough to move.
I was blown away with the sound! I also like that I can be blasting music and say Alexa without screaming and she hears me no issues. With the Echo I had to scream at her to wake up.

Was on sale for $169, I think. For the price, it is excellent and deserves 5 stars. Sound has full rich bass, but a little thin in the mid and highs. If I paid $50 more, I think I would have been disappointed, but at this price my kitchen music is good.

It has amazing room filling sound that can honestly be heard through the entire house! The bass on this is enough to feel in the floor on higher volumes as well and even at higher volumes the sound is sharp and clear!

Sounds was nothing special -- I chose to replace with an echo dot and hard wire to two Harmon speakers I already had but did not like using with the app from Harmon -- now I control them with echo dot and they sound great.

This "little" speaker sounds great. I have tried it alone, as well as paired with the sub, and both options sound better than my sound bar. The kids all love it, and can't wait to take it outside by the pool in the summer.
I love the clarity and the bass I can install 2 Studio speakers in my home and submerse it with sound. This is a good buy. I believe it will also decease in price, it will be an even better buy.

Love love love the sound and it pairs with my Alexa enable TV in the bedroom for nice sound while watching TV or listening to Music. Alexa is easy to wake up. Perfect this over the surround sound I had set up previously.
Get a pair for great full sound. And Alexa is a great companion to the already convenient speaker package

A single echo can be used for blue tooth streaming, but not two echo's paired in stereo, or three with sub. Amazon needs to do a software upgrade so you can have that and stream your files to it. Works fine with amazon music and sirius, but it appears that amazon wants to keep you on amazon music, and not allow you to stream your files to a three speaker system that cost me 600 dollars. That is not fair, please upgrade the software.
I was so excited to get this. I was equally disappointed in it. I think my old echo has just as good of sound as this one if not better, I believe it’s clearer.
I recommend everyone to buy two of these and use them in stereo configuration. A single speaker cannot reproduce stereo sound, but if you pair two of these, you'll have a great setup
My wife and I are completely enjoying our new echo studio. We have had it for a couple months now and we love it, the sound is beautiful. We control our HD 4K Fire TV Stick with it.

I bought this to use as an echo/soundbar to pair with my 4K firestick. Let me tell ya, the audio drops all the time, I’m constantly having to into the app and change setting to make it work.

Update from a few weeks later: honestly if I could give this negative stars I would. This product is such a nightmare to make work. Volume is a no go for the twitch app, which blows my mind since that’s another Amazon product. This thing sucks beyond belief, avoid at all costs

It took me about half an hour to set up . This is my first Alexa device and I am floored with the quality of the sound . Strong bass, clear accurate treble and mid range. Oh ! It controls all of my smart devices also. I am very happy so far.
I love the sound. I didn't realize how bad my tv speakers were until I got this studio. However, there are alot of times that I have to disconnect and reconnect. My echo 3 didn't have these issues

I was sure I was going to like the Echo Studio but I really love it. I synched it with my TV and it it’s like I’m in a movie theatre. My music collection never sounded so good! Worth the price. Highly recommended

Have a problem with "Song ID On". Play stops after one song when it's on. Tech support was arrogant and did not call me back when he said he would. They identified a software problem, but three or four weeks later - no fix. Otherwise, I love it!

Home run by Amazon. These speakers are amazing with powerful bass and perfect highs. Using it for outdoor theater and inside my home office. Setup in theater mode paired with a Fire Stick 4K and works flawlessly.
Not bad for the money. I replaced my old Yamaha stereo/floor speakers with this. It's not too notch sound but it does a pretty good job compared to the stereo. A better eq would be nice.
Nothing to dislike. Looks nice. Music sounds great. Voice recognition is outstanding - it recognizes everything you ask. It even has a dry sense of humor. Plan to get another one for the basement.

These speakers are pretty awesome. The sound is great. My only complaint is you can’t wirelessly connect to other media devices besides the fire cube, firestick or Amazon’s own services on these devices. If that’s not an issue for you I highly recommend getting two of these and an echo sub.

When it worked it was great, but sound clarity and punch can’t make up for spotty connections, speaker drops and constant restarts needed to keep reinitializing the speakers to my Firestick 4K. This happened regardless of location to the router.
We recently bought this speaker for our outdoor gym. The sound is Phenomenal!!!! For the quality and price this is the best speaker hands down and comes with Alexa, can’t beat it.

Sounds great in my apartment. It analysis the room at set up. Knowing this. I set it up on s centrally located table. With over 5,000,000 songs available with the Amazon HD music subscription its even harder to stump than the dot which I moved to the bedroom.

Sound was fine slightly above average for a $200 speaker. The Alexa integration works spot on, she will recognize my voice even over loud tunes playing.

However the marketing claims are slightly over hyped on this. The sound stage is pretty mono. If you are in a small room, and sitting in the sweet spot you get a decent stereo effect. However for most use cases treat this as a very high quality single point audio source

Amazing smart speaker. Picked it up for $30.00 off the reg price. It was a replace fir my 1sr gen echo. The sound quality is unbelievable. Read the online review and they were all positive, which made me purchase one.

Wanted to use as “sound bar” with TV and as Alexa. Connected speaker to TV with optical cable and works pretty good with TV speaker muted. The external input gets Alexa confused at times when switching uses. Also sound does not come from middle of tv like a sound bar does so it can seem a little odd that the voices are coming from the side when people are talking in the middle of the tv screen.

Why would amazon make a product that is not compatible with their previous echo devices. This is why apple is always ahead when it comes to technology. So dumb! Most people live in homes with multiple rooms. They probably are looking for a system that is compatible with their other Alexa devices or stereos. Common sense.
My Studio is only a few weeks old and fills my 24' patio with sound. I use the Studio for music but it is capable of more but as is it fits my needs. The Studio replaces the original Echo
I got this to have good sounding music while I work in the garage/outside the house. Both audio channels can be heard unlike the Echo Plus I have in the living room (mono only).

Volume can change as different song are selected, that is not good. I thought the machine was suppose to be constantly adjusting to the way I had set it up. Of course the sound is not the quality of my home stereo system, but it is much easier to access songs.Sometimes it plays some weird versions of the same song several musicians have recorded therefore I need to know the version I want. Also it would be nice to know if I can set up various favorites lists and if so, how to do it. Overall, its fun to play and I enjoy it.
Great speaker best sound I ever heard Alexa works great . Recommend to anyone top of the line product! Ps base is fantastic.PS THIS ITEM IS NOT 5 STARS. IT IS 10 STAR 🌟 RATING.

I was comparing this item with the Bose speakers and I decided for the Bose. Big mistake....they don't integrate well with Alexa. The Echo Studio does not have the sound quality of the Bose speakers, but the integration is perfect.

if your looking for great sound this is what your looking for. i am very happy with this purchase. wanted a new alexa and this fits the bill. great sound better responsiveness. and a built in hub.if your looking for a sound bar for your tv check this out.
My intent was to significantly upgrade the sound quality of my Echo 2nd Gen. Did not happen. The studio is in the same location but does not have the full sound experience I was expecting.

I've had echos from the 1st gen until this one. i honestly don't hear any improved sound. its just bigger. the voice response seems less sensitive and we often have to repeat commands or raise our voice to get a response. whispering doesn't work well and my advice is get the cheaper model
The sound quality in my office is really very good. The low response is decent, and the highs are good as well. Don’t expect this to replace a full hifi setup. But for the size, it is outside.

Love the Echo Studio the sound is great I’m a huge Alexia fan I have 3 echos, 3 echo dots 2 echo show 8” 1 echo show 5” and an echo show 10, even have echo auto for my truck, and the multi room audio is on point I have it set up for the downstairs and the upstairs and then the whole house there is nowhere you can’t hear it and the rest is Apple iPhone, iPads, Apple TV’s, iMac and AirPort Extreme for a router
The Echo Studio's sound is very good if music is the primary source. However, the speaker can't replace a sound bar if an improvement in voice audio is the main reason for the purchase.
Homepod sounds way better but just apple only is ridiculous, the only thing I they should change is the light should be visible from the side like the 3rd generation echo dot
I loved this product for the first couple weeks I had it. Now I can’t keep it connected to my fire cube. Reset everything so many times and it just seems to be bipolar. I am returning

For the last forty years I have considered myself to be some what of an Audiophile. I have a very discerning ear for music reproduction and I've spent many thousands of hours listening to high-end electronics and loudspeakers. This compact speaker took me by surprise even though I had read many of the online reviews before purchasing it. For the price...it's a real bargain!
AR-NJ
Good audio performance. Works well for portable room speakers. Much cheaper and sounds better than Sonos. Would be better if this integrates with the existing Sonos system.
Averagely disappointed. It never heard me

Purchased this speaker for our back porch. On initial start up the speaker conducted a sound test and adjusted itself to the acoustics. Love the sound from this speaker. Rate it’s performance well above the others Alexa speakers hands down.

HOME THEATER FUNCTION DOESN NOT WORK WITH FIRE EDITION TVS. Amazon refuses to update or give the entire os to their third party partners. Fire edition tv do not have Amazon’s firestick software. Please note in Amazon forums the tendency of speakers to disconnects and stop playing audio from tv without notice. Also that the fire edition tvs have stripped down os but marketed as full fire os

Its not a bright sounding as my Bose500 but it was much easier to integrate with Alexa! After a couple of weeks it started to distort, never played at high volume not not related to over driving it or anything. As soon as I see my refund I will be ordering a 2nd bose which is in my checkout cart.

I bought this Echo to have next level sound in our bedroom - and it did not disappoint. Wow! Fantastic, clear, room-filling sound. Aux port allowed me to connect my CD player. Combined with Amazon Music Unlimited, I can hear all the songs I love on a fantastic sounding device.
Really enjoying this upgrade. Sound is fantastic, but I'm not audio engineer. Great for music and podcast, every streaming movies through it in my kitchen when I'm working.

Simple instructions to follow in setting it up. I especially enjoy playing music on it and the quality of the speakers are unbelievable. I have just begun to use a few of its many features. You do have to download the program onto your mobile phone to use many of its features. You can use it to place a call and speak through it to any of the contacts you have listed in your mobile phone. The possibilities are endless.
I listen to music almost every day, I have 100 watt Jvc, and a Kenwood home entertainment center, and all I am going to say about echo studio is , amazon, you nailed it.

Set it up today. It’s a bit buggy. Connected to iPad and Bluetooth goes in and out. Also having issues adjusting equalizer on Alexa app. The studio doesn’t always respond as I slide the bass/midrange/treble adjusters.
Love the sound i purchase 2 im using them as home theater i wish you could add a center speaker i will definitely will add a subwoofer in the future but so far im in love with it!

Very impressive for its size, good things do come in small packages! Setup was easy as is all Alexa devices.
What I will say is that placement is key for great performance. Placing in the center of the wall is ideal. I originally placed mine somewhat close to a corner and didn’t hear it’s full potential.

I bought this specifically for the sound quality and it has lived up to the hype 100%. I use it in my new home office and it has been a great addition. When I have a few minutes to listen to music during the day it really fills the room with sound. I was a bit skeptical that it could tune itself to the room but it really seems to have done just that. Plus it has all the great Alexa features you want.

I upgraded from the Echo 2nd generations to these. The sound quality is definitely better however music with a lot of symbols are lost. Even if you turn off the stereo enhancement feature it’s a little better. But it defeats the purpose of the clarity and depth. So I would leave it on. There were some minor tweets but with the help of Amazon’s Tech support my issue was solved quickly. Overall I would recommend them but pair two of them with the Echo sub.

I really like the studio cause the sound is so clear. It’s a little challenging to set it up. Once it’s set up it’s great. I’ve used this in the living room and the backyard. The only this is I wish the speakers had more bass. I’ve purchased the Alexa sub and am waiting for it. I have two paired up. Pairing was pretty easy and sound great together. I would have given 5 stars had they had more bass and set up would have been a bit easier.

Great speakers for the money! Sound is really good and easy to set up. The app still needs to work on improving device grouping limitations (like allowing for only speakers in a TV Home Theater group to be used without turning the TV on). Overall very pleased with the product.

Echo Speaker is nice, sound is good . But Alexa ..... not even bit close to Google. Disappointed. I give Alexa D maybe C as grade Wish it responded like Google. Most of the time I get "I don't know or I don't understand " come one amazone make Alexa and A not D . So Echo as music player it's solid B +, Alexa on the other hand gets D.

Sound quality is great. Can get very loud. Great bass

Audio delay is making me return it though. Expected it to replace soundbar as it was touted to start with.

Replaced a Bowers and Wilkins Zeppelin that died. Sound isn't as good, but good enough. Voice commands work well most of the time. Sometime she has a mind of it's own and will do things on it's own, or make beeping sounds in the middle of the night. Lots of room for improvement but generally happy with quality and performance.
The best echo yet. The sound is amazing
Not worth the money the echo 3rd generation is good all by it self the sub was just ok not worth the money either.
I purchased this as a gift and my son loves it. The sound is amazing. The bass was much better than I had expected. Probably the best gift I have given him in many years.

The sound quality is great, but the voice recognition is pretty awful. 50% of the time I try to talk to it, my echo dot down the hall in another room here's me instead. I'd expect the voice recognition on a $199 device to be far better than a gen 1 echo dot that I got for free from some promo.
Love the sounds and I can get Alexa to play my music from amazon
Im very impressed with the sound quality

Echo Studio is amazing when reproducing music with potent bass notes, even when we play them on low sound volume. Also, its native integration with Alexa makes it extremely easy to interact with the device using voice control, only. I have had an Echo Studio for several months, now, and the only time I touched it was when I first turned it on! I can highly recommend the purchase, as I am extremely satisfied with mine.

I was amazed at the sound quality on just one of these studio’s so I ended up buying a second and a echo sub to match. I have no issues with voice recognition on any of my echo devices. It’s a great price for the sound this device produces in comparison to its competitors

A regular Echo on “steroids”, this unique gadget offers all the amenities of smaller Alexa devices tied to a very powerful and amazing sound, lot of uses to apply, in my case I turned it into a smart sound bar for my TV set... All in all a great purchase.

Blue light is on top difficult to see so not sure is Alexa is activated. Should circle the side like of Alexa devices.
Sound is better than other Alexa products. Better base form downward facing speaker

Excellent sound and superb sub woofer for a speaker that size. Two units can replace surround sound system when watching movies/TV-sound is really that good in a small to mid-sized room. Excellent for bedroom or sitting room. Highly recommend it.
It set itself up when I plugged it in, so that was easy. The sound quality is really good. The bass is stronger than I thought it would be. The whole range is good.

I was looking for a better speaker that integrated well with Alexa. I ordered the Studio with reservations. However, I must say the Studio out performed my expectations many times over. The sound is excellent. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who is looking for good sound at a reasonable price.
I love the studio! It is a lot more for the little ammount more than your regular echo. Its like a single speaker stero unit. Nice rich bass and a high range of sound. I'm enjoying it.

Alexa is quite amazing. I’m still learning what it can do. The sound quality is great.
My favorite so far is Alexa play the rain sound.. so it plays for an hour and shuts off...

The sound on the device is very good. I did not rate it 5 stars due to the fact I cannot compare it to the other models. If you are looking for full and clear sound, the Echo Studio will work for you.
Works well with my dots. So have music throughout the house. Love it.
Really impressed with the sound quality and bass response. Very happy with this so far. Setup was super simple and quick using the app. Plays all of our music flawlessly.

Don't buy this product. Our family probably used the speaker 2-3 times per week and at a medium volume. One of the speakers has already failed, and I am outside the support window. I can't imagine something like this happening with another brand of speaker. For $200, this should have lasted 5+ years. Now it's going to go in the trash.
I don’t know why people have been giving this less than 5 stars! I love my echo studio, the sound is amazing! Alexa works very well, I upgraded from the echo plus and it’s worth every penny!
The sound quality of the echo studio Is very good. It is a big improvement of the regular echo speaker, although the sound quality of the regular echo speaker is not bad.
I purchased this speaker in May and now 5 months later, the speaker is going out making crackling sounds instead of music. I’m so disappointed

I would think a $200 speaker (times 2 for stereo) would sound better - Why is there no interface for sound control for my computer - I am listening to music on my computer and need to pull out my phone or IPad to adjust sound
Sound good but you have to paid for 3d music to enjoy the features and for that price no thanks mine echo plus sounds just as good.

This review can be summed up in one word, wow! Such an incredible sound at the $200 price point. They deliver a full body sound, that's great both in the upper mode range with a deep base that sounds very balanced. Fills the entire room.
Not the impressive sound I was expecting for the price. I think you a pair of powered bookshelf speakers and a dot will outperform this for the same or less money.
Unit would constantly play music with no prompt. Unacceptable. Returned when amazon couldn't resolve issue in a week. Bad experience.

I am absolutely amazed at the sound coming from this little box WoW! I got 4 family members to buy it also. It small and convenient and movable and base is great.
👍👍👍👍👍

Your browser does not support HTML5 video.
 Nice deep bass. Rich full sound experience. Way better than any other echo device. If you only plan on getting one Echo device, this should be your choice.
What a difference the Echo Studio makes! The sound is outstanding. The set-up has all ready been done for you. Simply plug it in. I am very glad I purchased it!

If your looking to listen to music it’s a good choice, but if your thinking to use this speaker as a home theater don’t do it! Even if you get 2 you won’t have the good sound for movies or sports. Any sound bar price 140 and up will sound 10 times better.
Unbelievable sound! All I can say is wow!
This speaker is comparable to other high end speakers of its size, and is reasonably priced. It has real depth of sound and great balance. I highly recommend it.

I have Bluetooth headphones and the studio speaker requires multiple attempts to switch back and forth. Sometimes it’s good but sometimes it is really frustrating. Otherwise it’s a big improvement over the TV speakers.
I actually purchased 2 studios for a stereo pair, and they sound fine. I don’t use them for critical listening, but they sound great for casual listening. Nice design touch too.

It was a bit overhyped in my opinion. But it does sound very good, much better than Echo Plus. It’s much better now to listen if I have it paired with my phone via Bluetooth for music. I recommend it if you will buy it for listening to music often.

This speaker is top notch in every way. Clear sound and bass sounds right. No distortion even when cranked to max volume. One word of warning which i find completely odd. It does not pair to every amazon fire tv edition. Let that sync in. Amazon you need to correct that. Other than that it sounds amazing.

I bought it to be a optical powered speaker for my tv and to control zigbee lights.

The optical never worked reliably and even a year later it still does not work.
Zigbee support is now broken after a recent update which amazon support does not even know how to support so it has now become a very expensive echo dot.
There are other alexa speakers that sound better and are more reliable then this device. I would personally advise perusing those.

I was very excited about using this for music, , but after months of trying we could never get the product to work properly and there is little to no product support. Too late to return so it’s sitting in a box.

Great especially for the price. BUT...
The Alexa and Amazon HD Music apps have been a fail since I bought and paired two of these. Customer service was useless. I am considering returning both speakers and cancelling all Amazon services. The Bose speaker I replaced had issues but it's app worked. They quit pairing randomly as well. Sound is good at this price but everything else sucks...

Sent it back. It was pretty nice, but it still just sounds like a mono speaker, with bass :-|
Not worth 200. Now if it was 2 of these for 100$, that would be worth it.
This is my favorite Alexa so far. Quick response to voice commands, ability to listen to Sirius channels, etc. The sound quality is excellent. Definitely a good investment.

I love my Alexa tower! I only say this... being of sound mind I WISH THE SUPPORT FOR ALEXA WAS BETTER! Here is a question my husband wants an answer for... how can the echo dot recognize his voice as well as mine???

It is always nice for a mother,student, grandmother,teacher, ect. to be able to give orders to an assistant. Love that my hands can be busy, but Alxa can handle the task. The "music Alexa"has beautiful sound to play any genre of music u feel like at the moment. Her jokes are also high quality!
I use this in my art studio for everything from playng music to turning on the lights. It is great to have the smart functionality in a great sounding speaker.
I have set two of these up in a small cabin to take the place of a standard stereo. Great sound and have the advantage of Alexa as well. Next step is to hook my turntable up to them.

Great sound. Be careful turning it up using the Amazon Alexa app. I accidentally touched the slider to 100% volume and my ears are ringing. This thing is loud! Integrates perfectly with Amazon Music HD.

Was looking at getting a sound bar but decided on Echo Studio instead.
Great sound and works perfectly with Fire Stick.
I also love how it can play my music.
Great speaker, awesome sound and capabilities
Easy to set up - nice sound
Having this frees up a lot of space in the house. Getting rid of a lot of CDs and stereo equipment. The sound is as good as high end stereos from years ago. Very acceptable for me.

This is garbage. I couldn’t get device connected to xfinity. What a waste of time and energy. Don’t bother calling for support, there won’t be any. This is my fist negative review. Hopefully it will be my last.

Sound is very good for a small speaker - voice recognition has been spot on. I have had issues with Bluetooth with other speakers (Bose in particular) when connecting to any Alexa - nice to have it all in one and have great sound.

I actually like it very much.. I was disappointed in the sound. I was hoping more of a stereo sound. I am thinking I may of been thinking of the sound of the subwolfer for more base. I might as well add that and see how that sounds. I can always return it. I have. The studio and two dots. I regifted my original Alexa. My friend loves the Alexa. I do to.

Easy to connect multiple speakers. For the money, decent but not great sound. There seems to big, uneven jump in the volume control towards the higher end. I am satisfied as it is doing what I thought it would.

I have had an Amazon Echo from the get go, but the sound does not compare with the Amazon Echo Studio I got for Christmas. The sound is so rich and deep! It fills my large living room like it was a concert hall. Bravo, Amazon!

This is hands down the best smart speaker for the price. It sounds excellent and you can’t beat Alexa. I’m tempted to buy a second one so I can replace my home theater soundbar. I just wish the whole Fire Stick/Cube wasn’t necessary for movies and such. Other than that I highly recommend this speaker.

It’s bonkers!
Best sounding echo especially when used with hd Amazon music
Good bass response. I am not an audiophile, and this speaker meets my needs perfectly. Really fills the room with music. It is a bit large and placing it in a. Unobtrusive spot may be a challenge.

Intermediate sound loss from the left or the right channel in home theater set up. It happens during music or movies. When it works it works great. It appears to be a software problem. Customer support corrected a problem I had and probably others had with YouTube. Hopefully tech support can correct this intermittent audio problem between my cube and two echo studios. Praying for it every day. I wonder if Roku speakers have similar problem?
Awesome sound from a small speaker
You need to scream over top of music playing for Alexa to hear you!
The sound on this device is wonderful! The only thing I was disappointed by, was I couldn't get hooked up to my Samsung large screen TV. I was hoping I could.

My only problem is i have one studio already and was trying to set the second one up to play with the first one so i could get even more sound in my garage but no matter what i do i cant get the 2 units to work togeather i can get them to pair left and right but only one will play i can put them into a group and still only one will play.

The sound is amazing for it's size. I use this as a base and have 5 echo dots throughout our home. When we say to play music everywhere, we get music and quality sound everywhere. This is by far one of Amazon's best devices yet.
A good "echo" device but the sound didn't have the punch I was hoping. My similar size Bose speakers sound deeper. Perhaps just need a separate subwoofer.
Speaker issues when connecting to fire stick. It cuts in and out at random.

You don't know how good this thing is until you feed it right. I am going from my Sharp TV to my old Sony E9000ES via a digital cable. I then go trough a Behringer FBQ 3102. And then I go to the Echo Studio. The sound from this Girl here is clean and you get some base that you would expect from a 12" sub. I didn't notice any distortion. Now, if you're crazy like I am and you throw in 2 Definitive Technology SC2000, you'll feel an earthquake with the sound still clean all around..

I have several echo dots around the house. I bought the Echo Studio so I could have it by my TV and have a superior sound. The sound is weak, empty with no substance behind it. For the money, I'd just keep my dots. At higher volumes though the sound is very good.

The sound quality is decent, but nothing outstanding. The biggest issue is it would not connect to "everywhere" or "all rooms group" so when I want to to play the same music that is being played on all my other Alexa devices in different rooms, it does not.
3D radio was impressive. I purchased the echo studio mainly for the built in hub. Amazon tech support was way off in regards helping with integration. Thank goodness for “You Tube”.

I sincerely love these Amazon Echo Studio speakers with Alexa. I bought 3.
Two I use in living room as stereo (one for left channel and the other for eight channel).
I was apprehensive before I heard them, but once they played my music I was like: “WOW”. I was amazed. Love them.
I am going to add the subwoofer (not that I need it because the bass sounds great), but I am a musician who plays the BASS, lol. Couldn’t resist.
Perfect for my outdoor area.

The sound is great on this but it doesn’t seem top connect to the internet as well as the first generation echo nor does the voice recognition pick up well. We have it in our kitchen and use the timer function for cooking a lot - when trying to turn off the timer you often have to repeat yourself 4-5 times before the timer alarm Willa ctually turn off. This never happened with our first echo. The sound quality when it manages to play music is great through.

It’s nice until the music cut out constantly please I have a song shut off then I’ll start on the next song play half shut off

Doesn’t with metal country opera any type of music
Sounds much better when the volume is turned up. Remember you can go into the Alex app and change the highs, mids and lows. Haven't tried the 3D music yet.

This speaker is loud! I don’t plan on pairing it with a sub because I live in an apartment and the base on this thing thumps hard. I do plan on getting a second echo studio so I can pair them together for amazing surround sound!

First one received did not set up at all. Excellent help desk made a gallant effort but determined it had to be replaced. Second one set up very fast and the process was straightforward. I have some issues as I have numerous devices and with one more added there seems to be address conflicts. I recommend product highly.

I am reviewing all of my echo speakers; studios, sub, echo gen 4s, echo gen 3s, echo dots gen 3 and input connected to a Bose speaker all in a multi-room group. No complaints on the product or on the efforts of the customer service employees. If you have connection problems look to your router setting. It cleared all of my connection issues.
The Speaker is way Nice. But its almost the worst to listen to the Radio on it(Radio Adds keep on saying "Alexa" IN THEIR ADDS). Just change her name then you will be fine.
The sound quality is not that great. I’m starting to think it’s defective.
I wish she could hear our voice a little better over the music. I also wish she didn’t have to be plugged in to use all the time! Other than those two things, the sound is fantastic!

I LOVE this speaker. I have linked up my other Echo's in all the other rooms and it is so cool! The quality of sound is pretty good and I love being able to speak to it and have anything I'm in the mood to listen to available at command.
It sounds fantastic. It's just really large. I wish it were a little smaller.

I like the sound the speaker output but I don't like when I tell Alex to do something and she won't hear me or don't know what to do ) plus I got 2 echo studio and pair them but I also purchase a echo dot 4 and when I say Alex they both answer and they cancel each other!!!!! It get really annoying 😒 but other then that it sound great 👍each dot 4 sound it okay I got the one with a clock ⏰😌!!!

I am just getting to know everything that Echo can do! It is totally amazing and I highly recommend it to everyone. Alexa play music! Alexa print a crossword puzzle! Alexa tell me a joke! Alexa do whatever!
As described.
Very poor, good thing I kept my Old speaker
Was excited about this but it always had audio issues playing from Amazon Firestick.. it pretty much can’t make it through a single episode of TV without losing audio.
Better than the original but some design features could be better. Top light ring not noticeable enough. Needs a dimable clock/ day date/ weather, with color choices.
I have this paired with a sub and I usually have it with an echo when I play music and the three together are the perfect system for music in an open style home. Great base and full surround sound.

I love the sound WHEN it works. Bought this to use with my TV but regrettably, there’s either a delay (which makes watching awkward) or the sound will randomly mute, and unplugging is the only way I can get audio to come back. At times, when streaming music it will also just stop playing.-my regular echos continue, so I know it’s not my internet. When it does play, the sound quality is awesome.

This is the best Echo stand-alone device so far to play music. The sound quality is generally quite good but can be a bit muddy and boomy with strong bass. It reminds me of Bose systems of the past. Incrediably simple to set up and use!
I wanted a better sounding alexa for my deck in the summer with better bass. The studio is a vast difference over my echo so I'm very pleased so far.
The Echo Studio has vast sound improvement over Amazon Echo (standard); however, some music sounds muddled. Used primarily (for music) with Spotify.

I bought the Echo Studio with the idea of pairing it to the Fire TV and use it as a sound enhancement for the TV I have in my room. In two weeks since I've had it has been giving me so much trouble that the only solution is to unpair them and factory reset the Fire TV (which has worked flawlessly before buying the Echo Studio). This solution was the only option tech support gave me after running some other options. This works until the next time it doesn't...

I created a stereo system with 2 echo studios and a fire stick 4k. By and large the system works well when content originates from the fire stick 4k. I wish Amazon puts the mini toslink connections to better use. In my configuration toslink is useless. Any input from toslink connection works with only the connected speaker the other speaker in the pair doesn't get the signal. If they address this issue, a couple of these speakers connected to TVs would improve the experience quite a bit.

Pro:
Sound quality is great, and size is good.

Con:
Does not easily pair with previous Echo devices, however there is a workaround
The Bluetooth connection with my pc is not automatically connecting the studio . It should be automatic connect to my pc desktop every time I turn on my desktop computer but it’s not .

Product well constructed. Sound quality does not exceed that of latest generation Show. Not a bad deal for the money, but is not going to knock your socks off even with the Amazon HD subscription. I even tried it with the TV as a speaker. lips synced well with the optical cord sound was flat.
I have to say I'm incredibly impressed by the sound that comes out of this thing, it's a relatively small form factor, but has no problem filling your room with amazing sound.

I purchased two of these and a subwoofer. The sound quality on these is outstanding. There isn’t even a need for a subwoofer. But I told my wife that the two Echo studio’s only will work in conjunction WITH the subwoofer. That may or may not be true but that’s ok.
The Regular echo work better , something is loss signals

The sound quality is terrific. Waiting to add Sub for even greater enjoyment. The Amazon install instruction could be better, Such as need to disconnect VPI for TV theater set up. Explanation of Groups and Rooms can be better.
Since there are not many 3D recordings, I added 3rd Gen Echo and sound quality is much better, although it is not Stereo. You can't use Studio with Echo to do stereo. Only 2 echos can pair.
I really like this smart speaker. Maybe not quite the volume I expected, but decent nonetheless. Maybe just a little overpriced. I bought 2 on sale.
This thing Knox. If I turn to the highest volume I can hear it in every room in my house. Nice clear and clean. I bought the echo. Which is nice. But this has great sound great Bass and clarity
The sound quality is great! Only issue is sometimes the volume of Alexa is very low compared to the music it plays. I wish you could change the volume settings for each individually

The sound quality is great! One can adjust the bass, and treble from the alexa app. Alexa works really well. Has a lot of features. I would recommend a Subwoofer bar, if you want a home theatre quality. But, if you are just listening to music, or need a good sounding speaker for home gatherings, this speaker is perfect!! I just hope the product lasts me at least 3-5 years.
This thing sounds AMAZING! I heard one on display and pre-ordered it. I am very happy with this purchase. My girlfriend is jealous of Alexa now!
Only reason this isn’t a 5 ⭐️ rating is because they do not work well for what I needed them for. The product itself is perfect. Cannot wait for the next gen to come out.
Poor quality

One annoying point is that after requesting Alexa to play music, the speakers sometimes start the music before you can actually hear it. It's like a disc jockey talking over the beginning of a song...annoying. Otherwise, I really like this system.

I really like this Echo and got it for a good price. However, this is second Amazon device that was sold as new, but what arrived was an opened box with an obviously used item. Amazon offered both times to replace the items, but it’s taken a month to arrive.

 Mientras funciono todo bien, unas sola semana de uso, se cambio de la sala a la cocina y no volvió a prender y me cuesta casi 100 dólares devolverlo desde mi país para que me puedan devolver el dinero y Desde mi Panamá no sale código en su página para llamar a el servicio al cliente o que me llamen para que me den una respuesta.
sounds really good for it's size it's about as big as a large folgers can and heavy but I like it think I might get another for stereo sound but it's pretty good stand alone
Great speaker as a stand alone or paired with other Alexa devices. Best sound than any of the previous devices. Would be nicer if it were portable.

happy new year to all my name is Larry I am a blind musician the product is awesome I have one question could you please put on either a thumb drive or HCD the instructional material for the blind who cannot read any of the manuals, there are a lot of questions that I need answers for the setting up of the different types of 3-D and spatial sound etc. thank you so very much may you all have a very happy new year thank you again Larry from Boston
I love good music but not the huge boom boxes I used to have. This speaker is great. I just hope I connect my cd player to it. Any one knows how?

While the studio is much larger than other echo speakers it isn't nearly as large as it sounds. The sound is clear and robust with crystal clear highs, clean midrange and deep bass. Amazon has really pulled off a significant feat with this speaker.

While the unit is very impressive and delivers a nice sound stage, I am very unhappy with the poor or lack of music streaming services support. Amazon services yes... full support. TIDAL, etc... horrid if nonexistent. You can do better.

Echo Studio sounds simply awesome.

But it stops working randomly(reported that issue and waiting for fix, I am really hoping it to be a software issue). I’ll update my review once issue is fixed.

But the sound quality and compatibility is definitely something that beat it’s competitors(And I am talking about HomePod).
Sounds awesome! It doesn’t listen to me so perfectly at times (not a usual occurrence) but I’m a mom so I’m used to having to repeat myself at times!!

This thing is great. It’s a quality sound system with the added benefit of also being an Alexa. The voice recognition doesn’t seem to be any better than a standard Alexa. But besides that it great. Great bass and very loud.

This thing is amazing. It is a good bit bigger than I expected but after hearing the amount of sound it puts out I know why. The studio will not just fill the room with sound but super high quality crystal clear highs and mids and deep lows. Super impressed and considering purchasing another one.

Not ready for prime time technology. Got two of these with the ECHO sub and audio is constantly sputtering while watching a movie over my 4k fire stick (200Mb connection, 2.4,5 mimo ac2100 router 20 feet away)

It is great for music and the 7 microphones built in are fantastic, but it has a problem with connecting from another device through the optical cable. it keeps disconnecting and you have to unplug it and plug it back in to reconnect. To me, this is a big problem.

We were nervous the sound would not be adequate for our great room with its high ceilings, but it fills the space nicely. We added a few echo dots in the adjacent rooms and it syncs together perfectly. We are very happy with the setup!
I haven't needed any tech support, so I don't know anything about that. I love the sound quality. I'm thinking about adding a deep bass speaker.

Well first of all let me say , I feel that the Echo Studio has VERY GOOD Sound, but when I played Rocket Man by Elton John in 3D, I was blown away. My only problem is trying to figure out how to make it work as far as with my TV, Blu-ray Player.
I love this smart speaker! I have Alexa echos in 3 rooms and this big one in my Family Room. The HD quality is amazing. So glad I bought it!
We wanted better sound in our kitchen than we could get from the medium size Echo, and we got in this package better than we could have expected.

This was our first purchase of this type of device. My husband did some research and we settled on this along with a couple of echoes. We couldn’t be happier. The sound quality is great we use it for music and radio during the daytime.
Bonus: The ability to tell Alexa “ add this to my shopping list” is a godsend! No more forgetting what I was going to add when I get to my list 😀

Echo Studio delivers music the way you want it, either low and soft or loud and strong depending on the music you like. It is a little heavy and right so with the hardware inside. A little costly, but then the small size delivers the sound...
These replaced my Sountouch and work great thru out my house with my older Echos and dots I not play Pandora in every room in sync. Lovely.
This is a great speaker for my living room.Love the Dolby feature and off course Alexa.Can connect to fire stick for great sound for movies or videos.
Used in the family room and the sound quality is amazing. I purchased the subwoofer along with it. However, the bass in the echo studio is great on its own. I am so very pleased with this purchase
If you think the echo is good this studio is 10 times better and louder with clarity. The bass will shake the floor. Voice recognition is more sensory even and louder volumes. Amazon must have!!!!

Fantastic room-filling sound. Crystal clear.

Would I buy another one? Absolutely and I will. These can be paired for stereo sound.

Alexa Studio has been a blast to use these past weeks. Excellent bass and treble, and bumping that mid range up as well only makes the sound feel like im at a concert, pluging it in to my xbox made my zombies mode on black ops 3 sound like It was in front of me. If you are a home person like me and love to entertain yourself with eletronics then this is the one for you to enjoy your music and make your gaming or movie 10 times more Immersive. 5 stars
Music sound quality is good, but when it's paired with the TV, it doesn't play as loud. I have it on the patio, so it would be nice if it would play louder.
I like the Studio much better than the Apple HomePod, deeper bass, better midrange but it's significantly bigger than the HomePod. Overall, I would highly recommend the Studio.

Still getting used to her but so far love it. Music and controls are very convenient, audiophiles might pick it apart but for normal folk its does a great job. Set alarms, ask questions about just about anything mainstream, recipes, news weather, capitol of Kazakhstan, flip a coin or whatever. Haven't got into the home controls yet but I will, lots to still explore!
When I receive the Echo Studio - High-fidelity smart speaker I was amazed how heavy it was it's the perfect speaker to make my home theater
Love this speaker. Connected it to the Home Theater but use if more just to listen to music. Our living room comes alive when we play music.

We picked this up to get Sirus XM and this is a superb product. Great sound. Works well, we are able to get Sirus, local FM radio and WABC in New York (we live in Texas). This is a nice companion to our home.
I have three echo dots, two echo shows and bought this echo studio thinking the sound would be far superior to the others. I don’t hear it.

Sound quality wasn’t as good as I was expecting after seeing and reading other reviews. With that said, I do like the Alexa functionality and hub built in. I haven’t tried it for movies yet, but with Atmos Firestick functionality it is something that adds a nice bit of additional flexibility.
Really enjoy the sound coming from this and plan to purchase a 2nd one!

Audio quality fantastic. But I still think the Echo Dot Plus out preforms this thing as far as other features are concerned. For example, the Studio cannot sense temperature but the Echo Dot Plus can. Was it worth the money? Idk, I have mixed feelings about it.
This is the true "Echo Pro"! Best sound and has all the perks of a standard Echo.
Integrates well into household decor amd I love how I can use my echo show and this Echo studio to communicate with the kids when they are in a room with an echo.
