 Excelente dispositivo
Really responsive, I can whisper the awake work and it hears that
Amazing sound!

This is my first Echo device and I couldn't be more pleased with it. Easy set-up, fabulous sound quality - the packaging made me smile! I'm glad I waited for this edition. When I move into a larger place, I will definitely buy additional units.

Music playback sounds great, audio through an auxiliary cord is quiet. My biggest problem is the damn thing turns on by itself in the middle of the night and starts blasting music. Also turns music on full blast every time I tell it to turn the lights off.

It’s disappointing when a product is marketed exclusively for another product which is almost nonexistent. I can hardly find 3D music outside of the sanctioned Amazon playlists and there is no way to find what else may be out there without going on a needle in the haystack search.

I’m extremely disappointed by this product which was marketed on a service in which I pay a monthly subscription for and is nearly nonexistent 2 months after launch.

Outstanding sound. I purchased 2 for stereo sound. Small footprint with great sound, easy to set up and use. Bought 1 for my sister in law who often needs help with electronics but she set this up in minutes
I like using this with the Fire Stick. I added one Echo Dot with it and it sounds very good. I plan on adding another Echo Dot to the mix.
The sound is real good for its size.....but I wasn’t blown away....I was a little disappointed after watching and reading the great reviews on it.
It was way easier to hook up than the sub and it sounds better. You don’t have to worry which speaker is compatible, they all are in a group.
Better sound but not worth the upgrade. Large footprint is also hard to conceal. Would love this if audio quality was a couple steps higher or possibly as a first echo device
This is definitely an improvement over the standard Echo, but if you are looking for a huge difference, you're likely to be disappointed.
Love everything about it. Fills the room it is in. I wasn't able to use the android app, though. I had to use the Alexa web interface.
I love this speaker. The bass is great!! It’s a great addition to the 5 dots that we have, bringing the bass in for our surround sound! Definitely worth the money.

So I bought a Sony sound bar for my TV and Alexa. 6 months later after being unhappy with the sound quality but live the subwoofer on the Sony-I bought this! I’m in heaven, I’m ok with technology but not great-this was easy to setup and use. It sounds amazing and I have a 1700 square foot home-it sounds great everywhere!! Don’t buy the sound bar-get this!!!!
Really liking this purchase! The sound quality is awesome. I listen to a lot of music, use Alexa to communicate through the house, etc.
Very good speaker. I hooked it up to a my Hisense TV equipped with a Fire TV Stick 4k. And it connect the Fire TV flawlessly through Alexa. The sound is good enough for movie and music.
Bass, volume. a little let down by that, but sound quality is excellent, and has been a great start to turning my home into a smart one.
A compact speaker with Alexa and room filling sound. Also connects to Fire TV Stick 4K for great sound from your TV set. I’m very happy.
I enjoyed the first one enough to buy a second. I bought my girlfriend one so she could listen to music while she works. I like it well enough to buy one for myself.
The audio qualities of this item are a great value for the money. The effectiveness and functionality qualities are superb comparatively speaking.
Its loud, it sounds good and it works well. However amazon wont allow it to be used as a home theater setup unless its paired with a fire tv. Very annoying.
This is replacing larger speakers in the house plan on buying another one and a sub to go along. I’ m hoping this will come close to the larger Speakers I had .
Had a bit of trouble getting these set up as a pair.Have 2 +a sub.They sometimes unpair and occasionally won't turn off.Just got these so still playing around with them.Will update in a week or so!

Really like the compact size and sound quality, however the sub and studio linked controls each other’s equalizer. If I want more base in the sub it will also up the studio..😳 can Amazon fix this or am I doing something wrong?

I primarily use my studio to play music from my spotify account it constantly disconnects. A lot of times when I try to play from spotify it wont even start playing on the speaker. Not sure if a spotify issue with the studio specifically or a studio problem. never had a problem with spotify on any other alexa device though

The Harmon Kardon Invoke that we had with Cortana had superior sound quality far and away. Unfortunately, it was discontinued which is the only reason we got this Echo Studio. One would think with a name like Echo Studio it would have much better sound quality than the muddy mess it has.
I have called up old favorite tunes and heard things that I never noticed before. A lot of sound from a small unit. A good buy - recommended
Alexa has a hard time responding to my requests. I was also disappointed in the volume of this echo. I thought for $200 the volume would be louder.
A great addition to my Alexa/Echo series.....excellent sound quality for my family room and easy to install/integrate. Works seamless like all Alexa devices.

If you have a small to medium sized space in your home and you want a clear sounding Alexa unit, look no further because for the price, this is a great unit. It should also be noted that the unit is attractive and lends to the decor.

I bought this for my Patio and the quality is just what I was looking for.
No need for complicated multi speaker system, just plug it in and you have great music and sound.

I just received this and was super excited to get it in however it doesn't connect to the Alexa "everywhere" integration option nor does it listen to commands well. Super bummed as I was really excited to try this speaker but for the $200.00 price tag, it's being returned.
Easy setup, great sound for Bedroom tv also echo remote paired to it is a nice upgrade.
I use it all the time for lots of things, timers, reminders, shopping list, and especially MUSIC. This thing has awesome sound and very happy with it.
I love it! I will be buying another one! That's if I can find a place for all my speakers. Sounds great, great quality, easy setup. Its worth the price!
Terrible product. After much contact with amazon to trouble shoot why the sound constantly skips I am returning it. Not worth the sound and comparability issues.
Great speaker, but the voice recognition can be frustrating. Really wish it also worked with YouTube music.

The Echo Studio was plug and play into our wifi network and smart home devices network. There was only one light that needed to be reset to connect. We have a large open common area and the speakers fill the space nicely with sound.
The sound is rich and crystal clear. The interface between my cable and the speaker is not seamless when watching on demand, but it can be integrated.
Exceeds my high expectations! Like it so much, I’ve ordered a second!
This unit is a nice upgrade from other Echos 👍🏻👍🏻.. sound quality is awesome and we really enjoy listening to our music on it .

But I was proven wrong! This thing sounds amazing. It will easily replace a small sound system for a living room. I do think it could be a little cheaper, as it's pretty pricey. But I am happy with it none the less.

The sound quality was horrible. Sounded like an old AM/FM radio despite trying to recalibrate twice. It was also glitchy when trying to use Spotify. Lastly, I received the box with all my Alexa gear that I purchased and noticed that the seal on the Echo Studio box had been broken. This must have been a return from someone else that found its way back into stock without being tested.
Echo is supposed to be a smart device, but....if you tell Alexa "increase the volume by 10%" it will put the volume at 100%. What a stupid device.

I replaced the original Echo in my exercise room with this speaker and it was a great upgrade. A bonus is that it also includes a ZigBee hub. I was impressed with the bass and it fills the room with sound that I can hear over the sound of the treadmill. I will be looking to buy another one when I find the right price point on Amazon.
It's hands down the best speaker in the echo lineup. It is superb in every regard. I love it so much I'm buying a second one to pair with it and the subwoofer.
I held off purchasing for too long! How could this little speaker fill a room with 18 ft ceilings and a whole lot of space? I'm blown away. Rich sounds and a great base.
I'm really surprised with the sound quality of these speakers. I bought two and joined them as left and right. Great sound and great look.

Sounds good highs and mid but lacks in bass a little. Wish they would make on for real audio heads, even if the price increased I would buy. It is not high Fidelity (audiophile) quality but still is a nice speaker.

I usually dont write reviews, however, I feel very strongly about the Echo Studio and want others to know that you will not be disappointed with this purchase.
I am excited to buy another and run these babies in stereo. I am BLOWN AWAY by how it sounds by itself. I am also interested in using these with my television for their Dolby Atmos capabilities.
GREAT BUY!!!!!!!!!
Works well nice little speaker love it thank you Sound well when you hook up bass speaker and the two echo darts nice sound system
My family loves it. We also like the option to connect with our other speaks including Google while listening to Alex speakers .

Awesome product!! Awesome sound.. I think the only thing missing to make it better is the ability to disconnect it from the charger and make it wireless so I can move it to my back yard.. but that’s why I bought the echo dot !!
Sound is great just disappointed that my 2 year old firestick was "outdated" & forced to buy another product to enjoy fully. I hope that Amazon does not follow this path of non-updateable products.
This speaker is great! This is one of the best speakers I own. The sound quality is amazing and the bass is crazy! I love it. This speaker is definitely worth the money. I will be purchasing more.
The sound is excellent and very surroundsound capable, I wish I could hide it invisible in the middle of the room . It works well with the sub I put it 10 feet away I put it 10 feet away great!
The very best sound system i ever have from my LG,Bose,Sony and yamaha sound bar..im very happy with my two echo studio and sub of course..thanks to amazon
Audio quality is good (not great). Good value. Small size. Nice appearance. Alexa commands are mostly effective (not always).
The title says it all. The sound is quite good but not great and seems a little inadequate to fill a large space (e.g., a large family room and kitchen combination)
Tried to connect with Fire cube and my TV. After 4 hours we gave up. The problem was related to my cable service. Returned products.

Decent speaker -- but the 3D sound capabilities are in my opinion over hyped. Have also noticed occasional issues with video/audio synchronization when paired with a 4K FireTV stick that can generally be cured by briefly pausing the video. Overall I like the speaker and will likely pick up a second to pair with the first, but you need to be realistic about your expectations...
Doesn't disconnect the speaker when you plug in a headphone. The hub is a nice feature for those who have/want home automation.
I currently own 16 echo devices... 3 of them the echo studio. Placing them among the others makes the whole house sound amazing!

The sound quality is wonderful, Alexa can hear me from another room or while she’s blasting my toons. I’ve installed this as the speaker for my tv and don’t have any issues with sound matching mouths moving or anything.

I listen to Sirius/XM radio through this speaker and it sounds amazing! If I wasn't so cheap I would buy two and pair them! This was easy to setup and easy to pair with my existing Bluetooth devices. I would buy this again if it comes on sale!

We were very eager to try this after we had so much trouble connecting a new Bose speaker to our account. We returned that speaker to get the Studio and couldn't be happier. It sounds great and connects seamlessly to our dots. I will say that the sound doesn't quite have the body as the Bose...but then again, it's almost half the price. I couldn't be happier with our purchase and will definitely be getting another one in the future. I think two of them would sound even better!

I bought from Best Buy. Was looking at Bose or Sonos. I listened to Echo Studio and loved the sound. Looked at box and said Bluetooth. I thought like 99% other sound bars, or sound cubes could play music. NOPE.
You have to have WiFi to use the device and I bought for my office. No WiFi. Was highly disappointed because I loved sound. Ughhhhhhhh

The best sounding Echo that Amazon has put out there.. Better than my Echo2 , better than my Dot3 , better than my show10 or 5.. better than my paired 2 Echo2's with sub.. Might put he sub with it to see how thay sound together...

I bought this because I am hard of hearing and I have two other Alexis so now I have one in my bedroom one in my living room and one in my garage which are out on three different levels. I had one of the first echoes that came out

came out and I still like it very much it’s the Echo Dot and I use it more than anything because it’s right beside my bed. I am 87 years old.
Sound cuts out a lot and speaker constantly didn't respond. When it works it is fantastic but too many bugs make it a no go for me
I love this Echo Studio speaker. The only flaw is that for the money, it really should be a little louder with a tad more base but I suppose it gets the job done.

Up until yesterday it kept turning the music off by itself after an hour or so but recently it has stayed on. It was claiming that there wasn’t any activity for hours when it had only been an hour if that. However , it just stopped doing that.

The Echo Dot's big brother, the Studio provides a room filling sound. The audio balance sounds good and provides good base without drowning out the mid and high range notes. At this time, the holiday music streaming from Amazon Prime Audio sounds great!

Wow ! The sound is way better than our current Bose Wave Stereo. And with a pair of the Studios, it’s even better. Love the convenience of not having to tune into an FM station or load CDs. My Christmas favorite.

Very glitchy. It never works for me. We’ve had this since it first came out and I wish I would have returned this in time. I’m very upset that I’ve wasted $200 on a product that doesn’t work. For example, today we can’t even get the studio to play sound after various resets. I’ve read of others with this issue. Once we do get it working, it works for a few days and then we have to reset or spend hours troubleshooting.

Looking for sound to fill you room and watch that 85” tv like tour in a movie theater. But two studio speakers and the sub. Case closed.
I originally purchased two echo speakers and was like ok this is nice then a friend laughed at me and convinced me to get the echo studios. I was have been amazed at the sound.

Simply Amazing. The sound build and sound quality are top notch. We bought this mainly to use outside on the perfect summer days. Excellent for the family get together's around the BBQ kicking back a few beers while listing to your favorite tunes.

I love this speaker. Alexa is very helpful, knowledgeable and humorous. My musical requests are almost always recognized and played. The volume reaches high levels w/ good clarity. Alexa is very useful for setting alarms, stating facts and providing the weather forecast. She also tells jokes and can rap. When I ask a question that she can't answer, she replies that she doesn't know the answer. I'd recommend this Echo Studio to everyone.
Love almost everything about this! Sound is amazeballs!! Voice recognition isn’t perfect, but it’s better than the Echo Show.
Sound quality is far superior to Apple HomePod and Google Home Max, but Alexa still struggles to follow basic commands.
The sound is amazing and feels the room completely. We have had if for a week and I don't think it has ever missed a command.
Bought this on prime day - Oct 13th and it shows delivery on December 24 to December 29! Insane.
This is definitely the best sounding Echo speaker, but it's very responsive in hearing my voice and responding... impressed!

I purchased a 4K fire TV stick and an Amazon echo studio, looking to play the audio through the studio from fire tv. It hasn’t worked since day one and tech-support still has not provided a real solution. The unit sounds fine but can’t use it the way I intended.

One of the best purchases we made...so happy with clarity,the speaker plays music beautifully....
We love this speaker.
This speaker sounds ten times more robust than the standard echo. Fills the room with great bass and sounds much bigger than the footprint it takes up. Highly recommend

Our kitchen/dining room/sitting room are all in a very open space on the first floor of our house. This thing is great for providing quality sound in the entire space. I am still getting acquainted with Alexa and all they have to offer, but so far, the ease of use has been outstanding.

Echo Studio fits in with my video wall. High Def Flat screens with Amazon HD Sound completes in home studio experience. Intend to continue with Wifi lighting and wifi light switches at later date. Echo Studio can act as my household WiFi Hub. Controlling all rooms in the house; lighting, HVAC Control. Over time Echo will be the hub I use to make my digital home come true.
Well the only thing is it doesn't have enough bass for me I like just a little more bass but other than that its first rate.

This is by far the best alexa device I have bought. The sound is amazing. You can have the volume full blast and alexa still responds. Extremely easy to get set up. By far a 10 out of 5 star! Would most deff suggest buying this.

Not exactly all it was hyped up to be in my opinion. I expected to be blown away by the sound quality and 3D immersion. I was not that impressed not $200 bucks worth. Could have had a Bose for that price.
Great quality sound. I have a dot, fire cube and an older Alexa and this thing blows them away as far as sound quality goes.
The sound quality is incredibly good for the price. I use it in my room for Pandora music and it is plenty loud, and it hits all the right notes.

Lives up to the excellent reviews.
I'm using it as expernal pc speaker, with analog input. Works well for that too. Sometimes the audio goes to power save, but a loud volume on the input line will wake it up.
I really like this smart speaker. It sounds really good in my opinion. It is easy to pair other devices (phone, tablet, laptop) to it.
Sounds really good for its size. Fills the room with really good quality sound. Bass is good nice and deep. Crisp all the way around. Good buy.

The Echo Studio has better bass than an Echo does, but not as much as a Sonos does. I wanted to get the Sonos added to my Alexa everywhere group, but it wouldn't work, so had to settle for the Echo Studio.

Recently upgraded all Alexas to the larger Studio devices. While the sound is much better the devices don't always recognize voice commands. Even standing right over it and clearly saying stop playing music it pauses to listen to me but then resumes playing music. Not worth the extra money by always having to repeat myself asking simple commands the device and sometimes ignored all together.
Great speaker I placed it on my computer desk and use it as computer gaming speaker as well. Sounds great.
I wanted to love this. I tried setting it up as a speaker for my tv. Voice command is glitchy. Very frustrating.
I have not needed tech support so I have no clue how it would be but the studio itself is loud and awesome.

Love the sound quality. Amazing
Value for money. Feeling a little ripped off by Sonos right now. Considering selling all my Sonos devices and replacing them with echo studios.

Disappointed! There is plenty of bass, but the music does sound like it's coming out of a little box. It's slightly better than the Echo Show, but not enough to keep it. I don't understand how other reviewers can say it's like the musicians are really there.
The sound quality is different from the quality of the display item in the store. Have to now purchase a sub-wolfer to improve the bass.
I love the product pretty good sound. but if you need to yell at the thing to turn up or down or to change music it seems to be a problem.
It sounds beautiful and was super easy to set up. I have other Alexa devices so I just plugged it in and it did the rest.
I bought when it was 15% on sale, sound better than echo plus 2, sound quality is base on where you place your unit. I had to adjust equalizer for maximum bass to feel it.
Doesn't get extremely loud, but the quality is top notch and the integration and pairing with other studios and subs is great.
I bought this Alexa model because I use Alexa primarily to listen to music. I couldn't be happier with the sound quality
The speaker has better sound than my original echo, series 1. I like the volume buttons, since it is located beside me.
The sound is fantastic. I've been listening to an echo and a couple of dots. This filled the room with really rich sound.

Bought this for the kitchen after moving an Apple HomePod to another room. Out the box the sound is not as full as the HomePod. Worked with the eq a bit and was able to get more full sound. The Alexa integration is great, as she is smarter than Siri.

Voice recognition needs and second request fairly often. The sound is good overall but I had expected a bit more bass. Perhaps that is why the subwoofer is being sold. I have a Sonos One also and have to say the sound is better with Sonos but the Alexa integration is weak.
Great sound and features, the only flaw is that when it’s connected to tv via optic cable you can’t control volume from your tv remote.
Based on what other reviewers said, I purchased 2 speakers to pair in stereo. It really does make a difference. When I start music and sometimes only one speaker plays, I can tell immediately.
Disappointed in sound of unit. Cant tell it apart from my other echos nd it was $200, also dont like shape or size of it
This is beautiful sound and I’m very happy with it. It was very easy to set up and connect to my Amazon dots and my TV.
I read comments about pairing it with a second Echo studio and I beleve that is a very good idea to complete a good speaker and make the combo great!
This thing sounds like it's packed with alien technology! Lol, this thing legit sounds like a $1500 deep Badd home theater system.

I bought several Alexa devices and they will not effectively integrate with Spotify. I can get them to work sporadically, but almost always when I try to play the music on a speaker group (so it's in my whole house) they will simply go silent.
Got this for the garage to integrate Amazon music in addition to the Echo Link. The sound is so awesome we plan to buy more for other rooms.

As expected, the Studio features greatly improved sound quality as opposed to the Echo Dot 2nd Generation that I had been using. The bass is resonant and punchy even at low volume and the higher frequencies are clear and crisp. A big, immediately noticeable improvement. Setup was seamless- essentially plug 'n play. This device is money well spent, IMHO.
I have 2 Echo Studios and Echo Sub. Love the sound and Alexa integration. Set-up a little wonky at times. Overall very pleased with the product.
Sound quality isn’t as good as advertised. It’s better than the other models, but that’s a low standard to beat. The Apple HomePod sounds much better.

I have a 2nd gen echo and was looking at an upgrade. i am so happy I did!

I am not sure why there is so much hate for the stereo spatial enhancement. Review after review, I see the recommendation to turn this feature off. Without it, I find the sound to be thin. With it on, I hear a rich balanced fuller sound

This is great for my apartment and I couldn't be happier with this purchase

Honestly I was hoping to like it. Tried to hook up to tv with optical cable and there’s a sound delay so it looks like everyone is lip singing... the sound wasn’t that great either...I was hoping for better. Also linking groups of echo speakers should be easier. They get disconnected. Tech support was good but they said they get these complaints often.

I set up 2 of these devices in a pair, and had them play some music as a pair. At first, the balance seemed a bit off, but soon, it was perfect. It had adjusted itself for the room perfectly. I'm hearing things in songs I had never heard before.. a bass riff here, the individual voices in a harmony there... this is better than even high end headphones.
I bought 2 for studio surround sound with Dolby atoms on my fire tv. The sound is good when it works but it constantly disconnects and skips and cuts out. Wish I could return them.
I was honestly expecting a little more on sound quality. I ordered the upgrade amazon HD for extra cost hoping to get more out if this speaker but I didn't notice much improvement.
The sound is good when it actually stays connected. Bluetooth constantly being dropped. Goes offline all the time.
Very disappointed in the fact that it would not link with my two echoes to simulate a surround sound and the bass was sub-par.

Great sound quality! I have several in my house, and recently gave some Prime-Day ones as gifts.
The one I use the most is in my bedroom on my night-stand; I use it as an alarm clock, a radio (with TuneIn Radio),
for emergency weather alerts and daily weather, music (Amazon Music Unlimited, my Pandora radio stations),
and to manage-and-control Alexa-enabled home devices.
A great device that fills the room with high-end sound. This is my 6th Alexa device (now one in almost every room); for music this is the best.
Great sound!! Integrates with other Alexa based products perfectly. Had this set up as primary sound along with an echo sub for our Fire Stick 4K and loved it!

I love this speaker! Great sound and really good bass from an Amazon speaker. Once I went into the Alexa app and brought the highs and Mids up a little bit the sound was fantastic. I will definitely be buying another one.

Genuinely impressive for a small sound source.

Update 11/22/20 On my second unit. Just super glitchy. The optical cord creates havoc with this thing. You have to yell at it. Mic on my dots are way better. The price far exceeds the value. Sound quality is impressive when working just don't expect consistency as a television add on and to raise your voice.
The Alexa Echo Studio is amazing. My husband loves it. It delivers great sound quality and has so many options available to my Prime account.

I LOVE THE MUSIC ON THIS DEVICE!! However, I also use the Studio as a sound bar for my tv (it is an older tv so this is just my experience with that), and a lot of the time, the sibilant sounds from dialogue seem to distort the tweeter. I’m not sure if it has to do with some sort of age difference between the technologies, but it’s a bit disconcerting to be listening to a show and that distortion occurs every few minutes.
The voice recognition is better then some alexa products and with alexa integration i cause add other speakers but the sound quality alone is very good
Great sound definitely worth the money. We had to wait extra week because our original order got lost in delivery.
Sound is better and I’m glad I spent the extra $ to get this. Looks nicer in my living room then the other models.
This is a great sounding speaker for it's size. The way it seems to fill the room around you is incredible for the price.
its loud with really nice sound, however, some songs mid range are a little out of whack. but it is worth the money

Great speaker at a great price. I have a second one arriving today to pair with my first one (that I received shortly after these were released). The whole Ultra HD and 3D music subscription is not a gimmick and sounds wonderful...if you're a music lover like me this is an excellent and fairly priced device to enjoy listening to music and movies!
The set up was easy. The voice recognition took a few days to catch up. This was replacing my original echo which was series 1. I am very glad I upgraded to the Studio rather than the echo.
I love loud music and the other Alexa devices I had were great for a quieter situation. This one is my clean the house speaker😀
We got the Echo Studio to replace our old Harman-Kardon Aura. Sound is better. Going to buy a second one to have stereo effect.
Love this echo. Very well made and very powerful. Great for listening to music and for using as a Bluetooth device.
This was a gift for my wife as I could not stand her playing music through the dots. The sound quality was such that my neighbors ordered one the next day for their home.

Definitely a great product as far as sound, and functionality. When it comes to registering my voice with saying "alexa" it isnt the best. My echo 3rd gen seems to be better in the mic aspect. Either way, great product for the price. And sounds very very good. Not sure why people arent a fan of the 3d audio or whatever its called, sounds great with it on, and worse with out. But to each their own.
I am using 2 Studio speakers as a stereo pair. The sound is amazing and it was easy to set them up. Highly recommend!
Could be a good device, but Amazon’s Alexa servers are down and inoperable too often to make the echo worth it.
Easy set up and the sound is awesome. Connected to my note 20 ultra easily and I can listen to music on my SD card. Totally recommend.
Sound quality is good. I have to check to see if I am able to adjust it to my liking or not. All in all it sounds good.
Studios are great single or paired. Great sound. Great bass. I use them with their line level in port with my PC. PC gaming has never sounded better!!

Sound quality is generally very good, but frequently-in the middle of playing music - a shrieking noise that almost sounds like a chainsaw begins! If I turn off the speaker manually, wait and restart it, music resumes.

Excellent sound. Syncs up with my fire stick HD quite nicely. It definitely fills the room with high quality audio when you call for it. “Pair” (pun intended) this with your TV and Amazon Music HD for a truly pleasant experience.
Paired with a second studio for excellent hi-fi reproduction - Mozart in the bedroom! Vivaldi to gradual sleep!

Sounds good until it stops playback, usually about 1min into anything. The only way I’ve been able to fix it is to mute the microphone, which basically makes this a Bluetooth speaker without Alexa capabilities.
Unbeatable sound for the price. The highs/treble seems to be washed out slightly. But it still sounds fantastic.

I have friends with Alexa (not the Echo Studio) and I was surprised at the sound quality. I ordered the Echo Studio because it was the latest model. I expected the sound quality to be the same, maybe a little better. The sound quality is “Above and Beyond” my expectations.
Sometimes not all the time, when you ask Alexa to stop she continues to play forcing you to repeat yourself more than once sometimes up to five times.
I love the sound quality easy to use works great with my apple products loved it so much I bought another one.
I'm still learning the basics of Alexa but it's quite amazing. You just have to talk like you're having a conversation with someone and Alexa recognizes your voice.Sound quality is excellent.
We love it. It’s the best sounding Echo. Perfect for the living room, bedroom. This company is headed in the right direction. I’ll purchase another. It can be a bit glitchy, but it’s not a big deal.
Like the ability to hear good music easily without starting and setting up the stereo. Grandkids can easily use it. I have 3 echos and the Studio setup automatically, it was very easy.
Great sound quality can be paired with other echo devices for surround sound effects. Paired with my Yamaha receiver and can turn on power and change tracks, etc for complete hands free operation
Alexa es la mejor en AI, el echo studio tiene un sonido fantástico, no tan bueno como el de Apple, pero en su conjunto es el mejor parlante inteligente por mucho. Me encanta

I feel like the sound quality although better then the echo not up to the quality of Bose or Sonos. Look to those if you want a quality sound. This is just a slightly better Amazon speaker, still can’t run with the big boys.
Set up and was using it in less than 30 minutes. Great sound and features. I bought a second and it made a big difference.
I bought 2 and set them up in stereo. They have a good bass, nice deep, rich sound and still sound great at full volume.
Sounds Great with Good Bass. Replaced an Echo Plus in my kitchen where I listen to music while cleaning - Perfect for this application.

When I first turned on my echo studio, It started making some really nice sounds. Then the studio started calibrating the room and adjusted itself for the best sound. Not bad, but after I ask it to tune to a radio station the sound and bass was exceptional. I recommend this product.

I like the fact that echo studio is waterproof and I can use it safely on my patio. Studio best Quality in sound is best used indoors but I wanted better volume and quality of sound outdoors. I will likely get another to replace my 2nd generation echo.
Great sound quality as least as good as Apple Homepod. Love it! I am using it as a TV sound bar and Mac sound bar!
Based on numerous reviews I expected a lot from this speaker but found it to be good but not up to the hype.

The studio takes a long time to sync to the TV each time we turn the TV on. It also skips, despite being two feet from the TV and about 10 feet from a Wi-Fi Router. We also wish that the TV sound would continue in the background while Alexa is speaking. For example, when a timer is going off, the TV continues to play, but we can no longer hear.

Sound quality is great, but it does not work seamlessly.
This thing is awesome..loveee it...but it had fallen off my very high shelf and broke so my husband got me the new larger echo and I didnt really like it..miss this

I bought 2 along with the sub, the sound is great but it really doesn’t pair with other devices at all and only seems to work when it wants to. It often cuts to white noise in the middle of tracks. I’ve contacted support several times to no avail or resolution.

The speaker itself sounds amazing. It took about 15 minutes to set up even though it should have been faster. I thought that I could have figured a workaround to connect to the tv but without firestick it is not possible.
Sound qaulity is so so. Not worth what they charge for it. Would like to return it . Way to expensive for what it is
Much better sound than the first generation echo that we replaced. Great experience with all our echo devices.
The Saga continues with greatness....
The sound quality and range is amazing!!! The voice recognition works from kitchen to living room as well.
Awesome
The echo studio is great, it has excellent sound quality for music and I have integrated it with my other echos around the house. Very happy with it.

https://www.amazonforum.com/forums/devices/echo-alexa/529298-sound-latency-with-echo-studio

Delay in audio when hooked up to TV via cable.

I purchased specifically for this reason.

Will definitely return if Amazon doesn't have a solution prior to my return eligibility... They have a fix for this on the fire stick and cube.

I love it! Setup is a breeze. Sound is better than more expensive units I have seen.
I use it mostly to listen to radio and music, and have no use for the rest of the "smart" features so far.
Wonderful speaker with excellent highs and lows. It sounds like an expensive quality speaker, I love it.
Awesome sound quality. We're likely to buy a couple more to replace some of the older models. The sound is super rich.
Love the room filling sound , from all directions. And the bass response is very impressive. Old songs sound new again. Thanks for the innovation.
I just cannot get Echo Studio to play music form my TV or to even have the TV sound through the speakers.
A whole lot of beautiful sound from such a little speaker.
Best sound out there for this price. Matches well with the Amazon hd music I am listening to music again!

Sounds good, but better than the previous models? Not really. Unless you like to blast your music so loud the next county can hear it, this is not worth the price. If your just a causal listener or prefer your music in the background, this model is not for you.

Just a few words to tell you how wonderful and amazing is the sound quality of the Amazon echo studio. It’s the best stereo music I’ve ever heard.

25 years ago I bought a Bose system for around $1700. It had a great sound but the amazon echo studio is much better.

It was easy to install and I love Alexa. The best money I ever spent.

Robb H

By far the best of the echo family. Sound quality, construction and functions are all outstanding.

Sooo.... Yesterday, I went in to do some work for my Dad, and his Echo Studio Speaker was there for me to set up.

I actually couldn't get it set up correctly, because nearly all my siblings were there, and the pulses and sounds it was sending out forced me to turn it down, so that everyone could talk - and then he changed his mind as to which room he wanted it in...

C'est la vie...

The speaker is not tuned, and now it's in the wrong room, but it works and plays music...

Though it is not tuned, I was impressed by the heft - It weighs about as much, if not more than my and my dad's Klipsch speakers - we got him nearly the same setup that I have for his home cinema.

As it is, it does not have the clarity of treble/voice that the Klipsch speakers have, but it is a much more rounded speaker - and especially in the base portions of the spectrum.

The staging is a lot more clear with a pair of Klipsch R15s, but for a single speaker it's pretty phenomenal.

There are a lot pricier ones that come with Alexa, but my mom would ABSOLUTELY balk at the pricing on those... On a dollar basis, both my Dad and I were amazed, and most importantly he was pleased.

I had considered picking out the Sonos1 for what he wanted, but he has so many different apps on his phone, and he can never remember the passwords, so setting them up becomes a nightmare. I didn't want to add one more app I would have to figure out, when the Amazon product would do most of the work itself, and I wouldn't have to troubleshoot later.

Aaaaaaand speaking of troubleshooting, he remembered he wanted his Tile app integrated with Alexa, which took another hour, and then, somehow, his Pandora account was deactivated - but I knew the password on that, so that took another 10-15 minutes...

I was going to show him the Tile skill was working, so I asked "Alexa, where are the keys?" and Alexa replied:

"Try retracing your steps."

Which made my Mom and Dad burst out with laughter - they were laughing so hard they could barely breathe!

My Mom asked, "Who programmed this?" and my Dad said, "Are they looking for an argument? This is messed up!"and then they laughed some more - and I told them, "Well, If you're an argumentative person who is married, maybe you can just argue with Alexa, instead of your spouse!"

And they laughed some more, and my Dad said, "I know some newly divorced men in the Congregation who could use this!"

And then they laughed some more.

After the laughter died down, I looked up the skill, and you have to say, "Alexa, ask Tile where are my keys" - and Alexa gave the current address the keys were located in.

And then I asked Alexa, "Where's my dog?" And Alexa responded, "I don't know, maybe it will come back when it's hungry?"

Which made my parents laugh again...

I got zero work done, but my parent's agreed to pay me for fixing all their tech instead...

Next weekend I'll have to reconfigure the Echo Studio for the room it's in now, and I'll have a better understanding of its sound quality...

But first impressions were similar to those I have seen on You Tube Evals.

For $200, my Dad bought a UE Boom, and the list price on my Flip4 was $179. Those are not smart speakers, and it blows them away.

I bought a pair of R15 Klipschs, and they are better in most ways but not in some, -I bought them for $80, but the list price was $450, and they are not smart, and need a receiver. It's also not as good as many Logitech and other computer speakers, but they are also dumb, require more space, and can't completely fill a room with sound.

Even at full volume, there was zero distortion.

For a home theater speaker - though it's not configured yet, my ear tells me it's not going to be a substitute for a receiver and dedicated speakers so you can hear lips as they speak and sing... but for a smart speaker that you listen to while going about your daily activities, it's very, very good...

I have heard the Sonos one in stores, and it's not Klipsch, but there was a lot of commotion when I listened, so I really can't compare it to anything.

But my dad is more than pleased, for now the UE Boom he got is connected to an Echo Input- I plan to get him a Logitech computer system for that, and the Boom can go back to his truck and worksites...

C'est la vie... 5 stars, for what it is.

This thing is the reason that Amazon Music HD doesn't play back Atmos or 3D audio on any other device. I refuse to buy Amazon's hardware for this, and not only that, it makes me LESS likely to buy Amazon services and products.

I DO NOT want Alexa. Nor do I want these low quality speakers. I have a receiver with a built in streamer that supports atmos. I have a nVidia Shield TV Pro that supports Atmos. I have a full 7.1 or 5.1.2 speaker setup (switchable on my receiver) with pretty nice Elac speakers and an SVS subwoofer, and my front speakers are powered by a pretty nice Adcom amp that was designed by Nelson Pass.

This winter alone I've spent a couple thousand dollars on upgrading my system for multichannel and surround music. I have a plex server where I host my own music and have been trying out multiple streaming services: Tidal, Qobuz, Amazon.

I don't like Tidal because of MQA. Read up on it, but it's basically a form of DRM with lossy compression masquerading as a hi-res "lossless" format that somehow is DRM free, except you have to have a DAC or software with license for playback and it's a whole shit-show. But Atmos playback works on the Shield TV. Pretty great UI though, at least, comparatively.

Qobuz: Hi-Res Flac support. Doesn't have an Android TV app but I can stream it to my receiver directly. No multichannel/3D/Atmos. Android app UI sucks.

Amazon: Lossless Flac. 3D/Atmos support with proprietary hardware that spies on you. 3D and Atmos only work on a receiver if you also buy their streaming stick. So I have to buy two pieces of hardware that aren't even necessary, Amazon only requires this because they want to move hardware and get Alexa to spy on you at all times. App UI sucks but is slightly better than Qobuz. Slightly. Blatantly anti-competition and anti-consumer.

I've had it over a month now so k felt like this would be a good honest Review.

I purchased one at first and then another and then the echo sub, the sound is amazing. Highly recommend, but there are 2 flaws, one major with this set up.

1. Linking all the studios and sub to the tv was a pain. Chat support didn't really know what to do, I finally decided to call and talk to someone, he had me working in 5 mins.

2. And this is a major flaw for me. This system only works with fire TV. Not the Blu Ray, Xbox, ect. You can hook up opt to aux cable directly but you will have to unplug each time you want the fire TV/Xbox. Also you won't be able to have the sub.

If this system worked with what ever was on the tv, then this would be my recommendation for everyone. Hopefully that will come later.

I am disappointed that there is not the same choice of color as for the (normal) Echo right from the start. I am not buying the studio and then 2 months later there will be a light colored version, which I would prefere a lot.

A great way to make your house smart with Alexa, the functions range from answer questions, setting an alarm and play music to control the doors and locks of your house. Definitely a must!

The sound quality is not perfect at all, you can find better speakers for the same price. I would recommend to use 2 Echo Studio devices in stereo. The sound improves a lot! There’s also a dis-balance in volume between Alexa’s voice and the music it plays, so you always need to adjust it.

The appearance is not bad, but it’s a shame that the light ring that indicates Alexa’s status can be seen only from above and you cannot really know if it heard you or not, you must be right there.

I expected more of this Echo…

In my opinion, the sound is just okay. It definitely isn't hi-fi quality. But that's okay if that's all you need.
Also, I didn't discern a difference when streaming with Amazon Music 3-D quality.
But, having said that, if you are looking for something better than the Dots and the other Echo devices I think you'll enjoy the Echo Studio. It's just not for me.

My husband bought the studio and a sub as an upgrade to our existing Echo Plus. We had a good set up with 3 Dots, 6 plugs, and about 10 Sengled Zigbee light bulbs that worked exactly as we wanted. We expected that the Studio would do the same, just with better sound quality. However, none of the light bulbs will connect to the new studio and neither will the sub. We’ve tried everything, including fully resetting the bulbs and spending hours on the phone with customer support, but nothing has worked. To make matters worse, we tried putting everything back to how it was with the Echo Plus, and now the bulbs won’t connect to the old hub either. DO NOT buy the studio to upgrade your current system until the software is fixed! So frustrating!!!

I tried all the high end smart speakers - echo studio, bose and Apple home pod.

If your most important criteria is sound quality, which mine was, then the apple home pod ranks #1. I ended up buying the home pod.

The echo studio has good bass but the lows are not very good. But, of course if you want a balance of sound, alexa integration, the echo studio is good.

On first listen the Echo Studio appeared to be awesome, but it was a new toy. After a week of listening I was becoming disappointed with it’s overall performance. The mids and highs seemed masked and trying to to get out but don’t quite make it. Push the volume and it does not improve the sound it actually seems to make it worse. I was in Costco and they had the Bose Home Speaker 450 on sale for $269, a tad more then the Echo Studio speaker but upon listening to the Bose at home for a week it was worth the extra cash. The Bose sound is clearer tighter and more pleasing imho. When you push the volume it does not disappoint; clear, clean. and pushs higher volumes much better than the Studio. The Echo Studio is well built, impressive upon first evaluation but listening time exposes its weaknesses.
(The Echo Studio was purchased from Best Buy)

Browsing through these reviews there is a lot of hit and miss reviews that arent really telling you how it gets used day to day. We have had this since right after thanksgiving 2019, and we are very happy with this speaker. It is powerful, very powerful. I don't think we ever turn the volume above 6 or 7 because the bass and sound becomes too much on our first floor living room. 3D sound is nice, but hard to find consistent video/audio that releases in Atmos. We use spotify so not getting the full 3D effect right now. It is a center of attention for parties, has enough sound to take over a room, and it really is not too noticeable sitting on and end-table. If I had complaints, it's the standard software issues Amazon usually has compared to its competitors Apple/Sonos/Samsung. The app is so clunky, if you don't know where to go, its not intuitive. I would always hesitate giving any Echo device to parents/grandparents due to the software in the app. Also anytime we connect to the Fire TV, we have to back out of the menus, back in, disconnect from Echo Studio, reconnect, etc, It just isn't primetime yet. BUT, the Hardware, the speaker itself, is an absolute steal, and probably a loss leader for Amazon right now.

I bought this for my fiancé for his birthday and I was pretty skeptical on spending so much but it was well worth the price! The sound quality is amazing! There’s a few hiccups on getting the right word combination for it to do what you want but we’re new to having Alexa so that could just be operator error lol I definitely this! I’m also going to buy the sub woofer as soon as it’s available again!

Alexa's voice was terrible. It would start off OK but then would slow down and start to drag. Tried the 3d audio. It didn't sound as good as my 2nd Gen Echo. On some of the requested music the speaker had a loud buzz which made it un-listenable. Took it back.
Alexa worked fine for years, I changed nothing and update broke it. Waiting for weeks and no fix...

I believe this speaker earns my 5 stars. People complain that it’s not as good for 200 bucks but I believe it is! I had a Harman kardon speaker that I thought was good but this is definitely better! Great smart speaker for the price. I had friends and family asking me where I got mine at. And we’re surprised how good it was for the size. So if you are iffy about getting it. I say you get it! Give it a shot! :)

I have 2 Echo's and an Apple speaker. The studio sounds wonderful and Alexa works great. The sound is on par with Apples speaker for much less money. Alexa is also far more intelligent thank Siri. Good purchase if you are looking for a device that will give you good audio as well as Alexa integration I would highly recommend Echo Studio.

Excellent product much bettern than more expensive Bose ($299) that we got from Costco. AI is perfect, voice recognition works really well and sound quality is very very good. Thinking to get a second one for upstairs

I was surprised at the low quality of the sound. I think my regular echo has better sound. It might work better if it was placed in the center of the room but that would mean an extension cord across the floor.
Sounds like a speaker dropped in mud. Way too much bass as well completely unbalanced. Don't understand all the glowing reviews. Maybe they just compared it to the Dot's quality.

I received many invitations to provide Alexa Answers , to which, I responded. As far as I know, I conformed to all the rules, yet, I have been permanently banned! After many requests to find out why, they refuse to answer!

Do not buy this device to replace an echo that is in the middle of a room. You will have to decide which direction to aim the tweeter. It is not omnidirectional like Apples HomePod which is a much much better design. I had to go back to an old echo which works better in the middle of my kitchen.

This is a pretty good looking device, but doesn’t work well, the base is out of control, Trimble the windows and tables and still there is not effective interaction with the setting to reduce this effect.
This machine keeps saying I don’t know the answer, check your Alexa app.
Probably in six months ore after some developments can became a great option to buy, no right now.

For being a $200 sound product it lacks in sound quality for sure. Bose products now are Alexa compatible so I returned this Alexa studio for a Bose home speaker 600 for $250. Don’t waste your money on this speaker. 0/10 would recommend.
It would be great if they played my (uploaded) music but they stopped doing that. If you want to listen to their crap it's above average.

Ok, upfront & out of the box - this particular unit is WAY bigger then I thought it would be - was kinda/sorta hoping it was just a beefed up version of the Amazon Dot (MY Bad - I didn't read the tech spec's) - but - DANG Amazon - the SOUND Quality is OUT of this World Good - the setup was SO easy - I literally took it out of the box - plugged in the power cord - powered it up & it COMPLETELY configured itself to my Amazon Account / Wireless & the sound dynamics of the particular area of were it's located & the sound - WOW !!! - it sounds SO good - we have to have it fairly low due to apartment living - but - the afternoon - when I first received it - I let it ROCK & ROCK it did - Queen / Bowie / Beetles / Dire Straits / Police - all sounded absolutely amazing - very very very good - then for good measure - switched over to XM Radio - sounded great - Apple Music - NO issues - super solid device - been almost a week now & no technical issues - no weird snap/crackle/pop etc - very nice & SOLID unit - I love my music & this particular speaker makes it really nice to setup a mood & veg on the couch with my beautiful wife & a good glass of wine ... 5+ Stars EASY !!!

I don’t know what some of the reviewers are saying. My echo studio plays beautiful music. I listen to Amazon HD, Apple, Spotify. I heart radio. Works beautifully. I also have it on my everywhere group to enjoy music throughout the house. The added clarity and added bass is great. The 7 microphones do a better job of catching my voice even in a loud environment. Try listening to Ultra HD or 3D music. No going back.

I have two of the Studios paired with an Echo sub and use it as my home theater system. I love this setup! Keep in mind, you have to have it paired with a fire stick, fire tv cube, etc... I could not get the lips to sync when connected via optical cable, but connected to the fire stick works great. The bass is strong but not overpowering. The sound is full and rich, and the Dolby Atmos effects work well. Vocals are clear for dialogue and music is a joy to listen to. One Studio is very nice, but two is a real treat. Alexa has great range as well and responds to even soft spoken words. If you’re on the fence about the price, you won’t regret this $200 purchase.

First off, I have owned virtually every echo device since inception. I will make this a short and sweet review for you. I can appreciate and do like my echo 3rd generation but if I had to do it all over again, I would pass on it and go straight to the Echo studio. I know, I know.... the price. Well, simply put... bigger, better, louder and the foot print of the device is good. Its not too big and its not too small. It also has a built in hub and I believe it has the appropriate value proposition for what you get.

Read the reviews, Take a deep breath of air, relax and have realistic expectations, and you won't be disappointed. If you love Amazon and like their products, then you will love this one. This is what I do with everything I purchase and I am rarely dissatisfied as everything has pros and cons.

I just got my own place a little over a month ago after becoming a mom 3 years ago. I wanted to get something to not only play music, but connect to my Fire TV that would sound like a soundbar or surround sound. I live in an apartment so a surround sound system with a subwoofer was out of the question. The Echo Studio not only looks beautiful, but the sound is rich, beautiful, packs a decent punch that’s not too much to disturb my neighbors, and it’s a plus that I can use Alexa and connect it with my other Echo devices. I also really like the feature that allows the Echo Studio to adapt to the acoustics in any room it’s in. I’m not an audiophile, but I do enjoy quality speakers and this definitely impressed me!! I’ve had many speakers in the last 5 years including a smaller Bose one, JBL, Harmon Kardon, cheap ones from Walmart/Target/Amazon/Five Below (you get the point), and the Echo Studio has the most crisp sound and perfect amount of bass for its price. I’d say give it a shot if you’re contemplating it!! I’m extremely happy with my purchase!

It’s good. Home theatre sounds awesome. Can only setup two studio and one sub with fire tv cube. I bought four of these bad boys of studio and two subs and it doesn’t pound the house. There maybe better deals elsewhere for the amount of money I spent on these and for what’s worth. I only kept them because I wanted to have them paired with my echo dot. Klispe sell there stuff for the same price as a set of studio and subs. I should have went that route instead.

I think it’s a steal for $200. I had to purchase from a local electronic store because amazon was out. Sound quality is freaking great. Bass is tight and low. Even at low volumes. You must try the best of 3D audio on Amazon Music. I think I like this Echo Studio better than my Sonos Play 5s. It’s was a gift to my wife, if it were for me I would buy a second one for two channel playing.

I didn't expect a super sound quality, but I think the audio controls could be better & are very limited, 3D sound is not good for music. What I did expect was for this to connect easily via bluetooth with my TV. Unfortunately I could not get it to work yet. TV shows the pairing, Studio makes a connection noise but the sound doesn't come through. It woks very well with my Iphone though. Not unhappy with it , but a little disappointed. Still, I think it sounds better than similarly priced offers.

This speaker sounds great! Amazon has outdone this themselves with this Alexa speaker. I sold my HomePod and squired this and I’m not sorry at all. This makes any music sound great. You can pair it with any device unlike the HomePod which only supported airplay. I’m thinking about getting another for.a room filling stereo e perience. Great job Amazon!

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of sound. Receives voice commands well, hears from all over the room.
Fills room with good quality sound. My only problem was set up, but with tech support was able to settle
that issue. Worthwhile, nice addition to the Echo lineup.
Produces great sound at the price point plus being able to do monthly payments is great.
Easy to set up, good price, excellent sound. This is my 6th Echo. Great product.

Absolutely love this addition to my Echo family!
